Reviews.Title: “Great Place near Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: ThurmanMurman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels near the Magnificent Mile area, Including this one previously. It was nice to be back and reminded me about the level of service that the Hyatt chain provides. Arrived mid-afternoon for a 1-day vacation in the city. It was great to get straight into the room with no waiting. Stayed int the West tower and had a lovely corner room on the 21st floor with a view down the street and into the Pritzker Pavillion and the Art Institute. Room was spacious and minibar was fully stocked... Bed was extremely comfy, TV was a new LED flatscreen and the bathroom was extremely spacious and modern. The good bar is in the East tower and is always great for (expensive) cocktails. Bell staff and Front Desk were very friendly. Very good location for all the downtown sights in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, great value”
Reviews.Author: theycallmekacey
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for St. Patrick's Day weekend. It was my second time staying at this hotel, but this stay was just as pleasant as 3 summers ago. The location is right on the Chicago River which on St. Paddy's Day weekend just happens to be a glowing bright green. If you haven't seen that before, you really need to check it out! I like that the rooms have 2 Queen beds instead of 2 Doubles like most hotels in the city. The bathroom is very nice and the bed was very comfy. This was a quick girls' weekend trip and we spent most of our time out exploring but when we were in the room we didn't feel like there wasn't enough space. If you can get the side with river views, that's even better, but like I said we didn't spend time in the room besides getting ready and sleeping so that wasn't a big deal for us. Another bonus was the ipod dock so we could have some tunes in the room, nice touch. We were in the last room at the end of the hall and even with a packed hotel and all the St. Paddy's Day revelry going on, our room was quiet once we were finally ready to sleep. This is a small detail but there is a desk as well as a wide tv console/dresser which meant lots of available space for us to have all our stuff lying around. We girls tend to bring too much haha ;-) One thing to keep in mind is there are ice machines on every floor but not vending. So if you want a canned/bottled soft drink or water, you need to go to the lobby to get it (a kiosk open 24 hrs). No big deal, but just thought I'd mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive to worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lupan3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for a 4-day conference in March 2012. Even though I got the “conference fee”, I ended up paying about $185 per night, which I found extraordinarily expensive, particularly because the price did not include any breakfast or wireless internet (for which I had to pay an extra $10 per day). Even though my room was nice and spacious and the river view was nice, the hotel did not even provide us with any but the very basic toiletries. Because they were too many conferences happening concurrently, there was too much noise and hassle. I felt cheated and will certainly never return to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going above and Beyond!!”
Reviews.Author: Beth W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and what an amazing place to stay! After an 8 hour flight we were ready for our room and a good drink. As soon as we entered the hotel we were blown away. We were met with wonderful, friendly and very efficient staff and we were checked in in no time. We had an amazing room on the 27th floor with a huge comfy bed, I struggle with sleep ( or lack of) so this was really beneficial and I got great sleep .Our room looked out over the lake and it was a great sunrise and sunset. This hotel is in a perfect location close to Michigan avenue fab for shopping and it was a lovely walk when we went exploring all that Chicago has to offer. I can not say anything bad about the hotel. The bar was busy but we weren't without a table for long! and the breakfast is a little pricey but worth it, best hotel breakfast I have had so no complaints. If you need a good location, a good price and excellent hotel you need to stay here, we will certainly be staying there again! What a fab hotel and wonderful staff working there! Cant wait to see you in the Fall! This time I will be bringing my mum for a girlie holiday and leaving the husband at home, Sorry love!

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Pratik A
Reviews.Content: Reviewing a premium hotel in such a busy downtown is such a tricky business. I will do my best to offer my 2 cents to others..... pros: 1. Very very nice hotel. people are friendly from front desk to bell boy. 2. Excellent location and atmosphere for all ages. short walk to all the downtown attractions. 3. Excellent restaurant. Not too pricey either. cons: 1. Be ready to pay up for parking. I paid $50 per day. stayed there 3 days, and manager was nice enough to work with me for last day, as I checked out almost at 6 am. they charged only two days of parking. 2. Internet is pricey too. I needed the business line, and that cost me dearly. 3. If you book via third party (priceline, expedia, orbitz etc....), make sure to call the hotel for any needs you may have. I booked 3 rooms and every room ended up being in different tower. A little common sense cant be too much, is it? I booked for 3 rooms, isnt it obvious that I need them on same floor and same tower? over all? yes I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Truly Amazing Stay at a Great Property in the Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Chicago Date of Stay: Wednesday, March 14 - Friday, March 16, 2012 Length of Stay: 2 Nights In a nutshell, this is a truly wonderful and newly renovated hotel, with absolutely excellent customer service, top-notch dining that is perfectly located along the Chicago River! Now, for my detailed review: First, I must say that this review builds upon prior review of this property -- for further information and some more details on this property, please see my prior review: -November 2010, entitled: â€œA truly AMAZING Hyatt!! A perfect location with stellar service!!â€� (posted November 8, 2010) Having stayed at this property before, my wife and I were expecting similarly excellent service, and we were most definitely not let down. The Hyatt Regency Chicago provided us with the perfect place to stay in Downtown Chicago. We arrived very late at night, due to a late flight from Florida. Upon arrival at Chicago O'Hare, we were met by a driver that had been arranged for us by the Concierge at this excellent property -- if you need to get to this property from either of the Chicago area airports, I highly recommend contacting the hotel concierge prior to your arrival as he or she will be able to arrange a very skilled driver for an extremely reasonable price! Our driver arrived right on time to pick us up, and he was extremely professional and courteous, quickly getting us to the entrance to the Hyatt Regency Chicago. Upon arrival in the lobby, we we met by an excellent bellman who assisted us with our luggage, and who directed us to the Hyatt Gold Passport Check-in Desk. This property has excellent front desk service, with a very large and separate area dedicated solely to the needs of Hyatt Gold Passport Members. Check-in was extremely quick and efficient at this dedicated Hyatt Gold Passport Desk -- we were welcomed by name and thanked for being repeat guests and loyal Diamond Level Gold Passport Members. And, within a matter of moments, we were on our way up to our Suite, room 3614. All-in-all, a very quick and efficient check-in offering excellent customer service. Upon arrival at our room, we were very excited to see that we were once again in an excellent suite -- the suites at this property are extremely nice, and I highly recommend splurging and booking a suite at this newly renovated property. As we walked into our room through the double doors, we entered into a beautiful tiled entryway, with a wet bar directly to our left and a large and freshly entered bathroom to our right. The bathroom had clearly been recently renovated, offering a beautiful vanity, plush towels, a very large shower and a toilet. This bathroom had a separate entry into the bedroom portion of the room as well. Going back into the entry way, directly in front of us, we had an extremely comfortable couch with a coffee table, and a large HD-television. To the left of this living area was a dining area, complete with a large dining table and a nicely sized computer desk. And, all the way across both the dining area and the living area there were wonderful floor-to-ceiling windows, offering a beautiful view of the Chicago Skyline and slight view of the Chicago River. Then, as for the bedroom, it was equipped with an extremely soft and comfortable Hyatt Grand Bed, a computer desk, a large HD-television and similar floor-to-ceiling windows. All-in-all, an excellent and freshly renovated room that provided for a truly wonderful stay! In addition to the excellent room, this property has some truly top-notch dining experiences. For breakfast, I highly recommend "The Bistro at 151." This restaurant offers an excellent buffet at a reasonable rate. However, we opted to order off of the menu instead -- and, we were extremely happy with our selections ... I highly recommend the Eggs Benedict! Breakfast was truly one of the best hotel breakfasts that we have ever experienced. Additionally, for drinks at light appetizers, the "BIG Bar" is wonderful! Offering up beautiful city views, excellent appetizers and truly tasty strong drinks. "BIG Bar" should not be missed for anyone who enjoys a good drink. Furthermore, for anyone like us that enjoys a truly amazing steak, "Stetson's Chop House" should not be missed. As the property description indicates, this is truly one of the finest steakhouses in Chicago. Offering an excellent wine selection, AMAZING service and truly succulent steaks, you should not miss "Stetson's." In addition to the excellent dining, this property truly is in the perfect location -- just across the Chicago River from the "Magnificent Mile" aka "Michigan Avenue" which offers very excellent shopping and dining. It is also a very quick cab ride to all of the area museums -- and, if you want to visit Chicago's excellent museums, make sure to speak with the hotel concierge, as this property often has specials and discounts which can save you a lot of money. All-in-all, the Hyatt Regency Chicago is a truly wonderful and newly renovated property that offers excellent service in a prime location. This property should not be missed by anyone traveling to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Will I Stay Here - Horrible Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: I should have learned my lesson. Every year in March I attend a meeting held here. I usually stay around the corner at the Fairmont or just up the street at the Swiss Hotel. For some reason this year I forgot how horrible this Hyatt is. Here is a summary: 1. Failure to honor a reservation. Even though a special room was requested at time of reservation and even though i called the afternoon I was to arrive to verify that special room request, when I arrived at 6:30 pm, the room was not available. "There is nothing we can do, we are full." 2. When I arrived in the room (6th floor West Tower) the room reeked of cigarette smoke -- really?? Yes, really, even in 2012. And those f you who have had this know that nothing can be done. I did call -- I told my story and then was sent to a second person to tell the entire story a second time -- the first offer was, "we will have housekeeping come and spray." Of course those of us who travel frequently know this will not work. Then "if you can leave the room for a couple of hours, we can put a machine in there." Leave the room? Not possible then - certainly the next day. "Well, we could buy you dinner and then you could return to the room. Again, I had work to do, not time to sit alone for two hours in a restaurant waiting for the room to be de-odorized. And of course, they were full. NOTHING could be done. 3. Room service -- the first night -- to begin with, I was on hold for 15 minutes -- at 9 pm and then I ordered tomato soup, a reuben with fruit as the side choice and a glass of chianti. Ten minutes later i was called and told they did not serve the tomato soup any more and it should not have been on the menu. I was offered tortilla soup. Five minutes later called to be told they were out of tortilla soup (it was St Patrick's Day and they offered me Irish stew) - I chose the chicken soup. And yes, there was one more call. 15 minutes later I was called and told that I had an old menu and that they did not serve the chianti by the glass any more. Well, that was quite an experience. 4. Bell service - simply put, when they have a large convention, do not expect any bell service unless you are willing to wait 30-40 minutes for it. Enough said. I could go further but this is already too long. I stayed at the Fairmont for the rest of my stay. Thank goodness. And later in the week I get to go to Dallas where there is a great Hyatt. never again for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, do the park and surf”
Reviews.Author: WCO6Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 day family vacation. We could walk from the hotel to the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum, and the Art Institute. We shopped on Michigan Avenue. The location is outstanding, nothing could be better. We took advantage of the park and surf offer which rolled in daily parking and internet into the hotel price. Its a great bargain and we'd recommend it. The beds and rooms are comfortable. We had to ask for towels and a bathmat each day, not sure why, but they never did leave four towels. The workout room is lovely and I'd recommend that as well. The location is fantastic. Especially if you want to walk and take in the beautiful city landscape and museums you cannot go wrong. Also, we could see the Chicago River on St. Patrick's Day when they turned it GREEN!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly volume dealer of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: topperdude
Reviews.Content: My family and I got a fantastic deal via Priceline for the Hyatt in March. Before visiting the Hyatt be aware that it is very busy and very large. Overall the service was good. Some employees of the Hyatt seems friendly; some seemed indifferent. The Hyatt is in a wonderful, centerally located spot. Do not park in the Hyatt's parking garage for it is a ripoff at $50 per night. On Stetson street there is a very accessible affordable parking garage. There was a Starbucks in the lobby brewing delightfully smelling coffee every morning, and all day. Cassandra at the front desk was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: woodyx2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions, but this is my first review. The hotel is very large, set out in two separate towers of accommodation. Both towers are furnished in the same style and are equally as nice. Most rooms are very spacious and nicely furnished, very modern and comfortable. My only criticism is that some of the rooms are directly overlooked by neighbouring office blocks which make those rooms very dark and obviously no view whatsoever. There are some beautiful rooms that have waterside views and also views of trump tower/ wrigley building. The hotel is generally very busy, but check in is always very quick and efficient. The elevators can sometimes be a little slow when the hotel is very busy. The location of the hotel is outstanding, convenient to state street, Michigan Avenue, millennium park etc. There are plenty of great restaurants on the doorstep and several fast food places underneath the hotel which are a lifesaver in bad weather! The staff are always very friendly. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MeggieBeth
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and were very happy. The location was perfect. The rooms were clean and a good size. The desk staff were very friendly, and the concierge staff were phenomenal at helping point us in the directions we wanted to go. The only downsides were that our view was awful (but I think we could have paid for a better view), and the parking fees were astronomical. We parked in a lot just down the street. Even with the parking fees, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: snsmith27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the night in this hotel for one night while in town to see the Lyric Opera. I booked a "Park and Surf" package on Expedia at a reasonable rate, which included valet parking and wi-fi. Glad we had paid for a parking package, because this hotel charges a whopping $52 a day for parking! The location of the hotel is great-- right by Michigan Ave and the Loop. Check-in and check-out went quickly and the staff were friendly. The room was clean and modern, but not anything special. I had two complaints about this hotel (1) we were bothered by elevator noise even though we were 2 rooms away, and (2) valet parking was very slow to get our car and had a little trouble communicating. Overall, I feel this hotel is slightly above average to similarly priced hotels in the area, and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “guest are number #1”
Reviews.Author: myluv7
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I stayed at the hyatt for the Chicago Hairshow at McCormick Place. I couldnt have been more pleased with this hotel. They were able to store our luggage while we went to the show and called us when the room was ready. The bellman was cordial and informative. The people at the desk cheerful. The room was comfortable and inviting. The beds were very comfortable, the pillows awesome and the room spic and span clean. Hairdryer, coffeemaker. There was a gift shop as you walked in, also a convenience area to purchase coffee, juices, cereal and such on the run. I did not go to the bars or restaurants while I was there. The concerge suggested a great Mexican restaurant not far that was outstanding and only a short cab drive away. The hotel is centrally located, we went to Howl at the moon that evening which was great fun and Rosebud Trattoria for dinner. Perfection! Cant say enough about this great hotel. They treat you like a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent views, excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jodet
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and I spend a considerable amount of time in hotels and in the Chicago area and across the country. I am come to truly value the distinct experience I feel when I stay at Hyatt hotels. So when I meet staff members like Jason Jones who go above and beyond to bring quality and a smile while representing their hotel, I am assured that there are few and far options for me aside for this hotel for my business travels. The Hyatt Regency Chicago is truly and excellent hotel and I will undoubtedly continue using them for my future business and leisure travels.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location on the river and Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: Tarnold8200
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last week, and I was beyond pleased at the location. Very easy to walk to Michigan Ave and see two of my favorite buildings in the world, Wrigley and Tribune tower. There are a metric ton of restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. They have a ton of meeting space, so are perfect for large or small groups. We did not have a car, as it is so hard to find affordable parking anywhere in the city. Much easier to use the El, taxis, or the bus. We used the blue line El to get to O'Hare, and it was 2.25 each way per person. A cab would have been much closer to 80 dollars. The service was great, especially the club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “nice people, huge hotel, kind of sterile and old bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: obrij1
Reviews.Content: Would say for the price it is fine. The hotel has the basics, the room service was quick and good food. There just wasn't anything that would make me want to come back when compared to the Drake or the Westin or some of the other hotels in the city. It was just sterile.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing...not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SCauwels
Reviews.Content: Parking $52 almost more than we paid for the room.... We had high hopes for our "stay"-cation coming from the Chicago suburbs with our 9 month old. We looked forward to relaxing... Well, we were more than disappointed. First, most importantly, at 8:40 am, we (and our baby!) were still sleeping when housekeeping tried to enter our room to clean it. We wanted to cry since our baby rarely sleeps in. We were told we should have put the sign up but hey in this day in age of computer technology and cell phones you serious cant get coordinated? Overall, the rooms were ok however, our view of multiple homeless sleeping on lower wacker made us reflect on our lives and the lives of the less fortunate - not something we expected for our stay-cation. I do have to say most of the staff was friendly and willing to help. The food at the bistro was ok- but the description for the bbq chicken was plain wrong. Not a 1/2 chicken - a split breast and the description mentioned brussel sprouts... but at first we did not get any and then when we did, it was the leaves from 1 brussel sprout grilled... tasty but really lacking.

Reviews.Title: “great location, a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: floyd_n
Reviews.Content: There were 2 things I absolutely loved: 1.) locale 2.) Akilah (who upon arrival made the hotel room right. We booked through hotwire, guaranteeing 2 beds but upon arrival the hotel only had rooms available with 1 bed. After trying to persuade us to take the king instead of the sold out queen beds she ultimately made us happy by somehow getting the 2 queen beds, fantastic customer service, give this girl a raise, she is amazing!) There were 2 things I didn't like about the hotel: 1.) cost of overnight valet parking is ridiculous. We totally wasted $104 on parking because it's $52/night. There is a nearby garage (on Stetson St called Millennium (not to be confused with the Mellinnium garage around Mellinnium Park) where you can park for $30 but who wants to walk in the freezing cold just to park and save $22/night? LOL not me. 2.) the room was tidy and nice but it lacked pizazz for a 4 star hotel. I was not impressed. I wondered if we got the not so hot room because we made such a stink about getting the 2 beds we guaranteed for $8 extra/night. Over all it was a nice room. The bathroom was the best part, very modern sink but not good water pressure (I love good water pressure) but what can you expect when you're in such a big hotel with all those people taking showers in the morning it's likely to have bad water pressure. Housekeeping was on it, they replaced our towels and everything promptly. Over all I like this hotel and will def return. I will likely take the train in and take public transportation so I don't have to pay that crazy parking fee. (I get it, they do that on purpose to deter you away from wanting to park there because parking is very limited in Chicago as it is in NYC and LA but it doesn't mean I have to like it...)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: brittany11
Reviews.Content: Slammed with $52 parking. Also, don't so much as touch anything in your mini fridge. All items are weight sensored an will automatically bill to your room if you move them ($4.50 bottled water). Aside from that - it was average at best. Staying at other Hyatts set a standard of quality for this stay, which was not met.

Reviews.Title: “Hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Pyow
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy coming to Chicago and stayed at the Hyatt for a business conference. Room was super nice and clean. Although the conference area was like a crazy maze and was quite confusing sometimes, eventually you figure it out and there were all kinds of different conference rooms of different sizes. The fitness center was decent - better than most hotels I've stayed at. If you are looking for quiet, this isn't the hotel for you. It resembles Chicago itself.....very busy with people around everywhere. My only complaint was the OUTRAGEOUS prices at the lobby snack bar and the main lobby restaurant. They charge $22 for a breakfast buffet at the restaurant. I wanted to get a quick snack in between sessions and settled on a bagel with cream cheese - just under $7. Bring your own small food if you are here for non stop business.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: bwang20874
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location - walk to the Art Institute, M Park, Concert, etc. It offers decent rooms; check-in counter staff are very friendly and helpful; restaurants are good, too. Everything there meets expectations of a 4-star hotel. Downside is lack of swimming pool and parking is very expensive (>$50/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too big.”
Reviews.Author: bruin09
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and it is the first hotel I've seen in which one needs a map to get around inside. It is really two towers connected by tunnels which means one needs to use escalators to reach the floors that have bridges and then once on the other side, take escalators to the proper floor. The restaurants are expensive, but nothing spectacular in terms of food quality. The rooms are modern but quite small. If you are traveling on business, you won't want to share a room. Elevators were hard to get during breaks due to the number of people waiting - had to go down in order to go up, which we were already used to due to the tunnel and bridges. The location is excellent and a short walk to the shops and the museum. The hotel is fine for business, although not excellent. If you are on vacation, choose something else. I noticed that not one child was insight during our four day stay. This isn't what I would call a family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsArnold266
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! I loved it! The rooms are perfect. They are clean, sleek and stylish. There are restaurants and bars in this hotel so places you can eat if you want to have a meal without leaving the hotel. The room service was great. (of course on the expensive side as most room service is) but the food was delicious. The location is very central, close to Michigan Avenue. This hotel is huge. But overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay; winning view; management shines”
Reviews.Author: noneemac
Reviews.Content: My GF and I were in Chicago for Presidentâ€™s Day weekend. The purpose of our trip: two blowout dinners and some scintillating Chicago theater. We were fortunate (thanks to our Hyatt Diamond status) to be able to use one of our four confirmed suite upgrade certificates on this visit. Our West Tower junior suite (reportedly the biggest room on the 19th floor) overlooks the Chicago River, affording a view of the Marilyn Monroe statue and the gorgeous WGN and Wrigley Buildings. CHECK-IN: Cordial, helpful, and efficient. The fruit-infused drinking water is a refreshing touch. AMENITIES: Upon arrival, the room lacked robes, a corkscrew, and wine glasses. And oddly, there were no pens or paper, so the impulse to do some note-taking was hindered by a roomwide search. And finally, though the sleek, modern shower enclosure contains some nifty cubby holes for towels (meaning you don't have to open the shower door and reach to some distant towel rack) itâ€™s nearly impossible to avoid getting yourself wet when reaching in to turn on the shower. We wish we hadn't been placed on a floor where the elevator landing was half blocked off for repairs. LOUNGE: The entrance opens into a smallish seating area and the clubâ€™s own concierge desk. The breakfast room feels cramped, and the sound from the single TV inhibits conversation. The selection of breakfast items is modest: mainstream yogurt (and some high-quality plain Greek yogurt), bagels (with an inviting array of capers, onions, and cured salmon), underripe melon, and a small selection of cereals. Nothing artisanal, but a decent selection if youâ€™re not overly picky. (On the subject of melon: why do so many hotels in the north bother to serve it in winter? Itâ€™s expensive to truck in from a thousand miles away, and it doesnâ€™t ripen â€“ even in southern states and Mexico â€“ until at least late spring.) The coffee, from highly regarded Torrefazione, would have been brilliant if brewed strong, but it was watery and thin. Also on hand are several varieties of Tazo tea. Minor rant: We wish the hotel wouldnâ€™t electric-vacuum after breakfast, while the lounge, which is offered as a place for respite and relaxation. On our second morning, we arrived after breakfast, and while we appreciate the need to clean up, it was jarring to be taking our first cup of coffee while the staff was vacuuming (and pushing chairs) around us. Perhaps a silent push-broom vacuum would be fine. We urge management to hold off on loud vacuuming until after the lounge is closed each day. STAFF: Again, we found everyone to be efficient, friendly, and competent, from the front door to the front desk, and everywhere in between. We understand that this is a huge hotel â€“ the largest in the Hyatt family â€“ but we wish housekeeping and room service would have been a little quicker to clean items left in the hallways by other guests. It seems like more than half a day went by before the unsightly pile of pizza boxes and beer bottles were cleaned from in front of a nearby room. Itâ€™s not the end of the world to have to sidestep such piles on the way to the elevator, but we think Hyatt would want to shore up that little service step, perhaps with periodic, regular rounds through the hallways with the express purpose of whisking away such unsightliness. THE BIG BAR: Mixed reviews. On one night, we stopped in for a nightcap, and we decided to go old school. We ordered a B-52, up, expecting a cocktail, shaken and strained, rather than on the rocks. What the bartender put in front of us was a room-temperature ("warm" would be a better way to describe it, since many of the bottles sit on lighted shelves) layering of the ingredients in a cordial glass. The concoction was sadly unappealing. Rather than remake it, our bartender just brought us some ice cubes to pour into the tiny glasses. That was a letdown. However, on our previous stay at the hotel (in mid January), the Big Bar staff went above and beyond. We ordered room service at 2:05 a.m., a mere five minutes after liquor laws kicked in that prohibited the kitchen from sending us up a bottle of wine. I hustled down to the Big Bar to order a bottle, but â€“ bound by the same laws â€“ they demurred. The manager, however, was thinking on his feet, and offered us a creative solution: we were invited to open the half bottle in our minibar that evening, and the staff would send up a bottle of our choice from the room service menu the next evening as a gesture of goodwill. Both bottles were comped, and without complication, which was further evidence that the notes made the previous night were handed on to the staff on duty the following day. That kind of creative thinking is exactly the kind of goodwill that would keep us coming back to the property on future stays. IN THE END: Despite the cumulative weight of all the little things that werenâ€™t quite right [being located on a floor undergoing elevator maintenance; the lack of in-room amenities upon our arrival; strange sounds in plumbing near our room; the less-than-stellar soundproofing (being in a room with an adjoining door meant being able to hear the TV and conversations next door)], we were impressed with the overall courteousness of the staff, and of course we were pleased at how management stepped up to the plate on our behalf. [POSTSCRIPT: A further nod to management -- I mentioned the vacuuming, elevator, and Big Bar issues in an online survey Hyatt sent me after our stay was completed. I received a courteous e-mail reply within 24 hours from one of the hotelâ€™s managers, who agreed with our sentiments, said he would consider changing the vacuuming schedule, and asked how he could â€œmake it rightâ€� for us on our next stay in Chicago. Fantastic response!] 3.5-star amenities and room; solid 4-star management. Thanks, Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie099
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here for our weekend getaway. Great location to everything. Wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “That's it...I'm switching from Marriott to Hyatt as my hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: The young lady at the reception desk told me this is the largest of all the Hyatts. i was only there for a night, so I do not feel totally qualified to offer an opinion. However, my impression is that this is a very nice hotel. I arrived from O'Hare by taxi. There was a crew of bell personnell to assist and direct AND welcome you to the hotel. Reception was very efficient, friendly, and professional. Unlike when checking into Marriott as a "status" member, the Hyatt went out of their way to make me feel special and let me know that they appreciated me building my "status" with their company. They told me they had reserved a special room for me that was reserved for "status" members, and indeed, the room was very nice. It was high up on the 30 floor, with a beautiful view of the lake and the tower (I think), and it seemed to have premium , modern furnishings--not the standard hotel furniture you see everywhere. It was very clean, and everything was serviceable (no tears or worn corners on stuff). the manner in which the reception desk treated me at this Chicago hotel and at a Hyatt in San Diego has made it easy for me to decide to change my hotel of choice to Hyatt, and not Marriott. I did not eat at this hotel or use any of its facilities. I did nothing more than check-in, go up to my room and go to bed. But, it was a very pleasant, short visit, and I would like to spend more time in this hotel from what I experienced during this short up and back trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully surprised!”
Reviews.Author: DinoBoyWonder
Reviews.Content: The perfect attitude from the front desk attendant welcomed me on my 3 night stay there, then I found a very clean room and a beautiful inviting space. The bathroom made us squeal with delight when we saw the huge back-lit contemporary mirror and this enjoyment continued all the way to the discovery of the incredible down topped mattresses on the beds. I was given an incredible view of the river and Navy Pier too. I will definitely stay at this property again when visiting the 'windy-city'

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is very poor!”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth K
Reviews.Content: My room was dirty... hair on the bathroom floor that I had to clean up. Then second night housekeeping took away my shampoo, soap and conditioner and did not repalce it. I ended up not being able to really shower before a meeting. Had been looking at them for a possible wedding but would never want guests to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with great access to Lakefront and Loop”
Reviews.Author: Geert M
Reviews.Content: I don't know whether this Hyatt Regency goes the extra mile every time I go there because I am NOT a convention attendee and they are in some sort of withdrawal of 'normal' business guests, but every time I go there they are very personal in service and take extra care of me. The rooms are nice and the renovated bathrooms are clean and comfy, but a previous review was correct in that there is a lighting issue (most rooms I have stayed in are very dark). Room service is not the best as for choices, but there is a great little supermarket/deli called Bockwinkel's behind the hotel where I always create my own fancy room service dinner for less. If you're a runner, cross the street in front of the hotel and take the stairs down to the Riverwalk. Head right and you will be on the Lakefront and you can do miles and miles of the most stunning running I know in any city. If you're a longer-distance runner go all the way past the Planetarium and you'll be on Northerly Island Park - formerly Meigs Field airport, they have turned this peninsula in a beautiful natural open landscape. Definitely worth it! It is about 3 miles one-way to the start of the park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Fab44
Reviews.Content: We chose to upgrade upon arrival to the Regency Club room as we have in this past. This time around it was $75 to upgrade , a bit spendy but worth the convenience and view for us. We had an awesome view as we had a corner room overlooking the river. The windows in the hall near our room had a great view of the lake. We were attending a convention in at McCormick Place so we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel but found the room and amenties very nice. They have a great fitness room also, with plenty of treadmills and eliptical trainers . The worst part is getting the bill...yes I know it is Chicago, but $52 a night for parking? Please!! Love Chicago and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “If you love southwest airlines you will like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: And if you don't, I would suggest avoid this metropolis of a hotel. I'm not talking about the sense of humor of the SWA flight attendants, but rather the cattle car nature of the flights. You are not a guest here, but rather, a commodity (hence the southwest airline metaphor). If you have to stay here due to conference or meeting then go ahead, but if you are just looking for a nice hotel in a downtown chicago, may I suggest the Palmer House or the Swissotel? The thing I most dislike about this hotel is the lighting in the room. Super dim. There is a nice magnifying light in the bathroom, but even the bulb in that is not bright. the hallway to my room was dingy and the carpet needed to be replaced. At $250+ a night, I think the hotel could afford it. If you are here for a conference... bring your walking shoes. Although capable of accommodating large conferences, the conference area is the most inconvenient imaginable. Three floors below street level, no cell phone service, and miles from the main lobby. If you are a conference planner.... please keep looking. There are much better options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable bed/rooms, beautiful front lobby”
Reviews.Author: SunnyToronto_On
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel in October/2011. We took a taxi from the airport, and there are uniformed valets waiting to take your bags and direct you to the front desk. The hotel lobby is beautiful and expansive. On your right is the concierge desk (we used it many times!), in the middle are big comfy chairs, and to the left is check-in. Our king size bed was so comfortable, and the room was clean and well-kept. This hotel has seen many decades, and yet it is comfortable, clean and impressive. From this hotel, you can walk to many great restaurants (breakfast/seafood/steak...). A bonus for me is that it was only a 10 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile - endless number of high end stores, plus the famous Macy's on State Street is a 15 minute walk. For room supplies (water, wine/beer, and munchies there is a Walgreen's that is a 5 minute walk. You are going to love this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha H
Reviews.Content: From the Business Center experience to the Junior Suite to Lynielle at the front desk to Francois and Mario at the Big Bar! And even the guys at the Hertz desk were awesome. Everyone offered an amazing service and made me feel very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: nproehl
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Chicago staying at the Hyatt Regency. Overall our experience was very good. The hotel has a great location in downtown, an excellent choice if you don't plan on driving. The hotel and room met our expectations in every way. Clean, comfortable, and well-kept. We stayed in the east tower, which has recently been redone, and spent the extra for an unobstructed view of the river and downtown - well worth it. Be sure to "like" the hotel on FB, as they throw in a couple of perks for those who do.

Reviews.Title: “the hyatt dose'nt accept young black people”
Reviews.Author: TTIGER324
Reviews.Content: I Booked a room at the Hyatt regency 151 e Wacker downtown Chicago for a BACHELOR PARTY for a very good friend of mine. So I decided to go and check on the room a day prior to the event. They had me booked for a junior suite which is impossible to throw a party in because it too small so they showed me another suite with a very nice parlor size so agreed to take the larger room they showed so that it would accommodate my guest. On 2/24/12 we checked into the room a little after 9pm and every thing was fine until about 1:00 am when hotel security came to the room and said I HAVE TO BREAK MY PARTY UP because I cant have more than 4 people in my room after 10:00pm none of this was disclosed to me at any point in time. So naturally I refused to leave and the called the Chicago Police on me. when they arrived the police just asked us to keep the noise at a minimum. The police said we did nothing wrong and suggested that the hotel produce a manager so that they could explain hotel poliicy to me. All the employees ended up pointing fingers at each other and still I didnt talk to a manger so the police let the party continue.and they left.So about an hour later here comes security again to my room telling us we have to leave and again I refused so they called the police back to the hotel. When the police arrived they said I have to leave but before everyone left the room hotel security including the supervisor came into the room and watched the strippers dance! Yes this is not a typo....So after all harrassment we received hotel security just wanted to come in and get a lap dance.If I would have known that I would have let them in for a while so they could have so fun to. so at this point Hotel security and the CPD got a free show from the strippers I paid for in the room I booked.And i was still kicked out the room at about 2:30am. I would not advise any young African Americans stay at this hotel because of stereotypes made against us and pure racism by their staff. One more thing I would like to add I called corporate and complained and some lady in charge of the rooms said that the Hyatt regency Chicago does not allow bachelor parties in their hotels not for blacks anyway and she said that I would not get any of my money back because they had tp pay other guest back because of the noise from my party. I guess I learned my lesson if I want to throw a party at the HYATT REGENCY I HAVE TO MAKE SURE I ADD HOTEL SECURITY TO THE GUEST LIST.............

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Moe S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive in Chicago Illinois was the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel itself is very impressive and very deserving of its 4 star rating. They have everything that you need located within the hotel itself. There are many great amenities such as a salon, fitness center, great restaurant, and absolutely gorgeous view of the city and the Navy Pier. What really set this hotel over the top for me was the staff in specific Nataly who was at the front desk. Nataly made the stay as comfortable as possible did everything that was asked and was very knowledgeable about the hotel and the city. She knew where to go, where to eat, and made a vacation a memorable one. Thank you Nataly for making my vacation one of the best I've ever had. Also the fact that she is absolutely gorgeous and has a great personality did not hurt matters at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MobilityMan
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive is always my "go-to" hotel in Chicago. It's centrally located, large enough to offer all the resources for business or family travel, and the employees are constantly going the extra mile to make me comfortable. As you can tell, I'm already a fan and have been staying at this Hyatt for many years but, on my last trip I had some major challenges when my wallet was accidentally left in a taxi. The Hyatt team went out of their way to make special arrangements and prevented my unexpected loss from becoming a catastrophic event!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: MikeK413
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt - had a nice room (paid for an upgraded water view, which was nice to have), the staff was friendly and helpful, the location is perfect and we had a very decent rate. The lobbies were pretty nice, but we didn't hang out there or eat at any of the places. We walked most places (or took a cab if our destination was really far), even in the middle of winter. I try not to be too picky about these things, but our room was dusty the whole time we were there. It was enough to be noticed, so it should have been cleaned by the staff. Also, we weren't very fond of the bed. It was a bit on the hard side and wasn't exactly plus. It wasn't horrible though. Again, not horrible, but our room was very hot no matter how we set the temp at.

Reviews.Title: “A downtown "city within a city", great location!”
Reviews.Author: finnbee
Reviews.Content: I needed a convenient overnight in Chicago while on an Amtrak adventure. I found a bargain on the Hyatt on Priceline, and found a very comfortable hotel only a 14-block cab ride from Union Station (a walk if I hadn't been carrying a lot of baggage!). This Loop/Streeterville location is convenient to a number of Chicago favorites. The first several stories house elegant bars, restaurants, water features, snacking shops/gift stores, car rental service, concierge and check-in--pretty much any service you might need, though at a price ($8.75 tall domestic beer, $3.75 for a tube of Tums, etc!). My 12th floor room was comfortable, with a fantastic bed and a great view. I loved the small magnifying makeup/shaving mirror in the bathroom, an amenity I rarely see in hotels. My only criticism of the Hyatt was the ever-so-cheesy stocked fridge, complete with the "do not put your own food/drinks in here" sign that announced a $25 fee if you dared to - gasp - use their crappy little refrigerator! (Take the high road, Hyatt...give us the fridge and you'll likely get us buying overpriced foods on your property anyway!) The Hyatt staff, from the doormen to the concierge to the room staff to the desk, were uniformly professional, helpful, and empathetic. I was particularly impressed when trying to find a home for a fresh half-pizza that I couldn't possibly eat. A bellman, very discretely, pointed out the skyway to a man in the next block who was apparently a frequent resident of that stretch of sidewalk. The bellman emphasize to me over and over that "I can't advise you" and "You need to be safe", but I was persistent in wanting to find a good home for my leftover food! The fact that this gentleman had not only great professional integrity, but also a personal side, was heartening. My pizza was greatly appreciated by a homeless man with kind eyes. Bottom line: a great, convenient, comfortable property...if a little high-priced on the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. Your right in the heart of Chicago, by the river. The views are beautiful and you can see so many of the great and famous buildings from your room. My room was large and I liked the decor. Nothing too crazy, but it felt modern and clean. There is a good amount of storage which was nice as I was there for a conference and needed mountains of clothing storage space... uy! I found the different towers and levels to be a little bit overwhelming, particularly when already running late for a session. The staff was always very helpful though in pointing you in the right direction and I was even escorted twice by members of staff who wanted to make sure I got to the right place! Overall, GREAT location and quite a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Drew H
Reviews.Content: Great stay with luxury and awesome views of Lake Michigan. You have to check out the Eleven City Diner a short taxi ride but awesome food.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: clkiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. You are right on the river, and you have a gorgeous view from any room. It's walking distance to many bars and even the Chicago Theatre (which is a must see if you are in town). The hotel has 2 bars and a nice restaurant. The rooms are modern and spacious with plenty of luxuries. If I am in Chicago, this is where I want to stay. Fun, great price, and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: djbpdx
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay at this Chicago hotel. Not normally one we could afford, but had the opportunity and took it. The hotel was comfortable and clean, and the staff were great. The best part was the location: walking distance to museums, parks, the theater district and great restaurants. Definitely worth a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: 5252orange
Reviews.Content: stayed over the christmas holiday in 2011. despite it being an enormous hotel and very crowded, the hotel was well-staffed and took care of everything without delay. if you're looking to mainly stay downtown, this is a prime location, half way between the northern end of michigan avenue and the museum campus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: DrPygmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! It is within walking distance of so many major attractions. (River. Lake, shopping, museum, parks) The downside is that you have no fridge, just a mini bar. I like to have fruit and veggies stashed so I can have healthy snacks and this was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Location-Location!”
Reviews.Author: volsandshoesfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect location in Chicago, just east of Michigan Street along the river, which makes the theater district, dining, museums, and all shopping very easy to get to. We have stayed here several times, and like staying here more than other hotels in the area. The hotel has been updated since our last visit. A completely modern room with contemporary furniture greeted us, which was a nice surprise as the last time the room seemed to be stuck in 1987. The only issue we had this time was the vent covers in the bathroom and bedroom were both covered in dust and appeared to have not been cleaned in quite some time. This to me is totally unacceptable. When in Chicago, we pay a little extra for the location for the hotel room so we don't waste time taking in the sites and attractions. The Hyatt on Wacker is ideal for this. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Feburary in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: E_of_Virginia
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Everyone from the doorman to the housekeeping staff were freindly and helpful. The hotel has been updated and felt fresh. This is a very large hotel in two towers and the directions can be confusing, but the staff were very helpful. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is the elevators can be over whelmed at busy times.

Reviews.Title: “They Get It”
Reviews.Author: Brian F
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this property, Excellent service and a great location. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: KeshaKesh
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel twice. The first time a junior suite, the second time which is today a City View room. I love it here. The staff is nice and helpful. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Travel M
Reviews.Content: I was impressed at my first steps into the hotel. I was there last week for a conference.The front desk was great. Nataly helped me out and was very friendly, helped me with some directions, was as courteous as possible. The hotel is in a nice spot, 10 minute stroll to Millenium Park, about 10 minutes the other way to the shopping on Michigan. I didnt try any of the restaurants here. Great value with what I got on Priceline. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great option for lodging on your next 'Mag Mile' trip.”
Reviews.Author: tai786
Reviews.Content: I recall staying at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker multiple times over the past 10 years. It has consistently remained one of the better hotels on â€˜the magnificent mileâ€™ in terms of value and the reliable quality of its accommodations. To this day, management has done a good job of sustaining its upkeep and modernizing its amenities. Despite its being a bit off of the shopping district (youâ€™ll walk around Â½ of a mile to reach the Shops at North Bridge), itâ€™s remained our first preference. The lobby is fantastically contemporary; albeit small and not well suited to large conventions (Iâ€™ve been to three separate conventions in this hotel, and despite adequate ballroom space, the arrangement of the lobby proved to be a hindrance). The steakhouse here, Stetsonâ€™s, is very nice. The rooms are generous and aesthetically pleasing. The Chicago pedway (an underground, climate controlled network of tunnels and shops), which connects directly to the hotel, traverses the distance between many points of interest. There are multiple parking garages located within walking distance (some also connected to the hotel via the pedway). Unfortunately, there is a new aspect brewing in the underbelly of this fine hotel that, as far as I can see, defies logic. Iâ€™m going to be bold, as well as presumptuous, and say that the hotel staff is harboring a distinct lack of pride in this establishment. On my most recent stay here, their service reeked of apathy. Youâ€™ll see clumps of inexcusably overstaffed bellman and valet parkers, WITH their bell captains present, just standing around on downtime; refusing to greet guests, not even faking attempts to open doors for them, or directing traffic in a discernible manner. Good luck getting a bellman to help you with your luggage; I observed an old man being told to wait after asking for help directly from the bell captain, and when he received none from either of the three unoccupied bellmen he ended up lugging his bags in himself through a door that was held open for him (not by any of the staff â€“ they couldnâ€™t have been bothered to work for a tip, let alone as a courtesy â€“ but by another guest). Iâ€™ve worked at a medium-sized, family-owned hotel throughout my undergraduate degree, as a bellman and valet parker, and no matter how busy or understaffed we were we would make it a point to greet our guest warmly and without fail. We understood that the reception started and ended with us, and we had enough pride to make sure it was warm. Why that energy escapes the bellstaff here is beyond me, but I think the start of the solution is firing the bell captains point blank. Sadly, the less than mediocre service emanated in many other facets of this hotel on our most recent stay: everything was superficially cleaned by housekeeping, and you didnâ€™t have to dig deep (or at all) to find the layers of dust, coffee was served cold to us at the small cafÃ© on the 1st floor, one of the front desk staff was too impatient to help us resolve an issue we had. Itâ€™s a real shame to have seen service so consistently bad (on this trip) for a hotel that has previously been so consistently good. I have no evidence to conclude that this is anything more than an exempt clause, so I do still recommend this hotel as a good option if youâ€™re planning a trip to Chicago downtown. In the meantime, I hope that the general manager is able to get to the root of the problem and come up with a way to re-inspire the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tekinidiver
Reviews.Content: Great location, nicely appointed rooms and fabulous "Big Bar"

Reviews.Title: “Surprise for Jessy!”
Reviews.Author: Valdes63
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and close to blue line. Great bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: chrisw03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my mother's birthday. I followed the Hyatt Regency on Facebook and they gave $15 off nightly parking and free internet if you say their secret word. They also gave my family an assortment of candy for my mother's birthday. The location is great, it is easy to get everywhere downtown and the room are actually pretty large for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good.....but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: da_knees45
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and has a number of amenites. Didn't eat at the steak restaurant but it looked good - perhaps this summer when I'm back. There is a crowded place in the lobby where you can get breakfast stuff like yogurt, coffee and muffins but it isn't cheap. There are stores nearby if you plan ahead you can get these items for less than half of what they charge. The room is nice, although there was no bathroom fan but the room didn't fog up so perhaps there is some sort of ventilation system that is 'stealth'. The only real complaint - that others have mentioned - is that the walls ARE very thin. The first night it didn't matter as there was a quiet person next door but the next nights were noticed. Ear plugs help. I'm not sure if there is a pool - the review asks me to rate it. I didn't see one but perhaps it was outside or I was just clueless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out everyone we interacted with was friendly and helpful. Savannah at check-in was the perfect representative for the hotel. Helpful and accomodating, Savannah ensured that both rooms in my reservation were on the same floor. The rooms were well appointed and we had a a nice view of the City. The flat screen television was nice and the beds were outstanding. (I had a hard time getting my husand and son out of the beds!) We found that the ihome ipod docking station had its power source removed and the bellman had one brought to us within five minutes. One of the things I really enjoyed about the hotel was that there were many places to just sit and relax. We went to the lobby for a pre-dinner walkabout drink and had no problem finding an area for five guests. In the morning, there was a nice coffee kiosk (J's) with a variety of drinks and snacks. I found the prices to be very reasonable, by Chicago standards. My only remark would be that the valet collection was a bit hectic, but I do have to admit, we didn't call 15 minutes ahead as the hotel had requested. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away and feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: stinkysteve05
Reviews.Content: By far the best experience at a hotel I have ever had, hands down. Upon arriving to the Hyatt on Feb 2nd, the inside of the main lobby is calming and sets the tone for the hotel as being for business and pleasure for adults, so anyone looking for family fun should look elsewhere. After checking into my room (no issue with early check-in!), took some time to relax on the bed and then check out the mini-bar. Upon opening the door I found an uncleaned wine glass with dried lipstick on the rim and dried wine in the bottom. After working out at the clean StayFit center, I notified the front desk about the glass and was assisted by Jordie, who was quick to professionally apologize, take care of the glass and then extend the courtesy of comping me $50 for eat and drink during my stay. Totally unnecessary but definitely welcomed and I took full advantage of this via the BIG BAR, which has one of the best skyline views of the city. Drinks were a little pricey but I was their for pleasure so it came with the territory. Between Jordie, Jennifer and her wonderful housekeeping staff, and the great hotel atmosphere, I will definitely be looking to stay here again oh and book Hotwire, found a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler811
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The hotel was big and overall, nothing special. The rooms were biggish for a hotel in a city and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just a conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara95
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. Small lobby, no place to hang out during conference. Dull, depressing look in the public areas. Small room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly attitude at a front desk”
Reviews.Author: Sunny A
Reviews.Content: I and my boss have been on a business trip in Chicago and it's the first time to visit the city and hotel Hyattt in the states. The first impression is marvelous and kind engough to make us comfortable after the long flight from China. I specially thank you for the receptionish Nataly who has a beautiful smile and eyes. We had so much good time at Hyatt in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: shakespeare4me
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago exceeded expectations! From check in with Jason to check out, my stay was fabulous. The room was huge and beautifully decorated. My view from the 26th floor overlooked the city. I love the walk-in shower and the huge closet. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were cozy. The concierge, like all the staff members, were very helpful and welcoming. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, comfortable beds, inconvenient parking”
Reviews.Author: llm02001
Reviews.Content: We bid for this hotel on priceline and paid $80 per night. We had a fantastic view of the river and the lake from our room. We were taking a short vacation in the area, but it was obvious that the majority of the people staying there were business travelers. There is very little parking in the area and the valet is ridiculously expensive. The rooms were fantastic--very clean. Overall, this hotel is better for a business traveler--not a vacationer.

Reviews.Title: “GigaHotel, but with good and kind service.”
Reviews.Author: GustavoBR
Reviews.Content: This is one of the biggest Hyatt Hotels in the US. The room is very good and clean. Attended to a meeting in the Hotel's Convention Center - That is Giga too. The elevators get crowed several times during the day, due to the peolple attending to the convention center. The location is perfect, close to all shops and in front of the Chicago Tribune Building. Also in front, is the pier to the boat sigthseeings - a must in Chicago. Cons: When checking out, there was a fee for receiving packages (i had bought a book from amazon), when I complained that there was no mention of that in the web site - they just removed it from my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago. The only thing that I found unusual was when the bellman came upstairs to deliver my luggage, he was accompanied by a supervisor of some sort. As it was late at night, this might have been done for security reasons. It could have also been done for liability reasons or for training purposes. Either way, it was a bit odd. Good rates are available for this property through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointing for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: travelweary1
Reviews.Content: While the location is great, this hotel is difficult to navigate due to the two towers that only connect on certain floors. Room service was awful. Food was cold, there was a hair on my tray and the $38 lamb chops had to be chewed off the bone because only a butter knife was provided. The hotel was also not as clean as I expected. Some rooms have a beautiful view of the river, but they are hard to come by even when booking in advance. I had requested one two months before my trip and assured of one at the time of my reservation only to be told upon arrival that it was "no longer available". For a business trip it is OK, not great. For a pleasure trip, I would not recommend it. Stay at the Omni Suites instead.

Reviews.Title: “My Staycation home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sumi9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago again this past weekend, and I was a bit curious as to what type of trip I would encounter this time around. I love this property, and our king sized bed was comfortable. The view was fantastic. We had a city view and were up on the 11th floor of the west tower. The temperature in the room however seemed to be a problem. It was continuously fluctuating from either too cold, to too hot. It made sleeping very uncomfortable and nearly impossible. I again encountered a problem with the maids repeatedly knocking even though I had a late check-out. However the hospitality from the staff is top notch. I would also like to mention that the prices in the restaurants/bars are really high, as is typical for the downtown area. But right around the corner from the Hyatt is a place called Sweetwater that had a fantastic beer/wine selection and the prices were much more reasonable. I have another staycation weekend coming up at the end of February, and I may be visiting the Hyatt once more.

Reviews.Title: “Drab and a Bit Shabby”
Reviews.Author: JB88fml
Reviews.Content: I am in general a Hyatt fan but I was not so pleased with this property. It is definitely not one of their top tier locations, more like the Hyatt Place line. Check in via Kiosk lends to that lower end feeling. The decor, lighting and color schemes are simple, dark and grey/brown; itâ€™s kind of depressing. I've heard that they had a recent major renovation but it looks to me to have been done a few years ago. The room was ok but the double pane window was full of condensation which obstructed what would have been a nice view. The TV was a flat panel but without any HD programming everything on it was a bit fuzzy (these days I don't even bother watching non HD TV). The $14 per day internet was a big pain in the neck. It constantly asks you to re-enter your security code and was not all that fast. My opinion is that internet access is like a TV; it should be built into the cost of the room not fee based. If you want to charge for it than it better be the absolute best. This is not the case at the Hyatt. The breakfast buffet was fair and definitely not worth the nearly $30 (with tax and tip). There are many fantastic hotel options in downtown Chicago; this was my first time at this Hyatt and it will be my last. Their rates are competitive but I would rather go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good conference hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigLouieChicago
Reviews.Content: I know that flagship hotels like the Hyatt Regency are supposed to be able to handle conferences and such, but they made it look easy! From having session rooms mapped out, to having plenty of staff available to guide you, everything was top notch! It is difficult to single any one person out, since they were all consistently polite and helpful, but Brittany, at the lower level front deck was simply awesome. After the first time I introduced myself and ask for directions, she was sure to catch my attention everytime I passed her desk to make sure I was headed the right way. Brittany is very, very focused on customer service! My room was very nice, with a work space separated from the sleeping area, and a great shower. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: Carla H
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago is great! The staff (everyone!) is incredibly nice and helpful with every kind of question. My husband and I make sure we get to stay there whenever we are in Chicago. Go to the Big Bar, where they will make sure you are happy with everything, and say hi to Greg, the general manager. And all the friendliness of the hotel is the same whether they are busy with a huge conference not busy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dlobb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt a couple of times for the International Housewares Show. It is a large hotel with great amenities. The Big Bar is awesome. The rooms are very comfortable. I couldn't comment on the restaurants as I didn't eat at any of them. In the winter you have to take a cab to go anywhere because it is so darn cold. This hotel is usually quite reasonable so I would highly recommend it. If you can't get a good deal then try the Swissotel next door and come over to the Hyatt for a cocktail!

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DDK914
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been updates since I was there about 3 years ago. I found the rooms to be clean and comfortable with updated decor. The front desk staff was SUPER nice and friendly, especially Avi who checked me in. The Big Bar is a great place to hang out. Yes, the elevators get busy during a conference, but I thought the staff did a great job coordinating the crowded elevators at peak times. The valet service was prompt and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluepig112
Reviews.Content: 9 of us stayed here in December of 2011. We had two rooms, one which I reserved from a 3rd party and the other which I later added on. They were very accommodating, allowing us to have adjoining rooms. If you "like" them on Facebook they have specials going on just for Facebook fans- we got free WIFI and $15 off parking. Parking is expensive at $50/night, but with the $ off it was $35 which is very comparable to others in the area. WIFI was around $15/night, but getting it for free was a big plus. When you make a reservation online they offer upgrades that you can choose for a nominal fee. You don't pay for these upgrades unless they are available when you check in. I choose a room on a higher floor for $5 so the kids could enjoy the view. It was available and we were upgraded to a room on a higher floor for only $5 total (even though we had two rooms). Class act all the way. The check in and check out process was smooth. The accommodations were clean and comfortable. The rooms weren't large, but they were big enough and recently remodeled. Everyone was professional and helpful. The facilities were beautiful. As one of the kids put it when we pulled in, "This place is FANCY!". I think that says it all! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Scov70
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. Absolutely beautiful view of the city, and the snow topped it all off. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better for a Short Stay, But...”
Reviews.Author: JDevin
Reviews.Content: To be fair and to put this entire review in perspective, I'm sure the Hyatt Regency, like most hotels, doesn't normally have guests booked for 21 days. And if I were staying here for a night or three, I'd give the Hyatt a solid 4 stars for comfort, staff and location, so that's what I'm going with -- what the average traveler might experience -- although I'll expand on longer stay dilemmas in the body of this review. The Hyatt automatically loses a point because there's really nothing "extra" in an average (non-suite) stay that might make a guest feel particularly wowed or welcomed. Here, I feel the Hyatt could take something from the Hilton or the Westin (free brewed coffee in the lobby, real cream instead of powdered in the room, warm bathrobes, etc. Sometimes one or two little things like this make quite a difference in perception.) The price of everything in the hotel is also quite high. For instance, it's $16 for a hamburger and fries. (If you want it delivered to your room, there's an additional 3.50 delivery charge, plus a 15% service/gratuity charge. With state and city taxes, that's over $23--for a burger). High prices may be okay for a weekend of planned splurging, but over the long-term, they can be daunting. There's no laundry room on site for guests and when I tallied the cost to use the Hyatt's laundry service for one load of clothes, it was $70. Ouch! On the positive side, the bed is very comfortable, the staff is friendly, and housekeeping does a good job. Towels, linens, accessible plug-ins and workspace were all appreciated. I give special kudos to Chris, a supervisor who did what he could to make my stay easier, including having a small refrigerator delivered to my room (normally $25/day) and comping the internet ($13.63/day). I think an important part of customer service is to leave people feeling like they were "heard" and Chris excelled in this. I was impressed. For those staying for more than a couple of days, I would recommend Bockwinkel's market, (a very short walk away) for simple food, beverage and sundries. GrubHub is an internet food delivery service for local restaurants and if you want to dine-in they'll deliver to the lobby and the prices are reasonable. In warmer weather, there are several other restaurants within walking distance and for espresso addicts like me, there's an excellent local coffee shop, Descartes, around the corner on Michigan. I called the very friendly @ChicagoCabbie (you can find them on Twitter) for a ride to the Sudz Laundry on Ashland. Twenty dollars there and back, plus 2.50 for a load of clothes (free drying!) still saved me about $50 over the cost of the Hyatt's laundry service. In short, I would recommend the Hyatt Regency for short stays. For longer stays, check out my review on Comfort Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, made for meetings, but not me”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: I can't say it was bad, just not what I expect from a Hyatt. It has every possible amenity, but the place is laid out in a weird fashion with multiple floors to accomidate multiple conventions at one time. Finding the workout room was a challenge. The bed was again, not bad, but not great either. And the walls a bit too thin in that I got TMI from the room next door (I could even hear the news stories on their TV).

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: lumamahdi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the rooms are clean and the staff are very efficient and professional. The hotel is near a good range of shopping and attractions. The parking cost is $52 per 24 hour and you need to call half an hour earlier to get your car (valet Parking). You can get good prices from Hyatt travel web site.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hyatt Experience”
Reviews.Author: SarahDallas222
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline, and we got a really good deal for a Saturday night stay in Chicago. Overall, the lobby is pretty spectacular and exhibits how massive this hotel is. The surrounding area is pretty quiet at night, and I'm not sure I would feel safe walking around after 10pm. I'm sure it's fine - it's just a little empty. Overall, the room was nice and spacious. The view was not great, but I didn't expect a prime room from booking on priceline. Our only issue was the bathroom was pretty dirty. The front desk was responsive and cleaned it while we were at dinner that night. I would easily stay here again for a night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “underated”
Reviews.Author: yngmichcpple
Reviews.Content: As above reviews have stated, this hotel is over looked as a great choice. We received a wonderful rate of $89.00 on hotwire , what a deal. the room was recently updated, ask for the west tower. The room was clean and spot less even with my wifes blue light checker thingy...lol The bathroom was average , but clean with ample hot water. The hotels location is superb , parking is $50.00 at valet so do yourself a favor and park in the garage next door for $30.00 , its a all indoor walk to the hotel across a sky bridge. The part for us that made this a great experience was the service. From the start walking across the sky bridge , being politely asked we could use help and then directed to a little v.i.p. check in area right at the west tower, not having to trudge all the way to the front desk, was so needed after a long drive. We were in our room within 5 minutes and at the hotel lobby bar in 15. Speaking of the hotel lobby, its pretty cool with a open concept with a pool and a huge bar area. The bar was a little noisy and pricey, but once again the service made up for it, the Greg the bar manager came and chatted for at least 20 mins about sports and gave us some recommendations on what we were interested in doing. Make a effort to get to wicker park and off Michigan ave, its soooo much more fun and the shopping unique , anything from thrift stores to Mark Jacobs. Star taco there is a must for lunch!!!! Overall i like to say thank you to the staff of the Hyatt and we cant wait to make a another trip. One thing to keep in mind the bar manager said the lobby will be updated with other areas this summer, so you might want to call and ask about that , other wise feel safe with choosing the Hyatt cheers

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: WDW621
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did an overnight stay at this hotel and I must say that I was impressed. We had a king room on the 21st floor with a great view of the city. The hotel staff was very nice at check-in and check-out. The valet folks were very nice and helpful as well. I love how close it is to downtown--it is in downtown Chicago! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, great location.”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Downtown Chicago January 18th through the 21st, 2012. The hotel was immaculate in detail and hospitality; the staff were incredibly nice and helpful, even going so far as to upgrade our room and give us Regency Club access after a small mishap with one of the rooms. We checked in with Avi who took amazing care of us, he was extremely helpful and professional despite us having booked through Priceline on a â€œName Your Own Price.â€� He gave us free WIFI and a room with a spectacular view and made us feel extremely welcomed. As I explained earlier, we had a small mishap with Housekeeping when we had found blood on our sheets, however, we spoke with Akillah who took this matter to a high level of concern and upgraded our room to a suite as well as including Regency Club access for the remainder of our stay. On top of that, her manager Ashley called us to make sure w were settled into our new room, and that it was of satisfactory condition; we even received a card from the Hyatt Supervisor stating sincerest apologies for what had happened. This is definitely a hotel which rates 10 out of 10 stars, and will definitely receive our business again whenever we travel back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen J
Reviews.Content: Location is truly centrally located to just about anything you would want to do in Chicago and a skip away from bus and subway lines if you need to venture further out from downtown. The room was spacious, check-in front desk personnel very kind and courteous and accomodating.
