I didn't have any particular requests that needed to be met other than a clean, comfortable and nicely located hotel- this was it. Not to mention they house the largest bar- truly, anywhere. With an all glass wall to view the happenings of the bustling streets of the city, this is a good place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling stolen by hiden charges and what received for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: FlavioBK
Reviews.Content: Valet parking: $52/day. Last hotel in USA to still charge for WiFi: $13.93/day. In room refrigerator: $4.50 for a bottle of water. Linen had holes compatible with a one star. Last, acoustics are awful. For the first time in my life went through the embarrassment of having the guest in the room besides mine to knock here. Ok, it was just 8:30pm and I might have argued but the truth is that the walls seem made of carton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Duane H
Reviews.Content: The location and room were both great. Be prepared to be charge for all the extras though. Internet was over $13 per day. They had mini-bars in the room, so no soda machines on the floors, had to go to J's Express in the lobby and pay almost $3 for a bottle of soda.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - EXPENSIVE ITEM WENT MISSING IN ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed four nights at the Hyatt Regency Chicago in August 2011 for my birthday vacation. It was our first time in Chicago, so we spent a lot of time researching hotels and eventually decided to stay there. Turned out to be a HUGE MISTAKE. During our last night there, I realized that a brand new dress I purchased during our trip was missing. I specifically remembered leaving it next to the desk in a shopping bag - but while packing up, I noticed the shopping bag and my dress were both gone. I called the front desk and the unapologetic woman on the line said she would report my missing item to the Lost and Found office and someone would call me back. Upon checking out the next morning, I inquired about the status of my missing dress, and they said the L/F office still had not gotten back to them. As soon as the plane touched down back home, I called the Hyatt Regency Chicago and asked them to transfer me directly to the L/F office. The man I spoke with told me there was no record of my lost dress, so I had to explain the situation and describe my dress for the third time. He said he would call me back with an update - which he never did. Surprise, surprise. I finally heard back from him a week later after I called multiple times and all he told me was, "We didn't find it." No offer to continue to follow up, no offer to comp me with something (after all, it was a very expensive dress) - NOTHING. Fast forward to the present - my boyfriend and I are going back to Chicago this April for a wedding and we are definitely NOT even considering going back to the Hyatt Regency Chicago. For such a large hotel and an abundance of staff, not ONE PERSON took accountability for my dress disappearing from my hotel room. Such a shame. Moral of the story is: Don't stay here - a housekeeper probably stole my dress.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMaster
Reviews.Content: This is a Chicago favorite. The hotel itself is beautiful. The lobby areas are designed to promote social interaction. There are several nice meeting rooms that should be noted if you are looking to host a major conference including breakout sessions. The hotel restaurants are also high quality affording casual and semi-formal dining experiences respectively. The hotel is positioned in a great location next to the riverside. Three of my favorite places for good eats are within walking distance---Giordano's, Garrett's (popcorn), and the Grand Lux Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: peteb201
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for one night (Sat into Sunday). The front desk staff was efficient and cordial. Our room was clean and spacious with a moderate view from the 29th floor. Had a few drinks at the Big Bar. This is a great place to watch the game. You are literally surrounded by TVs. We went with the Awaken package which included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was pretty extensive and the quality was good. Called for car about 30 mins before departure and it was outside waiting for us. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful place, excellent food!”
Reviews.Author: nurse4death
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Chicago for her 30th birthday and we were greatly surprised! We were met by a very friendly man at the front desk who gave us a free buffet breakfast for a gift! The rooms were spacious, clean and we could see the lake from our room. The beds were very comfortable. In the evening, we sat for awhile out in the main room where fountains were spurting in different colors and the room was huge but felt cozy. The breakfast was amazing! Everything was there and with being a buffet the food was excellent! We were met with a smile and service was great! Definitely would refer anyone to this place and will plan to return myself!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room and location but without fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Joey965
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Hyatt Regency and the first time since their remodeling. I love the location of this hotel and the new remodeled rooms are great. My husband is a Diamond member so we used one of his upgrades for a Junior Suite and the size and configuration of the room was perfect. Great beds, great pillows and a shower with strong water pressure. Those are the big three in my book. The reason I can not give it 5 stars is due to the attitude and service of everyone we encountered; except for one employee in the Club Lounge. We stayed there 2 nights to attend a wedding over New Year's, so that might be why we encountered so many problems. On the plus side, a manager called my husband the day after we returned to say that he had been told of our experiences and was calling to apologize and see what he could do to make the situation right. Very, very impressive. Needless to say, we are headed back to the Windy City this summer to take in a Cubs/Cardinals game and I have already made our reservation at the Hyatt. Also, food in the restaurant was really good as were the refreshments in the Club Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - love the remodel”
Reviews.Author: DavoMama
Reviews.Content: My hunny had a conference in November, so I tagged along and worked from the hotel. We were both very impressed â€“ the renovations are beautiful. Our room overlooked both downtown and the lake. Love the modern feel with the 60s splash of color. The gym and amenities/services are great. Location is close to everything. Check them out on Facebook too to interact in a new way with the concierge staff â€“ very personable, very easy and very fun â€“ they had great recommendations and reached out once we arrived too. Service and housekeeping were top-notch. We did check-in early though, and our original room wasnâ€™t ready. They put us in a room next to an elevator and it was way too noisy. After a phone-call they moved us into a new room within an hour. I was impressed with how they handled it. One thing to note though is that the internet service in the hotel was spotty. It went out one morning for 5 hours which was challenging for me as I was working from the room. Other than that, no complaints. Iâ€™d stay there for fun too on our next trip. Iâ€™d give it a 4.5/5 stars if I could but I'm going up based on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but the parking fee is rediculous!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ironranger
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hyatt on Saturday January 14th for 1 night. The rate was $125 plus $21 taxes. The check in went smooth. The room was on the 9th floor in the west building. The building is older and the rooms seem a bit old. The hallways are in need of updating for sure. The rooms are poorly sound proofed. I could hear the cell phone ring, heater and toilet in the room next to us. The room itself was small but comfortable. The Parking fee of $50+ per day is outrageous. The cost for 3 at their 'bistro' breakfast was $70+.....not worth it. Location is very good, right on the Chicago River. But the costs of the food/parking would make this a hotel we would not stay at for more then 1 day.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: 433John
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrive at the front desk of the Hyatt Regency Chicago at 6 AM after a 15 hour flight from Delhi, India. We were tired, in need of a shower, and jet lagged. The greeting we received from Jason Jones was extraordinary. He got us into a great room in a matter of minutes and even upgraded us so that we could enjoy a great view of Lake Michigan at sunrise. Jason even called us once we got to the room to make sure that everything was in order and that the room met our expectations. He is a great representative for Hyatt and deserves special praise for how well he took care of us. We we checked out the next morning, we were better rested, clean, and happy to have met Jason. We thanked him personally for his help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dids50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel as part of a very large conference. The rooms were very large and elegantly appointed. The food was good (for the US) and excellent value. The Reception and concierge staff could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LillD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off of Michigan Ave. and right along the river. It's a great location for many downtown spots. Virtually every person at the hotel from Avi, our check-in person, to Anwar, our departure valet, exceeded our customer service expectations. The lobby/entry area is lovely, with little water touches enhancing the ambiance. The seating in this area is perfect for a quiet drink or a cup of coffee. This seating area is perhaps one of my favorite things about the hotel itself. Our room was of adequate size, clean, and with a great view. Looking out on a quiet (believe it or not) downtown short block with the Sears Tower in the backdrop was so nice. The beds were extremely comfortable. The pillows were far above the usual hotel type. One down side here is that there is no hotel pool. If you are traveling with younger children, or simply enjoy swimming or a hot tub for yourself, this is something you will not find in this hotel. I was told they have an arrangement to use a health club pool nearby, but in Chicago in winter, I didn't feel that was optimal for us. If you have other things to entertain/occupy your child, or if swimming isn't your thing, this hotel is very, very nice, and you would be hard-pressed to find more congenial and helpful service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RebaS83
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and great spacious, clean rooms. The only thing that was a little crappy was the lack of mirrors.. getting ready with other people in the hotel was difficult as the only mirror was in bathroom. The staff was friendly and the valet guys outside were helpful with getting a cabs. Trying to eat breakfast on a saturday morning was a little difficult as the line wrapped around the lobby so we walked to the nearby Houlihans for their breakfast buffet which was reasonably priced and decent. Def would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellersWord
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time in Chicago. The hotel was very clean and the location was perfect. We were 15min walking distance to pretty much everything downtown Chicago has to offer. The fitness room was above average compared to most hotels. The downside is that the hotel charges for internet, and downtown parking is very expensive. We spent $45/night in just parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good business/conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoloTravlr_34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business to attend a conference/event in January. Location - convenient downtown location, several restaurants within walking distance, easy cab ride to local places. 20 miles or so from the airport the cab ride over was about $40. Lobby - very spacious, plenty of rooms to sit, contains a restaurant for breakfast/lunch. Second floor has a large hotel bar. Check in and concierge is on the second floor as well as the bell desk. Rooms - clean, modern. TV was LCD of a decent size. Shower pressure was good. I didn't have a view but since I was here on business I didn't care. Two towers, try to be in the east tower if you're here for a conference, more convenient. Not a big deal either way. Walls are paper thin and could potentially be an issue as others have reported. I was here during the week and lucked out. Amenities - didn't use any while I stayed here, busy most of the time. Prices - on par with most major metro business class hotels, breakfast buffet was $22, hotel bar prices were normal, maybe a bit on the high side. I didn't pay for the room so I can't comment. (I live in NYC so prices for me were normal, may be a shock if you're from the suburbs or a rural area). Overall - good for business, if I was traveling here on personal I'd probably pay a bit more for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jc1001IL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend "staycation" in December, the weekend before Christmas. The location is great, walking distance of a lot to do downtown. Close to public transit and walking distance of shopping and museums. I was really surprised at how friendly the staff was when I checked in. The room was small and clean. The view from my room was amazing! The only thing I didn't like was the hotel soap was horrible. Everything else was perfect. The wireless is not free, so beware before you log on. The Big Bar was busy and the drinks but the drinks tasted great. I didn't try the hotel brunch, however. Overall, great place to use as a jump off point for downtown activities. I never felt either stalked by the staff or forgotten, which I liked. Everyone was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service at Check-In”
Reviews.Author: ElizaBeth H
Reviews.Content: There were no lines and I was greeted right away by Avi. He made sure that I understood the charges to my room and even worked to find me a "better" room. Avi made me feel welcome and started my stay at the Hyatt off on the right foot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.....staff could be better!!”
Reviews.Author: CruiseKing
Reviews.Content: I visited my hometown the weekend before Christmas for the festive holiday decorations in Chicago that time of year......and particulary, Michigan Ave. This is a great location because it's not as congested as just a block, or 2 away.....but so close to everything! Room was nice. Check-in personnel could have been better. Bar staff (Big Bar) "definitely" needed improvement.....bartenders have absolutely "no personality"....and both that I spoke to acted like you were bothering them when you asked for another drink, or had a question about the bar. I mentioned this to one of the managers. Lower level restaurant was over-priced for their breakfast. Came to $50 for 2 with just breakfast & coffee and waited for almost 1/2 hour to get our breakfast after ordering. As such, this hotel needs to amp-up it's personnel......or find some who really want to have the job & enjoy their work. I travel extensively, so I was rather surprised at the quality of service seeing as how this is a "Hyatt" product.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel over the New Years weekend, which was also her birthday. From the moment we arrived the service was very good. Everyone tried to be as accommodating as possible. Even with a packed house it never felt crowded or stuffy. The room was very clean, one of the cleanest hotel rooms I have ever been in. It had a great bathroom, minibar, and comfortable bed. We got a view of the City which was a real treat. Could not have asked for more out of this hotel. If you want to stay in Chicago, this is a perfect place. We walked to everything and it is right on the river with beautiful surroundings. You would be crazy to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: freqflyerSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in October on the first leg of my multi city trip. As my plans had changed at almost the last minute I hadn't had a chance to notify the hotel that I was cutting my trip short. When I confirmed this at check in the desk clerk immediately asked if there was something they could do to change my mind. I explained that my trip plans had changed and he then offered me the choice of two rooms that were available, making a recommendation as to which he thought was best. This turned out to be a room in the West Tower which is by far the quietest room choice. I made my way to my room and pretty much instantly ordered room service. This arrived within 30 mins and when I requested an additional condiment this was bought back up within 5 mins. The rooms are a good size with comfortable beds and pillows you literally sink into. The location is excellent for me as my office is within a ten minute walk. Itâ€™s also within minutes of the Magnificent Mile for anyone looking to shop. My one disappointment was the fact there is an additional charge for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Ashie24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 3 nights for an anniversary trip back in October. We purchased our room on booking.com and because of the discounted rate did not expect to receive any special service, however we were pleasantly surprised. Upon arrival to the hotel, our room was not yet ready so the concierge took our bags and stored them and told us we would receive a call once the room was ready. In conversation, we mentioned that we were in town for our anniversary and the staff member must have made a note somewhere. We checked into our room later that day, and about an hour after we checked in received a knock at the door. They brought us a complimentary bottle of Champagne, 4 fresh chocolate covered strawberries and a card wishing us a Happy Anniversary and a nice stay in Chicago. We kept expecting to receive a bill for the goodies, but it never came. It was such a pleasant surprise that made our trip extra special. Aside from that service, our room was only 4 stories from the top floor and had a fantastic view of the Chicago river. Our room was large, had a seating area and a very comfortable Queen size bed. My husband and I agreed that we would definitely stay at this hotel again and that we had never received some nice service from a hotel. Thank you Hyatt Regency for helping to make our anniversary trip a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for business”
Reviews.Author: AGSwallow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights; arrived early evening and was impressed. The entrance is great - a floating restaurant with an escalator up to reception. Two towers (east and west), with several places to eat and drink on site. A big room with a great view; floor to ceiling window. It is really well located for downtown, the parks and lakeside and river, which were great to stretch the legs after a day of conference sessions. Masses of meeting rooms. Very friendly and attentive staff. And responsive air conditioning! Some colleagues bemoaned the lack of HD TV and the Irish bar not open for lunch, but a big comfy bed and plenty of facilities nearby far outweighed this for me.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Chic001
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive is steps away from Michigan Avenue. It is central to many things including Navy Pier, a short taxi or longer walk (doable) to Millenium Park and the Art Institute. I stayed in the West Tower and it is more than comfortable. I have stayed there multiple times for conferences and most recently in November 2011. They have the baggage system down pat, easy access to cabs, a pub, coffee in the lobby and more....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, central to everything”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelto_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in the Hotel in April 2011. The hotel had a nice check in, though on the second floor. The had an expres check in for Hyatt Gold Members such as myself, which I used. They have 2 towers. i would recommend trying to be in the main tower, as it makes access to conference facilites, restaurants, etc, easier. If you want a DL type stay, with no prying eyes on your ins and outs, then maybe the other tower is for you! Got a nice high floor, with a view of another building! I guess i had a partial river view!New, modern room. Nice furnishings, great state of repair. i think it was recently renovated. The number of elevators felt adequate for the number of floors/rooms. Food is expensive, as is room service. Then again, you are in Chicago, so you should probably eat out! Check out was a breeze, and the check out clerk was most helpful, telling me about a mileage promotion they were having. Also, you can't beat the location, close to the Mag. Mile as well as State Street. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short trip!”
Reviews.Author: Nadineco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over new years (4 nights) and got a good price from hotwire.com. The hotel was huge, we stayed in the East tower, on the 30th floor in a king size bed room with a great view, and modern interior. The downside was that is was a handicap room, so it was close to the elevator that made quite some noise all thru the day. And the bathroom had no place to put our things (had to put everything on the floor), but they told use about it while we were checking in. Besides that the room had everything,VERY comfortable bed, coffee/tea maker, iron, tv++++ The staff were very friendly and helpful, except from one of the concierge that had a bad attitude. The location is central, right next to Millennium Park, and Michigan Ave! If youÂ´re not a fan of typical touristy big hotel with lots of people, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not a single complaint!”
Reviews.Author: gjaaa
Reviews.Content: View was fabulous, rooms were extremely clean (had 2 adjoining rooms), service was great, and breakfast was out of this world! Room service in a.m. a bit pricey (aren't they all), but the relish they served with the eggs just made the meal even more delicious. Kids had pancakes (one order would have been enough for two of them) that were also decadent! Really a wonderful hotel and the price was right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pricey but good service and location”
Reviews.Author: princess_software
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice before. Service is excellent. It's a grat hotel for work events and offers that open common areas for getting together. Not much for outdoor spaces when you just need some fresh air but you can easily walk to lots of bars and restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Chicago Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Cynrounds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend at the Hyatt for the Chicago Marathon. The hotel is in an ideal location for this event. It is very close to the red line, dining, and the start/finish of the marathon and of course...Michigan Ave. The view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier along with the city skyline was breathtaking. Staff as very helpful and accomadating. Facility is very clean. The only downside is the cost of parking per day but this is expected in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CZGreenlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for the first 2 days of a 4 day trip to Chicago at the beginning of December. We got a great rate through Priceline and would definitley consider staying there again. The staff was VERY friendly and willing to help with anything you need. The room was large and so modern and wonderful. The bathroom was huge and had great lighting. We also had a wonderful view from your room of the river and city streets. One of the best we've had since staying in Chicago. I would say the only down fall was that it was rather difficult to find the entrance with all the one-way streets. Parking was too expensive for valet, so we self parked and had to walk about a block to the hotel in the cold. The hotel was also huge with a ton of restaurants and lots of people hanging out in the lobby. But for being such a big hotel, we didn't hear any noise once we were in the room. I had an event to attend the two days we were there and getting to the highway wasn't as easy from this hotel as well. Regardless of the few minor faults, we would definitley stay again if we got the room rate we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: aghazanf
Reviews.Content: We booked a package deal (surf and park) and the cost was an amazing $129 . The staff was extremely friendly and everyone that I dealt with was very nice. I had booked 3 days before the new year and I wanted to stay another day for the New Years eve. Spoke to Steve Henderson @ the desk and he was as friendly as possible, took initiative to speak to his manager and I received the same package for another night. Very organize staff for the New Years Eve party. We couldn't go to the party since we have a 3 yr old, but as busy as the hotel was, no one was getting to the other floors per security's tightness. This would be my place every time I return to Chicago. whatever training the staff goes through is PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: dizzygoo82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December for 2 nights. We arrived at the hotel very early figuring we'd just drop our bags off and go wander around for awhile. But, they had rooms available so they let us check in and they even upgraded us and made sure we had a good view! The guy at the desk, Avi, was amazing! He was very helpful and upgraded us without us even asking. The hotel was very clean and I ate at the restaurant right across from check in and that was very good! The only thing that I have to complain about is parking is very high (50 a day) and wifi isn't free. But, I can overlook that because this hotel is very nice and has an excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: aliza s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for 6 days, through Christmas day and enjoyed it tremendously. The associate who checked us in (his name was Avi) was very helpful. he gave us a room with a spectecular view and made sure that we had what we needed according to our resources. We will definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needed ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Ash2580
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room in the east tower over new year's eve weekend, which I understand is a very busy time for most hotels. There was also an event on NYE in the hotel premises. First to list the pro's : It is extremely central - less than a few blocks to walk to the loop and magnificent mile. The rooms were clean. But the biggest issue I had was the noise. Since we booked on expedia, I wasn't expecting to get the best room, but on our first night, we got a room on the 30th floor overlooking the river, two rooms away from the elevator. This seemed very nice at first until it was night and the infernal noise started. The elevator made such a racket, it was impossible to sleep. The noise lasted through the night, not letting off for even 10 minutes, which means I spent most of my night reading a book. In the morning we asked for a room change, which we were readily given. This was a little further away from the elevator (on a lower floor) but the noise persisted here as well. At least I had bought some ear plugs this time, so I could sleep through the night. We could also clearly hear our neighbor's conversations. Overall it is a nice hotel but really have issues with noise control. If you get a room anywhere near the elevator, make sure you run down to the walgreens close by and pick up earplugs, especially if you are sensitive to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Everything seems good except for...”
Reviews.Author: VasusTravels
Reviews.Content: the room walls. The check-in was a floor above the entrance & it was pretty smooth. We were given a room on the 28th floor with the view of the river and the Wringley building to the left with the Trump tower behind it. Room was pretty spacious & the bathroom was just right. The problem occurred when we settled for the night & then we heard noises from the neighboring room...that's when we realized that the room walls were paper thin. Ofcourse our 1 night was totally ruined. Even though the location is great...also close to Nordstrom (walking distance), through which its easy to get to State street too, we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinSunseeker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights for a conference that was held at the hotel. I ended up getting what I believe was a handicapped room. The bathroom was enormous with granite everything. We had a lake view from the 24th floor and the view was spectacular. The hotel was clean and beautiful and the rooms were very comfortable. The location can't be beat. The walk down to Navy Pier was a 15 minute walk and Michigan Avenue was a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction. We walked everywhere. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mad880
Reviews.Content: We booked a great room and parking package for the Hyatt Regency through www.hotels.com. The $129 online rate beat the Hyatt's online room rate by at least $30 when parking is factored in. Tip: If you book through Hyatt directly, valet parking is $50 upon arrival, but on hotels.com our parking was only an additional $20 on top of the $109 rate that was offered for the weekday night. We also received wi-fi as part of our package. The Hyatt's rooms are modern and elegant. We stayed in a corner room in the East tower and had a GREAT view of the Wrigley Building and the river. The 'L' is just a few blocks away and you can easily walk to the Hancock building in less than 20 minutes. Our stay was fabulous and the only three issues we experienced were: 1. Every time we tried to call the front desk (about 5 times over the course of an hour the morning of our departure) we were immediately connected by the hotel operator, but no one ever picked up the phone at the front desk. 2. Our in-room checkout feature didn't work. 3. The valet was extremely busy the morning of our departure and I had to run him down to get my key because it appeared he was understaffed and overwhelmed that morning. I really wish I could give this property a 5 star rating, but it just didn't live up to my service expectations. We'd definitely stay again and hope that this service issues were just bad luck on our part.

Reviews.Title: “Great night”
Reviews.Author: Ashley8182
Reviews.Content: Went to stay for a late Christmas celebration. Great location. Regency Club room was beautiful with view of the river. The guest service rep was one of the best ?I've ever come across. My one issue was the service we recieved at the Big Bar. Bartender was rude and unfriendly, we felt very rushed and ended up taking our food to go. It was late at night, but not what I'd expect from a 4 star employee. Overall beautiful, clean property. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: nedve18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 6 nights, this is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The location couldn't be more than perfect, one block from Michigan Ave. I recomend this hotel no matter your trip purpose, you won't regret it. The only negative review I have is Jâ€™s Express, too expensive for salads and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: clkgrace
Reviews.Content: Loved the Chicago Hyatt, the hotel was very elegant, friendly, great location. I did reserve the Jr. Suite and was disappointed that the suite did not have a good view, but deciided to enjoy the extra space instead of the view. I had followed the hotel on Facebook for several months and was disappointed that I did not recieve the personal touch other recieved, but upon pointing that out Jennifer and Sarah sent me a special treat and I certainly was impressed. Thanks guys! We enjoyed our stay everything we wanted to see was conviently located, the conceirge always gave great instructions on public transportation and sightseeing. Don't be afraid to use the train or the bus, close by and convient. Loved eating at Houlihans, Bandera's and the Grand Lux, for a good cheap breakfast go to the connected Illinois Center, many fast food places and dunkin donuts for breakfast (one on every corner).

Reviews.Title: “nice downtown hyatt”
Reviews.Author: hcs7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and generally gotten a good deal. The beds are super comfortable and rooms are nicely decorated. Love the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be.”
Reviews.Author: kuddle21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Dec. 24 and had a great experience. We used Priceline and named our own price and this is where we happily ended up. The hotel is just a few steps away from the Magnificent Mile, wonderful location indeed. It's a very large hotel and it might even seem a bit confusing when you first walk in. They have everything from restaurants to a car rental kiosk. The rooms are well maintained and clean. Great views of the city and pleasant staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “bravo Hyatt Regency Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: mary i
Reviews.Content: my friends and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Chicago over trhe Christmas holidays. From check in to check out, we had excellent service, good food, and a terrific room. I especially want to recommend Avi, one of the hotel clerks, who made me aware of discounts that I qualified for- making an already enjoyable experience even more outstanding! So friends, ask for AVI, HE IS THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun5
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at a decent price on Priceline. It was a quick pit-stop post Dominican Republic vacation. We arrived late in the evening and were greeted by $50 parking. Not a happy surprise. We were too tired to argue or find a self park that was cheaper. The lobby is grand but escalators were broken. We were quickly checked in to the 22nd floor. We arrived at our room to find the bed crumpled and someone's belongings in the bathroom. We made the trip back down to the lobby to notify them that the room was occupied. They were very apologetic and upgraded us to a Jr Suite and gave us two vouchers for free breakfast. The beds were ULTRA soft and the down comforters were lovely! We rested up and continued our way home. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big busy business hotel”
Reviews.Author: nijunihk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 times this year (2-3 days each) for work. It's typically overrun with hordes of conventioneers. Even so, check-in & check-out has been consistently smooth, pleasant, and quick. Rooms are clean & modern, but can vary in size (one room with a single queen was very small). Beds are very comfortable. Getting a taxi at peak hours (bad weather & dinner time) can be difficult at the front door - walk underground to Michigan Ave & hail from the street. Fitness center is well-equipped but can be crowded due to the size of the hotel. Small grocery store 1/2 block away on Stetson. Location is excellent, on the river, walking distance (in good weather) to nearly everything. 5 city blocks to the Clark/Lake train station to O'Hare. Internet was $13 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: litespeedchick
Reviews.Content: Usually I like to suffer over picking a hotel, and try to find the swankiest , boutique-iest place possible ...that I can afford. However since I had Hyatt points, i booked this Hyatt without looking into it very much. I did not have super-high expectations from such a huge hotel. Boy, was I wrong. This Hyatt is very nice, our room (a jr. suite actually) was extremely nice with an unbeatable view of the river and straight up Michigan Ave. I loved the chaise right in front of the floor length windows. Bathroom was marble, shower was walk-in and huge, white ginger amenities smelled like gardenia to me. As always, the "Hyatt Bed" was the greatest...I keep threatening to suck it up and buy one of their branded pillow-top mattresses. Can't say enough about how delightful the bed is. The workout facility was also quite nice, with more treadmills and ellipticals than some gyms, and a cooler of frosty towels. Check-in and out was speedy, and while we were offered help with our bags, we weren't pushed into it. (Sometimes the super-swank hotels get on my nerves with the all the people grabbing my luggage.) Lots of cabs available at all hours, although we wound up walking to and from both the nearby subway (state and lake i think) and our restaurants (naha and frontera grill). It was a short jog to fantastic Millineum park and equally fantastic Intelligensia for coffee. So...great location. All in all, i think we had the best of both worlds here...the conveniences of a large business/conference oriented hotel combined with the luxury and service of botique hotels (but without the high price). We would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: cottageladybug
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire. Got a great deal! When we arrived, we were helped by Avi. Because we needed a rollaway bed for our third child, he graciously upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no extra charge. He later called our room to ensure we were satisfied and see if we had any additional needs. Great service! In addition, the hotel is gorgeous, and right on the river, one block from Michigan Ave. Great location! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Debbie P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to escape for the holidays and we had a great time. We love the city of Chicago and staying at the Hyatt was a complete pleasure. All of the staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful. The location is very central and the view from our room on the 31st floor was awesome. For as large as this hotel was it was very comfortable and felt homey. The elevators were very fast. I would recommend this hotel and will most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Allergies in bloom when you stay here”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and I was extremely disappointed. I called the hotel a week before arriving to request that no feather products were in the room due to allergies. I was assured that my room would be "defeathered" before arriving. When I checked in I was then told that my room had not been preassigned therefore had not had the feather products removed, but was told that they would send someone up to take care of that within the hour. A maid did come in and first took the blanket out that had been between 2 sheets and replaced it and then put it back in between the same sheets. The feather pillows were then replaced with FEATHER PILLOWS. The room was not vacuumed, and actually that seemed to be for quite a while. I needed to call to have the pillows replaced once again. I had left a message with the hotel manager who left me a message in return apologizing for the mix up, but no compensation was given, not even a free breakfast or drink, even though I was uncomfortable the entire time in the room. The bathroom floor had dust and dirt on it that was never cleaned the whole time. I will not stay at this hotel again and although I had previously thought that Hyatt was a very good hotel chain, I have now changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Too big and impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: Alex J
Reviews.Content: Some big hotels still manage to give special service and you feel well looked after, but at this hotel they do not pull it off at all. You are just a face in a sea of faces. The front desk girl was robot like in checking us in and sounded like she was reading a list of questions rather than actually speaking to us as people. Concierge always had a massive line and once you did get to talk to them they were pretty rude and wanted rid of you asap. The room was o.k. but bring your own toiletries. The ones they supply are cheap rubbish that absolutely stink! Bed was very soft and gave me a aching back. Avoid eating and drinking in the hotel. Overpriced and not good. Public toilets on ground floor always dirty and busy. Luckily I was only here for a few of nights but felt I had wasted my money paying to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Check- In Help”
Reviews.Author: susan j
Reviews.Content: Nataly was very helpful. When we told her it was our anniversary, a few minutes later she sent an appetizer to our room and a very nice card. Only disappointment, calling for a cab from the lobby was too slow.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable,enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: dowty_mp
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is recently remodeled and very nice. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful. The location is centrally located on the mag mile and we could easily walk to all there was to do downtown. Will definitely stay here again. Classy but not stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LungDocTraveller
Reviews.Content: Great welcome, wonderful location and staff that went out of their way to accommodate my needs. Avi, at the check-in desk fixed the only minor problem I encountered, and did so with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for a fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: ErthCrclr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located and has lots of things to recommend it. It is the largest Hyatt Regency in the world but manages to personally interact with guests in a welcoming way that would be more expected from a much smaller establishment. There are a few negatives: the wooden corners of our bed were pointed and protruding, so my shins got dinged up every time I forgot to give them a wider berth; there were no toiletries in the room upon check-in, but that was quickly remedied by a phone call; there was no tub; the concierges don't seem to be able to magically get reservations at high-end restaurants the way concierges in other major cities often can; and you can't store items in the minifridge. That last issue is relevant because you will be bringing back leftovers from the incredible Giovanni's stuffed pizza place about 3 blocks away. (Do not miss this Chicago-style pizza!) Other positives: the view from the west tower toward the water is wonderful day & night, especially if you are lucky enough to wake up to a snowy morning. There were individual reading lights on the headboard. The shower was hot and had perfect pressure. The word of the week on Facebook will get you free internet, a reduced parking fee, and possibly also another surprise...be sure to visit this hotel on social media! There is a well-stocked grocery store just behind the hotel. I had drinks at the Irish pub and Big Bar on the premises; both were fine. The Art Institute is just a 15 minute walk away on Michigan Ave, as is the seasonal public ice skating rink. And the hotel is easy to reach on the blue line from ORD...just take it to the Clark/Lake station for $2.25 and walk approximately seven blocks east and one block north. One more thing...if you love the blues, I recommend both Buddy Guy's Legends and Kingston Mines. The latter has two stages with music until about 4 a.m., which made me aware of yet another hotel positive: it was quiet enough to sleep in late on Sunday morning. ;~D

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, centrally located, walking distance to Magnificent Mile, Theatre District, Milleneum Park, Navy Pier. Staff is friendly and ready to serve. We got a late checkout for 3 pm which was perfect for us at no charge. We only stay at this hotel when visiting Chicago! Thanks Hyatt! Sarah and Jennifer, was totally surprised when I answered the door and a bellman was standing there with a tray of bottled water, a card and the best toffee I have ever had. Made me feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid but oriented to business stays”
Reviews.Author: Slowrider5
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location for getting to all the typical Chicago sights and sounds. Friendly staff and well-appointed rooms. Cons: This is a huge hotel, it was built for hosting conference travelers as others have noted. You can score a great deal on Priceline during times when there isn't a conference in town and they have a large amount of empty rooms. Be wary though, I got stuck near an elevator on the first night (probably because I was a Priceline customer). They were friendly in helping us change rooms the next day, which was nice. No free wi-fi and if you have AT&T, don't count on using your phone as a hotspot in downtown Chicago. I was traveling with a partner and wanted something at a very good price that was nice for a 3-day weekend stay. At the end of the day I felt I got a good value so I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pfpaul12
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, I had a concern with my room and Avi and his manager were both extremely helpful and moved me to another very nice room.l

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotels with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Smw17
Reviews.Content: We came to stay at the hyatt regency for my birthday weekend and it was a great experience. The hotel is located in a great spot where you are close to most spots a person would like to adventure too. The veiws from the hotel are great also. the rooms are clean and very tastefully decorated making them nice and cozy. The beds were so comfy, my only problem with the room was the bathroom...the plug-in was hanging out of the wall and did not work the second day we stayed here, also the shower seemed to be clean with the exception of a nice long dark hair hanging out and the dirty spots on the inside shower curtain..over all our experience was quite enjoyable..i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: jessica n
Reviews.Content: Friendly, professional staff. Building is old, but the rooms have new, modern interior. Checked in by Avi, who put us in a room overlooking the river. Feel very well taken care of. I'd give it a 5 stars if I didn't find hairs in the bath tub :p

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Hotel but no free wifi or complimentary brakfast”
Reviews.Author: tanuaditya1
Reviews.Content: I was put up by my company in this hotel. The locationw as apt as it was walkable from the Michigan Avenue and close to Navy pier too. I was surprised that with a $200 room per night, they did not offer a free wifi or complimentary breakfast. No picks and drops from the airport too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaMcKnight
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. We had a view of the lake and Navy Pier and there was plenty to do within walking distance. The inside of the room was nice but had some visible damage to the wallpaper in areas. The walls were really thin and we could easily hear our neighbors talking, luckily they were on a similar schedule to us. The hotel also charges 50 for parking, 25 for a fridge, and 13 for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: abbyov
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and got a great deal for end of July. Stayed for 3 nights. It's the largest hotel in Chicago, but it seems fairly well run. Service: Friendly staff who went above and beyond to fix a minor issue we had regarding hotel rooms (they had told us they'd move us to a new room, but didn't). We got a great room with a view to Magnificent Mile and free breakfast. Rooms: The first room was actually a half of a suite that had a queen murphy bed, and we were given 2 cots as well. The bed was comfy but the cots could have been better. Second room had a great view and was smaller but the bathroom was larger. It was perfectly clean as one would expect. Food: breakfast buffet was not worth the price. The selection was fairly limited and the food was average but not worth the $20+ they were charging.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with an equally good location”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: I was here with my wife for the weekend. We received excellent service from check-in (the bellman with our luggage beat us to the room and check in only took a couple of minutes) to when we left. The room was large and the Hyatt had all the amenities expected for a 4 star hotel. Room service was really good and quick. The internet was free which was a pleasant surprise for a hotel of this caliber. Loved the hotel location. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, museums, waterfront, etc but a little off the main area so you don't have to deal with the noise and pedestrian traffic when you are back at the hotel. If you needed a CAB there was always a line of them waiting for you. The complex had a full service business center but all services were for a fairly substantial fee. You could walk to other buildings without going outside and had access to many shops/restaurants within the complex of connected buildings. I would recommend a higher room away from the elevators. One issue with the higher rooms is the elevator service was sometimes spotty during peak hours. I will stay here again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: procyclist
Reviews.Content: This may not be the pinnacle of luxury hotels in Chicago, but I cannot find one single thing to complain about. Rooms are more spacious than some in the city, which seem to be more and more compressed to optimize the number of rooms they can squeeze into a building. The lobby and other amenities are great - big bar, lots of lounge and seating space, great snack bar/Starbucks, etc., etc. the best aspect is the central location - right between the Loop and Upper Michigan Ave. - everything's within walking distance. Would not hesitate at all to recommend it or to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and an overall great experience.”
Reviews.Author: cokat
Reviews.Content: I have had several visits to the Hyatt and the location is just great, you are in walking distance to so much. The Hyatt concierge were so helpful and know their stuff. On my many visits, I have had the pleasure of dealing with Jason Jones, a great asset to the Hyatt. He is very personable and very accommodating. All of the Hyatt staff that I have come in contact with have been VERY pleasant. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Service continues to be impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: ElSenorPetty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the regency at least 25 times and I have not encountered a hotel in Chicago with more consistent quality guest services. The rooms are great, especially for business. It's slightly on the high side for a hotel, but for the location, it's absolutely appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kellygal
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is in a great location. It was difficult to find the entrance the first time as it is not well marked but otherwise very easy to navigate. Front desk and staff very helpful. We got a great rate on priceline and could have upgraded at check-in but declined. My friends have upgraded and had fantastic views and rooms. Ours was standard. Very clean but had a foul smell that was tolerable (i have had to buy room refreshners at other hotels but was able to tolerate this one). Lots of condensation on window made it hard to see out but for the price paid for this area it was a good compromise. Within walking distance of Water Tower and Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Bowling_Guru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Regency after booking on Hotwire. We were given a room that overlooked the Chicago River & Navy Pier. Very nice room, very clean, and the service was great. Just a couple blocks away from shopping & entertainment. Only tip I have is to park at the lot across the street instead of paying to park at the hotel. $15 cheaper per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Meet Friends for Chicago Adventure”
Reviews.Author: MarciMo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, along with my brother and his wife for a birthday celebration weekend. The rooms are very nice and the lobby area is huge with many spots to meet up with friends before retreating to your room. The location is great - awesome views and a few blocks from shopping, restaurants, & bars. Fun time!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by Chicago Elegance & Charm”
Reviews.Author: amerinurse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Dec 5th. It chose me, because it was a blind "name your own price" on priceline (I named $75). I couldn't have been more pleased. 1st- don't pay the $50 a day to park at the hotel lot- there's a $35 one at 111 Wacker (just west of the hotel). 2nd-this hotel is on the river, which is the most beautiful part of chicago in my opinion. Our room happened to look out toward the river and the lake, and it had ceiling to floor windows to add to the drama. :) 3rd- its a big place but staff was friendly and helpful with finding our way. 4th- the room was spacious, clean and modern. 5th- it is a very easy walk (5min) to michigan and the magnificent mile shopping, and to the theater district (7min to the Chicago theater) Downsides- no pool (I didn't care since I didn't bring my kids this time) and no microwave to heat up your leftover deep dish pizza. That's it! Overall, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Shopping Trip With My Girlfriend Was Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Every thing about the Hotel was fantastic from the Valet service to the Room service! We always felt welcomed and taken care of and can't rave enough about the experience! We are going to back with her children later this month and will deffinetly be staying at this Hotel again. It was close to everywhere we wanted to go on Michigan ave. and not to far from the Gold Coast shopping we wanted to do as well!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Keszee
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal with priceline, only $75 per night for December weekend, but can't understand why you only get 3 towels and 1 wash cloth per day. Also, stayed three nights and did not receive new soap or shampoo after checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located!!”
Reviews.Author: gbb222
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on August, 2011. It's well located, just few steps from the Michigan Ave., for those who love shopping!! And the viem from the South Tower is amazing, I woke up when the sun was rising, I took some great pictures. The breakfast is very good too, it's a real meal. The room is very confortable, the bed and the bathroom as well... I loved the hotel, and I recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hyatt standards.”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: The first impressions when you enter are not up to much. It is big, brash and not classy. Had to wait an eternity for the lift to get to room. Room disappointing and noisy from passing people. Hairs in bathroom and towels were gross.They were greyish in colour they were so old and threadbare. Went for drink downstairs and it was extortionate. They charge prices you pay in top hotels, which this is not. Tried breakfast once but didnÂ´t make same mistake twice. It was luke warm at best and crowded. Very average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location!”
Reviews.Author: cao1530
Reviews.Content: Love the Hyatt Regency. Stay there every year at Christmas time and have never had a problem. Location just off Michigan Ave, can walk to almost anywhere. Regency Club is a great value if you plan to stop back at the hotel in the evenings- saves big $$$ on food and beverages, including breakfast. Great view of the lake and river- don't waste your money on the $20 "city view"- the free view is just wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like distinguished guests!”
Reviews.Author: coryandcarissa
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay here! Scored this hotel for 5 nights for a ridiculously good price via Priceline, and couldn't have been happier! I had friended the hotel prior to our arrival on Facebook, and upon check-in I immediately felt more like family than a "friend!" While checking in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite = Sweet! After a long day of travel with our two young children we ordered a Lou Malnati's pizza delivered to the hotel (IMHO, best deep dish in Chicago), and had a knock on the door in the midst of our pizza party. Why whoever could that be? Well, it was the hotel, sending us up a box of sinfully delicious chocolate covered toffee as a thank you for being part of their social network! Wow! Couldn't believe how wonderful they were to us! Really made us feel like distinguished guests!!! Had a great rest of the stay as well. Everyone we encountered was very eager and happy to help us, great attitudes, very friendly and courteous. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Diane54935
Reviews.Content: Everything about our experience with the Hyatt Regency was perfect! The service was amazing, the room and view was magnificent. Location was exactly what we were looking for during our stay. We will definitely return and would highly recommend the Hyatt! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: SueDere
Reviews.Content: Good views of the downtown in some rooms, nice views from the bar. Rooms were very big and modern. Great location, walking distance to Magnificent Mile, to shopping areas and art museum, cultural center, etc. Nice restaurants on the area. What I did not like is that they charge for internet and you need to pay for each thing: computer, ipad, etc.! And it was not cheap. Also they charge a lot for water, a very small bottle (6 US) !!! beer and other things on the fridge. They did not have a list with the price, you need to call to find out that they will rob you. The worst detail they have is a sign inside the room fridge that says you can not use it to put food or you will be charge 25 dollars. I wanted to put an apple and some chocolate but ... The room had a constant noice probably from some water heater or who knows!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing VIP treatment”
Reviews.Author: Zehir N
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal for the Thanksgiving night and following night. It got even better thanks to the friendly and kind front office agent, Avi. He treated us with VIP status and it was great. Room was huge and loved the modern bathroom. Great services by the Regency Club. Location is perfect for tourists and those who love the sights and activities of the city. Only downfall, if you have a car, be prepared to pay, 50 dollars valet for 24 hrs in hotel and slightly lower around, further out parking lots cost less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MaryAndRickTravel
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on priceline.com for a Friday night in December. The location is perfect. Great view of the downtown. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable king bed, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the city for a few days in November while my husband attended a conference. The location is fantastic, right at the base of where the fun shopping begins. Our room was very clean and on an upper floor facing the river and city which was beautiful. The room felt spacious and had all the necessary amenities--large TV, mini-bar, comfy bed, iPhone charger, safe, coffee maker, large desk area, and several drawers for clothing. The bathroom was on the smaller side but was clean and also had a makeup mirror. The hotel itself is huge, with a giant atrium, restaurants, bars, and a little gift shop. One reason that I could not give this hotel 5 stars is that it caters to the business traveler--the convention types. it gives you just exactly what it thinks you might need and nothing extra. it's those smaller touches that keeps this hotel in the 4 star class. if you can handle that then I think it's a fine hotel. The staff was always friendly and helpful. In fact, a coworker left his iPod in his room and was notified later that housekeeping had found it. We had yet to check out of the hotel so we were able to retrieve it for him.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhiellen
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is located close to the Magnifient Mile, Museums, and shopping, I don't think that it warrants 4 stars. The lobby is in badly needed renovation: as you look up at the huge atrium, the windows are cloudy, and need to be replaced, the water feature reeks of chlorine, and the furniture is stained and dirty. The rooms (we had a deluxe, with a view,) was very clean and comfortable, but the towels were thin and grey. We paid 35.00 extra per night for access to the Regency Club, for that we had a breakfast much like any express motel, fresh fruit thoughout the day, tea, coffee, soft drinks, bottled water, and wonderful cookies. While the rooms were clean and comfortable, the atmosphere of the hotel leaves a lot to be desired...Stetson's restaurant, on the other hand, was very upscale, and the food was and service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: cheapguy23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a 3 day weekend getaway. I booked on priceline and got a good deal. The check in was seamless, everyone was very friendly and courteous. The room itself was clean and very modern. Newly appointed bath fixtures, of course very large TV and queen bed. The only thing I was disappointed in was the bed. A couple of nights I had difficulty sleeping. The bed and pillows were just ok, wasnt too pleased with that. Everything else we enjoyed. The hotel itself is off the mag mile, close to everything! Walking distance to Navy Pier, Lucky Strikes bowling and AMC theater, and tons of restaurants and shopping. We had a nice walk to Ruth's Chris steakhouse and Michael Jordans. If you are looking for food courts, head to the West tower and go to the bronze level(lower level). That is a pedway to the Illinois center next door, which has tons of restaurants in the adjacent building. Houlihans restaurant next door has a breakfast buffet I think every morning, so that can be an inexpensive way to get that start in the morning. On a nice day, the river walk across the street is a scenic view of the river and beautiful skyline. While you are on Michigan Ave take a pic with the huge Marilyn Monroe statue. Keep in mind, as with the rest of downtown, there is no parking(free anyway.) Either walking or taxi is your best option. Parking at Hyatt is $50 per nite, the other lot is $35 per nite. So get dropped off by a friend or take a taxi there, otherwise get ready to spend $$$$$ for parking. BTW, in the lobby of the east tower is J's express, which serves Starbucks coffee and other snacks and ice cream and open 24hrs. If you feel like going out for extras, Bockwinkels is a block away and is a mini-supermarket with everything from cereal to wine to deli meats. I suggest this if staying in for long periods of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel96
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago with a AAA motorcoach tour. The room was spotless, and comfortable. Very nice modern amenities. Service was prompt and friendly. The concierge Robert was very helpful with suggestions on where to eat and directions to several attractions. The Bistro had very good food. The Hyatt is in an excellent location. Very close to Michigan Avenue and nice restaurants. Thank you for a wonderful stay! Next time in Chicago, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mcdentiste
Reviews.Content: One block from Michigan Ave and accessible to both downtown and upper Michigan Ave. Staff is helpful with restaurants and directions. Parking is valet and car retrieval is prompt considering the size of hotel. Rooms have been completely updated and quite pleasant. Lighting could be a little better in main room but is acceptable in bathroom. Would definitely consider on next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location. AMAZING SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: GabDC1
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The front desk agent Avi N. was very helpful about all of our needs, he made our stay in Chicago wonderful experience. We will defiantly come back. Thank you Avi.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: longhornLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency back in August for several days on my first trip to Chicago. The hotel is very nice, comfortable, and beautiful. The rooms are quite large (at least the one that we had) and the service was nice as well-- we had no problems requesting extra items like blankets, pillows, etc. The location is perfect. The view was beautiful, and it was a very short walking distance to the river tours (just below, in fact) and to "the Bean" and Giordano's. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sabrina00
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean and comfortable, but the best part were the people. The front desk workers were so helpful about any of our needs. Sometimes helpful people make the stay just right.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golfdr
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a good hotel catering to large convention groups. If you are expecting any more, you will be disappointed. It is efficient at what it does. It moves large numbers of people through checking, through its restaurants, and through checkout with a minimum of hassles. It has a nice bar--the Big Bar--with great views of the river and downtown Chicago. The breakfast buffet was good with cooked to order omelettes and lots of other good breakfast items (although short on fresh berries). The rooms are pretty basic but clean and adequate. I stayed on the club floor and the club was also pretty basic--cheaper drinks than the bar but nothing special on the munches and pretty pedestrian surroundings. Glad to have the newspapers and bottles of water. In short a good industrial strength hotel, but if your tastes are fine hotels check out the Peninsula, Trump, Park Hyatt or Ritz Carlton instead.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: huge hotel, but there are better ones in the area and there are hyatts more outstanding than this, like the one in new delhi

Reviews.Title: “Not just a conference hotel. GREAT service.”
Reviews.Author: MicheleLubbock
Reviews.Content: Simply put - I hit the jackpot! Hyatt, you should commend your staff for excellent service. I never once had any problems. Here are the details of my trip... I got a great deal on Facebook (48 hour sale). I regularly stay at Hyatt when I can but it is usually for business. I always stay at Hyatt Tamaya in Albequerque for pleasure (great priceline rates). Anyway, I was a little worried because I knew this hotel was large and my elderly parents were coming with us. Also, I didn't want to stay at a conference type hotel for Thanksgiving. Well, the hotel may be large but it is very easy to get around. Everyone from the bellman, to the valet to the front desk to housekeeping was SO nice. They went out of their way to accomodate us and I felt like we were at a second home for the holidays. Some special details I would like to point out... If you are parking at the hotel, be sure to check out the facebook "word of the week" and get $15 off parking - a deal! Larry, who worked at the valet was great as was everyone else who took care of our parking needs for the week. Andy at the bell desk was awesome. He helped me with our family "elf's (elf on the shelf for those of you with kiddos)" surprise for my daughter. She was so excited! One night, my hubby accidentally locked us out of our room and locked the adjoining room door. Andrea and Robert (the security staff) were great - so friendly and told us not to worry. Someone from engineering came up (less than 10 minutes) and opened the door (got my hubby out of trouble - haha). This is a great location and short walking distance to all the shops. Not only would I stay here for a conference, I would stay here again for fun. Thanks to all the staff at the Hyatt Chicago for a memorable week! You should be commended for having such great customer service. Thanks, Michele

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: chbruce
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weekend nights over Thanksgiving weekend, booked through Priceline at a rate of $135 a night. The hotel has 2 towers -- East tower is where most of the amenities are and the West Tower, where we stayed, is across the street, connected by an interior walkway. Overall, we enjoyed our stay a lot. The room wasn't huge, but was comfortable enough (the bed was very comfortable!) OK assortment of TV channels -- but I really wish that hotels would consider that women might prefer a channel mix not so dominated by ESPN and 24 hour news channels. They could use more counter space in the bathroom. Loved the free in-room internet and the snack shop in the lobby. While the room was nice and clean, the lobby furniture could use a good steam clean -- the sofas all looked a bit dingy. A tip to future travelers -- we were staying in the city for 2 nights then moving to another location where we'd need a car. Rather than rent a car at the airport and then pay for parking, we found that it was more economical to rent at the hotel's on-site Hertz location and return the car to the airport (no additional charge for dropping the car off at O'Hare).

Reviews.Title: “Tops for service”
Reviews.Author: TravelFanca
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. I could not believe how great the service was at the hotel. Room was gorgeous, view was really amazing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Erinn C
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond for my sisters, friends, and I. It was the perfect venue to host our pre- and post-bachelorette festivities. It is located near the river and just off of Michigan Ave, walking distance to all that downtown Chicago has to offer a group of girls ready for a night out on the town! Our room was spatious, clean and comfortable. I highly recommend choosing the Hyatt Regency for your next Chicago trip or just a fun night out downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great price on a holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: velab
Reviews.Content: Stopped in Chicago for a quick weekend to visit family and got a great price for a beautiful room. The room overlooked Millenium Park in the East tower and had floor to ceiling windows with the bed facing the window instead of the TV. Great layout that made the room seem huge. Bed was so comfortable and loved the lighted makeup mirror in the bath that doubled as a nightlight. I would love to recreate this room at home! It was lovely,except maybe the modern chairs. They were not so comfortable but fit in with the decor. We happened to be near the elevator and that was a bit noisy with people talking. Would stay here again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for enjoying Chicago”
Reviews.Author: allen006
Reviews.Content: We stay here often, and find this location ideal for enjoying the city. The hotel is located on the river, just across the river from the Magnificent Mile, a few blocks from Millennium Park, a few blocks from Navy Pier, and easy walking distance to the Theater district. The staff is helpful and friendly, the concierge is knowledgeable and eager to help you enjoy this amazing city. I use this hotel for business visits, family visits and just fun weekends with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a classy & fun girls night out”
Reviews.Author: Katherine M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated like guests. We had loads of things to bring up to our room (pre-bachelorette faire) and it was all taken care of for us. The parking valets were extremely helpful and the price was reasonable for downtown Chicago. So simple. Checking in was effortless and we able to give the receptionist information to help direct guests, arriving later, where to go. The hotel was very clean, modern, and great walking distance for a fun night out on the town. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice night out in the 'Windy City'. The price is reasonable when compared to the quality of stay you receive, not to mention there is a restaurant/bar right in the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Frostdsnoman
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago for holiday with friends. Stayed in a suite and had no issues. Bed was hard to leave on the morning it was so comfortable. Love room renovations. Staff was all very accommodating. Was able to walk to everything. Valet of $50 is pricey, but it is smack dap in middle of city. Might consider taking train to city next time. Certainly will return on future Chicago trips.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dimillage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Labor Day Weekend this year. I have nothing but great things to say about it! We were treated great from the moment we pulled up until we left! We stayed 2 nights, we were in town to see the Bears on Thursday, and went to hang out at Kingston Mines on Friday night. It was nicely located; we drove down to Navy Pier in a few minutes, and it was a short cab ride to the Mines. My husband walked to Michigan Ave. The hotel was huge, and even though it was a sold out weekend (2000) rooms, I didn't feel like a number, I felt like a valued customer. Take advantage of the social media site offers- they have a word of the week, and that week it was discounted parking! Fabulous! We came back from the game, and management had sent up a handwritten note thanking us for following them on Facebook along with some delicious toffee and nuts.....nice touch! We normally stay at the Four Points Sheraton, which is also a nice hotel, but I believe we will be staying at the Hyatt next trip too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great room but poor internet connection”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago from Nov 21 to Nov 25. The room is very clean and the location is outstanding! However, there are two areas of improvement: 1) The internet connection is very spotty. 2) The hotel only provide soap bar. Some people would like to use shower gel instead of soap bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, no ice and a femake robot handling check-ins”
Reviews.Author: Lizacamellia
Reviews.Content: Pros: The room was a nice size, clean and the bed was comfortable. The housekeeping personnel were nice. All around it was a pleasant stay. The burgers at Bistro 151 (or 51?) were much better than I expected. Cons: at check-in an employee couldn't find the correct reservation and just kept repeating that they were full and only had us for one night, even though the seminar we were attending at the hotel lasted 4 days. Her attitude was surprisingly uninterested, basically "well, sorry you'll have to sleep in the open". Then magically she found the correct reservation and suddenly was annoyingly chirpy asking for forgiveness. A robot or maybe, Siri!, would have shown more empathy at the possibility of us having to somehow find a hotel at the last minute. However, must say that the next day we went to check if everything was finally resolved and the other lady we spoke to was very polit and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Mega-hotel overlooking the river & off Michigan Ave; clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: A massive, convention-y hotel, characterized by a large glass-covered atrium-lobby, with ample space for lounge/dining area, gift shop, bar & restaurant, water pond, and the oh-so-80s metal rigging for lighting and hanging out ... maybe for evening disco too(?) ... but a very nice, convenient downtown hotel! Check-in is at the 2nd/mezzanine floor via escalator ... with a very nice welcome, and warm smiles at the front desk. We stayed 2 different times at this hotel within a span of a week, so we gave it a good test-run. Both times requesting King size bed, getting 2 different views. We liked both rooms, each slightly different in set-up and views (see attached pics). The Good: As we said, warm welcome checking in each time, but maybe given we are Platinum members of their loyalty program (hopefully, true for all guests). We stayed in the "West tower" each time, which offered high-floor, wonderful views from our rooms... first stay was facing the river below, tour boats, the Navy Pier and Lake Michigan, and the second stay, faced North with beautiful views of the river below and Wrigley building & others, up Michigan Ave. Rooms were modern, simple, comfortable, and most importantly, very clean. One stay, we had a glass-enclosed walk-in shower, and the other stay was standard tub/shower. They arranged one room differently than other, but same basic amenities & furniture. Bathrooms were clean throughout our stay, which included basic toiletries. The rooms were uber-quiet, with no hint of neighbors (and we knew there were people next door, and on our floor). We did not try the restaurants or room service in the hotel, given so many options in Chicago. There is an ample fitness center, with all expected equipment, but no pool. Even with its size, the hotel was very comfortable and nice. Internet was included as complimentary, but if not loyalty member, chargeable. Service beyond the check-in was adequate, especially given the size of this hotel. The hotel is right off Michigan Ave, right by (2) bridges that cross over the Chicago River. It's very convenient to walk North to Michigan Ave shopping, or East toward Navy Pier, or South toward the wonderful Millennium Park (Bean sculpture), Art Institute of Chicago, though a maybe for some, a little far (for walking) for all the other museums (Field, Shedd, Adler, etc) clustered further South. We found it very, very convenient, as there are tons of buses on Michigan Ave to take you anywhere, the EL subway somewhat close also, and plenty of taxis if preferred. Park the car for this city ... unless going to further outreaches! The bad: it's a busy atrium, with busy entrance of taxis, cars, and people going in/out. This is normal for a large sized hotel like this one. Gratefully, the West tower where we were, has its own entrance, and sped us to our rooms without having to go through the main lobby, and a bridge that connects the East tower (where lobby is) to our West tower.
