Do expect conventions to occur during your visit. The hotel has large meeting rooms, banquet halls, and ballrooms, to accommodate many activities, so it could be busy with people, loud (with music), and cordoned off areas. It was not a big deal for us, as we did not encounter any problems. Summary: It's a good, large convention oriented hotel, but suitable for all kinds of visitors, families, couples, etc.. It is a very clean, efficient, comfortable, modern hotel, with enough warmth for those who travel enough and do not need full service/hand-holding by staff. They were fine. Stay in the West tower if possible, as it is closer to the river, and offers great views of the Lake and city. Happy Hotel-ing !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RStepanski
Reviews.Content: One of the best bangs for your bucks in all of Chicago. The Hyatt's location is within walking distance of Navy Pier, the Magnificent Mile on Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park and the "Bean", Buckingham Fountain, and tons of Restaurants in River North. The Staff is always happy to see me and often go out of their way to take care of any request.

Reviews.Title: “Big, but good service”
Reviews.Author: 124MikeS
Reviews.Content: For a 2000 bedroom hotel I was impressed with their service. I slept through my wake up and they sent someone up to wake me. Pretty impressive for a hotel that size.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good for a conference”
Reviews.Author: elh76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights for a recent conference at the property. The hotel is huge and a great spot for a conference. I've traveled to Chicago more times than I can count but this was my first time here. I'm not entirely sure I'd recommend it for family travelers or those not traveling for business to Chicago. Your feet will hurt just walking from one part of the hotel to the other! The conference rooms and exhibit areas were very large and modern; I will say that the layout is confusing despite the multiple signs and color coded levels at the hotel. I stayed in "floating king" room with a great view of the river and water. I highly recommend that room set up, because it is different and good use of the space. The room was small, but if you don't spend a ton of time in there, it shouldn't matter. I thought the layout was really cool and sort of unexpected; something different and fun for my stay here. I was on the 30th floor. We ate at the main restaurant and cafe twice and the buffet was good quality and lots of options. I liked the quesadillas very much. Big Bar upstairs was really loud and fun, everyone has a good time up there. Prices at both places are to be expected. The room service for breakfast was very very expensive. I had toast, fruit and coffee and it was $30. Recommend eating downstairs and grabbing a quick bit of fruit, Starbucks, and something else to save some cash. Location is good but not next to 'everything' - you are within walking distance of Milennium Park and a bit farther to Michigan Avenue shopping. Otherwise a $6 cabride to the shops. The river area is really cool to be near, and views of the cool architecture was nice to have as well. I've said it is more of a business location versus vacation location for that reason. I'd recommended going closer to the shopping and train lines if you're coming to Chicago on vacation. I think the closest train stop was Lake/Clark and it was about 1-mile. So I took the El from O'Hare and then taxi to the hotel (total cost $8). All of the people I came in touch with - room service, wait staff, concierge, check-in desk, folks answering the phone, etc - were very professional and helpful. I did not have a bad experience at any staff. Only other Chicago tip I can share: beware of the cab drivers and ask before you climb inside the car whether they take credit cards. We had a ton of weird and unfortunate experiences with the drivers who would only take cash EVEN THOUGH it is passengers' rights and city law that they take credit cards. Don't believe them if they say the machine is broken!

Reviews.Title: “Average..expected more from the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: cplot
Reviews.Content: I expected more since it was 'The Hyatt' Food in center restaurant..poor. Big Bar had nice decor, pricey Room - clean, nicely decorated, bed and pillows were comfy Bathroom - expected litte more, towels old, and worn could have been more plush. Valet service - very helpful. Front desk staff courteous. Elevators - slow Coffee shop - long line, warm soda

Reviews.Title: “Below expectation”
Reviews.Author: AvidTr
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was not as nice as I would've expected in a hotel like this. And the worst of all, the shower head wasn't working. I found out 4am in the morning when I had an early morning meeting that day. forced to move room right then. not a good thing to start your day before important meeting. Also, maybe because they changed the room. The cleaning service missed my room. When I came back from a long day at 5pm, the room was still not cleaned. The sleep was good though. Would think twice before booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Chrisschmied
Reviews.Content: I went for 4 days, 3 nights for a work conference, and it was a great stay. We were treated to wonderful customer service and excellent accommodations. They are pricey, but I'd expect that of any hotel in their location. It was very convenient to everything we wanted to see downtown (the pier, the riverwalk) and we had a good time. The photos on their site of the rooms were accurate to our experience, and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business.....Probably leisure too”
Reviews.Author: jambony
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located- very clean and service one expects from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago for the Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GrammaOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Nov 12-14, 2011 This was a weekend trip with a friend I've known for 30 years. Our family lodging fell through at the last minute and I used the "blind booking" option on Expedia. The room rate we received was excellent. I would stay here again. Staff was attentive and professional, location excellent and all went well -no glitches, which seem to happen more often when using Expedia. Our trip was focused on seeing a concert and taking some extra time to explore the area. We didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel -mostly stopped in to sleep, but found the experience pleasant. Check in was fast and efficient and friendly. We had only one meal at the hotel -breakfast in "The BISTRO 151" in the atrium lobby. Food was good, hash browns a bit heavy, but I could have left some on the plate. Prices are a little steep, but we found that all over Chicago. 151 has a beautiful sun filled atrium atmosphere that is excellent for a morning meal. There is a Starbucks in the lobby as well a small, expensive snack stand. Our room was beautiful, clean and the beds comfortable. A plus included internet in our room with no additional charges. Nice and roomy bathroom stocked with "white ginger" based products - they were good, but a bit too clashy with any other scent you may be applying. Close to Millennium Park, the Bean and walking along the lakeshore. There are a huge variety of stores nearby including functional ones like CVS. Many options for food, beverages and entertainment nearby --just steps to anything it seems. Good trip overall!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey P
Reviews.Content: We definitely slept well here, and it's a close walk to everything downtown. We were near the elevator which was a bit noisy but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Karl S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and choose the hotel because of the location and the chain brand but disliked the hotel and the lazy staff. Everything was too much trouble for them. Room service expensive and the food was cold. The room itself was lacking many things and did not have a luxurious feel at all. The breakfast was disgusting and the eggs were like rubber. The overall experience was terrible and this is the worst Hyatt Regency we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Location awesome, but don't stay near elevator”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work / recreational visit recently. NIce room, decent ammenities, but the elevator sounded like the "L train" passing through my room each night. I don't wake easily, but that thing kept me up. If you stay, simply ask for a room away from the elevator, and you'll have a decent time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Pamj03
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hot Wire for a great price. The location of the hotel was a little off the main path, but overall I would stay there again. It was close to some of the major attractions. The John Hancock Observatory was in walking distance and the Navy Pier was a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Three Ring Circus”
Reviews.Author: NellT
Reviews.Content: This is very far from a luxury hotel experience. The lobby is like a three ring circus. There are multiple escalators, a large water feature and restaurant/lounge. It is difficult to find the check-in desk (on 2nd floor up the escalators). The rooms are passable, but bedding was really lacking--not enough blankets--no comforter--a real disappointment. The air handling in the room was also very noisy. The only good thing about my stay was the room service, which was as advertised with good quality food. I can recommend the 1/2 chicken under a brick but caution folks to avoid the spinach unless they really like it saturated with oiI. I would not stay here again--even if this were the designated meeting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago location, big convention hotel with its own convention center”
Reviews.Author: Sugarsgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago employees are very welcoming, very professional, and helpful. The doormen greet you, the bellmen are right there, the front desk personnel are efficient, patient and cheerful, the concierge folks knew the neighborhood and assisted with some decisions. The Hyatt people all seemed to be happy to be at work. This hotel has a lot of rooms. When the meeting ended for the day, there was an elevator traffic jam for the six East Tower cars going up the 28+ floors. I don't know if the West Tower has similar log jams. Hyatt employees were managing the hordes during the times when the elevator traffic jams were occurring. [Truly appreciated] It is a bit confusing that the registration is on the 2nd floor - but you only have to register once. The room was comfortable and quiet. I slept well. I didn't have any complaints about the beds - colleagues in other rooms on other floors found the beds too soft and some with squeaks. Lots of pillows per bed. The desk, television and modern easy chair were all fine. There really wasn't a water view from the 28th floor. The Lake is blocked by the other high rises and the river is just north, but below street level. However, depending on what side of the building you are on - you can see some famous Chicago building tops. I ate at Daddyo's [late night dessert] and at Bistro 151 [lunch]. The food was good and the prices reasonable for hotel based restaurants. The service in Daddyo's was very good but the service at Bistro 151 was indifferent. However, if you go down to the Bronze level and head west out of the West Tower, you will find an underground food court that includes a grocery store, dentist and bank. The usual fast food suspects and other options for grab and go or sit down for those meals you don't want to spend too much money on or need to overeat due to huge portions. Venture south past the fast food places and you can get to a real restaurant without going out in the cold. I've been in this hotel a few times before - always for professional or work related meetings. The underground convention center is under both towers, 2 floors deep and quite expansive. It takes about a day to maintain orientation between towers, level colors and the names of the meeting rooms and ballrooms. The fitness center is also underground and tucked away. If the weather is acceptable, you can get a fine workout walking or running to the museums, the Miracle Mile, or along the Lake front. You can pay to go to the next door athletic center that has a pool and classes. Don't put anything in the not a refrigerator refrigerator. The hot beverage maker is just fine for a tea drinker [coffee is also provided]. So, this was a fine hotel. I'd stay here again and feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Big by Chicago standards”
Reviews.Author: imreading
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to review this property when it already has over 1400 reviews. However I stayed here in November and have stayed here at least 20 times in the past 4-5 years. To start out, this is not my favorite hotel in Chicago. That said, the Hyatt can be a great experience. It starts with check-in. I have had the standard room where I thought I was in a 3 star hotel wannabe. I have also stayed in a Jr. Suite. Do your best to inquire at the desk and demand a clean room and a quiet floor. Next is your dining experience. The big bar, if you are alone, is just not that comfortable. Stetsons is a steakhouse and is OK. remember this is Chicago and there are at least 7 prime steakhouses within a 10.00 cab ride. If you want quiet, a drink and comfort without leaving the hotel your only real choice is stetsons, your room or DaddyO's pub. If you feel like walking for 5 minutes I recommend the Palm restaurant next door and also the South Water Kitchen on Water street. If you walk there in the winter, be sure to go out the west tower entrance. Both locations handle single patrons just fine There is always foot traffic and hustle/bustle in and around the Hyatt and towards Michigan avenue even at night. So if it is a nice Winter night and you feel like a walk it is safe. Usually you will see others walking the same direction. That is one of the charms of downtown Chicago for a single traveler. Also, cabs are cheap in Chicago. You can go from the Hyatt to the Water Tower place on North Michigan ave for shopping/dining for 7.00 with tip. Then walk back down Michigan ave and stop in all the shops. My only suggestion back at the Hyatt is they need to add a smaller more intimate bar area serving small plates or extensive appetizers and cater more to the single traveler. This is why I gravitate to the smaller boutique type hotels. That said, if you are booked at the Hyatt, enjoy yourself and by all means get out and enjoy downtown Chicago. It is a unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dazzlingdaveyoyo
Reviews.Content: Title says it all, the West Tower was very nice...the only way to improve the stay would be improved TV service. (HD). But who spend much time in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Definitely enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: LThia25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July and definitely enjoyed ourselves! He knows the city very well but it was my first time in Chicago and staying here was perfect for my first Chicago experience! The staff was very friendly and helpful...we even were able to check in early since our room was ready ....the rooms had a nice decor and were very clean! Cleanliness is super important to me! The hotel location was great! Walking distance to so many things...from sight seeing to restaurants or whatever else you are looking for! The breakfast buffet was good but a little too pricey for me, next time I might skip it. But if you are big on breakfast then it's worth it. Went to 2 bars inside the hotel ...one that was an Irish bar had a really sweet girl who was bartending ....she made us feel very welcome! The other bar was very large...it was near the main check in area...really nice bar area... bartender was not as friendly unfortunately but we still had a great time! Valet parking was very convienient too, granted you don't really need a car if you are in the city. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here! (We even decided to stay an extra night before moving on to another area of Illinois.) I would definitely recommend the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: PamperedParent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the weekend of October 21st and really enjoyed it. I requested a room with a view, and we had a lovely view of the Chicago River. The hotel is so centrally located, it was super easy to find a taxi, but also well within walking distance of Millennium Station as well as buses. It's probably the most convenient location of any hotel I have stayed at in Chicago. We had outstanding weather so, we walked for the most part. The hotel is very very large. Probably the largest I have ever stayed at. As such, I was worried about the noise, as I like dine in the city and sleep in the country; however our room was very quiet. The sheets were freshly pressed and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was sleek and spacious. We had free internet for saying the word of the day at check-in. The service was great! The concierge was very happy to help us find a hotel. They had a large monitored baggage storage area on the second floor, where you could leave your luggage for a few hours before check-in or after check-out. We did not eat at the hotel, however we did visit the starbucks in the lobby a few times which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Check your receipt for unapproved charges”
Reviews.Author: petd0c
Reviews.Content: Dates of stay were Nov 2-6 for a business meeting. Check in was fast using the new quick check in kiosks. I never spoke to a front desk person. The service throughout my stay was excellent from the staff helping with the conference (very helpful and friendly) to the room service people who brought things right on time. The room was average. Unfortunately my positive experience was offset when I checked out via the quick check out kiosks and discovered in the cab ride on the way to the airport that I had been charged two different "eStandby Guestroom upgrade" fees for each day I stayed there. I was completely puzzled by this so when I returned home I called the billing questions number listed on the Hyatt website. I was connected to an agent who explained that these charges were for the "cozy room" upgrades- one daily charge was for the "free" movie and the other was for a higher floor (I was on floor 15 which in my opinion is not an upper floor given that the hotel has 36 floors). I explained had never requested or approved any upgrade to my room, that I had booked the room for a conference, and checked in by kiosk. The agent asked me to hold while she contacted the front desk in Chicago. She came back on the line and said she spoke to a person named Chris who said that I had approved these charges at check in. First of all, I never met someone named Chris and its ridiculous that he would remember me any way so I was a little peeved that the implication from the agent was that this person clearly remembered me approving the charges, I never spoke to a human being at the front desk. I informed her that this was incorrect and that Id like the charges removed to which she replied that she would have to initiate a request to the "controller" to see if they would remove the charges and that this process can take up to two weeks. She kindly informed me that there was no guarentee that the charges would be removed. At this point I was quite unhappy since I never approved the charges, never spoke with someone who even asked if I wanted these upgrades, and needed to submit my receipt to my company to be reimbursed. I indicated that this was unacceptable and she will need to connect me to a supervisor. After a VERY long hold time, she came back on the line and indicated she had spoken to her supervisor and whe would remove the charges. Anyway, it was resolved but the whole experience left me wondering how many guests dont question these kind of charges. My advice is check your charges before you leave...dont trust them to get it right. And please Hyatt customer service billing people, dont tell a customer they accepted something they didnt and then argue that an INCORRECT charge will be processed in 2-3 weeks and may not be removed!

Reviews.Title: “the service is sizable”
Reviews.Author: davew49
Reviews.Content: For such a large hotel the service was outstanding. the staff met all of our requests and the valet parking crew was outstanding. I love the location and views at this hotel and it is easily accesible to both Lake Shore Drive and Michigan Avenue shopping. The famous "Big Bar" at the Hyatt is a must, but a little overpriced even by big city standards. Good workout and spa facilities, although they are a bit of a pain to get to. This hotel caters to conference and business travelers, but was also ideal for a family trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MakoRad
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely located hotel. It is clean, has nice rooms, and a really outgoing staff. You can walk to the magnificent mile, millennium park and lots of nice places to eat. Not inexpensive, but a good place for a meeting. Nice meeting facilities. Good workout facilities that were not too busy in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: SLKspingirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times for business. The staff is friendly and efficient, the room is fine for a business hotel. The "Big Bar" is a good place to have a drink. Nice fitness facility. The only problem was that I could not get my laptop to work in the room. Kept getting kicked off. They removed the internet charge from my bill no problem but I didnt get any work done. Well located, easy to get a cab. I'm sure I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago over the weekend. The location is great for anyone who wants to explore the Magnificent Mile and the Chicago lake front. Our room was comfortable and the had a number of upgrades. Our room had a breath-taking view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. The only complaint I have is that the elevators were always crowded. We stayed in the West Tower and regularly had to wait for a few full elevators to pass before we'd find one with space for us to get on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: sloubear
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel more than three times, twice on business and once for leisure. Twice I requested a "nicer" room and twice I was upgraded without having any special status. This includes once to the club level with full access to the club lounge. I've never been disappointed in their service or ability to deliver. The rooms themselves are clean and have a modern feel to them. The beds are comfortable and also clean. My only disappointment in the hotel is that it doesn't have much of a lobby bar scene. It's definitely more of a business or family trip hotel, so if you're looking for a "hip" place, this isn't really that kind of a hotel. That said, even though my firm would pay for much more luxurious brands for business stays, I will continue to select the Hyatt for it's level of service and kind staff. For those traveling on leisure, this location is conveniently close to the river where you can pick up on the architecture tours or walk to millennium park.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conference event”
Reviews.Author: Schaffs
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference, not much arround it but the hotel itself was decent. Rooms were good, gym was large and staff were very good. All and all no complaints. Roughly a 4 min cab ride to Michigan Ave and was very close to the Chicago White Sox stadium. If you have a conference here it is prefect. If not just expect a slight delay to get to the action but really not a huge deal if you have a few minutes each day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ChgoJohn
Reviews.Content: Bought a room off of Hotwire and stayed in the West Tower. This must be where they put Hotwire guests. The room was dark and depressing. King bed with a huge indent in the mattress. No wifi in the room. Nice bathroom, But unfortunately I did not spend much time there. With all the great hotels in Chicago, this Hyatt should be toward the bottom of your list of options.

Reviews.Title: “Scare Away Poverty”
Reviews.Author: annetcap
Reviews.Content: I applaud the Hyatt for facilitating an anti-poverty campaign called "Scare Away Poverty" last weekend. It was creative and well-organized. Dining for Women (DFW), an organization whose mission is to empower impoverished women and girls in developing countries, was the fortunate recipient of the money raised through the sale of a delicious and impressive Poison Apple Martini, as well as receiving an additional donation from the Hyatt. A pumpkin-carving contest was an added, fun component to the campaign and I represented DFW in the carving of my pumpkin. The Media Relations team led by Jennifer Kedinger, made all of the contestants feel comfortable and relaxed by their attentiveness, generosity, and attention to detail. Everyone we met from the Hyatt provided excellent service. The facility was very nice, including the Bar on the second level which was fabulous with a great view of the city and impeccable service. The location is excellent in walking to the Loop or the Magnificent Mile. It is typical to patronize a hotel for their service and facility, but it is even more meaningful when you patronize them in appreciation of their social conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CDins
Reviews.Content: Check in process was smooth and the front desk worker was very friendly. They also have kiosk where you can check in and out with your Credit Card. Lobby is nice setting. Some rooms have nice view of riverwalk. The room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable. Only con: Rooms by elevator sound like a roller coaster is coming at you at times.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire was good to us!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiSeminole
Reviews.Content: The only issue we had with this hotel was the valet. It's a zoo getting the car. Great room for a great price on Hotwire.com.

Reviews.Title: “excellent room for location, value and staff!”
Reviews.Author: mollyfromindianapolis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 27-29 and had an excellent stay! We checked in early without any problems. The room was conveniently located and we were on a high floor with a nice view of the lake and river. I especially liked the floor to ceiling window. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. The only thing I was not fond of, was that the room was handicapped accessible and I was unaware this was the type of room we were assigned until we got to it. There was no counter space in the bathroom but we made do by placing a towel over the luggage rack that we placed by the sink. I'm sure I could've called to request a change, but we had already settled in. The hotel was a great value and I would definitely stay there again as the room was extremely quiet and made for a very pleasant stay!! Additionally, I had checked out their Facebook page prior to arriving and received a personal card and a small gift from the staff - was a nice touch after coming back from dinner. Thanks again for a great weekend trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a weekend stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cmlewis1977
Reviews.Content: My experience was very good overall. I was there with my boyfriend on vacation for the weekend to celebrate our 1 year anniversary together. It was his first time to Chicago and I had been there multiple times before. I gave a 4 star rating mainly for the staff and location of this hotel. The location can't be beat with some of the most spectacular views of the river and lake. We could see the draw bridge going up with the sailboats coming in for Winter storage. Navy Pier is also visible. We were in the West Tower on the 31st floor in room 3114 a deluxe King Room. Very simple clean room with the floating king bed and a desk area with a great bathroom. Some of the cons were thin walls, you could hear people in rooms next door, no tub in the bathroom and I didn't like the bed it was a little firm, but that is a personal preference my boyfriend likes a firm bed and he didn't have a problem with it. Things to take note. This Hotel is HUGE, multiple towers with 36 floors in all towers. It is a haven for conventions,weddings and other celebrations. It was a weekend and it was really busy. The elevators were not a problem for us but at peek times expect a little bit of a wait, really people just be patient! The location can't be beat, its close to everything. Walking distance to the river front, Chicago cultural center, Michigan Ave, Millennium Park, Marilyn Monroe, and much more! we didn't eat at any of the restaurants or bars because there are simply so many other options for value around the Hotel and we didn't come to Chicago to hang out at the Hotel, we wanted to explore the city. The staff was just great! Like mentioned before friend them on Facebook and they will give you great upgrades and little surprises. Ours was Champagne and Chocolate covered Strawberries upon return on our first night, with a note telling us Happy Anniversary and to enjoy our stay. It was a pleasant surprise and after a long day of driving, a warranted surprise at that! The only con we had was upon checking out, being a busy Hotel they were swamped at valet parking and we had to drag our luggage down to the level of parking underneath and wait over a half an hour for our car. This was not a pleasant experience. Overall, I do understand and was patient but it was a lot of people with luggage and you had no place to wait and inhaling exhaust fumes for a half an hour was not pleasant. It was just simply really busy, I don't know what else they could have done. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay to explore the city. Upon our return we would stay here again. Staff was wonderful an very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Other Better Hotels”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was surprised by the massive lobby and being caught in the midst of the check-in/check-out madness of a convention hotel. Fortunately, as a Platinum member, I was able to be processed fairly quickly. I specifically asked for a high floor, very quiet room. Got both requests but the West Tower is a trek from the lobby. Club lounge is appropriate for approximately 20 people at any time and I noticed several guests arrive, sigh when they saw the already crowded facility, turn around and leave. Evening offerings are good but breakfast for the 2 mornings I was there consisted of pastries, fruit, cereal and a massive bowl of smoked salmon, matching bowl of sliced onions and capers. I would imagine 50% of the world wants to eat salmon and onions for breakfast but many along with me tried to sit far away from the smelly mess as possible each morning. Sleeping rooms are dark, very odd bed mattress and extremely small bathrooms. While the hotel is well run and the staff very helpful, this is not representative of Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Ah, just okay”
Reviews.Author: Ajetlgd1
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and was attending an event at the Hyatt, so I decided to cash in some points and stay overnight. Boy was I disappointed. The walls were paper thin, we clearly heard the conversations of our neighbors on both sides of our room. Six elevators in the West Tower and I would be willing to believe there were only two working at a time. Each time one came by the 14th floor, it was full and when we finally got on, it was a local to the ground. The shower curtain was sour - mildewy and the bathroom just did not smell clean, and I'm not real sure when the last time the inside of the windows were washed. I did mention it to the gentleman that checked us out and he comped the internet. But the icing on the cake was the $50 for the valet parking, having to wait about 25min and the attendant telling us that if we wanted our car faster, we could go down to the ground level and pick it up. Duh- then it's not valet folks. I was like wow! The poor tourist are trapped. Glad it was just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay / Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel and it was perfect from check-in to check-out. Front deskman Jason Jones in particular was courteous, professional, and got me settled and in a great room on the top floor. Excellent location for the Magnificient Mile and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Location!”
Reviews.Author: cathymur
Reviews.Content: I walked everywhere from this hotel. The best location. Sear tower a mile away, navy pier a mile away. Shopping over the bridge and your there.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Worn - just at a super deal or if you must”
Reviews.Author: zuperzigy
Reviews.Content: Hyatt aka bland generic but clean ; typical american congress hotel very worn from lobby that looks like a 80 s mall in some South African Suburb to smelly worn rooms with awful 90s furniture. I had to endure 4 nights before moving to another Chicago Hotel, intially the admittedly fast and courteous staff moved me next to the elevator - I requested a quiet room and got a perfect end of the floor super quiet . thumps up for that !! Rest forget about it the " Stetson " Steakhouse is at best average - Breakfast Buffet a joke and the BIG Bar part of the 80s Lobby - atmosphere like a airport terminal . If you get a deal go for it - if you attend a confertence do yourself a treat move into one of the many many choices with a 1 mile radius . Same price but indefinetely better

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MarbleJac
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, excellent location. Very much a business hotel with all the amenities. Within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, the Navy Pier, State Street, and the Art Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jhoyda
Reviews.Content: Very close to Michigan Avenue and walking distance to Navy Pier. My wife and I stayed here in July, taking advantage of the Groupon deal. Nice, clean hotel. We stayed in the West Tower which allowed us to get to our room without passing through the enormous main lobby which can get quite busy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Just around the corner from everything.”
Reviews.Author: Acemajorphi
Reviews.Content: Very close to what the lake front and Michigan Ave. You can walk out the front door and run or walk down the rive and/or the lake. The concierge service was great. They were very helpful in many respects. The best of their recommendation of a breakfast place called Yolk. One strange thing was the mini-bar was not refrigerated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weekender073
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean but smelled a little like bug spray. Food was good. Expect a long wait for elevators: Five minutes waits were common and occasionally longer when the elevator lines were long. The hotel was full during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, airport or shopping mall?”
Reviews.Author: jmo843
Reviews.Content: When you enter this hotel lobby, there is absolutely no feeling of warmth and welcoming, it is a huge, very noisy glass covered hall. The front desk is one floor above the entrance, it feels just like in an airport terminal or in a huge shopping mall. Absolutely zero ambience. The front desk people are nice enough, but that does not help much. Extremely busy elevators that stopped at seemingly all floors to pick up or let people off. Everything comes at an extra cost, there is no feeling of generosity or hospitality at all. We had a meeting in one of their meeting rooms (converted hotel room). The air conditioning was like a blizzard and Ifelt my thorat litereally freeze, and I became sicker than I have been for several years after that. Some others bravely took my seat the following day, but had to move after a few minutes. One day they did not clean the room at all despite several reminders, We reported it the last time just before midnight, and the front desk staff said that she would pass the message. When we asked about that at checkout some days later, no note had been made. The front desk lady at checkout was understanding and offered us a free breakfast as compensation - nice, but the breakfast "bistro" was also in that huge lobby hall. It is perfectly possible to make huge convention and business hotels more welcoming. All of us who stayed in our group said "never this hotel again". There are similarly priced, much nicer hotels just around the corner. Go for them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great, hotel is big!”
Reviews.Author: rlbrown77
Reviews.Content: Never been somewhere that they give you a map of the place when you check in! Big hotel. Room in East Tower was very nice, very modern. I had a corner queen room. Very nice. Was in town for conference held in hotel. Visited fitness center, very, very busy at prime work out time, but usable. Big Bar in lobby, very expensive drinks ($12 for Makers/Diet), but very busy both nights I was there. Check in, Check out very helpful. Valet a little slow when leaving, but very good convention stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pacolsu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention and the property is VERY big. Reminds me somewhat of hotels in Las Vegas. In addition to our convention, there were 2 others at the same time. Centrally located and near most attractions in the downtown area. In order to get to the convention levels from the rooms,you had to either get off on first floor and then take another elevator or take escalators from first floor--not very well marked/signed anywhere. Our room looked as if it had been recently remodeled and beds were comfortable. One of my pet peeves is AC/Heat controls never working properly but we were able to adjust the temperature to our liking. Only issue we had was the service at the "Big Bar" was average-bartenders were not very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Hotel - But Good at What They Do”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a huge convention hotel located in the very best place you can be if you are visiting Chicago as a tourist. If you stay here you have to take it as it is - there is not a lot of quiet and intimacy in a huge covention hotel with thousands of people everywhere. On the other hand this hotel is as good as I've seen at handling this kind of situation. Check-in and out went very smoothly, and Hyatt's automated check-out is pretty slick. Elevators can be a huge problem in busy hotels of this size and for our trip the waits were acceptable even though the place was packed. The room was perfect. The newly remodeled rooms (East Tower) were excellent in every respect except that they were too dark - a common issue these days. You don't have to spend a fortune on food here, there are a many very reasonable choices as close as the ground floor walk-through area in the West Tower, and many more on the street. You definitely don't need a car to visit Chicago from here as much as nearby and public transportation is excellent. If you park a car here it is expensive. It is not necessarily the case that an upper floor has a good view, so if the view is important to you be sure to mention that when you check-in. I had a wonderful view on the 7th floor. The Hyatt charges just short of $15 a day for Internet access - no excuse for that in this day and age except it shows Hyatt's willingness to gouge people. Plan ahead to minimize or avoid paying this charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff including Jason Jones who checked me in and 12:30AM after the Amtrak was delayed 1.5 hours. Food was good but expensive, Room we nice and the beds and pillows are very comfortable. cool no entry key/lock system. Just waive the key infront of the lock and the door unlocks. no more sliding the key in and out. nice 24hr gym which does not cost extra, although it could use more free weights. one of my my preferred hotels when staying in Chicago. Also has a CVS around the corner if you ever need to run out and grab stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay Here if You are Attending a Convention at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laplume9254
Reviews.Content: This is a convention hotel. Period. Lots of people, lots of movement, lots of noise. Lots of money. My flight did not leave until evening and there was a 20 minute wait to store my luggage. Typical Hyatt guest room. Decor attempts to be modern, but now it looks dated and dark. Bed was fine, however with the busy fire station across the street, noise was a problem. There are many other hotels to choose from in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service for a hyatt ever experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: Norcal530
Reviews.Content: My pregnant wife and I stayed two nights at the hyatt and we were not pleased at all. We stayed at a hyatt in kuaui and it pleased us so much that we decided to pick hyatt again, but let me tell you that this hyatt was not the same. Upon arrival we were not greeted by anyone, no one opened a door for us the whole time we stayed. They kept giving us wrong information at the front desk, first they told us the sky deck closed at 10 when we showed up there we found out it closed at 8 which cut our time short, then we asked for our room to be cleaned and when we came back all they did was give us new towels. they didn't even pick up our old ones, then I called the front desk to acquire about the airport shuttle tickets the told us it picked up every 15 min and that it was free, but when we missed the bus by 5 min they told us it picks up at 35 and 05. Then when the shuttle did arrive they charged us 20$ per person which I wouldn't have minded if they told us that when I called the first time. Overall a very bad experience and we will NOT PICK hyatt for our future stays

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel but busy place”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel92679
Reviews.Content: Popular hotel with groups and conferences and it's always very busy and lively in the common areas. Hotel has two towers so things are a bit spread out - not a huge problem, but this is not a queit, intimate city hotel. It's a large "conference" place with a lot of hustle & bustle. Fantastic location along the river, easy walking to popular city attractions. Rooms are nice, updated and clean. Everything you would expect for a city Hyatt location. Ideal for business travelers, however, I have stayed her previously with kids on the weekend and it was fine. Service met expectations, no problems. Regency Club level was nice and so was Regency Lounge and breakfast spread. There are lots of hotel choices in the city and this one is perfect for the money - nothing that will knock your socks off, but nothing to disappoint either. It's just not a small, intimate place -more of a large, busy thoroughfare, but this is not necessarily a bad thing. 4* review because hotel meets/exceeds expectations, but nothing super phenomenal to warrant a 5* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Downtown Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a girl's weekend with my sisters, sister-in-laws and mom where we stayed at the Hyatt. It's was walking distance to everything we wanted to do. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and we had a great view of the city. I was very impressed with the hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh...just ok”
Reviews.Author: travelzwithkidz
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is enormous. Think Las Vegas. Multiple towers, across a city street. Fairly imposing to walk into. Front desk personnel were very efficient and cheerful, although they celebrated the fact that they gave me a king bed, which is what I reserved. The room was updated, and nicely decorated, if not the cleanest room. Several long, dark hairs all over the room - fairly obvious against the light color tile in the bathroom. Conference center is enormous and has no cell coverage no matter what service provider. If this is the case, free wi-fi is a must. No cell service is a big downer.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated room accommodations”
Reviews.Author: pwill144
Reviews.Content: On this weekend, something really special was going on in Chicago and every hotel in the loop was trying to get $300 and $400 for the run-of-the-mill type rooms. We did manage to use our government or state-rate affiliation to get the room for half of what everyone else was paying. Normally an average room in a 4 star hotel downtown Chicago will be less than $200. The hotel sits right on the river and acquiring an upper floor room provides exceptional views of the city and the river. The hotel is within walking distance of Michigan Ave. and the magnificent mile. The â€œBig Barâ€� in the hotel is big... and priceyâ€¦ paid $28.00 for two long-island-iced teas and they were in 8 ounce glasses at that. WOW!. Should have just sprung for the Big Margarita for two (actually big enough for four) for the same price. When they say big, they mean big! I hate the rip of for the $50 parking. There are public garages within walking distance to the hotel and if you are not there with a bunch of kids and luggage, you can park next door at 111 Wacker where there is a public parking garage for $35.00. I used the hotel parking because the wife is a wimp but made them go and get my car three or four times while there that one day to try and get my money's worth. But the whole thing is a ripe off as far as forcing clients to use their valet parking when you pull up to the entrance. But their staff are extremely nice and friendly. Every single one of them went out of their way to be nice to us. When in the bar which gets really crowded at night, one of the floor managers came up to my wife and I at the bar where we were trying to get a drink to take back to the room but the tenders were really busy and weren't noticing us. He intervened and got the bartender's attention and ordered for us...."good looking out!" While you are there, walk down Michigan to the Grand Lux for a meal and then hit the stores. The newly decorated rooms reminded me of the dÃ©cor in the â€œWâ€� hotel line. They have incorporated modern, subdued color schemes, with interesting textures and wall treatments. We had started seeking accommodations in other newer hotels because they were showing signs of aging. Now, we will have to start going back to our old (new) spot for experiencing Chicagoâ€™s offerings. And, man, they have a lot to offer. You have to try Zed451 at 739 N. Clark. Brazilian style offering in a really nice settingâ€¦ Excellent food and staff. Valet parking was only $12.00. Normally anywhere you go they charge you $17 to $18 in a parking lot downtown for just an hour. This felt like a bargain. I am from Springfield, Illinois the land of Lincoln. Parking is free after 4:00pm and free all weekend. So, it is a shock to pay for every little bitty thing when you go to Chicago. There are more and more experienced beggars positioned on the streets... some with signs others just with props like one who used a young sad-faced child in tow asking for something, anything to help. Man, it may have all been an elaborate scam to invoke some sympathy but it worked with me. In the large scheme of things, I paid more for the coffee at the hotel. I hate this economy and what it is doing to some. I was in one of the most expensive cities in the world eating and drinking what I wanted, when I wanted. Many do not have that luxury. So, if you are privileged enough to travel to the big city, why not keep a couple bucks in your pocket and when you hear a really good pitch, give them the buck for their presentationâ€¦even if you donâ€™t believe the story.

Reviews.Title: “A hotwire deal”
Reviews.Author: IndianaOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a last minute trip on Thanksgiving weekend. Got a great deal in Hotwire. Location was great but the room left something to be desired. Very noisy- sounded like an elevator running constantly. Didn't sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: judith14
Reviews.Content: The hyatt is a very nice and cosy hotel to explore the city of chicago. The reception and hotel can be a bit overwhelming at the start, it is all big and business manner. But, as said, the location and room are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great locatio, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenthumb2000
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Regency. It is in a great location, right on the river and a block from Michigan Ave. It is close to the El trains, the bus lines, and many restaurants. We bought 3 day CTA passes, but hardly used them because we could walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel has recently been renovated. Our room was very large & well appointed. The bed was one of the most comfortable that we have ever slept on. The bathroom was very modern and everything was very clean. Our only complaint with the Hyatt (and other hotels catering to business travelers on expense accounts) is the ridiculous policy of additional charges for everything. They wanted $12 or $13 for internet access, which is just a terrible policy, unless you want to intentionally annoy customers! Other than annoying add on charges, the Hyatt Regency was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Daybright
Reviews.Content: They gave us a corner room on 32nd floor, which was extremely quiet and comfortable. The hotel has a great breakfast buffet, that operates very efficiently, in a nice atmosphere. The beds were comfortable, room quiet, despite the fact that there was a huge crowd in the lobby for conventions. Great view from the lobby bar. And you can do Michigan Avenue, from across the river, not to miss any sightseeing. The River Walk is romantic at night, and the hotel is close to many business locations. Wished we could stay longer than a day. Front desk staff was very very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: curleyhead
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt on Wacker Street is a very busy hotel, but the service was great. The location is great for visitors to downtown Chicago. It's close to the parks, the Riverwalk, Navy Pier, the Metro, etc. and within walking distance to lots of places. The staff was very helpful with directions and breakfast places. Our room was a good size with comfortable beds---important after walking so much! It's a great place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “no value here!”
Reviews.Author: ColoJan
Reviews.Content: Everything here is overpriced-drinks, food-can't believe they charge for internet. They also tried to charge $5/day extra for an upper floor room, even tho I hadn't asked for it. They removed the charge when I complained. $15/day for internet is ridiculous-no wifi in the lobby or bar either.

Reviews.Title: “It's A Convention Hotel, Period.”
Reviews.Author: LPLS
Reviews.Content: Great location and a beautiful property, but ---- the only reason I would stay here again is if a convention or conference put me here. It is B-I-G. It is crowded. It took forever to get anywhere. The central restaurant is like eating in an airplane hanger. Elevators, escalators, walkways are crowded. We stayed on the executive/club level, hoping for a different ambiance, but the exec./club lounge is pretty puny, and sketchy, and not too special. Not really worth it and always crowded (again with crowds!). We were here for a meeting and a number of friends chose to stay at nearby smaller boutique hotels. I envied them! On the plus side the hotel is immaculate, and Staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. I would not stay here as simply a tourist or a family with children. There are better hotels in the same area for a lot less money and chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: BusnessTravel
Reviews.Content: Very busy and noisy lobby. Upon arival I noticed that the Bed sheet was stained with a small drop of blood...therefore sheets are not changed in between patrons. I slepted in other bed. Not a good start. Location is excellent. Close to Millenium park, Navy Pier, Willis Tower, and the Magnificant Mile area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: bellacat47
Reviews.Content: We traveled by train to Chicago and wanted to stay right in "the thick of it". The Hyatt is on Wacker very near Michigan. Miracle Mile is close, as is the architectural tour boat, which I strongly recommend. We got a room facing north in the East Tower, looking at the John Hancock Bldg. Marilyn was visible from our room as well! I loved the nighttime view. Check-in was easy, we had a dinner and breakfast in the Bistro and both were very good. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the sights: Millennium Park, the tall skyscrapers, The Art Institute etc. I would return in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ljeffers
Reviews.Content: We were treated to a great stay. This is really a perfect spot for marathon participants. Close to shuttle for expo packet pick up. Close to start/ finish line but you don't get hung up in any foot or car traffic from the marathon. Strong social media/web presence. Like the Hyatt on Facebook for discounts and the possibility of special treatment. We were given a room upgrade and free coffee and pastry as well as access to the Regency Club as VIP guests of the day. Really top notch. Our friends and other marathon participants were given goodies and many hearty handshakes. Great location! Great service! Will stay again- maybe for next years marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Social Media manager goes above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry B
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I had a great stay at this hotel! I joined the facebook page before I went, and was able to get answers to so many questions I had before even coming to Chicago. That was a big plus for me. When we arrived, we were able to check in WAY before we were supposed to (our flight arrived at 945am and we got there around 1030). Jordy was the guy who was at the desk, and he seemed very pleased to be able to offer us an early check in. The room was very nice, and very clean. The view wasn't the best, but we could see a sliver of the lake from our window. It wasn't a big deal because we didn't really come to Chicago to look out a window anyway. So after we checked in, we headed out the the aquarium... After a long day of flying and exploring we came back to our hotel room to find some Chicago style toffee that had been sent to us from the social media manager. I thought that was a really nice touch, really classy, it had me smiling for the rest of the trip. The bed was the best i've ever slept on, and those blackout shades will ensure you don't wake up before you have to. It is true what people have said about the television stations available being not so great, but again... why go on vacation to watch tv? I would also like to say that, yes, the internet is outrageously priced per day. We thought we wouldn't have a need to use it, but we were wrong, and it ended up being a small annoyance (until we found other solutions)... you can join the facebook group, and give them the word of the week at check in for a free day, or if you have an iphone, just go to starbucks and use the free wifi there. $14 for internet is only expensive for average vacationers here on a deal... I don't think the business types worry about it, and therefor think that while it seemed outrageous to me, it might not to others. The housekeeping staff was great, we were only woken up by them once on our trip (check out day) but that was fine. This hotel is close to everything. you can walk, transit, cab, bike... whatever... to anywhere from here. On our check out, we noticed we were charged for some long distance phone calls which we didn't make... We went to the desk, and it was Jordy again. Let me tell you, this guy is so great! He looked into it for us, and realized there was a guest staying on our floor with an almost identical name. So, he RIPPED the bill to shreds and printed us a new copy with a nice ZERO on it. I thought it would also be important to note that although you may have to check out before your flight leaves, you're not comitted to carrying around your luggage for hours... you can leave it with the bell desk! All of these things made for an amazing first trip to Chicago. I will definitely be staying here when I go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: krun
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was close to everything we wanted to do downtown and an easy walk to the El for exploring other parts of the city. We also had a stunning view of the river and lake from our room (which I was able to request on their facebook page). I let the staff know that we were there for a special occasion and they sent up a gift of chocolate covered toffee on our first night. Great service! We were in the West Tower and didn't have any problems with wait times for elevators like I read in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needed organization”
Reviews.Author: Kware
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, and location is wonderful. The service was only average however. I was there for a conference, and it frequently felt as though they were not interested in customer service. The concierge desk, although well appointed, did not seem particularly helpful, and actually felt that we were interrupting them. The rooms were gorgeous, bed comfortable, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2011ChgoWanderer
Reviews.Content: Because of some long work hours and a big project over two days I wanted to stay downtown so there would be less commuting. Thanks to priceline, I got a rate of $63.00 a night at the Hyatt Regency. Anytime a discount broker involved, I worry about what I'm going to get for that rate but I was more than pleasantly surprised this time. The staff was friendly and accommodating, giving me a higher floor room at my request and letting me know that because I had used my airline credit card with them I would be able to get 500 miles on my account. My room was clean and overlooking the river with a great view of the downtown skyline. Best parts of the room were the comfortable bed, view and roomy bathroom with a huge lighted mirror. Only quirks I felt detracted slightly from the experience was a odd rumbling sound that I believe was due to the elevator bank (mine was the second room to the right of them) and a some signs of age with the furniture like scratches and gouges and a oddly mismatched looking hallway carpet. Overall, would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “STUNNING”
Reviews.Author: Cindy H
Reviews.Content: Couldn't stop looking out our window. The view was breathtaking. Rooms were nice and modern too. Great location so we could walk to everything. Beautiful lobby. Dinner too expensive as these type of hotels do, but this one actually had another option which was a mini cafe with coffee and snacks and friendly staff. My two teens loved using that. I would definitely stay again. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Littlebunch
Reviews.Content: It can't be easy keeping a very large, busy convention hotel running smoothy but the staff at the Hyatt Regency manages to pull it off with friendly personal treatment. Everyone from the doormen to the wait staff are friendly, helpful and professional -- the concierge service particularly so in booking tickets to a show. My room was very comfortable with crisp clean lines throughout. The Stetson Chop House is first class. The breakfast buffet is probably the best I've experienced. My only quibble is that I wished these convention hotels would drop the internet access charges. When every dive in the country is now offering "free" wireless internet it would seem a first class hotel could just build in the cost of the service to the room prices and at least let the customer feel he's getting something!

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is convenient to Michigan Ave. and river cruise tour. We stayed in the west tower and found the rooms to be smaller than average, especially the bathrooms. It is more of a convention/business hotel as opposed to a romantic couples getaway hotel. The staff was exceptional, very knowledgeable and went out of their way to answer our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Best Business Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jrferreras100
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Chicago due to many reasons, first the location in the center of the city, a couple minutes from Michigan Avenue, surrounded by Banks, Restaurants, Parks, simply everything around it. Amazing view of the Chicago River, Lake and City Skyline! Awesome Internet rate for a great room, perfect size, great bed, beautiful bathroom all perfectly clean! In the Lobby of the Hotel a fantastic Bar, great fun! The only downfall was that the Internet daily rate of $13 should be included in the rate!

Reviews.Title: “A dump unless you are on the club floor”
Reviews.Author: Jpeacott
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days in the subterranean conf facilities. No sun, no air. Freezing cold and the engineers tok 2 days to fix it. Rooms are bad, unless you are on the club floor, and the they are fine, not exceptional. Room service was consistently 5 min late beyond the promised time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: aboyer8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago for a conference and decided to come out a day early. We stayed at the Hyatt and loved it. The hotel isn't overly spectacular, but the location in perfect and right in the heart of everything. The staff was wonderful. They let us check in at 11 am and upgraded us to a lake view for $20. Deciding to splurge a little we decided to do it. They put us on the 22nd floor with an incredible view. The room was spacious and comfortable. Everything was very clean and fresh. The hotel is divided between 2 buildings and can be a little confusing if you have never been there. We were in the other building, so we did not see the pool or anything like that. The lobby was nice. There was a restaurant and bar that looked nice, but we did not eat at either. What it comes down to is that this is a nice hotel, but you are paying for the location. So if you want to be near it all with a nice place to sleep, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SkiBunny8975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Regency and location was perfect. Able to walk from Millenium station to the hotel and literally 5 min from shopping on Michigan Ave. Overall, a good hotel from priceline if you are going to be out and about. The TV channel reception was poor, and appears they cater to business travelers and convention-attendees...not families. Also bummed that you had to pay for wireless - really? Good place to crash after visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: gigi772974
Reviews.Content: I definetely would not rate this as a 4 star hotel, more like 3. The staff was wonderful, but the room was small and musty smelling. The beds were comfortable and room was clean, but not what I was expecting. I also would have liked to have been closer to Michigan Ave. Would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but has flaws”
Reviews.Author: sminerva21
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's a half a block from Michigan Ave, right at the Chicago River, and you really can walk anywhere on Michigan from here. My husband and I are Chicago residents and stayed here for a vacation so that we could do a lot of the things downtown we always want to do, but never have time because we need to get home. It was an okay stay: The room/bathroom was very clean and modern looking, and the staff was very friendly. However, the hotel has quite a few flaws: 1. The Internet situation here is awful. $14 per day for wireless access? That's such a rip off, and put a really bad taste in my mouth. This hotel, it seemed, catered to a lot of business people. Wifi should be free and accessible to every guest staying at the hotel. We didn't pay for the Internet because of the price out of principle. 2. The TV channels sucked. We had better channels and options on our TV when we stayed in Mexico. There were only a handful of channels, and the remote looked like it was from the 80s. 3. Walls were pretty thin - you could hear a lot of noise outside your door when guests walked by. 4. I booked through Priceline, and a week before our stay, I called to ask when I could request early check-in/late check-out/King size bed and a possible upgrade (it was my husband's birthday). I know when you book through Priceline, you can't expect any of these things. We were able to check in around 1:45 p.m., and I got a late check out of 1 p.m. but they couldn't get a King-sized bed even though I requested one (two double beds for a romantic birthday weekend kind of sucked) and they didn't offer anything for our special occasion. I thought maybe vouchers for a free drink at the bar or something would have been appreciated. Oh well.* *Again, I know these things shouldn't be expected, but usually more upscale hotels (not even just those sometimes) will try to do something to make your stay more special for an occasion you're celebrating). Overall, I'd recommend the hotel for people looking for a basic, clean conveniently-located hotel when you plan not to spend a lot of time in the room. But for us, part of the fun was escaping our every day life and relaxing at the hotel, and I wouldn't recommend it for that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: khardst
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is "in the thick of it", without being directly "in the thick of it". The hotel is extremely close to the Mag Mile, as well as Millenium Park and Navy Pier. This Hyatt is also a convention center so it is massive; there is a West and East tower. As large as it is, we still received A1 customer service and we didn't feel as though we were just a number, we truly felt like guest that were being catered to. The rooms are very clean and the view from our room was really nice. The hotel has several restaurants and bars throughout. We had lunch at Bistro @ 151 and the service as well as the food were great. Now The Bar @ 151 is another story, while it is aesthetically pleasing, the service in the bar is DEPLORABLE!! I have stayed at several 4-star hotels in Chicago, but we have decided for all future trips we will be staying at The Hyatt. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay downtown while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: dididb911
Reviews.Content: First off the location of this property is perfect! Ideal location and we were able to easily walk from the train station after flying in. There were 6 in our family so we had 2 rooms that I was able to obtain for an amazing rate by priceline. I had assumed with the fact my rate was so inexpensive that when I asked for a water view room on a higher level I would not be accomidated..but I was wrong and plesantly surprised! Asked for one room with a king bed and a second connecting room with two double beds~thrilled when we went to our rooms! Beds were very comfortable, rooms were spacious and the kids were thrilled! You should be aware that this place is HUGE!!!!!! Its also connected to an underground shopping area with many stores and restuarants so with bad weather you almost do not have to leave the property. We did choose to have the breakfast buffet one day which was wonderful but overpriced. Tried The Yolk for breakfast the next day and had the best breakfast food of all time for a third of the price. An added conveniance was the grocery store right behind the Hyatt which was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “If you not staying for a Long time”
Reviews.Author: Marcus G
Reviews.Content: well we did early check in and that was cool but then they told us its a handicap room o.k. that's cool we get to the room our bags came later when they came the guy expected a tip for some stuff we could have done. sure we tipped him but the rest of the one night stay the luggage guys asked for tips all the time Like this was the trump tower but any way long story short the view was terrible i think we seen people working in the other building and the refrigerator, don't up unless you want to pay 25 dollars so when you eat out bring own fridge or don't bring back doggy bags. all in all we would hated this place if we stayed longer but one night is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: ksiddel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Bed was delicious. TV large. Staff was friendly to fault. Quiet Great view. I loved the online check in and the notification when the room was ready via email! My only compliant is that internet charge is $14.00 per day. It is not as bad as some hotels but in todays world it should be free. I rented a car from Hertz for a day and it very convenient that they were located onsite. Definitely, take a cab to and from the hotel because parking is $50 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kramerica1
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip online for the Hyatt Regency in downtown Chicago. The hotel and rooms were nice, with a 37" flat screen TV in our room...although we didn't watch much TV, it may be a plus if you have kids staying with you. We choose this hotel because of the price and location. Although not cheap, it was reasonable compared to some other hotels downtown, and walking distance to Michigan Ave and Rush street. The hotel was directly across the street from the Chicago River where you could take a river taxi trip to see the city from the river. It was also only 3 blocks from the Navy Pier. Great location if you want to experience shopping, dining, and night life. Was a little shocked that hotel parking was an additional $50 per night. I couldn't find this info when we booked online. Next time will do more research to see if cheaper parking nearby, or pick a hotel with parking included. Also - be prepared, drinks & food are very expensive downtown.

Reviews.Title: “"Liked Hotel a Lot"”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for business. Took a cab to hotel. Don't know if the subway will get you close to hotel. Checked in went smooth even thought hotel was very busy. I had a room with a wonderful view of the river and the Navy Pier. Room was clean and bed comfortable. This is a business hotel during the week, but can see how it would be a good tourist hotel also. I like the service and prompt attention. You can check out via phone, menu on tv or down at the the desk. There are limited places to eat around hotel but walk down Wacker and there are lots of choices. Ask at the front desk. There is an underground area with all kinds of places to eat..Starbucks, fast food, etc. connected to the West Tower. Enjoyed my stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISINGLY NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: CAROLINAPANTHERFAN
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency and were very satisfied with the hotel. Prior to checking in, we had requested a high floor and a quiet room with a river view; however, the room we had been assigned was only with a view of the city. Tiphany (â€œphâ€� instead of â€œffâ€�!) at the front desk was able to find us a quiet, corner room with a fantastic view of the river and the city! Also, the window at the end of the hall and at our room faced the Navy Pier and we had a wonderful view of the weekend fireworks. Upon checking in we found we needed more towels, foam pillows, extra hangers, and the light beside the bed was not working. Within 1/2 hour everything had been delivered to the room and maintenance replaced the entire light fixture! The customer service at this facility is remarkable. The room was also extremely clean and the maid service was wonderful throughout our stay. My only con with the Hyatt Regency is the noise in the front lobby...I have been in subways that were quieter! Although the lobby was extremely loud and there were thousands of people in the hotel, we never heard anything in our room and found that amazing. We will definitely return to this hotel during our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property twice now, and both times, I've been thrilled with the level of service and the amenities. The rooms seem to have been recently remodeled. They have a very modern look and clean lines, with an earth-tone color scheme. No hideous floral bedspreads, carpet or curtains! The linens are nice, crisp and white, and they use duvets. I've eaten breakfast at the BISTRO at 151, had drinks at the BAR at 151, and I've had room service. All the food and drinks were just fine and reasonably priced. The breakfast buffet at the bistro is an excellent value -- loads of choices (many with a European flair), and all yummy. Even the minibar items are reasonably priced! The location can't be beat. You're a five minute walk from Millennium Park, Michigan Avenue shopping, Navy Pier, the boat tours, the theaters and more. Although the hotel has a fitness center, I got up early and ran around downtown, because the hotel was so close to so many attractions. It was a great way to see the sights without battling the crowds! And it's also convenient to many of the big office buildings and business-related destinations. My favorite part, though, is the service. This hotel is huge, with tons of convention space. Despite this, I felt like I was one of the only guests there. Service was prompt, and I never waited in a line or waited too long for room service or an elevator (my pet peeve). Every single staff member was friendly and smiling. They always offered a warm greeting, from the person who checked me in to the housekeepers in the hallways. And any time I needed someone, they were handy, whether I needed unexpected help with a bag, or a taxi, or help selecting a souvenir in the gift shop. I was not expecting this level of service from a large chain property. Some things to note: Public areas can get very crowded when there are lots of conventions, which may be a bit annoying to some. Not all rooms have a great view. Some look out to adjacent office buildings. But some have fantastic views of the river/lake. If a view is important to you, note this when booking. Likewise, some rooms are noisier than others. My first room was soundproof, but on my second stay, I had a connector room, and I could hear my neighbors at times. And of course, they charge for internet use. I know to expect that from this type of hotel, but I wish the industry as a whole would get over it and start offering complimentary wi-fi. Overall, I have no hesitation recommending this property. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ChuckTN56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip, so may not have stayed here on my dime, but would now reconsider! Check-in went great with very helpful staff. The rooms with a view are so nice! Lots of amenities available at this hotel with underground eateries and shops. Excellent downtown location close to the Chicago River Walk.

Reviews.Title: “Big yet personable”
Reviews.Author: time2viaje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Labor Day weekend. Nice decor, clean bathroom and yes, the Hyatt bed--very comfortable. Bathroom was very clean and like a lot of hotels now, you need to call to have your towels replaced--being "green". Used the valet service for our rental--very quick and efficient. I'm a Hyatt Passport member and LOVE the personal attention you receive. Hint, join the Passport Club, it's free. Also follow this property on FB for "word of the week"--you can get discounts on hotels amenities. We got, $15 off parking per night by knowing the word of the week. Hotel has a convenience stand called J's which is good for picking up cereals, muffins, coffee, ice cream, etc.--reasonable prices for downtown Chicago. Chicago is a walking City, so remember this as hotel is a block or so from Michigan Ave., but within reasonable distance of the Theatre District, Mag Mile, Grant Park, etc. Only giving 4 Stars because the walls of the hotel room are a little thin for my liking, I just like almost sound proof rooms. But if you're not like me, you will be OK. My sister had no issues with the sound though. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Busy Property. Mostly Business and convention”
Reviews.Author: rosgo
Reviews.Content: Had long wait to get into room (5PM) but room was fine with large king Bed. Small view of river. Extremely crowded especially @ bar area. Large wait for breakfast in dining room in morning. Service was good throughout. Very friendly front desk. If large crowds are not your thing neither is this.

Reviews.Title: “Good, quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: melissa1233
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Hyatt Regency for a quick 3 day getaway, and the hotel was nice. It was a lot larger than most hotels we have stayed in, and it was a little confusing as to where to go when arriving. The checkin counter isn't on the main level; instead you have to go up an escalator in order to reach it. For being such a large hotel, getting to your room didn't take long at all. The room had a good view of the street, however we couldn't see much more since there was an office building straight across from us. The room was large and the bathroom was a HUGE surprise with how big it was. Usually large cities skimp on the size of the bathroom, but this one was nice with little things that you may have forgotten at home, like toothpaste, shoe shine kit, etc.. The room was a little noisey from the elevators, but nothing too noticeable as other reviews have stated. I'm sure it depends how close you are to an elevator shaft. The hotel staff that we encountered during check in/out/ and once during our stay were knowledgeable and nice. They recommended a good pizza place that was within walking distance. I really liked the hotel overall, but I think that it was little too large. I think I would stick with a smaller hotel, but at the price we got it for you really couldn't beat it! We had a great time and we thought the beds and the room were cumfy!

Reviews.Title: “in bad shape”
Reviews.Author: Gaon9
Reviews.Content: TV did not work and took 24 hours to repair. Paid internet service terrible did not work in room, had to change room 2 times and was offered free breakfast to compensate the problems, but still not the service I expected to get from a 4 star hotel at high rate per day. Entering the hotel building tower b feels like invading an abandoned hospital building. Location is good close to millenium park.

Reviews.Title: “Too big for my liking!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine154
