Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference for 4 nights. Was initially very impressed with my room- nice decor and lovely view over river. However, I noticed the room was very noisy- at first thinking it was the air con and then realising my room was actually next to 6 lift shafts that ran up and down all day and night! I really didn't sleep well throughout my stay!! I mentioned this to the receptionist, but she was quite unhelpful. I would recommend avoiding these rooms (corner ones with queen bed) unless noise isn't a problem to you! My other comment on this hotel is probably general to a lot of hotels in Chicago- it is huge beyond belief!! The hotel foyer reminded me of a train station and was often very busy and congested with several conferences taking place in the hotel. Also, despite the notice in the room saying towels would only be changed at the end of the stay unless you request otherwise, my towels were changed daily- a massive environmental waste in my opinion! Not sure I would go back to this hotel- it served it's purpose but I prefer smaller hotels with a friendlier feel (and breakfast included for the astronomical price!!).

Reviews.Title: “2nd time just as awesome as the first”
Reviews.Author: TooCoolToBeMe
Reviews.Content: Won a trip based on a family photo contest my daughter entered us in - free 2 night stay. Had a suite, not sure what size or the name, but it was quite comfortable for 4 (but I'll always prefer adjoining rooms with 4 people.) Really like this Hyatt, and while I'm certainly not a hotel aficionado, I know something nice when I stay there. These folks know how to take care of the customer. Slight snafu trying to check out with regard to the free parking I was told we had but a few extra minutes took care of that. Only other thing was we had a bit of trouble keeping connected to the internet but I wasn't there to do much web-surfing so I just didn't bother calling the front desk. This place is impeccable and has a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience”
Reviews.Author: Glaporul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 4 nights and found the hotel really nice. Located conviently for most things in Chicago right on the riverfront. Hotel itself looked fairly modern and staff were really friendly and helpful (we had an error with the phones which we didn't know, and were charged $14 but the staff wiped the bill for us, which was a nice touch). Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Elena3548
Reviews.Content: Beds were comfortable, nice location, kids had fun. Breakfast for free with AAA rate. Just dont think the advertised QUEEn beds were really Queen beds! seemed a bit small, but overall great place and very helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with priceline”
Reviews.Author: Astorianka
Reviews.Content: Got a sweet deal on priceline for around $80 with tax. Awesome room, great view of downtown Chicago and a wonderful location. Definitely staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: champagnecaviar
Reviews.Content: Everyone on the hotel staff was very helpful and very nice. The front desk person made sure that I received 500 miles credit on my preferred airline and offered a late check out at 2:00 PM which was extremely helpful since I was attending a convention in the hotel and would not be able to leave until early afternoon. The Concierge was very helpful with restaurant reservations and the Bell Captain was very helpful in getting some boxes transferred from my room to the meeting room. The bed in my room was extremely comfortable and both nights I slept very soundly and I felt completely rested in the morning which is important when attending a convention. Overall my experience was extremely positive and I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and overnight”
Reviews.Author: chief322
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister in Law's wedding was held at the Hyatt. The room was beautiful, with great food and a nice outside patio. The reception room was large, and looked beautiful with colored lighting around the room. The staff were all very friendly and professional both at the reception and in the hotel. Our room was weel maintained and cleaned with the maid staff also being very friendly. The hotel is a great location in the city and you are able to walk to numerous locations, restaurants and sights. I would highly recommend this hotel for overnight stay, and also as a location to host large events/weddings.

Reviews.Title: “Service and cleanliness terrible”
Reviews.Author: JillAndSteveExelAdv
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying at this hotel, and it has turned me off Hyatt for life. Housekeeping was really sloppy, there was a sheet missing on the bed, the garbage was still in the bins, I had to ring three times before someone came to clean it and the first time they said they would give me a sheet and I could remake the bed!!!! The car attendant was rude. We were here for 5 days, not impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cleanliness issues”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Hyatt for a great price. I was very pleased with the location. The hotel is massive and reminds me very much of the Hyatt property next to Grand Central in NYC. The room was large and well-appointed. We experienced two major issues. First, there was blood on the duvet. It had obviously been washed, but it was a definite blood stain on the actual duvet, not the duvet cover. Unfortunately I did not notice this until morning. Second, something happened with the toilet during the night. I will just say that there was remnants of stuff on the toilet walls and seat in the morning. I complained about both things, and the staff was appropriately horrified and offered us a food credit, which was nice. However, upon returning the room several hours later, the toilet had not been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mariosmommy
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean with an excellent view of the Chicago River and it was very close to most attractions and shopping within walking distance,also they had a wonderful breakfast buffet,my hats off to the cleaning and wait staff they done a excellent job also to the staff checking in and out were very friendly.I plan to stay here again on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kjulie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the years, mainly on business. It's a big hotel, bustling with conventions and other corporate types, well located in Chicago. This past time, I had a room overlooking the river with a lovely view. Not all of the views are that nice, but I got lucky this time. The rooms have been remodeled between my last couple of visits and are nice and comfortable, typical of a Hyatt Regency. This time I was disappointed that the breakfast and lunch offered only a buffet, rather than ordering from a menu. If you want a typical Hyatt experience in a business hotel, this one will serve nicely. But if you prefer charm and perhaps more personalization, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel that meets the needs of everyone”
Reviews.Author: messthom
Reviews.Content: Before booking our hotel I spent hours reading reviews on all of the travel websites. I had a hard time deciding at first because there were so many hotels. In the end I was so happy about the Hyatt Regency I decided to write a review in case it could help someone else. The hotel is located in probably one of the most strategic positions between Millennium Park and Michigan Ave. This was important for us because we were travelling with a toddler. We could take our child to Millennium Park to play(there is always something going on there) lucky for us there was a childrenâ€™s festival during the whole time we were there. We could then go back to the hotel or just go directly to Michigan Ave for lunch or shopping. The hotel is so close to every type of public transportation: train, bus, water taxi etc. to take you to Shedd Aquarium, Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo, Navy Pier just to name a few places. We tried some of them and they were always clean and easy to use and if you donâ€™t want to take public transportation there is always a taxi lined up in front of the hotel. The rooms in the hotel were a nice size and after their renovation you can see that everything has been updated. The hotel is big but there was always someone available to give you directions or to answer your questions or just to say good morning. I was very happy(especially after reading some of the reviews) that with all of the conventions going on, they were so well staffed to take care of everyone. We happened to meet the hotel Social Manager Jennifer and her co-worker Julia one day in the lobby and they sent us something to our room, which was very nice and unexpected. This just shows you how the hotel makes an effort to make their guests stay the best. Our favorite part of the stay though was having breakfast in the hotel every morning. All of the wait staff and hostesses were so nice and accommodating. There are too many people to name, but by the end of the trip we looked forward to seeing everyone and it always started our day off right. I canâ€™t say enough good things about the hotel! The next time we are in Chicago we will stay there without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt with friends from work for a 5 day conference. Check in was easy, my friends and I were originally put in different towers of the hotel but were changed quickly once we requested to be in the same tower. The hotel is one block to MIchigan Ave and the river. We walked almost everywhere, to restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. We attended the conference at the McCormick Center and were provided shuttle buses to and from the conference throughout the day. We had dinner one night at Stetson's Chop House. The food was fantastic, great wine and alcohol selections. The price was what you would expect at a high end steakhouse. We also ate and drank at the Big Bar. We hung out here at the end of the day on most nights. Great view of the city and the river with the wall of windows. It gets pretty crowded and rowdy here late night! We walked to the Billy Goat Tavern for cheeseburgers, no fries!! The tavern is down below ground, under the river. The place looks pretty shady, but is actually very good. Cheap beer, great cheeseburgers and a fun place to hang out. We also had pizza at Pizano's. Fabulous deep dish! Can't say enough about it. The rooms themselves are very nice, what you would expect from a Hyatt. Linens and beds are very comfortable. Bathrooms are supplied with nice toiletries. We had reliable maid service every day. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: emmaxoxo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over Labor Day, large hotel, nice corner room on high floor. Internet was $13.63 I believe, try facebook word of the week, for a free day. Nice bathroom, though no hook for towels, only underneath of cabinet folded, so they canâ€™t dry. Hotel will only change towels & linens, if you ring and ask, no leaving them on the floor. Good desk area, location good a little too far east could be more central.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great option for Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend during the summer and was very pleased with everything overall. We stayed in the West tower, which is older, so I expected to be in room not as nice as the new tower. I was very wrong, whole room was renovated, big glass shower, black and white photos of chicago, decent room size, bed and sheets were top notch, contemporary decor, large window and good view. I have no complaints about the room and for being such a well known huge hotel in the city it was very quiet. My only complaint, and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was the elevators. No joke.....plan on waiting at least 5 min for the elevator. Then on the way down or up you will end up making 6 or 7 stops for a total travel time of ten or twelve minutes. I saw other people complaining about it too.....but not the biggest deal

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt REgency Chicago”
Reviews.Author: siciliano
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt for one night in july. We had a toddler and a baby with us. We were able to get an early check -in as I requested on facebook. I used a hotel crib which was very clean. I thought the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was also clean. We even had a special treat sent to us from the hotel staff who responded to our facebook request(which was a welcomed treat). My only complaint on the property is that basic things that are complimentary at other hotels are not here, for example internet, use of the in room fridge( a $25 charge for the fridge is just ridiculous - really the hotel should be ashamed to even charge for this). And finally as in other downtwon hotels $50 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, trendy, comfortable stay just blocks away from the Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: snickers3924
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel to stay at in downtown Chicago. I love the contemporary look of the rooms. It's close close to great restaurants and shopping. The service here is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjackUSA
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot in Chicago, On the Riverwalk and in walking distance of the Magnificent Mile. The service was very solid and consistent. this will be forever my favorite home away from home in Chicago. My wife and I stayed there 4 days and nights, enjoyed every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, outdated, and filthy !!!!”
Reviews.Author: inro41
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are outdated. Carpets are a dark brown (to hide stains), room furniture definitely aged, room color scheme screams 1987. Me and several people had to change rooms because room were not made! I had to request someone to CLEAN MY TOILET....DISGUSTING !!!!!!! Another guest needed new bedding. Valet $50 per night. I paid $180+ and got little or no service. Hotel way too busy for personal touch. I was on the phone for 15 minutes and gave up and walked to front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sherpafamilyhk
Reviews.Content: very close to michigan avenue and state street. right below the hotel are lots of places to eat. very convinent especially during bad and cold weather.

Reviews.Title: “great staff makes convention hotel more personable”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoResortSpa
Reviews.Content: Returned for a hotel reunion after 25 +years and enjpoyed the new attractions by the hotel- Boat Tours- Navy Pier- Mich Ave shopping- Art Institute all within 15 min walk; Regency Club was terrific to relax with a great view. Lobby Bar great for TV sports. Only problem was the hold on debit card was charged a week later...after we paid seperate credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice room, but very busy.”
Reviews.Author: cjdeperro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner over the Labor Day weekend. There were several events going on in the hotel and the lobby area was often very busy. Having said that, check in was a breeze (I am a Hyatt Gold Passport member, so separate line) and the room was very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and it was obvious when they did the room renovations that sound was taken into consideration...I never heard a peep from the hallway, or the other doors slamming, which is often the case in other hotels. The bathroom was on the smaller side but clean and remodeled nicely. A true towel bar, rather than the hooks provided, would have been nice if the desire was really for us to reuse towels....they don't dry out on hooks! The location is excellent for the tourist things...Magnificent Mile, Millennium and Grant Parks, Art Institute, etc. It's a little walk from the Metro if you come in from either airport that way...but doable. The lobby has a great coffee kiosk which "proudly serves Starbucks coffee" that also sells bagels, donuts, microwave meals, etc, which never seemed to close. It was great being able to come down to the lobby for a morning cup! We did the breakfast buffet in the Bistro 151 only once. It was very good, though not cheap at $22 a person. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best view, service, and SO much fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 14 year anniversary, and my birthday. And WOW, what a great time we had. The staff was SUPER Friendly, and a little tip, check out their social media, it will be worth your while! One of the best parts: our room was on the 9th floor facing the river/Michigan Ave during the day you could see the wonderful city, and at night there was the beautiful Wrigley Buidling! Everything about our trip was wonderful, and you could not be in a better location than this, the views from everywhere are wonderful, and have a drink in the Big Bar, that is a great one right in your hotel! Oh, I almost forgot, DO NOT forget your workout clothes!! Their fitness center is a dream come true!! And you need that in a city with such wonderful cuisine!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: momof2b0ys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times, and have enjoyed my stay each time. The hotel is located on Wacker Drive, a block off of Michigan Avenue. It's location is perfect for those vacationing....shopping just north of you, and Grant Park just south of you. The rooms are larger than most hotels in the area, and always very clean. I love their bathrooms, as they are large, well lit, and extremely clean! Staff is always helpful and a pleasure to work with. My list of cons is short. They charge $14/day for WiFi; I think it should be free with the room reservation. The restaurants are also very pricey ($23/breakfast buffet or $15/continental breakfast buffet) but there are tons and tons of restaurants near by to choose from so you are not limited to eating here. Valet parking is $50/day, which is not a con, it's just the way it is in Chicago. There is only 1 hotel in Chicago that offers free parking, and it's not worth staying in only for that reason. On the day you checkout you have until 6pm to get your car from valet parking, which was an unexpected plus for us, since we were doing some shopping/sightseeing before leaving town. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will more than likely stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: dealeya
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt provided the great base for my adventures in Chicago. This being my first trip there, I wanted to be in t he thick of things and this location was just that. I was able to set out on foot for sightseing adventures of the great architecture of the city, head to the water for a trip down the Chicago river and then make my way to Navy Pier and the Taste of Chicago @ Grant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Trip - no Housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: PeggyKate
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to this hotel for a business meeting his company had. When we arrived at the hotel, we had a speedy check-in and were given keys to our room on the 26th floor. The room was beautiful and very large. That afternoon we walked around the hotel and noticed there were people picketing outside. We were handed a flier and read that the housekeeping staff of the hotel were all on strike! The next morning we had a busy day and returned to our room around 4 pm. No one had been in the room to clean. At 5:30 a member of the housekeeping staff knocked on our door and offered to clean our room. We said that's okay but we will take clean towels. That was the last time we saw housekeeping. After that, our room was never cleaned until we checked out on Sunday. I was very disappointed that the hotel had such a poor response to their housekeeping staff being out on strike and feel that a better effort should have been made to keep the rooms clean. On Saturday, I ate a buffet brunch at the hotel restaurant in the lobby. For $19.95, it was a pretty sad little buffet. Everything tasted like it had been made hours ago. I ordered an iced tea and even though there were several managers & servers walking around the restaurant, I was never offered a refill on my drink. Early Sunday morning at 4 am we were awakened by the people staying in the room next door. They were drunk and having a loud argument that went on for over an hour. Thankfully at 5 am, they finally passed out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: kiyana65
Reviews.Content: Loved the modern design of our room, nice service, very good location - 10 min walk from Millenium Park and minutes away from Michigan Ave bridge - Chicago River walk, hop on hop off tickets, etc. Beds were great too. Breakfast Buffet was not included and was expensive -$22 per person, so we did not use it - went to Hooligan's next door where we had great buffet for $12.99 adult. But the restaraunt ambience at Hyatt was much better :) We stayed with 2 kids -11 and 6 -they loved the hotel as well!

Reviews.Title: “Another Positive Stay at a Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: onlyalivebriefly
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Hyatt Regency on East Wacker in Chicago. Extremly convenient location, great perks, wonderful restaurant inside, friendly staff, beauitful rooms with great views! We also booked during a 72 hour sale, so the rate was fantastic. It helped that we are Hyatt Gold Passport Members (Platinum status), so keep that in mind. Make sure to sign up for their Gold Passport Rewards program before you stay! We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tip on how to avoid going broke eating when staying at Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Travel_is_my_life_66
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. Everything you expect from Hyatt. Very safe/secure elevators, etc. Location is ideal for River Tours and Navy Pier. When I made my reservation they give you options to upgrade for fees, several things. For instance: Higher Floor. Special upgraded bed and bath. Etc. I chose non and was on a high floor with an upgraded bed and bath. Save yourself the money and chance it if you are a gambler. Ordered 2 glasses of apple juice from room service (for a diabetic who needed sugar) and it cost $16.75 plus the $2 we handed the delivery guy. Holy Cow. So, directly next to the Hyatt on Wacker is Houlihan's. WONDERFUL brunch buffet with everything you can think of for $12. EAT THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: newton1000
Reviews.Content: Booked the room using the AAA rate and paid $116 per night which included the breakfast buffet ($55 if paid separately). As a platinum member received a room with a great view of the river and lake. In addition, we had a coupon for a free upgrade to the regency club. The rooms are geared toward business travelers and I would rate them a little below four stars. The cleaning staff do not seem to replace anything in the room (shampoo, glasses etc.), We just called the guest services line and they brought whatever we wanted. The buffet for breakfast was great and the service staff was the best. The only caveat is that on weekends and during big conventions you may need to wait a half hour to get a table. The location was great since it is right at Wacker and Michigan. It is very convenient for public transportation to most of the tourist sights. We also tooks cabs from the hotel since the rates are so cheap and they are always in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Hyatt lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Justcruzn
Reviews.Content: We were completely pleased with our weekend stay at the Chicago Hyatt Regency. The hotel is perfectly located to provide access to the cream of the crop of Chicago's plethora of entertainment opportunities. For prospective visitors, I would point out that this hotel is huge. If you are looking for small and intimate, this is not the right choice. But, if you are looking for great location, great service, and beautiful modern rooms, this hotel is right on. The decor of the rooms is modern and sleek and comfortable. All of the amenities lived up to the high standards of the Hyatt chain. For the money, this is one of the best values in the downtown area. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city trip and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TinaPenguin
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here for a long weekend, it was easy to get to the hotel from O'Hare with public transportation. The room was spacious, well equipped and very quiet. It was a very convenient location to walk around, go on a boat cruise, visit the Pier, go shopping and a lot more. The staff was very helpful, our room was ready when we got there at 8 am in the morning! There are several restaurants and bars in the hotel, for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And we loved the BIG BAR, with the VERY BIG drinks ;-) Definitely would return and recommend to friends for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel room”
Reviews.Author: Linda F
Reviews.Content: The room was very well designed for a business traveler with a comfortable chair, desk, free internet and lighting. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was great, and especially like the make-up mirror on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, not a kid friendly hotel-won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: cliffcheek
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok for only paying $98/night and having a free buffet breakfast. When I arrived I didn't like the fact that the bellman started to help me unload my bags then walked away and helped someone else-he got absolutely no tip from me. I had a King room(2210) with a nice view of the Chicago river and Navy Pier. The bed seemed hard, woke up with a back ache-not plush and cozy like normal Hyatt beds. The tv channel reception was fuzzy, they had no channel listing. The bathroom was ok but had some mold on the wall and the cold air return was so dusty. We ate at the hotel resturant Bistro 151, food was decent but they had no kids menu or items, so I ended up having to buy a bowl of cereal and milk from a stand in the lobby. This hotel had nothing for my 2 year old son to do, no pool, no activities, no food. With me being a Hyatt Platinum passport member, I was not impressed with this hotel at all. This is well below the Hyatt standards that I am use to. Most likely I will not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property for the Price”
Reviews.Author: AGuyFromArizona
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights on business. The location was great and the room was very nice. The price was $25-$30 cheaper than any comparable hotels in the area. I had two minor complaints. The closet door was off the track, and wouldn't open when I checked in, and they didn't fix it the second day. Also, the Big Bar closed early, and the bartender was not very polite about letting me know before last call. Other than that, I would highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, and while the conference area was packed, it worked well. The hotel rooms are all renovated and very modern. I had a smaller room, but the view was amazing of the river and the lake. The location is amazing, right on the river with access to anything via water taxi. This is also a nice place to have easy access to running trails on the river or the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous escalator”
Reviews.Author: jeffrx42
Reviews.Content: The hyatt check-in is on the 2nd floor. Be very careful putting your suitcase on the escalator as more than one person has fallen and cut themselves. The hotel is aware of the danger to their guest, but it is an old hotel and it is in need of a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “After 20 years its still a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theworld2see
Reviews.Content: My family and I started staying at this Hyatt in the 1980's and to the early 1990's....This was my first time back after 15+ years and after the massive room remodeling project....Its still great and the rooms are even better! We used the AAA rate and received breakfast and free parking. We were upgraded to a deluxe room in the west tower on the 30th floor, with a GREAT view of the river and the city. Robin at the front desk was very warm and friendly and a great help. We liked the place so much we stayed a second night at the last moment. The location is in my opinion is the best in Chicago, view included. Keep up the good work! (Tip: The AAA rate/breakfast covered our 6 yr old the first night, but we were billed the second night of our stay...Per the front desk 5 and under are free, though we were never told this or asked of her age. We have never been charged at any other Hyatt's for our childs breakfast, so check the fine print....All was made right at the desk upon check out as they took the charge off the bill)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service with a Personal Touch!”
Reviews.Author: Malinda B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as a quick getaway for his birthday. This hotel was recommended by a friend via social media and ti was through this connection I received a great room at a great price. Overall our service was spectacular! When we arrived we were surprised to find out we had been chosen as "Guest of the Day" and received an upgraded room. Our room was ready for our early arrival, and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. A word about parking: valet only (as described on their site) so call ahead! My only complaint about this hotel was the valet service needs to improve communication. A voicemail message prompted us to go downstairs to the lobby to retrieve our car, then upon taking our luggage downstairs we were instructed to go to the actual valet services area, then our car was taken upstairs instead of to where we were. By the time it was said and done it took a half hour to get our car.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Holbe
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention and found it to be a great place to stay. The staff were friendly and helpful and the convention facilities were good. The rooms were clean and modern but the best part was the location. It seemed pretty much the centre of town. Everything was just a short walk including the train lines. I'd definitely consider this place when I next visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel we'll ever stay at from now on”
Reviews.Author: SB8000
Reviews.Content: it was our first time to Chicago and the Hyatt staff and facilities were absolutely perfect during our 5 days there. From the moment we checked in to the day we left, the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful at all times. My wife had an allergic reaction to the downfill pilllows/blankets and the housekeeping manager moved us to a new room with 'regular' bedding. They made us feel welcome and happy at all times, including sending us champagne on the day of our anniversary. The room was very spacious and very clean. The location of the hotel couldn't be any more perfect being right on the Chicago river and footsteps to all the action. We didn't use our car once and just walked everywhere. The breakfast buffet was great with an excellent selection........enough to keep us interested all 5 days! If there was one downside it would be the expensive parking at $50 every 24 hours (valet only). But do join their facebook group for specials and promotions..(including cheaper parking and free wi-fi for 1 day)......the social marketing managers are amazing at what they do and because of them guests like us will continue to tell everyone we know! We are coming back Hyatt.........that's a promise!

Reviews.Title: “If your thought Regency inplies regal, it doesn't.”
Reviews.Author: alsupremo
Reviews.Content: We were in the west building overlooking an office tower. Good job they were off on a public holiday. Room on 24th floor had been renovated. Location is great, a few steps from the magnificent mile and on the river. The hotel is split between 2 buildings, the main hotel on the east is connected by a 2nd floor walkway to the west Tower which has no services. We paid $89 a night Labor Day weekend for 2 nights from Travelzoo with 50% off valet parking which was regularly $50 a night. With so many guests valet parking is busy and we had to go to the basement to get the car. With a name like Hyatt Regency I thought it would have been better. I guess we paid what it was worth and didn't get a great deal, especially as other readers say they paid $62 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Stella1684
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency. I really don't think there is a better location in downtown. So conveniently located off the river and a short jaunt to Michigan Ave, Grant Park, and Navy Pier. I have already recommended this hotel to other travelers heading to Chicago. I would say, however, the dining in the hotel is pretty pricey. So, if you are looking to save a few bucks get outside of the four walls of the hotel. That being said, I will still always stay at this hotel when traveling to Chicago, with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hadams458
Reviews.Content: The people were very friendly and helpful. We were on the 29th floor and had a great view of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan from our room. I was given a "welcome gift" of yummy chocolate toffee candy. This was our first experience with valet parking and it was very convenient. Any questions we had about Chicago were answered by the great staff. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Already looking forward to our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: sensfan25
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our wedding anniversary, we decided to travel to Chicago. For our stay, we decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency and managed to get a reasonable rate after having the hotel match a lower price on the Internet and beat it by 20 percent. Upon arrival, we were surprised by the size of the hotel - it's on a scale of a Las Vegas hotel! Despite being a very large hotel, we were pleased with the friendly, personalized service at check-in. Our room was quite amazing. It was a newly renovated deluxe room with a view of the Navy Pier, which was absolutely perfect! These new rooms are quite possibly the most perfect hotel rooms as they have thought of everything! If I were to find anything to complain about, it would be the odd shape of the water glasses. Unfortunately, this trip is going to cost more than expected as we now want to buy the great hairdryer and incredible Toto toilet that was in the hotel room. For our anniversary, the hotel also surprised us with complimentary sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries. All in all, we have a terrific experience staying at the Hyatt Regency in Chicago and we can't wait until we can return!

Reviews.Title: “News Flash: Fresh!”
Reviews.Author: TheKarl
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying here! would I stay here again ... YES!!!! Positives: 1. Check in was easy and efficient, I asked for a room with a good view and it was no problem at all :) 2. I was placed in the East Tower floor 33 room 3362 facing the river! The view was great!! 3. The room had a fresh suave look to it... nice layout! **And very clean!!!! 4. This hotel is very Big... but I had no problems waiting for an elevator. Negative: (this is the only negative and a minor one and I feel does not reflect on the hotel as a whole) The 151 Bistro, Bar : A Fail When I arrived to get a little lunch it was the transition from breakfast and lunch. I was asked what I preferred by the hostess I told her the lunch. Immediately after being seated the waiter told me I should really get the breakfast buffet, I told him I wanted the lunch! He again insisted to me about the breakfast buffet, again I said I still wanted the lunch, so he said he would give me a min and be back! **He did not come back for almost 15 min but LOL walked by many times and so by this point I had decided I would be better off serving myself at the buffet than let him serve me!!!!! At most places I would have walked out before this, but I felt I should give it a chance The scrabbled eggs were grossly under done and to be honest how does one mess that up, not sure? The rest of the buffet was average.

Reviews.Title: “Not 100% perfect, but almost there!”
Reviews.Author: sumi9
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hyatt within two months. During this visit, I had booked the trip a few days prior to check in. Right after I booked, the Hyatt Regency Facebook page announced a 15% discount on a room. When I asked if I could use it, they said that I couldn't. I was slightly miffed but at that point, really didn't want to go through with booking elsewhere on such short notice. I arrived at the Hyatt only to find out I was eligible for a free 2pm checkout, so I was pleased. The room was fine though the bathtub trained out slowly and after taking a shower it was gross to be standing in water. The room also took a bit to cool down and I don't think it was ever exactly cool. The view was nice, though there was a major abundance of spiders outside the window. The night valet/doormen were all wonderful, in particular there was a man named Anthony who was absolutely friendly and definitely deserves some bonus points for being so personable. The next morning, the maid came by 4-5 times which was frustrating as we had the 2pm checkout. She continuously asked when I would be leaving and I repeated 2 pm each time. It didn't stop her from coming back and knocking constantly. Aside from those small bumps in the road, I did enjoy my stay at the Hyatt, and will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service, could use minor tweaks, but we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: old_type
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short. Family of 3, so it was the two of us plus our 1 year old. Spent 2011 Labour day weekend in Chicago, first time ever. Pros: awesome staff, clean rooms, location amazing; great overall Cons (not a deal breaker but nobody's perfect): washroom could use more hooks, two hooks only? also, they had a water kettle and paper cups, and glass cups, some ceramic cups with handles would be nice... also, we heard the tv and conversations from the next room, probably because we were adjourning rooms???

Reviews.Title: “It was Adequate”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler2005
Reviews.Content: I got this room on priceline for $62/night, and it was worth that. It was definitely not worth the $159/night that they were asking if you booked directly with the hotel. It was clean and got the job done for the one night that I needed it. The view was less than spectacular on the 18th floor...it is surrounded by office buildings. Perhaps if you get a higher room you could see more. I bet the river views are nice as this hotel is directly across Wacker Drive from the river. They had a nice lobby/common area (I'm almost positive that everything was overpriced), but a nice environment to have a drink/hang out. I asked for a late checkout, and I was permitted to stay until 1pm free of charge. The maid began banging on the door at 9:30 am and wanted me out sooner, which was slightly irritating. All in all, a good stay, but definitely not worth paying full price. Add this to your "good priceline discount" bucket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but smells like vomit...”
Reviews.Author: Chicken431
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a few nights while celebrating my anniversary with my husband. The hotel for the most part is great. Room is clean but hallway and every elevator so far has smelled like vomit...makes for a nauseating ride. Location is pretty good. Room service cheesecake was Eh. Staff very nice. Overall a decent stay thus far aside from smell once we leave the room (also very very cold too). Got a good deal on priceline but probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Trash in Room at Check-in and Poor Fixtures”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: There was trash in the room when we came in...a bunch of paper and bags stuffed behind the chair in the corner. When we first called down to tell the front desk, we were put on hold for several minutes and had to call back. Finally did get a hold of someone. We went for a walk and when we returned, some of the trash had been cleaned up, but there was still paper stuffed behind the chair (even though we had told the front desk that that was where the trash was). On top of this, the room we were given was the ADA-compliant room, which we were told was our only option if we wanted a king bed. It was very clear that this hotel 'phoned-in' conversion of this room for ADA-compliance; many of the fixtures were poorly converted or useless, regardless of one's ability status. For example, the bathroom sink was incredibly small and shallow. More the size of a sink in an RV than a full bathroom. Instead of installing ADA-compliant towel racks, there were simply no towels in the bathroom. It really was unpleasant to step out of the shower and realize that you have to walk out into the bedroom and into the closet to get a bath towel. Annoyingly, the room's security latch was installed at the same height as the main light switch. When the latch was unlocked, it covered the light switch. The was very frustrating when coming into a dark room for the evening and having to fumble behind the latch to get to the switch. The overall ambiance of the hotel lobby felt more like a mall food court than a relaxing hotel. Parking was shockingly expensive, and increased the cost of our stay by 50%. Only pro: Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency Club”
Reviews.Author: DM123
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is in a good location right on the river and 1 block from Michigan Aveneue. The hotel itself is very large spreading over 2 towers. Our room was large, modern and in very good condition, could not fault it. We travelled with 2 children so we had a room with 2 queen beds. When booking you really should look to see how much access to the Regency Club would cost. The quality of the continental breakfast and hors d'ouerves is excellent and completely justified the cost. The Regency Club room is on the 17th floor with views across the river to the Wrigley Building and Michigan Avenue, this makes it a pleasant place to go to at any time to relax with complimnetary tea/coffee and soft drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here for a conference”
Reviews.Author: LEUJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency for four nights for a conference in the hotel. Overall, a good experience. But, my preference for smaller, less expensive hotels definitely colored the view of my stay here. The pros: - Excellent customer service. Honestly, I didn't know what to expect knowing the staff was on strike. ALL of the staff were extremely courteous and helpful, from the front desk to the coffee shop to the housekeeping. Please remember to tip the maids, bell boys, and others. Doesn't sound like Hyatt employees are treated very well. - Comfortable beds. You can just sink into the mattress and rest peacefully. Pillows could use an upgrade. - Fairly quiet. I didn't hear anyone's TV, the elevator, or anything like that. Occasionally I thought I heard someone dropping something in their bathroom, but who knows what that was. - Location. Close to several restaurants, bars, and shopping. I highly recommend walking 1/2 block down Stetson St. (in between the towers) to Bowinkles(?), a deli with reasonably priced made-to-order sandwiches, baked goods, sodas, coffee, and a full grocery (also sells wine and beer). The Cons: - Expensive. Everything from the coffee shop to using a refrigerator, it's pricey. I would much prefer to stay in a hotel with free wireless, a refrigerator for your use, somewhat drinkable in room coffee, and a simple TV channel guide. The room feels like a set-up- every time you turn on the TV, look at the fridge, open your computer- they are trying to get your money. Wireless was free with the conference hotel rate but still... A coffee and fruit cup costs $9 at J's express. - No pool. Not sure how a pricey, massive place like this could not have a pool, but they don't, and they should. - Employees on strike. Just not a good feeling knowing you're supporting a corporation that treats its employees like second class citizens. I only stayed here because I generally like staying at the conference hotel (you can go rest when there's a short break), and I wanted to support my professional organization. Now I see there are plenty of cheaper options a hop skip and jump away. Try the Club Quarter, Hotel Monaco (where there's a free happy hour!), or one of the many other hotels within a 4 block radius. I know I've listed more pros than cons but for me the cons outweigh the pros. It's not that I didn't enjoy myself here and convenience was a huge factor in this scenario. But next time in Chicago I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff--amazing view.”
Reviews.Author: Tboucek
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the hyatt. During my stay, a maid accidentally walked into the room while I was in the shower...the management quickly addressed the situation and provided us a refund as well as a free stay. Next time I stay in Chicago, I sill definitely look to stay at the Hyatt. The staff is extremely friendly and the hotel is very nice/elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, happy to stay again (with earplugs at the ready)”
Reviews.Author: Route128North
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hyatt last month was a pleasant one. In any city hotel, I always expect a small room and am happy if itâ€™s anything larger than tiny. My room in the East Tower, however, was generously sized with a king bed, long desk unit holding a flat-screen TV, two (sort of) comfortable easy chairs, and a small table--and still plenty of open space! The room faced north with a nice view of the river. Desk space was plentiful and allowed me to spread my work out. Internet was free (a charge showed when I connected each day, but the staff said it would be credited on the bill and it was), though the connection was slow. There were plenty of power outlets, but I wish the ones at the bedside were easier to access. Drawer space was very limited and probably would be insufficient for two persons who prefer to unpack their suitcases. Reading light was good at the desk, chairs, and bed. The mattress sagged in several spots and it was a bit difficult to get comfortable. The bathroom was also a good size, but with minimal counter space and only two hooks (Iâ€™m happy to reuse my towel, but never know what to do with it nor how it will dry between uses). Water pressure was acceptable and the hot water was steady. The room was clean upon arrival, and housekeeping did a good job each day. The only major concern I had with the room was noise. I could hear some street noise from the exterior, but it wasnâ€™t bad. It was the noise from the interior hallways that awakened me many times during my first two nights. After that, I wised up and used earplugs so Iâ€™m not sure if the noisiness those first nights was largely a weekend phenomenon or if it continued on weekdays. I do know that the sound-proofing of the interior corridors is poor. The staff were generally pleasant and helpful. Check-in and check-out were uneventful. I had a minor concern about the luggage storage process. Huge amounts of luggage were stored (in a cordoned-off area of a corridor), but there was only one worker at this station even though a) a large conference seemed to be ending (with many folks therefore retrieving luggage at the same time), and b) several bellmen were milling around nearby. It was very slow. The public areas of the hotel are fine though rather noisy. Elevators are numerous, but sometimes, the wait was long. The location of the Hyatt is great, right by the river, the Magnificent Mile, and Millennium Park. Restaurant choices are almost endless. I found it convenient to take the CTA from Oâ€™Hare and then a taxi from Clark/Lake station to the hotel, but the walk from the station is not far (just too far for me with luggage!). I would be happy to return to the Hyatt Regency Chicago, though I will be sure to bring my earplugs to insure a good nightâ€™s sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is HOT in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: Arnold J
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. My business client hosted their annual conference in the Hyatt. This place is spacious, modern and classy. It is located right off the main paths for downtown Chicago. Walking to different places was easy and close by. There were different entrances one could use to gain access to hotel, making walks around town much easier when returning. I rate this Hyatt "A+"!

Reviews.Title: “They "get" social media among other things”
Reviews.Author: JLEDC
Reviews.Content: I hate huge hotels; it was however where the conference was housed. Prior to arrival, I wanted to ensure I had a pre-assigned hypo-allergenic room in the first (closer to entrance) tower. Tried calling the hotel but got into voice mail ickiness. I tweeted and posted on their FB page and got an almost instant reply from the AMAZING, fabulous, wonderful, she-deserves-a-huge-raise Jennifer Kedinger who is their (my title for her) Queen of Service & Social Media. She helped me with this, and while there, a bunch of other things .. like ensuring I had a Sunday New York Times. My sense too is that she is wonderful on her own and wonderful as a result of a good service attitude at the Hotel. What I liked about the hotel and my stay: - love the hypoallergenic rooms AND think they need to doa bit more .. like totally unscented bathroom products and signs to remind people they are in this type of room and to go easy on cologne, lotions, etc. for the next guest. - staff are great - people were helpful and kind, always with a great attitude. It mattered. One of the doormen remembered me each day and knew what kind (non-smoking, air conditioned, non-van) cab I wanted. I noticed this with many staff who remembered guests. That takes a positive attitude and good training. Special praise to the housekeepers who were so pleasant and welcoming. It's the toughest job in the hotel; remember to tip daily! - room service breakfast - timely and good. The fresh fruit was really that! Things on which they can improve: - Free wifi would be really nice. - Package intake and shipping are costly just for handling and the process, because it's outsourced, is annoying. (I pre-print my own labels; I still had to deal w/ this.) - Ramp access to the Bistro from the elevator side. One has to walk all the way around the area to get to the ramp. Seems an easy fix. - See above "likes" re unscented bathroom products. - Better bedside lighting needed. There is a 'reading light' but the height of it is not great for reading in bed. In fact, better lighting generally in the guest rooms would be nice for these "Boomer eyes"! I wished earlier in my stay that I'd known about the Afghan restaurant that is "right there" - out the side door. I love Afghani food and would have gone. Overall, it was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: derelicte78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is humongous! This is my second stay here, but this time I stayed for 3 weeks for a business trip so I got a great feel for the hotel, but it took a couple days to find my way around. The rooms are a bit on the small side but typical for a big city hotel. We stayed in a junior suite which was decent-sized and had a separate living area, though it was all one room. The regency club is excellent though the food selections don't change. All of the staff is extremely friendly. Car pickup from the garage can be a hassle. You have to call down 15-20 minutes before you need your car and if you lose your ticket it's more hassle then trying to get a new driver's license! There was a weird smell coming from the water, but it wasn't really all that annoying after awhile. It can be a hassle getting down the elevators in the mornings and around check-out/in time, but overall this hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “a massive business hotel”
Reviews.Author: piaccere
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for business earlier this year. good: location in Chicago, good rooms. a really nice bed. bad: it's massive and impersonal. Rather expensive for the what it offers. The lobby is a convention center already and there are always lines on the check in, check out and luggage counters. the hotel is a favorite for large conventions - so if you are an individual traveler, be prepared for the masses that are always around. Conclusion: it's good in a good location, but massive and not special.

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of, thank you for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: astebelton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days on business in the city and it was an excellent stay. As a frequent traveller, I am very stingy with my "Excellent Ratings," but in this case it was well deserved. I contacted the hotel via their Facebook page in advance of my arrival and they helped me get a room on the 31st floor with a great view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. The room was a "King Deluxe" in the West tower. Apparently, this room type has been recently renovated and has what they called a "floating king". Basically, the bed is an island in the middle of the room, with the desk behind. It looked a little unusual when I first walked in but after I was there for a bit and walked around and used various items in the room, it really grew on me. Functionally it was probably the best room I've ever stayed in. Two of my biggest complaints in hotels are not enough accessible power outlets and not enough data bandwidth. Neither of these were a problem here. Used Netflix streaming with no issues and there are power outlets EVERYWHERE! In addition to the great room, the social media team left me a small token of their appreciation in my room, a container of "Chicago Toffee" Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: JessMontalvo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last week, only for one night. We were on our honeymoon, and I booked at several different hotels. We are from Iowa so we don't know much about the hotels in the area and didn't want to be stuck in a hotel we didn't like for more than one night. But we found ourselves wishing we could stay longer! We got a room discounted on Expedia and paid 20 dollars to upgrade to a river-view room on the 19th floor. It was absolutely beautiful, especially at night. If you do stay in this hotel and they offer to upgrade you to a room with a view, it is worth the 20 bucks. There was a lot of people and boat watching from our room alone, and at night there was a fireworks display we could see perfectly from our room. It is also very close to lots of shops and places to eat, as well as a grocery store right next to the steakhouse. Since hotel food is so pricey we just walked to the store and brought back snacks and drinks for the night. This is a great hotel if you just want to explore the streets of Chicago, we actually skipped a trip to the zoo so we could just walk around. Now for the downsides. The parking is so expensive, it is 50 bucks. When I called they stated they had self-parking, but it took us over an hour to even find the hotel, and we had no idea where the self-parking was. When we pulled into the service entrance we didn't even know where the front entrance was so we just ended up having to pay for valet parking, which we didn't even use since we walked everywhere. My advice is to call and get directions, because I had them all written down from Google Maps, but they were useless due to construction. We also tried using our gps on our phones, but because of the tall buildings it did not work right. So if you get lost call and the staff will give you good directions. Also, beware that this hotel is very crowded so you will have to wait a few minutes in line for everything. If you dislike crowds, this may not be the place for you! Overall, great hotel with a beautiful view! Staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: corgi22
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat and service was wonderful. My only criticism is that soundproofing was lacking (room to room) and there was a service charge for the in-room refrigerator. But the computers at the concierge desk for printing boarding passes were tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large and has two skyscraping towers. The lobby looks like a shopping mall when you enter with different eateries, shops, and directional to conference spaces. I have stayed in both towers and the rooms are very modern, clean, and very large. Our room had a great view overlooking Wacker Street and the expansive and beautiful Chicago skyline. The Internet works great but is a bit pricey just as everything else inside the hotel is expensive from a bottle water to room service. We paid $4 for a bottle of water and over $25 for a burger and fries from room service. The food was great but not $25 great. The staff was super friendly and helpful. One thing I was impressed with this hotel was the kiosk to check in and check out which makes it super easy and fast opposed to waiting in line. Overall this is a great hotel and I really enjoyed my stay here. I do recommend taking a 5 minute walk to one of the local drugs stores to purchase water, soda, and anything else you might need to avoid paying for it in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All Around”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were travelling through the country and were astonished at how well we were treated at this hotel. The room was extremely clean, the staff accommodating, and the view was great. Pro Tip: Like them on Facebook for free internet, and $15 off parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and has a great location close to downtown as well as the lake!

Reviews.Title: “A bit lacking in finer details”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days there for a conference. Staff are very welcoming, helpful, everything you'd want. My room was in east tower so not sure if representative of west tower as well. Room had the old wallpaper finish everywhere. Power points were loose and several were coming away from the wall. Bathroom was good - obviously newer than the bedroom. Beds are wonderful, really comfortable and lots of pillows. Heating/cooling worked well and not too noisy. In-room safe was old and didn't fit my new 13.3" Sony laptop which was surprising. My room had a really long desk running behind the bedhead which was great to work at. Room lighting was quite minimal which wasn't very cheery. Breakfast buffet was very good and staff very attentive. Sunday was super busy with a long queue to get in but other days were fine. I had free internet in my room package (a business plan) but couldn't get it to work until I rang the 1300 number after several hours of trying. The instructions in the hotel room service guide were wrong. If your internet web page doesn't bring up the login page automatically then it says to type it in manually. This did nothing. Problem was that the website address was for globalsuite. There were 2 wireless services available that my PC found: globalsuite and hyatt. The instructions didn't mention this so I (wrongly) assumed that I needed to connect to the globalsuite one as that was the webpage it told you to use... turns out it's the hyatt one. Bit annoying as I was there for business and specifically needed the internet access when travelling overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieNewBoston
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker knowing it was a little further than what I was used to. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. It depends on what you are looking for, but the hotel is clean, accommodating, and provides a late 2PM checkout which was wonderful. It is a great location to everything and not a bad walk to the Water Tower area. Staying here enabled us to explore 'across the river' for a change which was a delightful experience. It is very close to the Water Taxi and located right near the River Walk. We dined at the Stetson Steak House and the Bistro, both located in the hotel. Both were wonderful with first rate service. The only drawback for me was when we arrived on Sunday, the lobby was very crowded. The hotel caters to many conventions and meetings and, depending on what you prefer, can be a little overwhelming. It is truly like a city in a city with anything you need available. I would stay here again because of the location and service and cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 10!!!”
Reviews.Author: esther7
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect, the check in experience, the room, the restaurant, the location, the professional and courteous service of the staff... I received the AAA rate @$125/night which included full buffet breakfast - not your typical buffet, but 5 stations with hot selections, cooked to order, and for those of us who don't eat pork, there were turkey and chicken selections... The room decor is contemporary and modern, clean, clean, clean... And the service is just exceptional. I can't rave enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location and typical hyatt quality and customer service”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a business trip. This hyatt is very typical of hyatt brand - clean rooms, great customer service, and a prime location. This is located just off of michigan ave and wacker drive, so you can walk just about anywhere from here. i appreciate the staff attention to details, the folks working about in the lobby are helpful and friendly, the check in and check out staff are patient and friendly. I really thought was cool the door lock mechanism isnt on the door but a touch panel on the wall, that was kind of neat. The only disappointment i had with my room (2080) was that it was in an area that happened to face the fire station on the east side of the building, so there was some noise throughout the night from that, but it wasnt all that loud. Overall a pleasant stay at a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn6586
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. I must say, when I first arrived to check-in I was very intimidated. The check-in area was so busy that it reminded me of the airport! This hotel is very large and very busy but I had a really nice stay here. The rooms were very clean and I loved the decorations. They look like they might be newly remodeled. Breakfast buffett was nice also. The best part is the location! Right on the Chicago riverwalk and right across the street from the Magnificent Mile and the Marilyn Monroe statue! They hotel is about 4 blocks from Navy Pier also so you can really walk almost everywhere. Millenium Park is also right around the corner. The is a water taxi that runs right across from the hotel which is also convenient. All-in-all I had a nice stay here. No issues at all. I would definitely recommend it if you plan to sightsee around the city!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: JR591011
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to the main entrance we were treated like royalty. I get to Chicago once a year and always stay at the Hyatt. There are other places to stay but for the money, I find the level of service at the Hyatt second to none.

Reviews.Title: “MONEY HUNGRY HOTEL with ZERO AMENTIES”
Reviews.Author: couponer85
Reviews.Content: Absolutely boring hotel, I've been to other hotels in Chicago and this one does not meet the 4-star rating. First and for most, the vents make it so that everyone can hear you and others. My husband was in the bathroom reading and he said he could hear everything from the other rooms. Second, there is a charge for everything. NO breakfast, no internet without $$$$. Buffet breakfast per person was 22 dollars, and internet per day was $13. WTH? Most hotels give you those amenities for FREE. No courtesy lobby computer, cost was .50 a minute?!? Location was ok... our view was ugly, looked into a gloomy office building. BE VERY CAREFUL about their mini refrigerator, it can sense if you put your belongings in there and they will charge you!!! I had my toddler son there and he was getting into the cabinets and they were going to charge me $35 because they sensed him putting his hands in there! Not my fault there was no lock on that thing! The front doors of the hotel DON'T WORK, YOU MUST USE THE ANNOYING AUTOMATIC SWIRLING DOORS that are scary and hard to use with kids. If you are handicap, I can imagine this being a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Cards stank. Hyatt made it all better.”
Reviews.Author: Rick E
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Downtown on E Wacker from Aug. 19-21st. We were in town for the Cardinals/Cubs series. I am the Cards fan and she is the Cubs fan. The Cubs won the Friday and Saturday games, so Lisa was happy. Me? Not so much. However, the staff at the Hyatt did everything they could to make our stay exceptional (and this sad Cards fan, happy). I could go on and on about all the things they did that were classy, and exceeded our expectations. But I will just leave it at this........they know how to treat there guests there. Period. Contact them via social media and they will respond in a timely manner and do all they can to accommodate. All in all. We would definitely stay here again. Great location and great hotel with great people working there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 123lori
Reviews.Content: Great location -- close to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, shopping on Michigan Ave, etc. Took the water taxi to the Navy Pier to do the Skyline boat tour. Loved the boat tour! We did the tour on the Friday before the air show and it was really cool seeing the planes practice. Also walked to Grant Park to watch the free concert which was really nice. We upgraded our room to a "room with a view" which was $20 more a night. We looked out at the river and toward Navy Pier. Well worth it. The room and bathroom were very large. The only downside were the beds. They were very uncomfortable. It felt like there was no support. SInce they just did a 90 million renovation I was expecting the beds would be pretty nice. They were not. I stayed in 2314 which was in the west tower.

Reviews.Title: “3 STAR PRICE FOR 5 STAR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ericjbabin
Reviews.Content: Spent the last 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency Chicago at 151 E. Wacker. Overall, the best hotel experience I can remember having. (After 20 years in the Navy traveling the world that really says something.) For the reasonable price in such a great location I have to be honest and say my expectations were not too high. From the moment we were dropped off every member of the staff treated us as if we were VIP Rock Stars. From the door man, to the front desk staff, waiters/waitresses, and Jennifer K. the Social Media Marketing Manager who made sure we had a great room, with an awesome view, right next door (adjoining) with the rest of our party. Jennifer even sent us a thoughtful welcome card and gift. We experienced every eatery, pub and bar, and were consistently pleased with the quality of the food. The only problem we had was the fact the hotel is in such a great location to all the sights and sounds of Chicago but the hotel offers equally enjoyable temptations.... we were torn... out on the town or visit one of the hotel restaurants, bars, or pub? They have great property and very talented and caring employees. . The only negative experience our entire visit was the Hertz rental car desk on property. If you want to rent a car don't do it there, but that will be a separate review since you can't fault Hyatt for Hertz's poor customer service and questionable business practices...... We look forward to visiting again. I highly encourage those planning a visit "friend" the Hyatt on Facebook for special offers often including room discounts, parking discounts and free food at some of the property restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - great value”
Reviews.Author: ealex231
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel for a conference and was very pleased with my stay. The Good: This Hyatt is in the perfect location for a tourist or anyone looking to enjoy good food and shopping. It was reasonably priced for such an amazing location - a few blocks from the Miracle Mile, River Walk, and Millennium Park... and just a 15 minute walk from Navy Pier. The hotel itself had a great 24 hour gym and speedy room service - which was quite good! It also had the "Big Bar" in the East tower, which offered huge martinis and yummy appetizers. The Bad: The bed was not very comfortable, the pillows were way too soft. Also, there was very low water pressure which actually made brushing my teeth and washing my hair difficult - go figure. Also, internet was not free... $13.63 per day! I certainly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency and this hotel would be my pick if I ever return to Chicago for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic week in the windy city”
Reviews.Author: pizz-11
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, great location ,great friendly knowledgeable staff , great steak house, redy too return

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: sdcoombs0523
Reviews.Content: Follow them on Facebook and Twitter for special deals!

Reviews.Title: “Really???”
Reviews.Author: KJ E
Reviews.Content: You would think with 2000 rooms this joint would have some amenities. Well, think again. I must, in all fairness, give kudos to 2 things. The location and the exercise facility. Now for the non kudos: No free breakfast, no complimentary newspaper, a thermostat that could not be set lower than 65 (the hallway was cooler), an uncomfortable bed (too hard), no free internet, and, of all things, no phone book! If you want to stay at a place that takes ($$$) and does not give...have at it. As for me...REALLY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: sooprnova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago August 5-9, 2011 for Lollapalooza. When we arrived at the hotel, we checked in at the Gold Passport desk and really felt as though they went out of their way to get us excited about our stay. We were in a junior suite on the 30th floor with a great view of the river and the city. The view of the city lights at night was just breathtaking! The room was well-appointed, with a sitting area with a coffee table, two couches, and a few end tables. Behind that was a desk. The other end of the room had the bed, night stands, etc. The bathroom was standard, and we thought the shower was a bit small, but definitely worked for us. In the entryway to our room was a nice "prep" area with a mini fridge and a counter-top, perfect for those on more than a 1-2 night stay. The only negative was that we could very clearly hear the party people in the room next door, but they must have spent most of their time out of the room, because it only woke us up once in the middle of the night. We ate both at in-room dining an at Daddy-O's, the "Irish Pub" on-site. Room service was very prompt, especially considering that the hotel was at capacity, no small feat for the largest Hyatt in the world! The food was good - burgers were cooked exactly the way we ordered them. Daddy-O's has a pretty decent selection of beers on draft and in bottles, and the food we tried was good and reasonably priced for hotel bar food. Since this hotel was recently renovated, everything was clean and modern. We really liked the decor and the sleek lines of the furniture and the artwork on the walls. Thumbs up to the designer! The one thing, though, that we couldn't get over was how friendly and helpful the staff were. We had some contact with Jenn K. from the hotel prior to our trip, and she went out of her way to make sure that it was amazing (we were also celebrating our 8th anniversary). The front desk representative who checked us in made us feel special and took her time with us despite the fact that there was a line in the lobby for check-in. We never felt rushed, and the concierge/front desk staff were always positive, nice, and completely accommodating every time we called or stopped down. This is a HUGE hotel, so if you're not into walking, it may not be the best for you. The elevators, though, are quick and plentiful. The gym was also much larger than many I've seen, and I had no problem using a treadmill in the morning even though the hotel was full. The hotel is also connected to shopping by underground pedways, which really came in handy during some of the crazy rainstorms we had! Overall, we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The rooms are nice and newly renovated, there are several dining options on-site and hundreds more in the general area, it's within walking distance to almost everything you'd want to do or see in downtown Chicago, and the staff are ultra-friendly and accommodating. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “We can't do anything about it.”
Reviews.Author: J9wings
Reviews.Content: I arrived and my friends were already there and visiting a nearby art gallery. They put my name on the reservation and told me to get a key from the front desk when I arrived. The front desk staff gave me the key to my room and I put my stuff away and went to meet the group. We returned late that night and I soon realized the room that my friends were in was not the room that I placed my stuff in that afternoon. We went to speak with the front desk. We were met with "We can't do anything about that right now due to the hour. We will not disrupt the guest staying in the room you say you left your stuff in." Unacceptable!!! My $1500 laptop and all of the things I brought with me were in that room! Not my mistake! FINALLY, after arguing with the head of security for about 30 minutes, they knocked on the door of the room I had left my belongings in and a lady answered. She was upset and stated she had security take the items from her room in the afternoon. All of my belongings were recovered in the security room; however, all of this hullabaloo could have been avoided had they communicated about the situation! Terrible, terrible customer service. They sent up an apology letter, champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries to the room. Although I was appreciative of the gesture, it still does not excuse the fact that they argued and continued to say "We can't do anything about it."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: CTBadger
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on business. The room and bedding were very comfortable and clean and the room was very quiet. The hotel recently underwent a $90 million restoration and the results are great. Loved the bathroom, with the rectangular sink and lighting around the mirror. I always check bedbugregistry.com and found an anonymous Sept 2010 report of bed bugs but found absolutely no evidence of bugs in my room (it's tough finding a hotel in downtown Chicago that doesn't have bedbug reports). I'm not big on breakfast, but the yogurt and fruit cup (that comes with complementary granola - ask for it if they don't provide it) available at the lobby Starbucks was delicious. My room was in the tower across the street from the main hotel (accessible by an indoor footbridge if the weather's bad) and had a great view to the east, down the Chicago River towards the Navy pier. We found a great room rate online (much cheaper than any other 4-star Chicago hotel) that included free internet, to boot. Easy walking distance from some great restaurants. What more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but extra charges can add up”
Reviews.Author: shethang
Reviews.Content: We stayed two non consecutive nights last week. I thought it was interesting that the first night, when the room was booked directly with a pre-paid rate through Hyatt.com, we got a room on 22nd floor with a fabulous view of the city and river. On the second evening, which was purchased via a Priceline bid, we got a room on the 12th floor facing other buildings. Proof that you get what you pay for! However, I actually liked the room without the riverview better since it was quieter. The room with a view connected to adjoining rooms and soundproofing through the doors was pretty weak. My spouse was awakened in the middle of the night by what sounded like drunken neighbors. Service is efficient, although you may wait in a line to check in/out if kiosks are not operating, which at times they weren't. The property has been updated nicely and rooms are modern. Are they sparkling clean? No, but they weren't giving me the creeps either. There were a few dirty smudges on the shower curtain in room #1 and a dirty handprint on the wall in room #2. The location was one of my favorite things. It's convenient to get to from the train (State and Lake stop is maybe .4 miles from the hotel). We used this to avoid $50 parking fee. Charge for wi-fi is expensive. If there was a reason we would not come back this is it!

Reviews.Title: “great locale in my kind of town”
Reviews.Author: CMCBaltimoreMd
Reviews.Content: HUGE hotel who got it right as far as service and ambiance. Stayed in west tower , quiet, great Lake Michigan view from 18th for fireworks, interesting storm clouds and Navy Pier. Corner Bakery nearby for reasonable priced breakfasts. Facebook 'secret word" gets u a free day of wi fi. Thanks for complimentary toffee for booking thru Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Got the VIP treatment, definitely returning!”
Reviews.Author: ameliaswaggert
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here Sept. 2010 and loved it, afterward entered the Hyatt's family photo contest and ended up winning a 2-night stay in a suite. I arrived before my family since I was already in Chicago for Lollapalooza and was greeted by the VIP Relations Manager who was great. I was early for check-in and she got the room ready for me within 30 minutes. They called me when the room was ready, brought my luggage up to the spacious, clean suite with a nice view of the city. When my family and I returned from dinner later that night, there was a lovely handwritten note from the hotel as well. We were also comped parking, breakfast at the amazing hotel restaurant and Wi-Fi. Our stay was short but sweet and we had a great little vacation. Both times we've stayed at the East Wacker Hyatt, it has been wonderful. All the staff are friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend staying at this beautiful hotel. P.S. Get the eggs benedict for breakfast--so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is near everything”
Reviews.Author: nollvis33
