Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a trip to Chicago. I reeived a rate on Hotels.com and did not know what I was geting. This is a perfect hotel and place as it is in the middle of everything. Th Chicgao river is next to you and Maganificent Mile is a block away. The staff was very friendly. I had to get my son from the base and even when they were busy the car was there in 15 minutes as promised. I would suggest if you could afford it get an extra room if you have kids. i got a roll away and we were cramped. The rooms were nice. I would reccommend again especially for people that want a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: wvguy22
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago is a huge hotel with more than 2,000 rooms. The numerous staff is very helpful and eager to offer assistance. I stayed on the 20th floor of the East Tower. My early check-in was easy, and without a long wait. The elevator wait time was never a big issue and expected at a large hotel. My guest room was clean, and as advertised. Also, it was very quiet allowing for 3 good nights of rest. The mattress felt worn but I've slept on worse. A modern decor is displayed throughout the hotel. The hotel is located within a short walk of world class shopping and dining. Internet access is an additional charge and I heard parking is $50 per day. I will stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy for first time Chicago visitors.”
Reviews.Author: orangeboots
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for tourist destinations in the city. We walked 5 blocks from the 'L' from O'hare, were upgraded gratis to a club level room for free breakfast and beverages. The room was tastefully updated, granite/marble bath, 40" flatscreen, and partial views of the river and skyline. We took the the Achitechtural Boat tour located across the street. The room was quiet even though the public spaces on the bottom floors were insane with conference attendees. We're usually pretty loyal to Starwood properties or enjoy Kimpton's, but after our first stay at a Hyatt we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: RsvlTraveler
Reviews.Content: There were five couples in our group. Everything was great! We had a wonderful view of the river. Great walking distance of shopping, eating, Navy Pier. Easy cab access as well. Room was super clean and bed very comfortable. We liked that the bed was situated so that we could sit in bed and see out the window - great view! We'll be back. Staff was very accommodating. Every time we walked through the lobby, a staff member, with an I-PAD in hand asked if they could help with "anything". They are amazingly attentive to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience-- definitely will recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: Early131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for a bachelorette party, and the Hyatt was a perfect experience for what we needed. The location is stellar-- cab rides were never more than $10 anywhere, and there was always cabs available and waiting. The marketing team (shoutout to Jennifer and Sarah) treated us great-- they even suprised the bride to be with a yummy chocolate cake and champagne one night during our stay! The rooms were very clean and spacious; modern decor and great views of the city. Will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay at Hyatt Regency Chicago Again”
Reviews.Author: uktravel_11
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at Hyatt Regency, Chicago. Experience was very positive from arrival to departure. Staff were friendly, My "like' of the hotel on facebook was acknowledged and allowed me to obtain the word of the week from facebook which gave me a day's free internet access. The hotel was in a great location with a Hop-on Hop-off bus stop only a block or two from it. Within walking distance to Sable restaurant which I had planned on eating at my first night there. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All the way around, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Footloose39
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for us while visiting Chicago, right near the lake and Navy Pier, the shopping district and Union Station. The room was typical Hyatt, nice and clean and the beds were very comfy. The front desk staff were efficient, pleasant and helpful. All the common areas in the hotel that we used were just right. The steakhouse in the hotel, Stetsons, was excellent for dinner. Save some money for that pricey dinner by bidding for your room on priceline, $77. a night. What a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: SherriB1050
Reviews.Content: Wonderful facility. I was here for a conference and the hotel was full, however it didn't feel that way. There was always staff around to assist in any needs. Love the bath products White Ginger! Room was spacious and comfortable. BIG Bar great place to people watch. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBearAuckland
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very busy and conferency type place, but awesome location and very very friendly. We had 3 kids in the room, but it didn't feel overcrowded. Was not cheap, but the view from our room was amazing. Nice welcome when root beer and popcorn were delivered to room - unexpected and kept kids happy. Room service was really good. Breakfast is unbelievable - my partner would go back just for that. Chicago is such a brilliant city - I think I could almost say I loved it even more than New York. There was a US$50 fee for car parking overnight which was pricey, but that was the only downer. Will definately stay again when I get back to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: joylama
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a good business hotel in Chicago. It is very centrally located, though the Wacker Drive location feels a little isolated, it is actually a short walk to Millenium Park, Naby Pier, and shopping / restaurants. The rooms are comfortable and modern, though a little dimly lit. There are a number of restaurants in the two building complex, and the staff was friendly and efficient. It's a five-ten minute ride to McCormick Place via regualrly available cabs. The hotel is okay for families too, but there are probably better choices like the Embassy Suites across the river (with an AMC theater attached to it) and others if you are traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: funseeker2011-11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for six days. Their service was efficient and courteous. The room was new and clean. It was spacious and had two double beds. The room looked just like the picture of a double bed room on the hotel's website. We enjoyed a comfortable stay. No complaints! The fan in the bathroom was running all night long and was noisy. I did not bring the problem to the attention of the hotel. The following nights, I simply closed the bathroom door so I won't hear the on going noise from the bathroom fan. The fan kept the bathroom dry. No moisture or fogged up mirror. The sleep quality rating I gave had to do with the fan noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: cach23
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is nicely furnished with a comfortable bed and a modern, clean bathroom. I would imagine some of the rooms would have a good view of the city but I did not have one! I did have a very quiet room though.The hotel offers a very good full breakfast buffet to get the day going. The hotel is in a great location for walking to shopping on Michigan Ave.and a great park. It is right across the street from the water taxi for sightseeing and visiting the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Three is Charmed”
Reviews.Author: Lafemmegiselle
Reviews.Content: This was our second of third time at the Hyatt, and it was fortunate that we were placed in the same tower as the registration this time. The secondary tower just feels desolate, which is not a good feeling at night in any large metropolitan city. Also, it was a great surprise that a room was waiting for us when we were ready to simply drop our bags at Noontime. We were there in anticipation of the McCartney concert, so the extra time to wind down (or up) in the room was appreciated. We were given a room with a view (a first). Although we could not see Lake Michigan, we had a unique view looking north toward Millenium Park through a courtyard. Since we are "locals" this was a nice change of pace. We would have missed the view at street level. Also, by joining the Hyatt rewards program, we were allowed a late check out from the room: 2:00pm! That is practically unheard of but gave us much more flexibility. If there is a pool it remains invisible to me.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: turkey49
Reviews.Content: The hyatt is in perfect location one block off michigan, A short walk to lake and also to blue line. You can catch 151 bus at union station to hotel plus same bus all up and down michigan. The check in was great and fast. Check out used the kiousk without a problem. Beds are the most comfortable I have slept inn. Everyone was very helpful with ideas and directions. Make sure to do first lady cruise on the river, and also the segway tours.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay if you need WiFi ($18 a day!)”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler025
Reviews.Content: While I really liked my room and amenities, I was put off at the daily charge for WiFi. I canâ€™t remember the last time I stayed in a hotel that charged! The mega huge hotel is nice but the location is just a little â€œoff the beaten pathâ€� compared to others in the area. The "Irish Pub" without any Irish food was rather funny to me as well (ceasar salad, burgers, mac & cheese, buffalo wings). Itâ€™s also more expensive for a hotel worthy of maybe 3.5 stars (not the 4 stars itâ€™s given). If you stay, there is a market around the corner with a lovely salad bar, deli, fruits and cheeses that is resonably priced. They also have outdoor seating which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: labell9
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with wonderful business traveler amenities. Close to Michigan Ave shopping, the Navy Pier and in the heart of the business district. Wonderfully designed rooms with unique layouts having a boutique type feel. A great variety of restaurants available on site and within walking distance. We arrived late - the staff was very helpful directing us to eateries nearby that were open late. Parking is a bit steep at $50 per night with valet the only option - however this is in the heart of a major city so is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mohamed e
Reviews.Content: you are in the heart of the loop, you are near everything, there was a very nice view from the room, the breakfast is good, they were so friendly, the internet was expensive 13$ / day and there was no free wifi even in the reception

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: VSI666
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago from August 4 - 9 for Lollaplooza, a cubs Baseball game and some shopping and eating. The Hotel was wonderful from the check in by a terrific worker named Jason who gave us our keys, maps and directions to our room, let us know that our internet would be free and if there was anything needed to call immediately and ask for him. After checking into the beautiful room on the 29th floor with a great view of the Riverwalk and Chicago skyline I had a problem opening my luggage, as the airport had locked it with a TSA key. I called the front desk and a maintenance man was up within 10 minutes and the bag was opened immediately.Most impressed. We then left the room for a meal in a Chicago pizza place, upon returning a couple or hours later there was a handwritten note (from Jennifer K) and some delicious chocolate fudge asking us if our room was fine and if we needed anything, i was most impressed, there was also a message on the phone from Cassandra in Guest Relations to ask us if we were satisfied with the service we had received thus far. excellent!!!! The room was cleaned and serviced promptly everyday, it was well air conditioned as Chicago is very hot and humid in August, and everyone at the hotel was super friendly. Upon check out we were booked on a shuttle and our luggage was promptly stored while we had a late flight out of Chicago, I CANNOT WAIT to stay their again next year for Lollaplooza 2012. Best hotel ever :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: argos14
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a convention I was in town for. While it's large and somewhat intimidating, lots of people to help you out. Fitness area is excellent and room was just fine. Lots of bars and reataurants. Location is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Lollapolooza 2011”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected because of its location (close to Grant Park) and its price ($199/nt). We couldn't have have been happier with our selection. The rooms were great - comfortable beds, nice amenities, hot showers (after the rain soaked days at Lollapolooza!). Although the lines at breakfast could get a little long in the mornings, I think that was because a number of room packages came with a free buffet. The food was good, but we elected to wait for doughnuts from the Doughnut Vault one morning, and coffee at the stand was enough the next. We also loved the Big Bar, and met friends there after the show 2 nights in a row. The food at the Big Bar was perfect after a day at the big show! Staff was great - from our check in clerks, to our housekeeper (who greated us with a smile every morning - - or was that afternoon?!) Would recommend this hotel for its location - easy to walk to the "el", the parks, the shops on Michigan etc. . .

Reviews.Title: “Great price, okay room”
Reviews.Author: Enjoylife46
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hyatt on Priceline and got a fantastic rate. The room was a typical Hyatt with typical amenities. It pulls a lot of conference traffic, and it felt crowded all the time in the lobbies and front. Great location to the river, expensive parking and not much around to help with that. One good tip is to use the complimentary van to get around; it will take you to McCormick, Water Tower, or Macy's if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago weekend destination”
Reviews.Author: Kandsm
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay!! Great customer service!! Several bars and restaurants located on the premises. The decor is a little dated. WIFI is an extra charge, but with the price of staying here, it should be included. The location is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!! would like to go back to see more sites”
Reviews.Author: HappywithChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency from Aug 3-6. What a fabulous experience! The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive! The hotel was everything it was advertised to be. The rooms were clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast at the restaurant was excellent ... quality, selection and service.The location was excellent. If you wanted to, you could walk to most of the sites. Would definately recommend this hotel and stay there again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice!”
Reviews.Author: ajnrobin
Reviews.Content: I make this overnight trip to Chicago yearly with some girlfriends, so each time we search the web to find a $$ Deal at a downtown hotel. This is how we came to the Hyatt Regency. We got it for a great price in July- and the hotel was fabulous! It is a huge hotel that hosts a ton of events, i.e., weddings, banquets, conferences, etc...so that being said, it was very busy. The hotel was beautiful, the atmosphere was amazing and the rooms and bathrooms were awesome and clean! The doormen were very nice and very attentive, hailing us cabs as needed. We spoke to the concierge several times over the phone, not only did he suggest restaurants, but also took the liberty of making our reservations for us! Super nice hotel, and we would certainly go back!!! Perfect location as well. Very close to Millenium Station.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made the hotel perfect”
Reviews.Author: judith9614
Reviews.Content: There was not one staff member who was unpleasant or put out by any request by our group.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: iswick
Reviews.Content: All the staff was great from checkin to checkout. Jennifer and Sarita went the extra mile to make our stay a memorable and great experience. The room was clean, modern and had one of the best views I have ever had in all of our stays to Chicago. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: JDoRDH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights for a conference and an extra day to do some sightseeing. Great location, felt safe walking the streets as I was by myself. Plenty of shopping, restaurants, drug stores all within short walking distances. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Awesome customer service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lkfreema
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at my recent trip to the Hyatt Regency Chicago. I was there on a really busy weekend (Lollapalooza) and was really impressed by their staff and customer service. The check-in and check-out lines weren't long at all and the front desk staff were extremely helpful. They met all the needs of our reservation and our room was great. We got in late when we arrived and had a late meal and drink at BIG bar and it was a really fun scene. Good food too and nice and convenient. The hotel is in a really good location - right by the river and close to all of the major attractions downtown. Our room was great - really comfortable beds and crisp sheets which were great to sleep in. All in all I would highly recommend the hotel and would go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Maximized our Chicago experience!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherD62
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago was a standout amongst recent hotel stays. This facility, conveniently located just east of Michigan Avenue on Whacker, appears to do a high volume of conference business, but the staff is obviously well-trained and highly efficient. The level of customer service, from check-in to the bell stand to housekeeping, more than met the needs of a steady stream of visitors. Conference visitors congregating in the lobby area seemed focused on accomplishing business rather than worried about ancillary details. I didn't spot one disgruntled customer during our three days in the hotel. I had no problem getting an early check-in, and in fact, was switched into an exceptionally nice room to accommodate my request. Our view on the 27th floor included the river and Navy Pier. The large bathroom was very clean (and I'm picky about that) and included high quality toiletries. This is a full service facility with a well equipped gym (and many other services including on-site tailoring) and multiple restaurants. We found members of the staff to be pleasant and eager to help throughout our stay, whether they were behind a desk or riding an elevator with us. We were asked often if we needed anything and if we were enjoying our stay. Refreshing! I'd like to highlight the bell stand tasked with the hefty job of storing what looked to be truckloads of luggage. Their system seemed to work well, and we really appreciated being able to safely store our baggage -which left us free to explore the city both before our check-in and after our check-out. My stay was purchased with a Groupon and was a terrific deal. I would stay at this hotel even without that extra savings, however. I would (and do) recommend this hotel without hesitation, and it will be my first choice next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location and awesome views.”
Reviews.Author: stephvaca
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Nice CLEAN and updated hotel. I am very particular about my hotel room and this one was great! I have stayed in many 4 star hotels that have had mold/mildew in the shower, yuk, not acceptable! This room was very clean with nice showers. Beds were very comfortable. We had an awesome view of the city and the Hancock building. It was located in a nice central location. We walked almost everywhere. Nice, huge workout facility! They had about 10-15 cardio machines and a full variety of weight machines, including free weights. We ate at the Big Bar, just had appetizers, they were alright, nothing special. Only downfall, there was no pool! Had a great stay and would definately stay again if it was just adults, my kids would want a pool!

Reviews.Title: “Made for a GREAT Bachelor Party!”
Reviews.Author: chiefchuck102
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel experience! We checked in late Friday night and at the front desk I told them the facebook word of the week for discounted parking and 24 hours of free wi-fi! The lady at the front desk was so welcoming and funny. We got to our room and wanted to have a drink, but the nice glasses they provided by the ice bucket weren't clean. There was sticky stuff, like old OJ or something. I called the front desk and they immediately brought up 4 new glasses and 4 new disposable coffee cups. We weren't in the room 10 minutes before we got a knock on the door. A gentleman from the hotel was standing there holding a tray with an iced bucket full of bud light and a hand written note from one of the managers welcoming us to the hotel and wish us a safe and fun bachelor party! We were AMAZED! We walked from the hotel over to the nearby Giordano's and got the night started. Then we had some drinks in the hotel's Big Bar. For a couple guys from the cheaper midwest, the drinks were expensive... about $50 for a round of 4 cocktails. In the morning we took advantage of the hotels great location and went for a jog along the river & lakefront. Then we walked to the CTA Red line for a trip to wrigley. Not a bad walk at all. Upon checkout, parking charges caugtht me a little off guard. I expected $35/night because of the facebook discount, but I was informed that $35 was for one night and $50 for the second night. Well, if I had known that, I would've decided to park in a nearby garage instead of valet. Overall, the exceptional personal service earns this hotel an excellent rating. We all had a great time here and would not hesitate to book here on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “loved the team members”
Reviews.Author: midwestlover
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker that we had contact with were great. From the morning and late evening front desk members, maid service, waiters, concierge...all team members were awesome. The rooms were comfortable and clean and some had a view. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms; River views”
Reviews.Author: JLorraine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. Overall the hotel was quite comfortable. The rooms were quiet and beds were comfortable. Fine for a good night or two of sleep. Be prepared for SLOW elevators packed with people each morning. The location is fantastic - just a few blocks for Michigan Ave shopping and the riverfront. My maid could have done a better job cleaning the room but overall it was nice. As for the conference center, the space is not great. The conference rooms are spread out so it's challenging for colleagues to network, the food is just ok, and two tower configuration is a logistical pain. The organizers of the conference said the hotel staff was fantastic, but as a participant I think the conference center was a 5 out of 10 scale.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: BIGN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business, rooms were clean. Charge for Internet and use of refrigerator, even if just for personal items. Ended up with room right next to elevators that ran all night, did not sleep well at all. Second night woke up sweating, co-workers said same happened to them. Don't eat at hotel, very pricey and you can walk to restaurants nearby. Also places to eat in lower level of west tower. Walking distance to most attractions. Would stay again but would not eat there or take a room right against the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: donniemcneil77
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for the weekend to see Paul McCartney at Wrigley Field. From the moment we pulled up, the service and hospitality at this hotel were amazing. The valets were very polite, the concierge was very well informed , giving us directions to various train stations, restaurants, and shops. Check in and check out were both a breeze thanks to the great service the staff provides. When I'm back in Chicago, I will definitely be staying at the Hyatt again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: RuthG4
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was the perfect place for my family of four (including 2 teenage boys) to stay. The room was very spacious and so comfortable!!! We will definitely stay there again. The whole staff was very helpful and kind. The concierge was extremely helpful. The hotel is the perfect location; close to so many things. I would highly recommend the Hyatt anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Decent Stay....But I Prefer the Swissotel Next Door (Sorry Hyatt!)”
Reviews.Author: j_nNYCArea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency during July. To be perfectly honest, I thought the Hyatt, while very nice, was just ok for me and I probably would not stay there again unless I snagged a fantastic rate. Itâ€™s a very large hotel (with 2 separated wings) more suited for conventions/business than for leisure travelers although that should not deter you from booking if youâ€™re staying for vacation, as the hotel is in a great location to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, theater district, etc. The hotel graciously put us on the very top floor, I suspect they did so since it was our anniversary during our stay and they upgraded us. However, the room did not have much of a view, so unless you are going to be guaranteed a great view, I wouldnâ€™t bother paying extra money for the higher floor. This can be an issue if the hotel is crowded with a convention, as the wait for the elevators can be a real drag. Also, the room is decorated with lots of rich browns and chrome which was nice by design but way too dark for my tastes. By comparison, we stayed at the SwissÃ´tel next door on a previous trip, and our room was far brighter and felt much more expansive (and we had a much better view). Another plus for the SwissÃ´tel is that they offered dispensers of ice cold water or lemonade in the lobby (I think coffee in the morning too) which was a small but very nice and hospitable touch. There is a Corner Bakery cafÃ© within a few minutes walking distance and a small grocery store literally footsteps away (if you are taking side entrance). As I was traveling w/my family, it was far less expensive to eat out for breakfast rather than at the hotel. The hotel concierge recommended Emerald Loop which was less than a 10 min walk as well and we enjoyed that as well. The hotel offers a coupon there for a free appetizer which conveniently served as a kids meal for my son. Overall the hotel is very nice, in a great location, and the service courteous...but I just like SwissÃ´tel better (and no, I'm not Swiss!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Acrosstheshiningsea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance to everything we wanted to do: Miracle Mile, (located alongside the Chicago River), Lake Michigan, Hancock Tower, Sears Tower, Pier, Millenium Park. I wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: DeviousTA
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. We stayed here 4 nights in August and it made our trip! We received an upgraded room, free wifi for the duration of our stay and a nice treat from the social media manager in our room (yum!) You should LIKE them on facebook and see how well you are treated. The hotel has clearly just recently been upgraded with beautiful rooms, glass showers, LCD TV etc. Location was absolutely perfect distance from lots of things and just a short bus ride from all of the attractions in the city. We needed a fridge in the room and it was a $25/stay charge which I thought was pretty reasonable. With 2 small children this was a must. My only disappointment and its pretty common to find the same in other Chicago hotels is the lack of pool. Fortunate we went in summer and we were able to go to one of Chicago's great beaches. Loved the trip, Thanks Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Badgerm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our two young boys. I was blown away by the great staff. They are obviously trained to go the extra mile. The hotel is well staffed - there was ALWAYS someone available to answer a question or respond to a request. I can't say enough of how impressed I was with this hotel's staff. Despite the cost of parking, I found the valet service worthwhile. We had a discount for knowing the Word of the Week (check the hotel out on facebook), which saved us $15 per day on parking and one free day of internent. We were allowed to "pre-load" our luggage in our vehicle the day of checkout and come back to pick up the car by 6:00 p.m. that day so that we could continue to enjoy seeing the sights without worrying about finding new parking all day which is costly and time consuming in the city. Plus, the public transportation is so convenient to the hotel. We only ate breakfast at the hotel on one day, but it was delicious. The newly renovated rooms were nice and super clean. The new beds were soft, although my husband found them too soft for his back. Only wish that the room came with a fridge, but I guess you can request that a fridge be brought to the room. We didn't have the greatest view (East Tower, facing away from river), but our boys didn't know the difference and enjoyed the city view. A downside for families, is no pool. It is a huge hotel and very busy (fitting for Chicago), but the hotel staff make you feel like a VIP. We were treated far better here than at smaller hotels. Would definitely stay here again and highy recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyGonnerman
Reviews.Content: Thank you for making our stay great. The staff went out of their way to make sure we felt welcome and valued. This hotel is within walking distance to so many great Chicago destinations. We would definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: martygSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Went there in March for business. Standard higher end business hotel. Pros: Comfortable room. Efficient service. Recent renovations (but you pay a preminum.) Giood location in downtown, but the river. Cons; I do not know why the higher end hotels charge a fortune for internet ($10-13 / day) when mid level and cheap hotels can offer excellent internet service for free. Standard business hotel, at business prices. Absolutely massive. Some areas are dated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, huge room and an amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: NRM_11
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline not knowing which hotel we would end up with and couldn't have been more pleased to have secured a stay at the Hyatt for my first trip to Chicago. Getting to the hotel lobby/check in desk from the adjacent parking garage was a little confusing as we had followed the signs to the "Hyatt" but arrived at the convention center side of the Hyatt...not realising this wasn't where we were meant to be! However we managed to find a member of staff who was going towards the front lobby who showed us the way, which was great. At check in we were assisted by a member of staff called Avi. He gave us a truly fantastic room on the 24th floor with the most amazing view I've ever seen from a city hotel. We could see the river, the Hancock Tower, the Tribune Tower and the Wriggly Building to mention but a few things, without leaving our room! It was a complete "pinch me" feeling waking up in our room each day and returning to it each evening because the view was amazing. The room was huge! It may have been a suite...not that we'd booked one. The trade off was that we were on a Murphy bed but that was just as comfortable as a "normal" bed so wasn't an issue for us at all. Avi, if you ever read this, thank you so much! :-) Now for the negatives such as they are. There was a dental conference at the hotel whilst we were there and on our first night there we encountered so many drunk people walking around...spilling drinks that we began to wonder if we'd made a huge mistake by booking here. The elevators took a tad longer than normal due to the high volume of use but nothing to cause us too much of an inconvenience really. The negative which bothered me the most was that room service never came on our first full day there (we'd checked in the previous night) and I'm not sure they'd have come the following day either, if we hadn't sought them out on our way to the elevators and requested that they stopped by our room to change the sheets and towels. We got back to our hotel at the end of the day and noted that they had been but I was upset that out of the 3 bath towels they'd left for us, one had a huge hole in it and the other had a nasty looking stain on it. As it was our last night, I didn't want to complain or get the room service staff in trouble but it did upset me a little. Other than the above negatives, it was an absolutely amazing stay and I'd definitely stay there again. The view and size of our room was something I guess you'd have to see, to believe! :-) The location was amazing and I felt perfectly safe returning to our hotel on foot late into the evening too. Two huge thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, but dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sdmiller95
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying how much we did appreciate the 2 free nights we were able to use for trying out the Hyatt Visa card! Proâ€™s: - Locationâ€¦Location is over the top amazing! Quick walking access to both Millennium Park (and things south of the River) and the Magnificent Mile (and things north of the River). The view from our 24th floor room was beautiful as we could see the other buildings, the river, Navy Pier, and the lake. Absolutely beautiful at night. - Check-inâ€¦Check-in was quick and easy, even though there was apparently a problem with our reservation. Conâ€™s: - Getting Aroundâ€¦At the risk of making myself sound like an idiot, we had a hard time understanding the â€˜flowâ€™ of the hotel, even with the map provided after asking. Trying to get to the 111 Wacker Dr. self park parking garage from inside the Hyatt was downright comical (I guess you just had to be thereâ€¦felt a bit like the Grisswoldâ€™s from the Vacation movies). This all could have been taken care of if we would have just paid for the Hyatt to park us, but we were wanting to save money. - Cleanlinessâ€¦as soon as I walked into the room, there was a plastic cable tie laying on the floor. Odd thing to find on a hotel floor, especially given that it was so noticeable (I would have thought a cleaner would have noticed for sure). The carpet was nice, just littered with fuzz and noticeable items (a quick hit with the vacuum would have cleared it all up). There was food, yes, food, slapped onto the wall between the TV and the full length mirror (at least 5 spots). We did call about this item, asking if it could be cleaned while we went out to dinner. By the time we returned, it was spotlessâ€¦but how did the staff miss food slapped on the wall? The bathroom was spotless, and the beds were fine. We needed a few more towels, so we called down and asked for a few more, including a foot towel for the shower. We were told that they donâ€™t have foot towels. Odd, but okâ€¦we could deal with that. The next day though (Saturday), a foot towel appeared after the room was cleaned. There was another one of those plastic cable tieâ€™s on the cabinet below the TV, locking the two cabinet doors together. I found this strange, so I pulled the door open far enough to see what was in thereâ€¦snacks? A Refrigerator? At least that is what it looked like. Was there a reason this was cabled off? If so, that was oddâ€¦why wouldnâ€™t they want us to purchase these items? If there wasnâ€™t a reason, is it not odd that when the room was cleaned Friday or Saturday, the cleaning staff didnâ€™t notice it and cut it off or whatever? Iâ€™m not sure we would have purchased from it anyhow, but made for an oddity in the room. In conclusion, I cannot get past the cleanliness thing. We have stayed at other Hyattâ€™s and have not had like issues with cleanliness. I can put up with a lot, but I canâ€™t put up with a dirty room. This would be a deal breaker as we look to lodging in the future in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and nice hotel...but the elevator can be annoying”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and another couple, stayed at the Hyatt Regency from 7/28 - 7/31 for a quick getaway to see the Red Sox vs White Sox game. We used Priceline and got the Hyatt for just over $90. For this price we thought this hotel was excellent. As most of the prior reviews have said this is a large hotel that has a lot of conventions so it can be quite busy in the lobby areas at times. We only had experience at the front desk but it looked like there were always hotel people around to help. The first day or two there was a dental convention there which did cause a small issue for us (which I will mention later) but for the most part was not a problem. Front Desk - we arrived around noon or so on Thur and there were several people working. We were able to walk right up and checked-in. The young women working the desk was very personable. I always forget to request a King bed, and hotels rarely seem to ask a preference, but she did ask to my surprise. We told her we would prefer a King and she said he had a King near the elevator or she had 2 queens. We thought a second and said we'll take the King and after looking in her computer again she said she had another King room open up away from the elevator that we gladly took. You could also check-in using airport-like kiosks too but I wasn't sure what the bed request situation would have been so we opted for a live person. Room: Our room was on the 33rd floor which was the "Board of Directors" floor. I am not sure what the difference was from the other floors since our friends had one of the top floors too, but in the West tower, and from their description of their room it seemed to be identical. The room was modern, very nicely decorated, a decent size, and spotless. You could tell they were recently updated and I could find no show of wear anywhere. The King bed was located in the middle of the room which was different but worked. The head of the bed was toward the window and the foot of the bed was toward the TV. Just on the other side of the head of the bed was a large desk and floor to ceiling window. The view was nothing special, it just looked out on another apartment/condo. The TV was a flatscreen but the TV reception was lousy, however, I have found this to be a problem at a couple hotels I have stayed at lately. Hopefully one day hotels will upgrade to HD service instead of sticking with whatever they had before they got flatsceens. The air conditioning worked very well and was extremely quiet except for a short hiss every so often. It sounded liked it was venting or something but other than that you would barely know when it was on. The bathroom was equally as nice, modern, and spotless. A couple of other nice touches were individual reading lights attached to the headboard, iPod dock alarm clock, and the provided travel size toothpaste. Elevator: This was our biggest "issue" with this hotel. There were 6 elevators and depending on the day and, if there is a convention, the elevator could take forever or filled up quickly. We were coming down at one point and it stopped about 10 times and was filled by about the third stop. We also waited for it on the second floor (front desk level) and the elevator went from floor 1 to 9 without stopping at 2. We saw this happen a couple times at that particular time. While this wasn't a huge issue it was annoying at times. When the convention people left on Friday we only had it happened once, maybe twice, and our friends in the other building said they never had an issue. Location: The location was very good but we did find ourself doing a lot of walking (which wasn't really a bad thing with all the good food Chicago as to offer but it was also really hot) We spent most of our time on the other side of the river on Michigan Ave and each day we found ourselves up near E. Ontario, Grand, or State St for one thing or another. These streets were about 5-6 blocks just to get to them and then most things we went to were several streets down. Millennium Park and the theater district were a little closer in the opposite direction. So this hotel is a really good central location but if I could choose the ideal spot for this trip, based on what we did, it would have been a few more blocks up Michigan Ave. BIG bar and Snack Shop: The only other things we visited in the hotel were the BIG bar and the small coffee/snack shop. I really liked the BIG bar for a hotel bar. They serve some good cocktails and you can get them in BIG sizes. It is also very cool in that it has 2-3 story windows that look out on Chicago. We only had 1 drink there, and it was pricey, but it was one of the cooler hotel bars I have been in. The snack bar was handy, and 24hrs, but again it was pricey...which I always expect in a hotel. They also sold Starbucks there as well which would be handy for those people on business or in a hurry. We did not have a car but I would avoid having a car if possible since parking was $50. I didn't have a need for the WIFI although WIFI would have been nice to have it if were free. Check-out: The TV check-out didn't work so I used the kiosk in the lobby. Within a couple minutes we were checked out and it was just as easy as the TV So overall we liked the hotel and I would recommend it for the great room, good location, and if you can get a great price like we did. I would definitely stay here again if I got the same rate or a little higher but if I got their site rate I probably could have found something similar a couple blocks up Michigan Ave that would have suited our itinerary better.

Reviews.Title: “For $50 to park I would expect them not to lose my keys”
Reviews.Author: zack876
Reviews.Content: The only option to park at the hyatt, is $50 for valet parking. I needed to get my sons blamket from the car at bedtime, ( 6 hours after checkin) and they could not find my keys.They had not been filed yet. I waited and watched them search, for 40 minutes with someone in managment assisting and all getting very nervous. Finally, after they were located there was no apology, sympathy etc. I can't believe, for tht much money I had to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience in a Beautiful City!”
Reviews.Author: SarahSlush
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay in the Hyatt!! This was our first trip to Chicago as a couple and we were celebrating our two year wedding anniversary. We arrived at the hotel after a long drive from Kentucky and we were exhausted. We were greeted at the desk by very friendly and prompt hotel employees who checked us in and informed us we had been upgraded to a suite! We were not disappointed- the room was on the 34th floor and faced the river, so the view was awesome! We booked through Hotwire and had no issues at all. The room was lovely and the bed was WONDERFUL! I slept more soundly the two nights we stayed than I do in my bed at home. The TV was nice, the bathroom was nice, and the room was quiet as well. All our interactions with the staff were very helpful and friendly, from the concierge staff to the bell-man, to the valet workers. The hotel was in a fantastic location! We ended up walking everywhere, except the Shedd Aquarium and Navy Pier. We were a short walk from Giordano's pizza (DELICIOUS Chicago deep-dish), several bakeries/coffee shops, and right next to Michigan Avenue shopping! Sunday brunch at Houlihan's was the best meal we had all week--it's literally a 2-minute walk from the Hyatt and the selection and taste was excellent! The hotel also has lots of different food and dining options available. We loved taking the water taxi, very close to the hotel on the river, and the river walk was just delightful. We were smart to take advantage of the hotel's facebook page, which offered multiple discounts on parking, dining, and other activities. They really do keep up with their fans on facebook and are prompt in answering questions their guests may have, as well as offering suggestions of places to see and eat. The thing that impressed me was that when we came back from dinner the first night, we had a tray of delicious gourmet toffee waiting for us with a hand-written note thanking us for choosing the Hyatt and being a part of their networking on facebook. In a hotel as massive and busy as the Hyatt was this weekend, they were so personal in their service. We would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the location, I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Terri Eggeman
Reviews.Content: I have been stayed in Chicago several different times but this was the first time I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency. I typically stay at smaller , boutique hotels. I must say I did enjoy the location of the Hyatt. I was able to walk across the street and down Michigan Ave which was very nice. It was a short walk to catch a water taxi or take a river tour. It was an easy walk to Navy Pier and most of the main attractions inside the Loop. We had a wonderful view of the fireworks at Navy Pier by walking across the street. Check in was effecient with many clerks at the reception desk. It was a little crowded and noisy but there were several conventions checking in. The lobby was very nice, with water features, casual seating, multi levels and resturants and shops. Staff was helpful, often asking if I needed directions getting around or if they could assist in any other ways. Our room was two queen bed room was comfortable and clean. Adequate seating in the room with a nice desk, flat screen TV, refrigerator, in room safe. Bedding was comfortable. The bathroom was clean, spacious and the shower had good water pressure. We had 1 drink at the hotel bar which was just mediocre. The atmosphere was fun though with a very long , open bar with a view of downtown. We ate brunch on Sunday morning which was a bit pricey but excellent in the varities of well prepared dishes. I enjoyed everything I tried and the service was impeccable. I would stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Always Delivers”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith65
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s been my experience that you canâ€™t go wrong with Hyatt. Even at this enormous hotel I still experienced high service levels, clean rooms and great amenities. Ask for a renovated room and/or a river view. The river view rooms are amazing, especially on the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NYCityTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel with a somewhat anonymous feel as is the case with many hotels geared toward business travelers. I liked the contemporary room dÃ©cor and the nicely renovated bathroom. My room was on a high floor with a partial view and was very quiet and clean. The friendly front desk clerk offered a late checkout which unfortunately I could not enjoy due to work commitments. The hotel provides computers in the registration area to print airline boarding passes. I would recommend this hotel for other business travelers, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great expereince!”
Reviews.Author: Kendra73
Reviews.Content: We have had an excellent time in Chicago. The staff at the hotel has been very helpful and has accomadated us nicely. We are traveling with our four year old son and the staff has welcomed him as they would any adult guest. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdventurist
Reviews.Content: I decided to book the Hyatt because they had offered a AAA promotion of $129 per night including buffet breakfast, and what a bargain that was! The front desk was the most friendly and welcoming people I've ever encountered in all my travels. Not only was everyone courteous, they actually had a genuine smile and really seemed to care about each and every guest even though the line was long. They were very efficient without rushing anyone. I just can't say enough good things about the front desk! When we checked in, we were put in the West tower, which had been renovated 9 months before (the East tower was renovated only 4 months before) with a view of the building right next door. When I went back to the front desk to request a lake view, the front desk was very gracious about it because my 5 year old son had been in my parents' room that overlooked the river and lake and loved sitting by the window and watching the boats go by. The room itself was very nice and comfortable, and I especially liked how new it was. The buffet breakfast included gratuity and tax and had an excellent selection of fresh fruits, pastries, hot items and made to order omlettes. Our waitress was so kind and thoughtful even when my son was having a meltdown. Now, the downside to this hotel is the parking. They only offer valet parking for $50 per night which allowed unlimited in and out for each 24 hour period. That's quite steep, but I think pretty much all hotels in downtown Chicago charge a similar rate. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who's visiting Chicago. They offer an excellent value for your money...and it's recently renovated!

Reviews.Title: “Very high service levels”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge convention hotel with a perfect central Chicago location. As a platinum member, there was a separate desk and the reservations host couldn't do more for me. I was upgraded to a junior suite with Club services. The suite had a lovely view and was beautiful. However, I wanted a tub and there are no junior suites with a tub. So, I was quickly moved to a Club room, which was average in size and nicely decorated. I was accommodated with even a better view. This hotel provides 5 star service, far above the other 5 hotels I have stayed in over the past two months. The service was even better than the Palomar in Philadelphia and it was nice to have the Club floor offered to me. I find this hotel superior to the Intercontinental which is a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: iowaloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a travel website for this hotel. This place is huge. It is right on the river. Just be aware that there are more than one hyatt hotels in Chicago. We stayed there and went to a cubs game. The train station was about 6 blocks away. The concierge was most helpful giving us a map and telling us how to catch the train. The room was clean and had enough space. The usual amenities it did have fitness tv on the tv which you could download a workout for free which was nice. I did a work out routine right in my room.

Reviews.Title: “High class!”
Reviews.Author: Lahijamia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed the Chicago Hyatt very much. It was bustling with activity and was right in the heart of many fun activities in the Windy City. It is close to the river (The Chicago River boat tour is excellent!), and my favorite pizza place, Giordano's, is right down the street. The staff was extremely helpful and the room was clean, neat, and modern. There is an excellent gift shop, several restaurants, and a lovely breakfast area with a wide variety of great coffees and food. Our only complaint is that we were very disappointed in the Big Bar which was advertised as a spectacular place. We sat down in the bar, and after 15 minutes no one took our drink order. We tried to call some one over, but both the waitresses that we could see were busy laughing and talking with other customers (friends?) instead of doing their job. We left and went to the Irish Pub which was much friendlier and served wonderful beer and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great sleep.”
Reviews.Author: dtcswim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency and loved it. They have updated and upgraded the rooms to include new sheets and mattresses, new bathroom tile and fixtures, etc. Very comfortable. Check in was quick and friendly. I was not with the convention that was there, but I flew right through check in (helps to be a Gold Passport member, no waiting)I ordered room service (and the lady on the phone was so nice, like talking to my mom). This is what I expect from Hyatt and they delivered. Everything was just right. If you are not a Gold Passport member, I would recommend it. They offer deals that regular guests do not receive and it is free to sign up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: marleney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. We enjoyed our room with a view of the river and Lake Michigan. We could even see part of the Saturday night fireworks at Navy Pier from our room in the West Tower. The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning worked well in cooling off the room. It was very hot during our stay. We had a Groupon deal for $99 a night, making this very affordable for a 2 night stay for 3 people. The shower was nice, plenty of hot water. Only problems, and they were minor, were that no one made up our beds or changed our towels. We had to ask for that as well as washcloths and toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Huge HUGE hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTKaren
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel, very close to the Magnificent Mile. I had gotten it for a pretty good price, and at that price, would definitely stay again. Mostly what it had going for it is the location. Easy to walk to many, many attractions. We took a river boat cruise with the architectural society, and we caught the boat right outside the door of the hotel. Very convenient. The room was clean, the beds were comfy. They stored our luggage for the day since we didn't have to leave for the airport until about 5:00 pm. Only thing is, for ambience or personality, there wasn't much. It's just too big and bustling. Being in the lobby is a little like being in an airport because there are so many people coming and going. Still, every request I made was cheerfully granted, so I have no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room w/ a view, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cbudny
Reviews.Content: Had a single Sunday night at the Hyatt before starting my business work & stay elsewhere in Chicago. Good downtown location for hitting the main parks, taking in the River Walk, or heading up Miracle Mile. Perhaps quieter than something closer to Millenium Park or the L lines. My room had a straight-on view of the Chicago River & the John Hancock building in the distance. It was a very stylish, contemporary room; comfy bed, interesting Chicago-based art on the walls. I appreciated the alarm clock with iPod/iPhone dock for charging as I'd left my USB cable at home. I was disappointed the desk chair didn't have a gas-lift feature---I'm tall, and the chair's set height is too low. Very comfy bed. Checkin was quite crowded and busy Sunday morning, with bag-check (ie, to hold your bags before your room is available) filled to overflowing---they had taken over a small area cordoned off around the corner, to hold everyone's luggage---there must have been 500 bags there. But it worked out fine in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: indyoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, clean and in a great location. One thing worth noting is that it is huge, which is no big deal if you don't mind it. It just kind of feels like you're in a mall or an airport. It was very busy with lots of people all over the place. Nice bar in the main lobby. Close to shopping and restaurants, all in walking distance. The bathroom in our room could stand to be updated, but all in all we were very comfortable and the price was really good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff,excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sbcbonds
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this place...I have stayed there several times over the last few years and it never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: traveler22494
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in december after planning to see a show in the city, the hotel offers valet parking with in/out privilages $50/day, however look to ALL other websites besides the Hyatt for deals, we found one on hotels.com that included parking and a city view room with 2 queen beds for $90/night. Overall pleased with the location and service, lacking a pool which was one of the highlights of staying at a hotel for this group however the spectacular views made up for it, quite a costly breakfast/dinner in the hotel, I suggest hitting up a local establishment: Billy Goat Tavern; .25 miles away, Corner Bakery or Houlihan's .1 miles away. Otherwise this hotel proved to be a great choice for all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: synchromom1226
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday and the hotel is very nice. Valet was more then helpful so nice and polite. Our room was very clean. There was a storm overnight and the carpet by the window was soaked but not sure if it was the rain or air conditioner. Beds were very comfortable. Pillows were not. Needed one more towel to make 4 large towels. Rm3364 We had breakfast in the morning. Although expensive very delightful we had a large group of 16 and they got us in right away that was really nice as we had 9 hungry kids. Overall really nice and clean for such a busy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, will be back”
Reviews.Author: pooesq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend Yankee games and it was a great value, the staff was superb and rooms were comfortable. And the topper was they through in free breakfast for us -- which was sumptuous. Great location and an excellent hotel bar. Would definitely stay here again if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gb6000
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and they checked us in. Awesome location, close to water taxi, Michigan Ave. extremely friendly staff, professional service, clean rooms, $50 valet parking per night is average price in Chicago, only downfall is I ran out of time and didn't visit Stetson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not really "Family Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: kleigh88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my daughter's birthday. We took train in from suburbs...great rate on Metra by the way, weekend summer pass. The room was very nice, very clean, I think it was recently remodeled. Too many extra fees, though. Extra for a fridge, when many hotels just have fridges in room these days. No pool, which was what the kids were really looking for! Check-in was fast, we got in a little early, probably 1:00. Our room was not ready, they took my cell phone and said they would call. We stopped at concierge, asked if there were any family-type restaurants right nearby, something kids would like. She told us about a sushi place and fancy Italian restaurant. Not really kid stuff... Asked her if she had any coupons or deals on anything, maybe anything at Navy Pier, she said no. Other hotels I've been, the concierge, or even the desk, has given us dinner deals or coupons for stores, etc. We ended up walking down the street and found a Houlihan's very close to the hotel. Perfect! I got a call at 3:00, our room was ready. Kids wanted to eat breakfast in atrium next day, but it was very pricey! Huge hotel, more for business, conferences, conventions....just not a warm, fuzzy, family friendly hotel. We walked to Navy Pier, walked everywhere, that part was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: hj99
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed here while visiting the city. Our room was nice, clean, the staff was helpful, and the location was great. The things I didn't like were they didn't offer free internet and their cafe' was quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Metropolis Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trouleau
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for a conference, the hotel was sprawling for sure. It accommodated our conference of 1200 plus one other one (that I know of) - there were some minor inconveniences involved (like elevator waits at check-in, check-out time) but overall the staff was friendly and efficient and our stay was wonderful and the kids loved traveling through what they called the "underground city" in the sub-level floors. Loved the little "convenience" store on the first floor that had a toaster and microwave that you could buy inexpensive foods and cook them yourself. We got a room in the newly renovated East Tower on the 32nd floor (avoid the high floors if you expereience vertigo!!) - the floor to ceiling windows made me very nervous at first, but I eventually got used to it. Beds were comfy, valet service was especially helpful - and you cannot beat the LOCATION!!! Expect crowds (this is Chicago you know) - check out the BIG bar, and make sure to take a walk along the river....

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for a Girls' Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: nml1971
Reviews.Content: Me and 5 of my girlfriends travelled to Chicago at the end of April to celebrate my 40th birthday. While originally booked at another hotel chain, I was able to secure a great rate on Priceline. We were so pleased that we had to opportunity to stay there as our experience was amazing! Before we arrived I did a little research and stumbled upon the Hyatt Regency Chicago facebook page. Their page is full of local events, things to do, as well as promotions where you can save on rates, parking, etc. You also have the ability to leave a wall post regarding your trip and someone will usually get back to you pretty quicky. I did this prior to my trip and had wondeful conversations with Jennifer who went out of her way to satisfy all my requests i.e. quiet rooms as well she made my 40th birthday extra special...ask her to sing for you if you ever get a chance to meet her :) We had arranged our own transporation and reached the hotel in no time from the airport. When you first walk in it is pretty daunting as it is a large hotel and there is a lot of activity going on however there were a number of staff at the front desk and the lines moved fairly quickly. Upon check-in, the concierge (I believe his name was Michael) welcomed me with a smile, and was very personable. He quickly got my friends and I set up in 3 rooms and we were ready to begin our vacation. The rooms were amazing. I was travelling with a friend who has travelled to Chicago many times and she commented that the room size was very generous compared to some of the other hotel rooms in the downtown area. I found the bed comfortable and there was very little hallway/elevator noise during the night. The location is pefect - a lot of things are within walking distance. The Navy Pier, Millenium Park as well as shopping on State Street and the Magnificant Mile. The river cruises depart from across the street so that was very convenient. For times when we did not want to walk we found the buses easy to use. My friends and I would definitely stay there again - in fact we've talked about making it an annual trip. While it a hotel geared towards the business traveller, I did not feel out of place and would recommend that singles, couples, families, girlfriends, whoever stay here if they want a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “more of a business hotel than for family”
Reviews.Author: maagworld
Reviews.Content: in the last leg of US trip our family stayed here from 22 - 24July. the hotel is massive and located in the downtown. more suited for business and a lot of hidden charges are there from the one advertised online. they will charge extra for even a refrigerator and the parking fees is massive even though Hertz is located in the hotel itself. Staff at the front desk are more of business like than smiling/friendly. breakfast is good, but expensive. the area is crowded and need to wait atleast 20-25 minutes in the line to get seated. if your group is more than 4 it is advised to take a cab whcih will cost you $40 to the O'hare airport rather than the transport from the hotel which charges you around $15 per head. for less luggage you can use the metro which is a couple of blocks away costs $2.25/head. the cab from hotel to the station will cost around $8 for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Chicago near Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: dmhauser2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hyatt for one night in July 2011. The hotel is very nice and is located within a 5-10 minute walk to Navy Pier. The beds were very comfortable and the views from the hotel are great also. We will stay here again when we come to chicago next.

Reviews.Title: “Got Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: Wbbth
Reviews.Content: Went on Priceline and got a great rate for this hotel. I even knew the name of it before we booked it! Got free breakfast which was awesome! ($22.50 usually!!!) Rooms were nice, location was great..Only drawback was .no pool and internet was way to high priced for "us little people" w/out a business expense account! All in all, glad we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency”
Reviews.Author: dickandjackie
Reviews.Content: We stay in the downtown section of Chicago a few times each year at different places and locations. The Hyatt Regency has one of the best locations for shopping, theater, museums or just cruising the streets. It had some mixed reviews but the more recent ones were very positive. All the rooms have been recently renovated or updated. We were able to check in early and actually see two shows on the same day." Nogalar" at the Goodman and " Ethan Fromm" at the Looking Glass theater both walking distances. We are going back in August for more plays.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great view”
Reviews.Author: Saved1Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a large conference being held by my employer. This is a very large and busy conference hotel. The location is great and the hotel has great views of the Chicago River. It appears to be within walking distance of major activities although due to the oppressive heat in Chicago the week I was there I did not venture too far from the hotel. I had a room with a king size bed. The room was very spacious and nicely furnished. As I indicated this is a very large hotel and there were about 1200 people at the conference I attended. Needless to say, this caused a few minor challenges. For example, I arrived at the hotel at about 5:30 pm and my room wasn't ready. Apparently this was the case for numerous other folks who arrived later in the afternoon. Fortunately my wait for the room was not that long (about 20 minutes). The elevators were also a problem. When the conference broke for breaks, etc. you ended up with hundreds of people trying to access the elevators at the same time. My room was in the West Tower on the 11th floor ( there were 36 floors in total). Unfortunately, the elevators are not separated in groups by floors like you would normally see in other high rises. As a result the wait for an elevator as well as the rides up and down could be long at times. All of the staff I encountered were very pleasant and friendly. The hotel has a very nice fitness center and there are a couple of restaurants onsite although I didn't eat at any of them. All in all I was pretty satisfied with my stay and I would probably stay at this hotel again should the opportunity arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wetlandfan
Reviews.Content: Okay- so the conference I attended at the Hyatt had our meetings spaces a bit disjunct, but the service was great. And the hotel sponsored a reception and the food is wonderful! Everybody was helpful and friendly. The location is great. We had a view of the Chicago river from our room! Room was clean, nicely decorated, beds comfy. Stayed before at the Marriott and would definitely come back to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: 1-spidermonkey-1
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I usually stay at other business branded hotels when travelling on business. For this business trip, I was precluded from staying anywhere else by my employer, and so did not choose this hotel myself. That said, I would heartily choose to stay (and also would recommend to others) at this Hyatt again. The hotel is perfectly located at the heart of the city along the river. The area abounds in eateries and drinkeries with much happening nearby. However, one doesn't really need to venture from the hotel to partake in these things, since the hotel has an abundant variety of these within its premises. From the lively and entertaining to the mellow and subdued, a guest can find a restaurant / bar that suits their style/mood. The hotel is spread out into two towers and does not at all feel cramped even though it accomodates many people for conferences. The hotel has an energizing atrium area that is the hub that connects the two towers with several other access walkways between the two above/below ground. Like most hotels that cater the business set, the hotel restaurants were pricey--a price for the convenience. The room I stayed in was reasonably sized, had a great view of the river, and was well appointed. The mattress was firm but not hard; TV large and clear; bath/shower adequately sized; and a bar refridge for those who wanted to pay for the convenience. The room had a safe abut I was surprised by it's smallness, hardly big enough to place a very small (10-12 inch??) laptop. [It could not accomodate my 17 inch laptop]. My room was adjoining the bank of elevators that server the tower I was staying in and as a result I could hear the whirr of the elevators as they went up/down. One evening my rest was less than restful because of my ablility to hear them. The hotel is definitely setup to be a conference hotel and I give it exceptionally high marks on this front. Nice business center; excellent conference space; concierge, front desk staff; quick check-in procedure; valet/bellhop; conference food service, etc. etc.etc.. That said, on two separate occasions I experienced poor (unprofessional) service from the wait staff. Carafes of hot coffee dumped a few feet from where I was sitting; tray full of food dropped onto the floor; coffee cups dropped. I am not sure what was happening -- there was a lot of people with a lot of things going on all around, but a little more care should be taken in these situations. Luckily no one was hurt from these accidents, other than our table had a bit of anxiety during each meal because of this. This was probably just an outlier events or the "bad-day" of one or two people. Overall, I felt the staff to be highly professional and courteous and attentive to guests. All-in-all, this Hyatt goes on my A-list to stay at. I would definitely stay here again knowing what I'd be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cher018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel overlooks the Chicago river and our room in the west tower overlooked Navy Pier. If you don't like large, busy hotels this is not the place for you. It is very centrally located; can walk to Navy Pier and if you enjoy walking distances, there are parks and shopping nearby. The only real complaint we had was the concierge. She acted like dealing with people was the last thing she wanted to be doing. Otherwise everyone else was pretty friendly & helpful. Be aware that if you eat in the Irish bar, the food is brought from another part of the hotel and if you order soup, it will be luke warm! (just an FYI). Also, bring lots of money, everything in Chicago is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “u r in the heart of chicago”
Reviews.Author: eidology
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed my stay there, the rooms are very clean, the stuff are so friendly, the location is awesome u can go anywhere in the downtown in few minutes walking, the view from the room was really nice the only annoying thing was the internet it cost 13$ per day, i went to starbucks which is about 5 min. walking to take my cofee and enjoy a free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, great location, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaKoenig
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. The location couldn't have been better, we were steps away from Grant park on one side and Magnificent Mile shopping on the other. Everyone I spoke to at the hotel which includes the front desk clerk, housekeeping, room service, and valet were so friendly and helpful! The view from my room was spectacular, the Hancock building was centered in my huge picture window and the canal sparkled below, it was very romantic. The water pressure was great and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaint about this hotel is that parking is valet-only so it costs $50+tip. A non-valet parking option that was less expensive would have been nice. But the hotel has an off-street unloading area unlike many hotels in the Mag mile area, so it was easy to unload our bags and find more affordable parking. Also, check-in was a breeze, very fast.

Reviews.Title: “We could have loved it, but....internet connectivity was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: eemala
Reviews.Content: Clean, attractive rooms with very comfy beds. Internet connectivity was horrendous. Felt like dial up. Must be several years behind technologically. Plus, they charge for internet while you wait forever for a page to load. This created a lot of tension and running around because 5 of the 6 people in our party needed to complete some work online. The hotel staff were indifferent to this issue. They still charged us. Complete rip off in that respect. Needless to say, we were angry.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations...”
Reviews.Author: shuff1203
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago July 8 - 11 2011 on a get away for our anniversary. I paid an upgrade for a room with a view. There was "barely" a view. If you stood right at the window and you could see the Chicago River off to the left; but you couldn't see anything from sitting down with the window open. What I should have paid an upgrade for is a quite room -- which oddly enough when I went back and looked you can request a quite room on the website am I the only one that finds that odd? Shouldn't all the rooms be quite? Anyway -- the room was very narrow and had doors on both sides of the room to make adjoining rooms and you could hear the people in the other rooms clear as day. Not to mention our room was near the elevator and you could hear people coming and going a lot. We had a special deal called park and surf that allowed you to park for free (normally $50 a night) and get free internet (normally $14 a day). I used the on screen TV check-out and was told I'd be emailed an invoice, that never happened. I had to jump through hops to get an invoice mailed to me which reviled they charged my for the Internet, I'm still waiting 5 days later for that credit to appear. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The staff seemed overly busy but was polite and courtesy once your got there attention. Had I not had to listen to people conversations from rooms on both sides of us each night it would have been a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at this hotel, and we loved it again!”
Reviews.Author: ninewide
Reviews.Content: The only drawback to staying at this hotel is that some amenities are expensive, such as room service, the bars, and even the internet is 14 bucks a day. But everything else is great! It's within walking distance to everything, including being less than 2 blocks from a giordano's. We also walked 2 blocks to a cvs and got everything we needed for the room to avoid the steep room service charges. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and i fully recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katikat1234
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one-night stay at the Hyatt and really loved the hotel. We got a great rate on Priceline and felt like we got a steal for such a nice hotel. The location is very convenient to Michigan Ave shopping, right on the river, and not far from Millenium Park. The hotel room was very large for a city hotel, bathroom was modern and spotless and the bed was seriously one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The hotel hallways looked like they had not been updated and the elevator was kind of slow (we were on the 31 floor, so made many stops on the way down each time), but all in all it was a great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelSnob
Reviews.Content: Was there wih family and hotel was nice. Very BIG, but service was excellent and maid service was equally as good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rennovations”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt multiple times. The last time I stayed there I felt that the room was comparable to a room at a Holiday Inn Express. I was completely blown away by all of the renovations. A once blah room is now nicely decorated and chic. The room was very inviting and is no longer just a place to sleep. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: chemchelle
Reviews.Content: First off when i arrived at the hotel at 5 pm my room was not ready. I had plans and needed to shower and leave but I had to wait another hour to get a room. this caused me to miss things i had planned. then after i checked out a week ago I thought everything was fine. But the hotel still has a charge on my account that has not been removed in a week. Seriously expected more from this hotel. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Marybry
Reviews.Content: For a hotel this large, I was time and time again impressed with the staff and their level of attention to their guests. I stayed here at the end of June for the HOW Live Design Conference and almost wished I didn't have to leave! Check-in was quick and courteous. Be sure to check out the hotel's Facebook page. You could score free internet and parking discounts. It will be worth you time. The hotel really pays attention to their Facebook page and any questions/comments people have. A+ grade in the social media category. I stayed in the West tower on the 31st floor. Pretty decent view of the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue bridge. The room was spacious, clean and, most of all, quiet. I never heard anyone and the hotel was very close to being full for this conference. The bathroom was large and very brightly lit.
