Elevators were running well with minimal waits, even during peak times. WiFi connectivity in the room was spotty sometimes, but generally worked well. I was able to do video conferences without interference. Bed was comfy, too! I will certainly consider staying here again. It was refreshing to stay at a hotel where the staff really was going out of their way to make guests feel welcome. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: trvwll
Reviews.Content: We received great service upon arrival and it continued all the way through checkout. I was greeted by the employees every time we passed by. The location is great for enjoying the riverwalk and access to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chango7
Reviews.Content: Great location, three or four block walk to the El. Right on the river and one block from Michigan Ave. Upon check in I was given a junior suite on the 29th floor in the West Tower which is a little quieter than the East which has most of the restaurants and bars. Overall a great place to stay and do your thing in Chicago. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. I had Sunday Brunch in the hotel. It was probably fairly priced ($22) for the selections offered. Manuel makes a great omelette.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Woodstick
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights on the 27th floor with a great view. Room was great! Staff was very friendly and very accommodating. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They Made Our Memorable Moment More Memorable!”
Reviews.Author: MrPhinizzle
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided several months ago to visit Chicago for the Dave Matthews Band Caravan music festival; being huge fans of the band we knew that this would be a great weekend for each of us! What she did not know is that I was planning to make it even more memorable so I purchased an engagement ring with the intention to ask her to marry me! My plans were made, rooms at the Hyatt Regency Chicago booked, airplane booked, concert tickets purchased, but I am not from Chicago and had never stayed long enough to have "visited," so I needed help. I am an avid Twitter user and saw on a Dave Matthews Band feed that they were contacted by the Hyatt Regency Chicago to offer rooms, so I began following them as well. I private messaged them asking seeing if I could simply have some champagne and flowers for this special moment... what came next absolutely blew me away! Not only did they help me by getting a suite with a terrific view but made sure that I knew of various locations to pull of the proposal! In addition, they that when we returned from the big moment that we would be met with champagne and flowers, but it completely exceeded what I imagined; words cannot describe just how nice everything was (this is why pictures are posted)! From the first moment I contacted them and up to the private message that we were out of the room they were terrific! The best way I can describe it would would be to quote the conversation I had with Hyatt Regency Chicago staff the day before we left... "I feel like I am a part of this!" and to which I responded "You Are!" Here are a few other thoughts about the hotel: Great Location... Right On the the River Walk, near the Michigan Ave Bridge (and for the shoppers Magnificent Mile). 2 blocks from the Millennium Metra Station and 4 blocks from the "EL" Clark and Lake Station. Great Staff: Very helpful and willing to assist you with whatever you need. Not everything is perfect, so I have to give one negative and that is we had to leave. We made friends while there and it will be a place we go back to visit again... very soon!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Doris C
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and an awesome location. We were able to take buses, water taxis or walk wherever we wanted to go. The staff was awesome and the rooms were large and clean. We will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldmrhare
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Fourth of July and this hotel fit the bill perfectly. Walked to restaurants, shops and the fireworks. I've stayed here before and you can't beat the location and the value for the price (booked on Priceline). The staff was very courteous and helpful. Comfortable bed, clean room. There was some noise from the adjacent rooms but it didn't trouble us too much. Could be a problem with louder neighbors...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good promotional rate”
Reviews.Author: chubbyviking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Chicago River and our rooms had views (between builidings) or Lake Michigan. It is easily walking distance to Miracle Mile, Field Museum, Art Institute, Hancock Tower. The hotel is very nice and the rooms were decent size. We had a very good promotion on the hotel's site where we paid $129/night and received 50% off valet parking (it was still $25/day). The rack rate was $1000/night. We would stay here again...if we got the same promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: JuneBug016
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, clean, huge, has everything, and situated just minutes away from Magnificent Mile, the Millineum Park and Navy Pier. We ran into a small problem the first night, but soon was taken care of the following 4 nights. The manager of the hotel was very apologetic and surprised us with a bottle of champagne and choc-dipped strawberries, free wi-fi, and breakfast. She made sure that our stay was comfortable, and fun. This is the hotel to be at when visiting Chicago. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jpminard
Reviews.Content: We had both sides of our family in this weekend , coming in on different days and staying in multiple rooms. We even had a couple of family members show up unannounced and the staff could not have been more accommodating as I attempted to make some changes to the reservations at the last minute. On top of that they had at least one wedding and two conferences going on in the hotel at the same time and they had all the rooms ready early and I don't believe we had to wait more than ten minutes for any request. Certainly the location is the main draw, but I was extremely happy to find the staff as helpful as they were!

Reviews.Title: “Uncontrolled Madness and Erroneous Charges”
Reviews.Author: paqs2110
Reviews.Content: I am in total agreement with the poster below regarding this hotels front desk service and elevators. We stayed during the same weekend and it took us over an hour to get from our room to the front desk and vice versa. When we finally did make it down we were charged for things from the mini bar we never used along with being double charged for our room at a rate higher than our original rate! We discussed it with them and they "took care of it" Later that week I found that the charge was again taken from my account! After dealing with the billing department it has now been refunded, we will see for how long. I have stayed at many Chicago hotels with my wife for pleasure and business and needless to say we will not be back. It was like pulling teeth to even get an apology from the staff for their errors.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: c-kai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a conference in early July. Considering the massive number of guests at the hotel, I think the staff did a very impressive job of keeping things running smoothly. The room and hotel in general was clean and in good condition. I was especially happy to discover that the gym was available at no extra cost, and that it had a fully satisfactory range of equipment. I opted for a business plan package, which included breakfast and internet access. The breakfast buffet was nice, including omelets made to order. The internet connection was very fast and reliable, which was highly appreciated. I could borrow an adapter for European power plugs at the reception, which saved me a lot of trouble. This is a very good hotel for a business trips. I wouldn't expect anyone looking for a more personal touch to stay at a big hotel like this one. If I would wish for something more, it would be the following: - Internet access is included in the business plan package. However, when you connect to the internet, you still have to register and agree to a daily fee (which does not end up on the final bill). As the billing procedure was unclear to me, I asked the staff in the lobby. The first person I asked advised me to call the central tech support of the hotel, which was not what I wanted. Later, however, I found another member of the staff that could help me. The directions and procedure regarding internet access could be made clearer, and the staff better educated in this matter. - The breakfast buffet is rather focused on fat and sweet things. I would appreciate a wider selection of healthy choices. The same billing confusion applies to the breakfast as the internet access. - The closet in my room had only one small shelf and no drawers. - The AC unit in my room was rather loud, and I had to sleep with ear plugs not to be woken by it. - The room was rather dark with only a few small lamps. - There were five big pillows in the bed, but they were actually too big for me to sleep comfortably with. I know that this is a matter of personal taste, and I didn't bother to ask for a smaller pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed and won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JMP700
Reviews.Content: Yikes!! I stayed here for the first time with my husband, and we were NOT impressed. Knowing we were staying on the Sat. night of July 4th weekend, I was expecting it to be busy. We did not, however, expect to wait in a line of 30+ people to check in (with 1 staff member behind the counter!). The bathroom in our room smelled like horrible, horrible mildew, and the white duvet cover on the bed had some sort of brownish-red stain on it (I can only imagine what THAT was).The elevators were very slow and always full. When we were leaving the next day, we ended up taking the stairs and lugging our baggage down from the 16th floor because every elevator going down was already full from the floors above us. I am generally a patient person, but this hotel was an absolute zoo and it seemed the building and staff could NOT manage the heavy traffic. This was not our first stay in Chicago, and there are many other hotels in the area that are comparable in price but offer a far better experience.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back..”
Reviews.Author: BrianW1979
Reviews.Content: Every time I spotted a hotel employee, they were always smiling. It's clear that they enjoy making their guests happy. Check-in was easy and quick. It seems as though they don't treat their Priceline customers different than any of their other customers (which is a good thing!) Being on the North end of the loop, the location was great. It was steps away from Michigan Avenue, and a couple of blocks away from State Street. The view from the room was grand, facing the Wrigley Building and Tribune Tower. The bed was very comfortable. There was actually a bathtub in the bathroom, which comes in handy after a long day of walking around. The lobby was both busy and beautiful. There was a great selection of food inside the hotel. It's reminiscent of a Vegas hotel (sans casino). I will definitely stay here again when I visit Chicago. At their price range, Hyantt Regency definitely goes above and beyond of what's expected from them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bpowell1908
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location. The staff was very friendly. Quick check-in and check-out. Had a wonderful stay. Will stay there next time I am in Chicago. Perfect location to Michigan Ave and Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Huge Hotel at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: SBR_7
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a massive hotel. The lobby is busy and there is a line at checkin. We skipped the line by going to an automated checkin, which spit out our keys and room number in about two minutes. Our room was on the 23rd floor with a good view. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom large and well appointed. This is a very nice hotel in a great location. It is not a good choice if you are looking for personal service or a boutique experience. We scored a great rate on Priceline. If you have a car, I would suggest parking somewhere other than the Hyatt garage, which charges $50 per day. The Millennium Garage, less than three blocks away, charges $24. Overall, this is a great base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value rooms, friendly and efficient staff... with one exception!”
Reviews.Author: Shufti_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend with my family, Thursday through Monday, at the Hyatt to attend a family wedding. This is a big and very busy hotel - but well handled by the front desk, an informed and helpful concierge and the bell desk staff. Kudos to those folks. Unfortunately the Big Bar staff, and in particular the Big Bar manager let the side down â€“ and badly too! Although I can identify with the frustration bar staff has to put up with, late at night, dealing with patrons who may have "over-consumed" on the fortified refreshments, nonetheless professionalism should demand courtesy and good manners. None of these traits were displayed by the bar manager, when at a few minutes past one oâ€™clock in the morning, not having over-consumed on the fortified refreshments, I requested a round of drinks for myself and my family. In spite of the bar notice stating the bar closes at 02:00 a.m., I was told the bar was "closed". When I politely questioned the barman (and the bar manager) why the discrepancy between the sign and the bar being "closed", I was rudely treated in a patronising manner and my questions discarded off hand. In some other service industries, the attitude and behaviour displayed by the bar manger, would not be tolerated and would result in disciplinary action, or perhaps, remedial training. When I complained to the front desk, the night duty manager offered a complimentary bottle of wine from our room mini bar. Although we did not take up the offer, the response of the front desk is an example of a far-sighted and intelligent response. In spite of the attitude of the Big Bar manager, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Poor/inaccurate communication between central reservations, hotel staff and customers= extra fees for you.”
Reviews.Author: exhaustednow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for two nights for a family trip to Chicago. We booked the hotel via phone with Hyatt central reservations. We usually stay at a Marriott or Hilton but, despite several negative reviews online, thought we would try this hotel due to its location and price. To begin, central reservations listed our AAA rate as having complimentary internet (on the email confirmation). Based on several complaints about this very charge on TA, we called to confirm this. Central reservations said we did not have it despite the email, but that we did have comp. breakfast. We though this was agreeable and did not pursue the internet issue. We also noted that our confirmation via email has two adults and two children listed as guests. When we arrived we again checked with property desk staff about the breakfast because our in house self check-in receipt listed only two guests. We were told via phone (front desk) that four breakfasts would be complementary. The second day, in good faith, we checked to see if breakfast was complementary for one or two days. The manager said that we never had complimentary breakfast and if that was a component of our rate there would be only two. He further said that he would do us a great favor and take off the price of two of the four and also offer us two free the second day (which required us to purchase two more unless we let our kids watch us eat). Despite this, he would not comp all four for the first day. His attitude, as I perceived it, was not service oriented (unless the "I am gong to make you a great deal" [that costs you money] attitude is service), and he repeatedly said, only what is in writing matters. Essentially he was justifying lack of consistent verbal communication across Hyatt employees (though notably he would not admit our room came with comped internet, which we chose not to use based on the conversation with central reservations). The breakfast was not a small charge--$95 for four. It was nice but not that nice and we would have never purchased it if central reservations had not told us it was included (along with the local employee that said we would get four). This too, the manager simply did not understand (by his own words). The short story is the negative reviews you read on TA are accurate. Hyatt (or at least this Hyatt) will gauge you such that you should have stayed elsewhere for a slightly higher rate and avoided the hassle (the Embassy Suites breakfast is comparable and all guests receive it). Also, the hotel may be technically a four star property but three stars would be more accurate so that should be considered when comparing rates. One bright spot was the excellent housekeeping. In sum, based on miscommunication, we were stuck with ~47.00 charge (half was comped) that was represented to us a free. Hopefully Hyatt will get their employees across offices/properties and email confirmations in sync for future guests. We will avoid Hyatt in the future based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “A trip saved from disaster.”
Reviews.Author: Cbolt
Reviews.Content: My trip to Chicago ended in smiles much of that thanks is due to Matt at the front desk. He saved what was a potentially disastrous situation with grace and kindness. I had come down to the desk as my room was filthy and he took great care in making sure he personally rectified the situation. The regency itself is an excellent location and great deals can be found on rooms. I would advise staying there and checking out the architectural boat tour.

Reviews.Title: “So so in a great city”
Reviews.Author: travelread
Reviews.Content: This hotel is HUGE. The whole experience is very impersonal (and I am not one who really cares about everyone knowing my name...). We asked for a room with a view of something (some rooms seem to look onto a roof) and were told the ONLY room left was next to the elevators. The guy at the front desk was very honest and told us the elevator noise really bothers some people and doesn't others. We thought we would try it - the noise was obvious but you did get somewhat used to it and we were on a high floor so the elevators did not come all the way up every time. The view was great and worth the noise - over the river and up the Miracle Mile. The room has been recently updated and the furnishings and art were very attractive and modern. The bathroom was smallish but updated also. However, the new, attractive seating (other than the bed or desk chair) was HARD like a rock and very uncomfortable - meaning the only place to sit and read a book or look at the view was on the bed. Really poor design. Chairs are for sitting! This huge hotel has one small Starbucks in a hallway so just leave for your coffee/breakfast/snacks - there are lots of great choices close by. We were here for a meeting; if I had to choose, I would choose some other place to stay in Chicago. There are many other choices and Hyatt makes it easy to leave and find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiffinTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 1st thru July 5th, 2011. The location of the Hyatt is GREAT, right beside the Chicago river and just one block east of Michigan Ave. Our room overlooked the river so we had a good view of all the river traffic, water taxis, tours, and pleasure boats. The room was nicely decorated in a contemporary style, looked great, no function. Very limited drawer space so we kept our things in our suit cases, night table beside bed was very small, the telephone took up 2/3 of it and my glasses just fit on the rest. Hotel staff was friendly but not outgoing. The lady who checked us in messed up, so we were locked out of our room the third night, a trip back to the lobby fixed this situation quickly. Elevators are very slow at peak times, early morning & evenings, there was staff there on two occasions to direct traffic for elevators as the backup of people in lobby waiting got ridiculous, I counted 28 people at one point. We were in the west tower so we would walk across street and use elevators there. Valet service is very slow also, called for our car at 11am, they said 20min., at 11:45am I told the valet to forget it we are going to get a taxi as we had a tour booked for 12:30pm and needed to get going, at checkout our car took 40min. to arrive, and the back corner was all scratched up, which was another delay with filling out an incindent report. They said they will cover it, we'll see, I have my doubts. DaddyO's pub in the hotel is fairly sad, told us to sit anywhere when we went in, we took a booth, waited and waited for service and both bartenders avoided us, got up and went to the bar and they waited on us right away, beer for me, soda for my wife, hers was flat, ask for another soda...... flat too. We both noticed the beer bottles on the back bar are covered in dust as was the shelving, gross, not much cleaning going on here. One drink and we left. Overall the Hyatt is OK, not what I expected for a Hyatt but average, we have had better service at less expensive hotels in Chicago. The Hyatt will not be our first choice when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, limited dining options, remote location, requires cab ride to get around”
Reviews.Author: Lousviews
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean, and the staff was friendly. The location was less than desirable. If you want to get downtown for anything you need to take a $10 cab ride. The restaurants in the area (outside of the hotel which are very good but there is only 1 plus a cafe) are not within quick walking distance which again requires a cab ride. While this may not be a deal breaker for most, I prefer being able to walk a few blocks have shops and restaurants close by and feel the city energy . Hyatt Regency is great if you're attending a conference at McCormick but would not recommend for a tourist or someone who wants to get out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: hinkgen
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 3-5 with two older kids and two adults. Most of the room is very standard hotel stuff, but the beds are OUTSTANDING. A great night sleep in a hotel is rare for me and I had TWO great nights at this hotel. We had a room on the 30th floor and were able to check in (very) early when we arrived at 11:00 a.m. (NICE!). Front desk service was very courteous. You can get a day's free internet service if you mention the "word of the week"...you have to follow Hyatt Chicago on Facebook to learn the word. Like with most higher end hotels, they GIVE you less and charge for more, that's the case here, but the comfort of the beds and great location (plus a decent price on Hotwire) make it an excellent choice for a Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jam214
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and had a great view. This is within walking distance of the Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile. If you go to the Irish Pub, be aware that they they are not serving Irish food. The food was only average and they seemed short handed on staff. Parking is approx. $50 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_Checklist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency during a trip to Chicago with friends and had no complaints at all. We got a good deal on it by booking through the unnamed hotel offered by expedia and we couldn't be happier with the result. The rooms were quite large and modern, bathrooms were renovated, and everything was very clean. The hotel is huge and busy! Some people may not like this - if you prefer to be personally greeted everytime you enter the hotel, this place is not for you - but we had no issues with it and we were able to assistance from the information desk when we needed it. It also offers a bar and several restaurants if you want to stay close to the hotel one night. The location is perfect for visiting Chicago. It was very close to the Magnificient Mile, boat cruises, and Millenium Park. Walking distance to Navy Pier as well, and even the Shedd Aquarium and Field Museum if you're interested in a longer walk. Stops for most of the train lines are also only a 5-7 minute walk away. If you find that it is too long of a walk with your suitcases, you can always just grab a cab for a few dollars to take you to close train/subway stop. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Air in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joey3rd
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at this hotel four days. The location is great, reasonable close to everything; the L is close, shopping, theater, etc. The staff was very accommodating, and I give them high remarks for their efforts in trying to ensure our stay was pleasant. Our only complaint was with the air quality in our rooms. One day when we returned we noticed a damp mold type smell in the room. Two of us were in the 21st floor and two were on the 12th floor in the West tower. When we checked out, all four of us left with coughing. Two of us shared rooms on the 21st and two were on the 12th floor. We reported it to the staff at check out but they didnâ€™t really seem interested or stated they would look into is, it was more like OK, have a safe trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tagged along with boyfriend for ASCO Conference trip in Chicago - decent stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency with my boyfriend when we traveled to Chicago for the ASCO Conference (held at McCormick Place). Considering the size of the conference (30,000+ attendees annually) and the distances being traveled by said attendees, it's not surprising that the Hyatt is one of the sponsoring hotels. However, to all the travelers considering Chicago's Hyatt Regency as a non-conference hotel (i.e. simply for leisure or personal travel), I would not recommend this hotel. The hotel is your typical over-sized, cavernous space -- complete with multiple towers of rooms/elevator banks/etc. It's a confusing space to navigate. It took three trips up and down various elevators and escalators to get to the ONE gym located on hotel grounds. If you are the type of traveler who enjoys luxurious comfort, privacy, excellent room service, and unobtrusive housekeeping, the Hyatt is NOT your hotel. For that in Chicago, I recommend the Peninsula or the Four Seasons. For a work trip in Chicago, Hyatt makes a lot of logistical sense; it's in a great location very close to the Loop downtown, and there are plenty of cabs always waiting by the front. My last point about the Hyatt -- the breakfast omelette of goat cheese and spinach, coffee, and fresh fruit w/yogurt was the worst room service meal I have ever consumed. The omelette, in particular, was atrocious. The only reason I force fed myself the food was because I had paid so much money for the breakfast. I would not recommend the Hyatt to a friend who is visiting Chicago for a personal/fun trip. Perhaps a work conference being held AT the hotel might be the only reason to justify the need to tolerate this type of second rate accommodation. There are better value and luxury/comfort options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best city in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Regency for 3 nights, June 30th to July 3rd. It is a great hotel in a great location and we got the room at a very good price for Chicago; we used Booking.com to make the reservation. Spotless room, king size bed with and amazing mattress and we also had great views of the Navy Pier, â€¦yes from the bedï�Š. Mind you, most rooms do not have such a great view as the hotel is huge and the East tower view of the pier is blocked by an apartment building. You can always ask for the view and maybe it works; that is exactly what we did. The first less than perfect thing I can bring up about our stay was the fact that we tried to contact the concierge and weâ€™ve been transferred back and forth for several minutes. We eventually gave up and found a restaurant on our own. If you ever been to Chicago, you should know that it is almost impossible not to find a good restaurant anywayâ€¦. The second thing that was less then desirable, and this should be a serious concern for most; is parking. Downtown Chicago is bad for parking period. The hotel offers parking with In and Out â€œprivilegesâ€� for 50$.... that is ridiculously expensive, but pretty much in line with what other hotels charge. Street parking in the area is time limited and it cost 5$ per hour during the day and 5$ for 2 hours at night. Options? There is really no good reason to bring your car if you only stay downtown Chicago and this would be your best option. CTA offers great service all over Chicago area. However if you have to have your car and if you have more time than money, here are some options: - Sundays and holydays you get free parking on Wacker dr. â€“ not in front of the hotel but not far from it either (past Michigan towards Illinois, on both sides of Wacker). Iâ€™ve always been able to find a spot. - On La Salle, close to North St. Some sections are free Saturday and Sunday all day. Time restriction Monday to Friday. Cab back to the hotel 12 USD - Park further away, close to some of the L lines. Pay attention to permit and / or time restrictions. Sometimes it is 2 â€“ 3 blocks away from the L stations before you can park, sometime just 50 yards. - You can also park at Navy Piers, 24$ / day. Not sure about in an out. - On the N side of the river, on the lower levels there is also parking for 28$, in a sea of 40$ lots. No in and out and the area looks questionable. There is a convenience store, open to midnight, about 50 yards from the hotel, on the east side of N Lower Stetson Ave. Wifi is available for 14.95/day through out the hotel, or if you can wait, go to the Corner Bakery on Wacker Dr. and its free. They have good food there as well. In summary, I would say this is amazing hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mainstream hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: myintd
Reviews.Content: My usual preference is small boutique hotels but it was very difficult to find a bargain towards the July 4 holiday and was able to booked through Hotwire. I found the hotel's Facebook profile and posted the days and occasion I was arriving for and asked for a room with a view and perhaps some comp. When I arrived to my surpise a few things happened, I got a big warm welcome and a large modern room with an awesome lake view, next day I came back to be greeted by ice cold beers, tidbits and birthday wishes, never have I received such good hospitality from any hotel, I am truly converted but doubt that any other mainstream brand hotel would provide such personalize care. Tips: become a Gold Passport member for late checkout, the Stay Fit gym, Bockwinkle's on Stetson, rotissiere chicken open till midnight and Lou Malnati's deepdish in River North.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: geoffg32
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 4 nights on vacation. First, I have to say those were the best beds I have every slept on...the beds alone make it worth staying here. The rest of the room was nice and very clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We reserved our room during a 72 hr sale that Hyatt was having and got a very good rate, but would have been just as satisfied paying more. Keep in mind, this a huge, busy hotel and there is a $100 a night hold put on your card for incidentals, which you can avoid by having them put a restriction on any extra charges (which I did). This was my 3rd time to vacation in Chicago and the next time I visit, the Hyatt will be the first hotel I consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Room”
Reviews.Author: patricka5
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed 4 nights while on vacation. We were generally pleased with the hotel. We had a great view on the 28th floor of the river/lake. Pros - location is convienient to just about everything downtown. We walked the Magnificent Mile, walked to Willis Tower, Federal Reserve. We took a water taxi (located across the river) to Navy Pier, Museum Campus. Great fun and easy to do. The staff was always very friendly and even though my bill was nowhere near correct when I checked out, the man at the desk fixed everything quickly and with no problems. Cons - very little countertop space in bathroom if more than one person is staying. Not enough towels. Make sure you figure out a way to get free wi-fi, because that's about all its worth. I'd say I only was able to get it to work 25% of the time - quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: skeToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Hyatt for our first visit to Chicago. Check in was quick and efficient. All the hotel staff that we encountered during our stay were polite and friendly. We had a great newly renovated room on the 25th floor that had a fantastic view of Navy Pier which was perfect for watching the fireworks. Our room was in the west tower which was very quiet. The only negative comment I have is the room we were in was an accessible room and there was virtually no counter space in the bathroom, only a small glass shelf next to the sink enough to hold a bar of soap and a toothbrush. Valet parking was $35/night with the word of the week program on the hotel's facebook site. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location for visiting many of the tourist sites. We visited Navy Pier, Millenium Park, the Field Museum, Museum of Science and Industry (great for kids and adults), took an architecture boat tour, and Taste of Chicago. The architecture tour was one of the highlights of our trip and highly recommended. We will definitely return to Chicago to see all the things we missed this time, and the Hyatt will be our first choice for hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again & again”
Reviews.Author: FanofIllinois
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 3 days with my husband and our teen and what an enjoyable experience. Front desk staff was very professional and friendly (not snooty as in past hotel experiences in the Windy City). Our room which was their new respire rooms (hypo-allergenic) was white glove clean. I looked very thoroughly for anything amiss regarding the cleanliness of our room and was extremely pleased with housekeeping. This hotel is in a great location to all the sights of Chicago. We had a 2 queen room and I would say it was average sized as far as hotels rooms go. The beds were quite comfy and the pillows were amazing! I have a difficult time sleeping in hotels but not this time. We never heard any noises from the hallways or other rooms throughout our stay. Next time we're in Chicago, I would not hesitate to stay at the Hyatt again. The only cons to our stay was that upon arrival in our room there were only 3 towels and if anyone knows traveling with a teenaged girl, you will use more towels. They were happy to send up more, but I felt that they should have at least provided 4 towels to start with. Another was that in the hotel rooms you had to pay extra for wi-fi. Pul-ease, even McDonalds has free wi-fi!! All in all I give this hotel two thumbs up for location, cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: kimbatrey
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the How Design Conference....its a bit daunting b/c the hotel is so huge but the staff are so friendly....always asking how you are doing and just general politeness everywhere! Random but it had the best snack selection out of any hotel I have ever stayed at...organic gelato, organic tea, fresh pasteries, treats in bulk bins and more. My room was very nice and the king bed was super comfortable. No complaints at all and super convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandeepina
Reviews.Content: It was a well located in downtown Chicago. I was at a conference taking place in the hotel, which was very convenient. The thing to watch out is for the paid internet ($27 per hour). The extras are quite a bit. The breakfast and dinner is ok.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Pattict
Reviews.Content: My first time using electronic check-in and it was a breeze. I was pleased with my room. It was spacious and modern in design. I wasn't expecting to like the hotel because of the noisy atrium entrance. But the other amenities won me over. I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mickhally
Reviews.Content: This is not the nicest hotel I have staid in, but it was good. The best thing was the location. It is right on the river downtown. It is a short walk to the park, shopping, river drive or most any other attraction you would want to go to. The room was a little small, but had a great view of the river and the tribune building. Food in the hotel was passable and forgettable, not bad but nothing I would have eaten if I weren't in the hotel. We were there because the wife had a convention and I was along for the visit. The convention space was nice and a lot larger than you would expect from the outside. Seems like this hotel is more geared to a business or convention guest than someone on vaca.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good service, a nice conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtclg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all...a great location, close proximity to the Magnificant Mile shopping, across the street from a great movie theater, can walk to Navy Pier and the Theater District in the Loop. This is really a convention hotel, and quite large. It is always bustling with traffic and lots of people. If you don't mind that, you'll love this place. The rooms are a nice size, comfortable, and the hotel offers a variety of services on site...such as a spa, numerous restaurants, great room service, and friendly staff. It's a glass and steel building, so certainly nothing fancy or cozy. We request a deluxe king room with a Tempur Pedic bed. That's right, they have a handful of rooms with Tempur Pedic beds...you have to request them, and they are totally worth it. Best night's sleep ever. If you're looking for a "big city experience" then this is a great place to stay (especially for the price). If you want to multiply your nightly rate, I can definately recommend better places (Park Hyatt, Conrod, Ritz, or The Penninsula), but you will pay a whole lot more. If you prefer a more quiet, botique type place, then the Hotel Alegro or Burnham would be nice choices.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and grand accommodations”
Reviews.Author: bsu1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were extremely pleased with the accommodations and service we received. We were able to check in @ 10:45am which was a relief (reg checkin was 3pm). Rooms were fantastic and we were given a great view of the city overlooking the riverwalk. Fitness center is great also. One disappointment: no pool / jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Could hear next room through the doors”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithFour
Reviews.Content: It WAS a nice hotel. Couldn't ask for a better location. Across the street from the Architectural River tours, down one block from Millennium Park, down two blocks and across the bridge to the Magnificent Mile. Perfect location and great hotel did equal full of conference goers, weddings and families on vacation. If the people in the next room were close to the adjoining doors you could hear them talking, but since it isn't a party hotel it wasn't bad and all was quiet at night. But room felt new and very clean. Bed was very nice and comfortable. I was there for a conference in the same hotel. The basement conference rooms had huge pillars that obstructed the sight lines during some of the talks. Workout room was small and had barely any empty floor space for mats. For the price it should have had a pool. But otherwise it was a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that you remember!”
Reviews.Author: FullOfWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Hyatts and I expected more from this property due to its prime location. That being said, I expect that the Hyatt Regency Chicago has a constant influx of traffic, based on what I saw in the extremely busy lobby, and the hotel struggles with keeping the rooms up to a luxury standard. My room was perfectly adequate, until I noticed the mold on the inside of my shower curtain, someting a maid should notice, as it was quite obvious, and should have replaced immediately. I have most definitely encountered a moldy shower curtain before, but not in a $200+/night hotel room. Since I was only in my room for a fraction of a second and was at a conference the remainder of my time in Chicago, I let it slide for my time's sake, as I did not have the time to wait in the long lines at the front desk for something I wasn't spending much time in. Considering this property gets many a visitor per year, perhaps more attention should be paid to the little things that the frequent visitor will notice and definitely remember.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: ritabryant
Reviews.Content: 1. Very convenient downtown location! ( Walking distance to Millennium Park, The Chicago Art Institute, Michigan Ave shopping, fabulous restaurants (Giordanos Pizza and The Purple Pig), and MANY other Chicago sites. 2. Room darkening curtains were an added plus! 3. I was very satisfied with this hotel and would recommend it for business or pleasure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: jrlyon
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights over Fathers Day weekend. From the moment we arrived, the staff was friendly, helpful, and professional and they provided a lot of little "extras" that helped make our stay that much more enjoyable. We stayed in the West tower on the 30th floor, and our room overlooked the Chicago river with beautiful views of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. The room itself was clean with tasteful, contemporary decor. The location of this hotel is prime. You are close to the Magnificent Mile, and in the other direction, you are just a few blocks away from State Street. Parking can be a little pricey, but that is typical Chicago. However, with the word of the week that Hyatt posts on their Facebook profile, you can subtract $15.00 a day from the normal $50.00 rate. Overall, you can not beat this perfectly located hotel, and I will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: ekswl
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 night stay to attend a conference. Hyatt Regency Chicago is an enormous hotel with many floors of event rooms. Very nice hotel with beautiful interior--but it also requires a lot of walking to and from the room. Some Pros: 1. Very clean and spacious room with pleasing decor. My room was in the East Tower. The A/C unit was whisper quiet. I barely noticed it was on! 2. Bathroom was also spacious and very modern with nice bath products. I appreciated there was a small tube of toothpaste. Water pressure and temperature was all good. 3. I found every member of the staff I encountered extremely courteous and professional. The hotel had many employees all over the site to direct guests to the right place in this huge hotel. (I know I got lost a couple of times!) 4. Location was great. Because I was there for the conference, I spent most of the days inside the hotel, but there were so many restaurants within walking distance for dinner. Michigan Ave. is exciting and fun for people-watching. Some cons: 1. Hotel wi-fi (not complimentary) was terribly slow and kept dropping. They need to install boosters in more locations. I ended up using the network cable and being chained to the desk. 2. Walls are extremely thin! I heard every word of everything my next door neighbors said. The little boy didn't want to go out and threw a tantrum. Luckily they were only there one of the 2 nights I had the room. Try and ask for a room with empty rooms next to you... 3. Housekeeping woke me up by knocking loudly on my door at 8am. This was the morning I was supposed to check out, so I don't see why she couldn't wait until I was checked out. If you are not an early riser, keep the privacy tag on the door. Overall, I'd consider this hotel again if I am attending an event in the area. I personally prefer smaller, more personalized hotels for leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - slightly expensive compared to other deals”
Reviews.Author: CARIBBEAN757
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - newly remodeled - very clean rooms. It is slightly more expensive than other hotel deals, but a decent value. It is very convenient to the Loop and you can take the El from Midway for $2.25. You can also walk right down Michigan Avenue from the front door of the hotel (but you are across the River)

Reviews.Title: “Size competes with luxury.”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very clean and spacious -- velvet throw pillows, large comfy beds, modern bathroom. The hotel has clearly gone through a recent renovation; however, the size of the hotel (5+ restaurants, multiple towers and levels, skywalk) compete with the feeling of luxury and the quality of stay. One night it took me 10 minutes to get from the front door to my room given the long lines at the elevators, and the escalators and hallways required to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelTravelNow
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here 6 days last week for a combination of work and vacation. It was a great choice. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the L, Chicago Cultural Center, and Millennium Park to name a few. Bus service is also very close by. Our room on the 8th floor of the West Tower was super quiet with an excellent view of the River, Lake, and Navy Pier. We even watched the fireworks from our window! The bed was very comfortable. I would like to have taken it home with me. Only two gripes, both fee related. $13.95/day for wireless is ridiculous. It's not even free in the lobby. Also, the hotel assess a charge of $7/stay if you store items in the fridge. That is simply crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LLSquared
Reviews.Content: While in town for a Convention I had the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt on Wacker, although this is a very expensive hotel to stay at the location is great and saved me a lot on cab fare. Due to the great location my Coworkers and I were able to walk to great restaurants for dinner and entertainment each evening. The hotel has a great breakfast and a nice bar with a great view out to Wacker Drive. The rooms were modern and were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaryPlanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for my husband's work while my children and I visited the local museums. It is more of a business hotel than for families, but has an excellent location on East Wacker by the Michigan River. It's right next to the water taxi ferry and is about a 5 minute walk to grocery stores and restaurants. A bus stop out front will take you to the local museums and cabs are lined up around the corner day and night. It's a 15 minute ride to the museum campus (Field, Shedd, Adler) and 10 to the MSI. It was a $25 cab ride to Midway Airport. It was a 20-30 minute walk to Navy Pier (mile and a half). The concierges were extremely helpful in assisting us with info about the area and about public transit (very safe). The front desk clerk helped me find a 24 hour pharmacy when my son was sick at midnight...and the bellman gave me the first cab to get there right away. We had trouble getting cell reception in the hotel. The wifi was $13 a day and was even difficult to download at that sometimes. No pool No free breakfast. Everything was designed for the business traveler's expense budget. But there are plenty of choices in close walking distance, including a McDonalds and a Houlihan's (we liked) and Pizzeria Uno (we did not like). Also a Rwanda party on Friday night was very loud (hundreds of people in the lobby at midnight), and security did not respond when we complained that the neighbors 2 doors down were very loud in their room and in the hall from 3 am to 4 am. The room was not NYC tiny but not huge. It was clean and nice. The housekeeping always did a great job. The beds were EXTREMELY comfy--firm but not too hard--something we don't always find. Room service and gift shop and lobby cafe are very pricey. You can't use the fridge and if you even move an item in it, you are automatically charged. Bring a small cooler to fill with ice from the hall. There aren't even vending machines in the hall, so the nearby grocery stores are great (individual sodas in the gift shop were a special 2 for $5).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service horrible hotel. Worse than your average big convention hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lasereyesdoc
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping in the hotel is terrible. Rooms remain unmade even after multiple calls requesting service. It took 2 hours to get extra hangers and two phone calls. The rooms stare straight into an office building. There is no privacy. Water pressure in the shower was poor. There is simply nothing good that I can say about the place. The final rip off was guest parking at 50 bucks per night.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: inzombiac
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a cross country trip and we definitely started out on the right foot. The location of the hotel is right on the river and everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. The staff were exceptionally friendly. The best example of this was an issue I had with the phone in our room. I walked down and notified the front desk and by the time I came back from dinner, the phone was repaired. I also received a note from the manager apologizing for any inconvenience -- just felt this personal touch goes a long way. The valet was fast and make sure you check out their website for the word of the week to get a discount on parking. The room was large with a great view of the river. The bed was comfortable, plenty of towels, and the bathroom was fine. My only real issue was the fact that the room was dusty and it appeared it hadn't been dusted in at least a week. The concierge was very helpful and helped this newbie to Chicago navigate the city. Just a quick note on the clientele in the hotel. I happened to be staying the weekend the Mr. Leather International competition was in town. My wife and I didn't take any issue with this, but this goes to show you should probably check if there are any conventions in town and plan accordingly. Overall this quick stay was entertaining and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel wonderful ammenities”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The location is perfect. You can walk to anywhere in downtown Chicago. It has great views. The rooms are spacious and very confortable. There is a great bar in the lobby. The staff are exceptional and go to any length to make your stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for a Great city”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a very recently concluded business trip to the fantastic SAFETY 2011 show. My stay was a rare opportunity to experience my own town, the great city of Chicago, as a visitor. It actually made me envious of the many people who get to come here often on business. My base . . . the Hyatt Regency. As I always do, I am breaking my review down to the GREAT, GOOD, BAD, and UGLY with some bottom line-type comments. Ready? Let's do this . . . GREAT * The 'Backdrop': This is bold, beautiful, dynamic Chicago we're talking about here and the Hyatt Regency (referred to here henceforth as 'HR') is a great setting. On any level much higher than a standard ferris wheel, you will be treated to awesome views of the city, river, and Lake Michigan (I was on the 25th floor and really enjoyed the view). The hotel ITSELF offers a very impressive lobby area with one of the very best bars I have ever had the pleasure tipping a few back in. Seat yourself at the bar of the HR and enjoy a dramatic elevated backdrop of the Chicago River and city beyond - this is especially nice at night (see pic included). GOOD * Location: The HR is situated at a nice location for a visitor - just off the river and close to city-center and Navy Pier. When you stay at the HR you are in close proximity to the main shopping, dining, and party areas a little further north (and the more interesting areas even further northwest). Yet, you are also a short walk away from the many city-center attractions just south - like Millenium Park, the museums, Grant Park, etc. * Service: In a lot of other reviews here, the HR is referred to as 'impersonal' and 'not charming'. Well . . . duh! Folks, this is one of the largest non-gaming hotels in the WORLD (I think it might still be THE largest in room capacity). Complaining about this hotel lacking charm is like visiting a quaint boutique lakeside bed & breakfast and complaining about their 'terrible business center'. That said; I found the HR staff to be very friendly and helpful in limited interactions and I found the service to be highly efficient. When I arrived at registration I cringed at the long line but I was checked-in in no time and . . . I never had to wait long for my food or another Blue Moon at the beautiful bar. * Room temperature and 'comfort': I loved the room temperature control system - you just set the desired temperature and the system does the rest - very easy. And I found the room to be comfortable and very 'new' feeling but . . . BAD ('room' for improvement) * This is defintely the type of hotel you will remember years after your stay but . . . aside from the view, you will likely NOT remember the room itself. For such an otherwise great hotel, the rooms feature the standard cookie-cutter hotel room design with a bathroom being the first thing you encounter (either on the left or right) and the room beyond that. This is a minor knock but . . . I felt like they dropped the ball in not making even more use of the spectacular city backdrop with a more interesting room design. Then again, I had a lower priced room - perhaps that is the case if you upgrade. UGLY * I would have loved to have had my car during this stay (Chicago is a great convertible city) but . . . I could not have expensed the exorbant parking charges to my company in good conscious. I know its downtown and all but . . . $50 / night to park? That's 'how do you sleep with yourself?' expensive. BOTTOM LINE COMMENTS / RECOMMENDATIONS * You will not regret using the HR as your base when you visit the great city of Chicago. * DO request a high-level room * DO NOT bring a car if you can help it. Chicago is a very 'walkable' city with good public transportation (be sure to know where you are though) * If attending a trade show at McCormick - no prob. DO NOT stay at the McCormick Hyatt as your nighttime options will involve having to have a car or spending a fortune on cabs. Stay at the HR and use the show shuttle (there will most likely be a show shuttle) or pub trans from the nearby Millenium Station (there is a red line stop at McCormick). Feel free to shoot me a note of you have Q's.

Reviews.Title: “Great leisure trip to Chicago - Headlined by the Hyatt Regency Chicago”
Reviews.Author: fstop75
Reviews.Content: I am relatively new to the Hyatt family and coming from the Starwood family I have a level of service that I expect out of a hotel. Let me begin by saying that the Hyatt Regency Chicago did NOT disappoint me. I was pleasantly surprised, given the size of this 2000+ room hotel, at the level of personalized service we received. Maybe it was because we were there on a short getaway and not really in a hurry to get anywhere, but it seemed that everyone we encountered went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Due to a late checkout, part of our suite was not ready but Kari at the front desk went ahead and made up keys for our connector so we could freshen up (it was almost 100 degrees when we arrived!) and made sure we had access to the regency club where we could wait for the rest of our room to be ready. The main reason for our stay was a birthday trip for our two kids who have very close birthdays and boy did the Hyatt come through on the birthday. Jennifer, one of the managers, arranged for a beautiful birthday cake to be delivered to our room about 10 minutes after we arrived! This was totally unprompted and was VERY well received. I mentioned in my thank you letter to the hotel that my kids felt like big time VIP's! The only downside, and warrants mentioning, is that unless your count the fountain in the lobby, the hotel does not have a pool. Though my kids may disagree, spending time in a pool when you are in a city like Chicago is a waste of time. Overall we had a great 4 days in Chicago due in no small part to the Hyatt Regency Chicago! Additional tips: Either fly in or take the train, but leave the car at home; parking is $50/night. Parking is expensive but not unrealistic considering the value of real estate in downtown Chicago. If you are going to visit the museums, look into the Chicago CityPass. Best meal bang for the buck - hands down, Market Bistro in the Fox and Obel market. Three words: market price wine. Last but not least fireworks at Navy Pier on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The view of the fireworks from the top of the ferris wheel is sublime!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is just OK”
Reviews.Author: Coronatraveler
Reviews.Content: I am staying in the hotel right now. Made reservations way back in Feb. My husband is here with a convention and I came with him. We tried to find out about upgrading to a Regency Club room using our Regency Gold Passport points and were told since we made reservations thru group reservations we had to go thru them. they said no it had to be done with the Hotel. finally after six or seven calls back and forth the hotel said we have to wait until we check in and request this. When we checked in they said all the Regency Club rooms had been booked. They offered to upgrade us to a suite. When we looked at the room it had a pull down bed. It was like a meeting room. We asked for another room and were given a king room. Beautiful view. We later found out other people in our group had Regency Club rooms and they had never even asked for them. They checked in after us. This isn't the way to treat Gold card members. They did try to make it better by given us free Internet. The problem in the room is there are only three small draws in the nightstand. We had to leave everything in the suitcase. The carpet in our room is so dirty that I walked from the bed to the bathroom in sox and they are filthy. This renovation they talk about seems to only be on some parts of the room. Carpet and paint seem old.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago for Conference, would take family”
Reviews.Author: fife2003
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago many times in my life, and I grew up only 3 hours from this city. Although I never stayed downtown until 2011. This was a great trip and staying at the Hyatt put us in the middle of the action. This is an awesome hotel and would love to go back. This hotel is right by Michigan Ave. and so there is lots to see and do. Also very close to Millennium Park if you want to go see the bean. I was the first from my company to arrive to the Hyatt, I was confused that check-in was on the 2nd floor but that was okay. I got my room and it was fantastic, newly remodeled and very spacious. Although I did find my curtains open every morning, So who ever works next to the West Tower, I am sorry for the show every morning. I had a conference at this hotel and it was very convenient. I goto many of these conferences and I had more fun at this one because of the setup and location of the Hyatt. I found myself at the Big Bar many of the nights there. They do close early...which is really 2am. The law in Chicago is that people can drink till 4am which I think is crazy in the first place. I ate along Michigan Ave many of times and I loved being so close to everything. Including a Chipolte about a block away for all you addicts out there. I would rate this as one of the best places to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Awesome Room”
Reviews.Author: Jn2jn2
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, the service was excellent. My room was on the 35th floor. Awesome views, clean, quiet and very restful. Location is with walking distance to restaurants & transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: BV74
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a Saturday night with a friend and walked our hearts out! The location is close to awesome shopping, restaurants and best of all, Millenium Park! The room was very well appointed and roomy. Plenty of opportunities to park off property at a lower rate than the hotel. The service was fantastic from the moment we pulled up. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, rooms clean and sizable”
Reviews.Author: Pebblecreek_10
Reviews.Content: We usually make a pilgrimage from Michigan at least twice a year to Chicago. This is our second stay at the Hyatt. The rooms are a nice size, wonderful amenities and the hotel is in a great location just minutes away from the L train. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service (Diamond Member)”
Reviews.Author: Kevman123
Reviews.Content: Situated right at the beginning of the Magnificent Mile on the Chicago River, this hotelâ€™s location is hard to beat. Everyone at the property was super friendly, especially during check in. Jennifer T. checked me and my parents in and she was no doubt one of the friendliest hotel staff members Iâ€™ve come across. Once of the best check in experience weâ€™ve had at a hotel. This is something so easy to do, that costs the hotel nothing; but so few offer this level of warmth and hospitality. PROS: Super Friendly Staff Great Executive Lounge Perfect Location Great Restaurants On-Site Modern/Updated Rooms and Bathrooms CONS: Very large property, so it can take a while to catch an elevator if itâ€™s busy; which it was when we were there Small rooms and bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: alan2955
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been recently updated with new everything. Even the bathtubs were replaced. The hotel lobby and restaurant and bar are all under a glass roof..it is a very nice place to have breakfast or lunch while the sun shines in. The food is rather expensive though. The nearly $15.00 a day a charge for internet is ridiculous, as are the parking fees. The hotel staff was very friendly, and the rooms were very clean. The rooms are on the smallish side though.

Reviews.Title: “Looks new again”
Reviews.Author: NormanDF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in March of 2011. I booked it through Priceline and got a really great deal for the room. When I checked in, I was given two options - a room with two queen beds or a room with one king bed with a view of the lake. I took the second option. Good decision. The room was immaculate and had a contemporary bathroom. The last time I stayed in this hotel was in February of 2009 and the room I got that time looked old. I had read that this particular Hyatt just underwent renovation and the room I stayed in this time indeed shows that - very comfortable bed, big LCD TV, iPhone dock with radio/clock/ alarm, and a modern bathroom. Parking is not free, however, in this hotel. There is a charge of $50/night for parking with in/out privileges. I did notice that there is a public garage two buildings away from the hotel. Cheaper but with no in/out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: goforfun
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just okay, most staff were rude. Just prior to check-in, I saw the ad for up to $175 in hotel credits for 3 to 5 day stay. I asked about the credit at check-in (for my 6 night stay) and was told that you had to book the room at a higher rate to get this promotion. In other words, they would charge more per night for the room in order to provide this "promotional credit". Sounds like bait and switch to me! Only 3 staff members were gracious and kind during our stay; Amber at the front desk, Gustavo in the restaurant and one other server (sorry, can't remember his name). Rooms were small with only 3 drawers for clothing. The minibar took up most of the storage and offered soft drink cans for $4.50each. Breakfast for 2 cost $53 including tip.

Reviews.Title: “A $250/night hotel that's really cheap”
Reviews.Author: wondersn
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I should have known better, but when offered flight and accommodation for a working trip to Chicago I was persuaded against my better judgement to stay in the pre-booked corporate hotel rather than find my own place. This hotel faces onto the river in the downtown area, a good spot for access to the bars and restaurants of the Near North Side (across the river), and Millenium Park & the Art Institute of Chicago a few blocks South. It is huge, although that isn't necessarily a bad thing (I once found the Hyatt in Xian, China to be a virtual island of sanity in a difficult town) and all staff are unfailingly polite and efficient. But it is awful. Turn on the TV (the most ridiculously large plasma screen) and instead of going to the last channel viewed it defaults to a series of screens offering pay-per-view services.Eventually I navigated to the TV channels (very limited in number for such an establishment), but every time I changed channels the TV reverted to the start-up pay-per-view menus. I am fairly sure that had I inadvertantly selected one of these services I would have been charged without recourse to a refund. How can I be so sure? Because it fits the pattern. Do you like to leave a bottle of water or the chocolates you've bought as a present in the minibar fridge? Forget it. Any food, drink or (get this) medication left in the refrigerated mini-bar (which is apparently "not a fridge") gets removed and binned each morning - there's a warning to this extent, together with the generous offer to store all your perishables in the hotel fridge, for a very reasonable $25. I tried to be clever - storing some milk in the minibar overnight and removing it in the morning - but there is clearly some sort of weight monitor, and I was fined $6 for "mini-bar infringement." So to the bed. I gave up sleeping on a foam mattress when I was 8, but in this hotel there is no choice. Not the place to stay if you like a firm bed. Internet: of course the place is wi-fi'd. Many hotels in Chicago seem to offer free wi-fi for residents. I started to log-on and there didn't seem to be any indication that there was a charge: residents are just asked to enter their name and room number. Before doing this I went to the Frequenty Asked Questions, pretty sure that many people would ask "am I being charged for this?" Apparently not, since it didn't feature. So I called down to the front desk. Just as well - I saved myself $15/day. This place exemplifies all that is worst in corporate American hotels. The grasping need to extract every single cent from guests whose rooms (often payed for by other corporate giants) are priced way over their actual value. So, when I say this place is "cheap," I don't mean it in a small way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: auntkrusty
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 2 days at this hotel and can not think of one bad thing. All the staff was very helpful and patient. We are not from the city so it was nice to have the hyatt help us get around. A specail praise goes out to Sarah form the facebook/social media dept. She helped us get a larger room and a welcome treat for our stay. I ihghly recommend checking out the hotel facebook page for extra perks. We would not hesitate to stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: ellemac007
Reviews.Content: The front desk agents are incredibly helpful, courteous, knowledgeable and truly love what they do. If you get the pleasure to stay here - I would ask for Matt by name. He was so helpful to me. He gave me the inside scoop of Millennium park and the surrounding area. Speaking of the area - It is right on the Chicago River, just a nice stroll down (literally) to Michigan Avenue. In between Millennium Park and the Wrigley Building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms, great central location”
Reviews.Author: puzzolente
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms with nicer, more modern decor than many similar places--appears to have undergone a recent remodel. Bathroom had great lighting and decor, though shower a bit wimpy outside of full-on massage blaster mode. Decent flat screen tv, storage. In-room safe too small for most laptops. Comfortable beds with a pillowtop mattress that was on the softer side. Service was friendly and brisk at the desk. I appreciate that the maid insisted on ID when I arrived at my room while it was being cleaned (scary how many places don't). Food in the 151 restaurant was actually pretty good, if typically overpriced. Wouldn't recommend the lobby area bars, which were either crazy packed or devoid of anyone, including bartenders. Convention facilities themselves felt like Reno or Downtown Vegas, hidden away deep in the gold-carpeted bowels of the hotel, a windowless land clearly untouched by the remodel. But for those of us who just show up where we're told, overall a very nice option for the hotel part of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Serivce is unbelieveable!”
Reviews.Author: Rbelcore
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency twice, the first time i was happy with my stay the second time i was thrilled, i want to share my story about my stay the second time. When i stayed the second time i booked the room from my phone about 5 hours before i went. When i arrived there was a podiatrist convention i believe going on and my room actually wasnt available. I asked if i could receive free valet parking or something of the sort. The manager at the front desk replied, "No but i can do you one better." They bumped my room up from a normal king size bed room to a Jr. Sweet on the top floor over looking the river (it was getting dyed green the next day for St. Patty's day). I can not tell you how amazing the room and the view was. This experience alone will have me coming back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Renoir184
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! It is enormous, but the service we received, right from check-in to check-out, was small and personable. We had a problem on check-in as the rooms were not ready by 3:00 p.m., but the front desk looked after us, stored our luggage and then found a new room once 3:00 had come and gone. For our trouble, they treated us to a free buffet breakfast the following morning. The hotel's location is outstanding - 2 minutes from Magnificent Mile, 2 minutes from Millennium Park, 2 minutes from State Street shopping, 5 minutes from Navy Pier - - - can't beat the location. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and will stay there again on our return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception and service!”
Reviews.Author: Gail211
Reviews.Content: I treated my mom to a weekend and Chicago and enjoyed a wonderful time. The staff at the Hyatt was exceptional. I appreciated the warm greeting and help throughout the weekend. Check-in and check-out were made so easy. The bell captain and bellmen were so friendly and helpful. The concierge desk was very helpful providing information about attractions. We had booked a river cruise recommended by the concierge. We had some difficulty finding the dock in time. We went on another nearby cruise, immensely enjoying ourselves. We were able to easily attain a refund on our deposit for the cruise booked through the hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. The hotel was in easy walking distance of Michigan Avenue and other attractions. Inexpensive cab ride to most destinations. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Good representation of the warmth and hospitality of this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, and Chicago is my kind of town”
Reviews.Author: sophielaura
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago from 5/21 through 5/26. On a business trip from the UK, the hotel was spot on. Without exception the staff was A1, very polite, going out of their way to provide great service without being intrusive. Stayed on 29th floor West Wing. Loved the walk in shower, big plus for me as a hate baths, bed was fine and a good nights sleep was had. Stetsons is a fab steak house, and again, the best meat I ate whilst is Chicago. The bars have a good atmosphere with plenty of drinks to choose from. All in all, the hotel was everything I wished for from my trip to the windy city. On the weather front, first day was 90+, last was an advert for the end of the world!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: YAMA0611
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to explore Chicago, and over all experience was good. King size bed was clean and cozy, and room was spacious. We asked if it's possible to stay nicer view room when we checked in, but they told us they would charge us more (I forgot how much). This is a huge hotel mainly for business people, so I didn't expect much, but the bathroom was renovated and nice. What I liked best was the location. It's only 5-10mins walk to "the Bean", and 15-20mins walk to John Hancock Center. There are so many restaurants and shops nearby. What I liked least was that the room was bit too dark, and there's no free internet service in your room. We were told to go to another building to use free internet even though it says "free internet in the lobby" on their website(but we found out later that you could use in the lobby. They just started this service, and workers didn't share the information). Also, there's no fridge to store your own drinks or foods(there's a sign on the fridge says: "we'll charge $25 if you put your foods/drinks). Besides, it's stuffed with lots of drinks, and can't really put anything. Just as other upscale hotels, breakfast is overpriced. I would strongly recommend to use websites which allow you to bit the price. We could get $269 room for only $72(before tax)! (Hotel is no worth of $269, really)

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GonzalezX2
Reviews.Content: From midnight directions to the Hotel by the switchboard operator to the front-desk checkout personnel, the level of personal attention and caring was the absolute best. Also, my wife and I enjoyed a fine dining experiance at the Hotels Stetson Restaurant (the Ribeye is out-of-this-world) and the Regency Club offered a great range of breakfast items and early evening snacks. This Hotel catered to a large convention during our stay there, yet surprsingly, personal attention did not suffer. We would definitely recommend this Hotel for all travelers to the Chicago Loop area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Knowlesitall
Reviews.Content: If you must be downtown or near it, this is a good location. If you're driving in, be aware that overnight parking is $50 with in and out privileges per night. You're walking distance to Michigan Avenue, so there's great shopping nearby. There's also good access to public transportation if you walk a little down State street. Cons: Our bathroom had a funny odor. It smelled as if the area had recently been treated for an insect or rodent problem. The odor persisted for our entire stay of 5 days. Also, we were situated in a corner room near the street. The street noise was mainly noticeable at night, but not too bad. However, the walls are not very thick, because we heard our neighbor in the bathroom on several occasions. Also, I'm assuming because our room was at the very end of the hall, we could not pick up wireless internet service. The bed was somewhat comfortable, but there were always feathers coming out of the pillows. Also, in the bathroom, the towels were very low quality and shed constantly.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: yeti1975
Reviews.Content: stayed here a couple nights for the auto show and thought it was great. the service was wonderful. check in was fast, the room was clean and very nice. the location was nice and the view could not have been better. my wife and i typically dont stay at such a large hotel. this place is more for the business traveler cause its so huge. we stayed here cause of the great rate we got. we will be staying here again in may. no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Chicago -Great location, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: upstateAnnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency. It was our first trip to Chicago and the location couldn't be better. Our room faced the river with a view of the Wrigley Building, the Tribune Tower and the Hancock Building. It was an easy walk to many tourist sights (Millennium & Grant Parks, Art Institute, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier....) - although we like to walk and for some cabs would be a better option. The El (elevated train) is just a few blocks away, inexpensive and easy to navigate; we took the train to and from O'Hare as well as to a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. Check-in and out was smooth and fast. The room was clean and a good size for a city hotel. The Hyatt has a number of restaurants, we had two enjoyable meals in the Irish pub - basic bar food with Guinness on tap - and a good breakfast in the atrium. My husband used the workout facilities, the exercise room is clean and well equipped. The Hyatt is a large hotel, but we found the hustle and bustle in the public areas pleasant enough. The sky walk was an enjoyable spot to drink coffee and read the paper in the morning. We found the staff at the Concierge desk very helpful, they provided maps and suggestions for restaurants and answered our questions cheerfully and fully. We hope to return to Chicago & the Hyatt soon!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago won me over”
Reviews.Author: Mustangdad1961
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Chicago for my 50th birthday celebration. Not a fan of Chicago, I had been "challenged" to change that opinion. The hotel played a great role in helping achieve that. I had a great time! The hotel was centrally located downtown, along the Chicago River and less than a 5-minute walk to Millennium Park, home of the "Bean."
