The hotel is clean. the staff is super friendly, from the doorman and valet to the front desk staff. We had a connecting suite on the top floor. It was awesome! The view of Chicago from the suite was amazing. The facilities were great. The restaurant area was clean. The food was delicious. I recommend this property for any stay in Chicago. And my view of Chicago was changed - can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for downtown with nice service”
Reviews.Author: jenaralee
Reviews.Content: Yep...it's huge, however, we easily navigated the hotel on our first night there. The staff member checking us in couldn't have been more kind and funny. The room was modern and nice for the price. No complaints there! We didn't eat at any of the hotel bars or restaurants...there are too many nice places right around the corner! We didnt go to Chicago to eat in the hotel (except the one night we were so exhausted we ordered pizza in the room.) My only complaint about the entire stay was that when I checked in I realized my credit card was 3 days expired (completely my fault) so I had no choice but to give them my debit card. For some reason they placed a $640 hold on my checking account. When I asked about that they informed me that it was, in fact, an error on their part but there was nothing they could do about it.

Reviews.Title: “Valet are theives”
Reviews.Author: bajastuts
Reviews.Content: For the past couple of years my wife and I stayed at the Hyatt as a tradition to walk down Michigan Ave and see the lights etc at Christmas time, upon arrival you are FORCED to valet your car, at $50 per day... while the hotel stay was okay, when we returned from our weekend getaway, the first business day back, my checking account had been drained, long story short, is the Valet, had gone through the car stolen my identity and cashed checks at a local branch bank cleaning out my checking account... Hotel took no responsibility for it, and eventhough the items were in my glovebox, and the Valet had my keys, they banks wont stand behind you. So beware, if you stay at the hotel and Valet, your more likely to lose more than you gain, Valets their are theives..

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: anchmer
Reviews.Content: Hotwire landed me a well-priced night at the Hyatt Regency. The location is great - very central and easy access to the "L". The hotel is indeed HUGE - if you are looking for a personal touch, this isn't the place. The rooms, however, are clean, of decent size and everything has been recently upgraded (with the exception of the bath tub and some of the fixtures). My only constructive criticism is that the beds were a bit soft (I perfer a firm mattress), and that housekeeping didn't need to knock on my door at 9am to confirm that I was checking out that day and to ask the specific time the room would be free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean and huge hotel. They've got several sections to the hotel, so it's like walking through the airport to get to your room. The service is excellent. One of the gals at a service desk in the West Tower actually checked me in. The room was clean and very nice. I had a king bed, sort of corner room (room 951). One entire wall was windows, almost floor to ceiling. I was near an elevator, so that caused a bit of night time noise, but not much. Overall, the hotel is very quiet. Special marks for the bathroom. I loved it. Spacious shower/tub, marble floors, backlit mirrors, and very large. One other good point about such a large hotel is that they have a huge lobby bar. I walked by and thought it was a concert. There was dueling pianos, dancing people, and plenty of libations going around. Looked like a really fun place if you wanted to stay close for the night. As far as attractions, well, it's right corner to Michigan Ave and just across the river from the whole River North area. If you can't find something to do there, well...then you don't need this review. The only low mark I'd give would be regarding the hotel's proximity to parking. There is public parking close by, but it's easy to get yourself twisted around on Lower Wacker or Michigan Ave searching for it. Overall, I'd say this is a great hotel for just about anyone's needs. Whether you be traveling alone like me, for business, or with your family, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dmbakerphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt for a weekend trip to Chicago. Driving in to Chicago in the evening was beautiful but navigating the city downtown by car can be quite confusing. I would definately recommend valet parking the car and using city transportation or go it on foot to get around rather than driving. The rooms were clean and spacious. Our room did not have a mini-bar or refrigerator and I found the ice machine on the 11 floor was not dispensing ice. The consierge was helpful in booking at segway tour and in providing us maps and directions for using the "L" to several unknown sites in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room big hotel”
Reviews.Author: galway85
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April. Our room was very nice and newly renovated. Six lifts so no long wait, you had to have a room key to use the lift after 10.30pm. Very large hotel so staff appeared not to be aware what was going on expect in there own area, Front desk staff could not tell me opening hours for the bars or restaurants. As it is such a big hotel it has no atmosphere. Booked this hotel on Hotwire so got a bit of value would have been disappointed if I had paid full Price.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Terminal Airport Food”
Reviews.Author: deepchi
Reviews.Content: Lousy Food! Cramped rooms. Infrastructure doesn't support large numbers of clientale. Good locations however! I would avoid!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: iluv2travl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hyatt Regency, booked on Hotwire for a total rate of $105.29 . Room was comfortable, good beds,flat screen tv, desk and office chair (no other seating in room) coffee maker (the new pod one that makes a cup at a time and only two pods= 2 cups of coffee) good sized bathroom with good lighting and the first time I have seen toothpaste as one of the amenities in the bathroom. The view was one of the other towers of the hotel facing us. The restaurants were all very pricey so we didn't eat at any of those. This is basically a hotel for business people, The teens would have been happier with a pool and with something for breakfast before we headed out for the day.If you get a good price it is a good location for everything in downtown Chicago with a bus stop right outside the entrance. I would stay at this hotel again, but probably not with teens or younger children. I like to have breakfast at the hotel before we start the day, and this hotel the breakfast was too pricey, I would prefer the breakfast be included with the room rate as some other hotels do. So basically, it was a good place to sleep for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Foo_ong
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been recently remodeled, the room is clean and modern looking. We had a great stay here for the 3 nights we were at Chicago. The location is very good because it's only 20min walking distance to most downtown hot spots. I guess my only complain is they put us close to the laundry room and it's a bit noisy, but since we were so tired after a long day so it doesnt bother us that much. Also, the staff in the morning are much nicer than at night, they recommended us where to go for food and sightsee while the staff at night seem like they had a long day and all they want to do is rushing to check us in.

Reviews.Title: “This is less like a hotel and more like an airport”
Reviews.Author: corklevy
Reviews.Content: This may be the biggest hotel I've ever stayed in. It was a little overwhelming. Don't go here if you're looking for a boutique experience. There are electronic kiosks for check-in if you want to bypass the front desk. There were people crawling all over the place at all hours. There's a couple of restaurants, a gift shop, a convenience store-type area, et al. However, I had a positive experience. Our room was spacious and clean with a nice view. The guy who helped us check in was personable and seemed interested in us. The location is outstanding - close to Millennium Park, the Magnificent Mile, the EL train, etc. I also got a fantastic deal ($55/night + taxes) on an online hotel site, which made me like the Hyatt better than the Fairmont, which was next door but about $175/night more expensive for not much more.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night using a $99 Hotwire deal. Did not experience any of the 2nd class customer attitude you sometimes come across in these situations. The beds at this hotel are heavenly! Extremely comfortable. Classy bathroom, nice ambiance through entire hotel. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Dismal and depressing.”
Reviews.Author: Danraydan
Reviews.Content: Just checked in after 3 hour wait. Used a diamond suite upgrade. Got the junior suite with the junior bathroom. One sink, no bathtub, few drawers, one robe, 4 hangers. Wife called for more of everything. No place to move in the bathroom and this is the supposedly remodeled section. This is really a room for one person Regency club also closet size. I guess we're spoiled by park hyatt Asia and hyatt place locally. We just came from staying at a Hampton Inn room, much better, especially bathroom much nicer. Unless you get a great price I'd stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ref_316
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago was for a conference. The room was quite comfy, but the pillows were not to my liking. They were lumpy & super soft. The room was clean as was the rest of the hotel. The hotel staff was very courteous & helpful throughout my stay. The hotel location was perfect for exploring downtown Chicago, Navy Pier, & the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the Noisiest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: AuburnWine
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here for a conference, so my room is paid for. The list price seems very high for what one gets. My one overwhelming complaint is the noisiness of the elevator in the east tower. They moved me once, and were very gracious, but it sounds like a train is running through the back wall. Surely, they could have done a better job with the acoustics!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price and a good stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC_EM
Reviews.Content: We booked via Hotels.com and picked a price and area of the city where we wanted to stay and then Hotels.com selected the hotel. This hotel was a wonderful value. Low price, big rooms, beautiful view facing north (we were on the 34th floor) and a big bathroom. Perfect for 2 people. Location is also close to the bar and restaurants across the river. Taxi ride is only 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: We had a small business meeting at the hotel and found the staff to be friendly and extremely helpful throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: pharmboyak
Reviews.Content: Nice room, poor view but what do you expect in a city. Great location, close to the Loop and the Magnificent Mile. Big Bar is a great place to entertain although pricey. Big disappointment is that our room was not attended to and cleaned during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and value - room was fair”
Reviews.Author: Snoweater
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is in a fantastic location. Like most places, there are ups and downs: Service - Fantastic. From the front desk to the the concierge to the doorman and room service - all employees encountered were professional and accomodating. And downright nicer than they had to be. In fact, when I told the front desk that it was my friend's birthday, he 'upgraded' us to a renovated room, and sent up a bottle of champers. Nice! Rooms - Meh. We were put in a room that was 'recently renovated'. It was functional, but there was a lot of wear and tear seen in the wallpaper, walls, doors, windows - things that would not typically be replaced in a renovation. The bed was also an 'upgraded pillow top', but it was no Heavenly Bed. My friend had problems sleeping saying that the bed was too hard. Paid internet connection was sketchy and slow, but I was able to work with it. Location - Fabulous. Walking distance to Millinium Park, theaters and great restaurants, Food - Room service was great - timely, delicious and presented nicely. The bartenders at the Big Bar in the lobby were friendly and efficient. Cost - I got a great deal at Hotwire. In fact, it was much cheaper (about 50%) than the Hampden Inn that we were going to be staying at for a wedding in south side. Overall experience - The Hyatt has done well selecting customer-facing staff and training customer service. This is a huge hotel (over 2000 rooms), but it didn't feel over-crowded (well, except at the bar on a Thursday). I would say that for a 3 star property? Its amazing. As a 4 star? Its ok - the staff really improves the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not very clean, dark, depressing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hongdemao
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The first room I was given faced a high rise across the street and realized that no sunlight would ever reach the dark room. I was able to switch to a better location and the room had some sunlight. The room was renovated, but the design was too dark. The dark wood only served to highlight the dust on all surfaces. The renovation was only superficial, because the door frames and baseboards were dirty looking/ rusty. The tub had permanent dark spots and gouges (which I first thought were hairs, but realized were deep scratches). The closet carpet had dust bunnies. The hallways were dim. However, the bed was comfortable and clean. The room had connecting doors to both rooms adjacent to it, so I could hear all the conversations/ tv programs going on in those rooms. Luckily, they were business people and went to bed at an early hour. The location was excellent, convenient to many great restaurants and Miracle Mile. The location made the stay worthwhile, even though the room was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at McCormack Place and the conference set up a special rate with this hotel. The staff were very friendly on check in and the hotel was clean and quiet. Just a couple of observations 1. There is no pool. If I am away with the kids a pool is essential! No pool is ok for business, but with kids it's a no no! 2. The Internet is $13. Happily we were comped our Internet on check in. If you sign up to a gold passport (which is free) you get free net. Other people have commented that the Internet is not stable, I did not find this. I ran both FaceTime and Skype without an issue. The updating of the hotel has been largely a success, I would happily come back to this hotel if I am in Chicago on business.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been treated this well!”
Reviews.Author: bardicwench
Reviews.Content: After a frustrating month, a bad break-up & surgery, I decided to take a week's vacation to Chicago. Being short on funds for an entire week's stay, I decided to go through Priceline. Luckily, my bid was accepted by the Hyatt Regency Chicago. As a Priceline customer, I expected a basic room without a view. But I was still excited because the location was wonderful, so I posted on the Hyatt Regency Chicago's FB page letting them know that I was coming for my birthday. To my surprise, when I checked in, I given a gorgeous room with a view, my Hyatt Gold Passport number was written down for me (since I always forget it) and I was offered late checkout. Yes, I know that late checkout is pretty standard for Gold Passport members, but I didn't expect it since I reserved through Priceline. After getting settled in my room, I went out for dinner, and came back to a birthday card and some yummy treats for my birthday! I have NEVER had a hotel even acknowledge my birthday before, let alone leave a surprise for me. Throughout my entire week stay, I was treated wonderfully. Housekeeping was excellent, and I got fresh towels every day even when they were hung up. I never had to worry about my safety, and I love the security of needing a room key to use the elevator after 10:30pm. The room was quiet, the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and hotel staff was always polite and cheerful. The hotel is located in a great place as well. Just south of the Chicago River and east of Michigan Ave, you can walk to just about everywhere... and if you can't, there are multiple CTA stops within walking distance (for all CTA lines!) and the buses are easy to catch. The Theater District is just southwest of the hotel, the Magnificent Mile starts west and heads north, and just about any type of restaurant you would ever want is right there. Navy Pier is also within walking distance or you can take a short bus ride. I adored this hotel and will stay here in the future! It was a wonderful week... and to cap it off and make it perfect, my best friend & I started became a couple during out vacation together. This was literally the best vacation I have ever had, and the Hyatt was a big part of why it was special.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a View”
Reviews.Author: OntheroadMom57
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Friday, April 8th at the Hyatt Chicago to celebrate my daughter's 20th birthday. We were greeted warmly by Isabella at the check in desk. We were given as requested a double and Isabella made sure it had the perfect view of the Chicago River. She was wonderful to us. The hotel is perfectly situated to enjoy all Chicago has to offer within walking distance. We did awake to protesters but once you saw what they were protesting about you wanted to join. It had nothing to do with the Hyatt but issues facing all American's and were joining as one and that was the slogan, "We are One". We shopped, we dined, we had big fun all over Chicago from the hotel to Greektown and much more. We checked out with the friendly Cassandra and stored our bags for one last tour of the city. Millennium Park was right outside their door and more. We went on to our second hotel to finish our stay but can not wait to return to the Hyatt. Two conventions were happening but it was still quiet and the bar will blow your soxs off as well as their in house restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: B0710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for only 1 night over spring break week. We really loved the hotel. It is very large a bit confusing where to go at first, but once you find your way, it's great! Location: The location is fantastic. It overlooks the river and is within walking distance from many things (Navy Pier, Millennium Park, etc). We walked numerous places to and from the hotel with a 4-year-old in tow and it was great! Rooms. The rooms are very nice. They were spacious, had a large bathroom, nice beds, pillows, etc. Very quiet too, considering it's prime location. Negatives: The parking at the hotel is $50 a night, which I think is a little ridiculous. We did not have to park a car, but if we had I would have parked in one of the nearby common parking areas, as they were much cheaper. Also, we booked our room on a discount online retailer and got it for right around $100 with tax. I tried to add another night to our stay and all of the discount sites said it was sold out. I checked the hotel website and the price was $225! It was a great hotel for $100, but I personally would not have paid $225, even for such a nice place. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and we would definitely stay there again for a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: Mego78
Reviews.Content: We took our chances and booked a four-star hotel in Chicago through Priceline. We have never failed to strike a great deal this way. This time, we low-balled it and booked two rooms because traveling with teen boys, we all wanted our space. (You can't book suites through Priceline.) We were surprised and thrilled to book the Hyatt. When we arrived at the hotel around 3 p.m. we simply requested two rooms with a door connecting them. We wound up with a beautiful two-room suite. The boys each had their own queen bed PLUS an allergy-free room upgrade and their own full bath and huge flat-panel TV. We had a comfy murphy bed and a spacious room with a cocktail table and a coffee table and plenty of funky chairs and lounges, plus our own huge flat-panel TV. Just a shower in our bath but the lighting and back-lit mirrors were really cool. Beds, bedding and pillows were luscious and we slept great. Nice view, too! Location was convenient. People were ultra kind and accommodating. Would book this again!

Reviews.Title: “Unusable internet ruins otherwise quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: yangsta
Reviews.Content: I spend about 10 nights at the Hyatt Regency Chicago out of the 200 nights a year I spend in hotels for business and for pleasure, so it's pretty easy for me to compare and contrast. The Hyatt Regency Chicago has a good location on the river, far enough from the raucous crowds but close enough to walk almost anywhere in the loop and river north. This is a very large property, with separate East and West towers (you have to take the elevator down to concourse to get from one to the other) and many conference facilities. The rooms are well-furnished and modern. Lighting is good, the TV screens are large, and there's been a full-length mirror in every room I've tried. Unfortunately, with the exception of the hypo-allergenic "PURE" rooms, room surfaces can be very dusty and unappealing. The in-room furniture (desk chair and day chair) are reasonable but not extremely comfortable. The staff is generally friendly but can be overwhelmed at peak times. The common areas are well-staffed with people to help you with your luggage and get you on your way. As I mentioned in my title, the one problem that spoils this otherwise decent hotel is the in-room "high-speed" internet service. The past few times I've stayed here, I've consistently been unable to maintain a connection with enough speed to adequately read web pages, load email, and chat on instant messenger. I can't even dream about getting on VPN for work, video chat with family, or stream any videos -- it just doesn't work! One night, in-room internet at the entire property wasn't working. For a hotel that caters to many business travelers, I honestly don't know how they get away with it. If you need to use the internet during your stay, stay away from the Hyatt Regency Chicago (until they fix it).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice room, no problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: cworld26
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Hyatt via Hotwire and got it for $80 per night for two nights. Had a business seminar for two days in the Loop and brought my sister along for shopping and fun. We called ahead to see about an early check in and letting my sister check in as I had to go right to the seminar. No problem--she was all checked in before 10 AM even though check-in is posted as 3 PM. The room (19th floor of West Tower) was very nice and clean. Our view was okay--mainly of an office building but you could see the Wrigley Building if you stretched your neck. Comfy beds, decent size, nice decor, and nice bathroom (even if the lighting was horrible). No complaints at all about the room, and we were really only there to sleep! The only bad thing about this hotel is the PARKING! SERIOUSLY!!!! $50 per night is ridiculous. We parked right next door at another ramp in a condo building for $30 per night. Still expensive but much more reasonable, at least according to Chicago standards! Location is perfect--close to both the Loop and the Mag Mile/River North. You can walk everywhere if you wear comfortable shoes. As far as facilities, we really didn't use any. The bar looked cool, but we ate and drank elsewhere. Internet was not included so we just used our smartphones if we needed anything online. There was no pool, which might disappoint some--especially families. I'd stay here again! Some people I met at my work seminar got their room for $60 on priceline a few days ahead of time. I had booked my room several weeks in advance. Next time I'll wait! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: JeffAPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Just completed my stay as I was there this past Thursday. The whole staff was wonderful beginning with Jennifer helping me plan my trip and letting me know of sites in the area. Once we checked in, there was one little mishap but they quickly corrected it and things were smooth. The view from the room was great, the beds were comfortable, the buffet was delicious, and again, all the staff was extremely helpful and polite. You are right in the middle of the city so everything is close as well. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: blueribbon_98
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago at 9 a.m. for a conference starting the next day, and were able to check into our rooms at that time without having previously made arrangments to do so. The staff was friendly and very accommodating throughout the hotel. The rooms were clean and the meeting facilities were execellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, newly remodeled room, very quiet, great staff”
Reviews.Author: nottheone
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at this hotel. Location is great, staff are excellent. The rooms have been remodeled since the last time I was there. We had a very nice (standard-type) room on the 20th floor. It was super quiet, even though I know the hotel was very full. I would definitely stay here again, even if it weren't being paid for by my company.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Alright Value”
Reviews.Author: summerhydrangea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance of numerous sights of the city. There is plenty of access to public transportation, as well. So, it is great for people wanting to experience/explore Chicago. The room itself was fairly clean except for being very dusty (the alarm clock, the tables, even the toilet paper holder had a thick layer of dust). The room was decorated nicely and had plenty of space. I had a room on the 31st floor with a crummy view of construction, but someone else in my group had a suite on the 20th floor with an amazing view, so that is obviously very hit or miss. I came to this hotel as part of a conference. The conference center was spacious, and the food served to us during the conference was good. The temperature in the conference area of the hotel was usually way cold or way warm, though. Overall, I would recommend this to people on business or people here on pleasure with extra money to spend. If I came back on pleasure, I wouldn't pay the price for the fact the extras like internet and food on premise are pretty exorbitant. I didn't pay for my room, so it was a good place to stay with that consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: hoosier16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and concurred with several of the other review of this hotel, however, on this trip I was pleasantly surprised by the level of service we received. To me the down side of this hotel is size and price. This place is huge and if you come with a convention like we did, you will fight a lot of people. Also, price is an issue. We chose not to drive, but took the bus to Chicago to avoid the parking fees at Hyatt. I find it ironic that Greyhound Express will give you wi fi for free and Hyatt charges $14 a day. We stayed on the club level which was not much of an upgrade in price from the regular rates. It was worth the price. The Regency Club had excellent food and amenities (including computer access for free) and the room had been refurbished and was very nice. Again a big surprise from previous visits. This hotel is not my first choice in Chicago, but the location is good and for a super big hotel the level of service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “I cant believe the Hyatt wants to charge $13.63 per day for internet.”
Reviews.Author: joseph_scott71
Reviews.Content: I just checked into the Hyatt Regency Chicago (East Wacker Dr) first the welcome omg i wanted to turn around imedieately and find another hotel. the entrance and reception is enoungh to make me not want to stay here. then i get to my room and find out the Hyatt wants to charge $13.63 per day for internet. What day and age are we living in when they want to charge for this. I havent had a hotel charge me for internet in years. Wont be staying at a Hyatt. Anytime soon. Especially in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “It's getting better all the time”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review of the Hyatt Regency a few months ago, but felt compelled to write another on my recent return visit to Chicago. This time I stayed in one of the renovated West Tower rooms, and I've got to give the hotel its props. The Hyatt rooms have always been spacious by downtown Chicago standards, but the makeover makes them seem even more so. The new rooms have an elegant modern minimalist look, without taking it to annoying extremes like some boutique hotels. The room furniture is sleekly elegant, and the flat-screen TVs are nice. The bathrooms too have gotten the mod makeover, with cool sinks. (My only gripe is the awkward placement of the toilet paper spool.) My big king bed was a tad bit firm but overall very comfortable, and the Hyatt thankfully has taken away a few of the pillows they tossed on the bed in the older rooms. (There were way too many). The public areas are as busy as they ever were, but for such a big hotel check-in is a relative breeze and service is about as efficient as it can be. I didn't eat at any of the in-house restaurants (I never do) but there are plenty of them. Location wise, the hotel is in a prime spot about a block from Michigan Avenue on the south side of the Chicago River. It's connected to the Illinois Center and its ersatz collection of fast-food outlets and offices. If you're smart and taking transit, the CTA Jackson bus (no. 6) and several rush hour-only buses stop right across from the hotel entrance at Wacker & Stetson. The numerous bus lines that use Michigan Avenue are a block away, and the Wabash/Randolph & State/Lake CTA stations are about 4 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lapabear
Reviews.Content: It was one of the most enjoyable experiences in a hotel! We got a room with the view on the lake through a big glass window! Room was clean, bed comfortable and staff was extremely friendly! Hotel was beautiful inside!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK, but not one of Chicago's best.”
Reviews.Author: CBT_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge and somewhat impersonal but is perfectly nice as are the rooms. Everything was very clean, but you pay dearly for everything else. $50 per night for parking, $3 for 10 minutes of internet. I have never stayed in a four star that did not offer complimentary internet. To make matters worse, I paid for the internet and it was slower than dial-up from 10 years ago. I complained and a staff member allowed me to use the computer in her office which I thought was very kind. I was also not impressed as rooms with views cost extra. Isn't the customer as a matter of practice supposed to get the best room available of the type which has been reserved? So if there are lots of empty double queens should the customer get one with no view or one that has a view? I can't get my head around this no matter how much I try. Location is good, just a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue. As for parking there are nearby lots with overnight rates as low as $13. I wouldn't say that I can't recommend this hotel but keep in mind that there's plenty to pick from in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: shira-eliora
Reviews.Content: I believe that the hotel rooms and parts of the lobby have been updated since my last stay 6 years ago. I cannot recall a time I experienced such excellent customer service. The staff was warm, helpful and kind. Even as a priceline guest they were able to accomodate my needs with a room near the elevator. I loved the rooms...the lighting, the beds were the most comfortable that I've ever experienced at a hotel and the bath products have the best scent ever (Hawaian ginger, I believe). Gorgeous skyline views on the upper floors, easy access to restaurants and stores in the Illinois Center through an indoor walkway. While the food at the hotel is fresh, creative, abundant, my only complaint is the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: sheckleremporium
Reviews.Content: A group of us travelled to Chicago for the weekend. We had three rooms booked - two with 2 queen size beds and one with a single King. This combination was not available on one floor when we arrived but the check in staff was very helpful in changing it to 2 deluxe doubles. She was very friendly and service oriented. Staff was friendly. A lot of time was spent in the bar which was fun and had great service. Rooms were clean. Hotel is close to everything in the downtown area and the pricing was reasonable. I would definately stay there again. Downside - wish they had free internet! It is true there are rooms that look directly into other rooms, if you are a voyeur make sure you ask for one of these ones !

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: tenabeana
Reviews.Content: Booked the room through priceline and paid $82 with taxes and fee. Great room, close to everything. Taxis right out the door. Didn't use parking because we took the train and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again, Worth every Penny”
Reviews.Author: emiliaP1
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, worth the price, room was clean, in room computer was a huge bonus...loved it. Traveling from Upstate NY and looking forward to returning to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Hotel in a Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference at this hotel. The room was clean and nice. I would stay here again when my conference is at the hotel if I can another good rate. The front desk was very accomodating and let us delay our checkout until after the end of our conference. I appreciated their generosity. Please note that this is a very big hotel. We had quite a walk to a different tower to get to our room. However, this is not all that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: cms531
Reviews.Content: We live in Milwaukee and make quick weekend trips down to Chicago often, always just booking from Priceline the day before with whatever hotel gives me the best price for the area I want. Was able to get our room at the Hyatt for $60/night which I thought was reasonable, especially for downtown Chicago. We stayed on the 30th floor of the new/updated east towers and really liked the room. It was medium-sized, nice view, and the bathroom was clean and decent size. We couldn't hear the other rooms but could hear loud people walking down the hallway during the day and at night - for this reason I would recommend that you request a room as far away from the elevator banks as possible. I read a lot of other reviewers complaining about the cost of the valet ($50/night) but it's downtown Chicago and that's a very standard rate for valet. We looked up parking locations ahead of time and ended up parking literally right next door to the Hyatt for $30/night (again, typical rate for Chicago overnight). However, in this day and age it is just expected that hotels will offer free wireless in rooms - not worth the $20 charge in my mind. Also if you want a real "view" of the city then you'll be charged an extra $20/night as well but since we didn't plan on spending much time in the room we opted not to have that added. Oh and two great restaurants are Vivere on Monroe Street - fantastic food (gnocchi is literally the best we've ever had) and Friend's Sushi on Rush, yummy! If you are looking for just a basic hotel in a central location then this is a nice spot. I would not however pay more then $90/night for this hotel - again wait until a day or two before your trip and book through Priceline. There are ALWAYS open hotel rooms somewhere in Chicago!! Any questions about either the hotel or Chicago feel free to private message me, I'm happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nickeled and dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: Jwanderer57
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with beautiful views. It was very clean, the staff was friendly, the room was very comfortable, and the bathroom was roomy. The only complaint we had was the amount of fees and how high they were. We were excited to stay here until we walked in to find we had to pay $50 for parking. With very little if any available parking in the area you are virtually guaranteed to be over a barrel and have no choice but to pay this fee. This truly put a damper on the one night we spent in Chicago. After paying this astronomical fee with much reluctancy, we decided to just forget about it and enjoy our stay. We then arrived to our room to find that even after the price of the room and the $50 parking fee, we would have to pay another $20 for wifi (which we did not). Again, this was a beautiful hotel with fantastic views, but short of water/electricity, basic television and an iron, you have to pay separate fees for everything. After this experience we have no intention of ever staying at another Hyatt. If you are visiting without a car and don't mind paying $20 here and there for extras, this can be a very nice hotel, but if you are driving, without a doubt find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU VALUE YOUR MONEY AND SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: blitzh4106
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this hotel after reading generally positive reviews but was disappointed by the service, value, and PARKING! First of all, if avoidable, do not bring or rent a car in Chicago. Parking is absolutely ridiculous. Parking at this hotel is $50 a night! And when we called to get our car, the valet people were looking at us expecting a tip! How outrageous! If you think about it, you're basically paying $50 a night for the car to sit there. We spent more on parking than food, gas, and entertainment combined. The staff was also rude. When we questioned the guy at the front desk about parking, he looked at us like we were cheap and from a different world. Secondly, the sleep quality at this hotel is horrible. You can hear everything your neighbor is doing at 2 AM. If the neighbors adjacent to your room are having a loud party at 2 AM, you will be woken up by their obnoxious behavior. My boyfriend had to go down to the front desk and ask the guy at the front desk to tell them to quiet down. He was obviously unhelpful, however, so he got security involved. Lastly, the price of food in this hotel is absolutely absurd. We were looking at the breakfast menu...$5.75 for cereal with milk! Excuse me, can I get the rest of the cereal box and gallon of milk for that price? The fine print at the bottom says that "a delivery charge of $3.75 and a service charge of 15%" will be added to the cost. So basically, you're paying over $10 for cereal and milk. Also expect to pay $14 per day for internet service. And there is no refrigerator to put food or drinks in! AWFUL! How do these people sleep at night?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: momx4WI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency twice in the last few months. The first time we got it through Hotwire and stayed on Black Friday. The staff was very friendly, the hotel lobby was bustling, and the hotel was in a great location for shopping on Michigan Ave. and State Street. We stayed in the East Tower in a very nice, big room with partial views of the city. The room was clean and the view was fantastic - we even had a few drinks on the couch looking out the window before supper. Our room was right behind the elevator (which made a swoshing noise all night long) however, we didn't complain because we loved our view so much. We had such a nice time that my husband went on Hotwire (hot rate) again and again got the Hyatt Regency for my birthday. I was so excited to stay at this hotel again because of our first experience. However, this time we were SO disappointed. Our room was in the West Tower overlooking an office building and when sitting on the chair by the window you could see right into another hotel guests room and see them laying on their bed! The room was small (and it was a handicap room). The bathroom was HUGE but there was NOWHERE to put our things. Okay, so we didn't get a great view and the room was smaller - no biggie - but the room was dirty. You could tell that this room was not vacuumed after the last guests and the nooks and crannies (like under the curtains, wall base, behind the doors, under the desk) had not been vacuumed in months. Near the bathroom door there was a big toenail cllpping! DISAPPOINTED! Once again, the hotel staff was very nice and the lobby was happening. Once you pay the Hotwire rate and then the HUGE parking fee - this hotel is NOT worth the $$$ if put in a room like we had in January!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sutanuka
Reviews.Content: The worst Hyatt experience ever by far !!!!! My husband's a diamond member and never ever have we had such a horrible experience at any Hyatt across the world( not just USA!!). The service sucks!!! No attention to Diamond members (wonder what happens to regular cutomers). Have to call to ask for room cleaning and some guy at the front desk named Sang tells me "oh! You know about the green movt.!!" what ??!! Is he kidding me??? Stay here just to sleep and location but spend more time outdoors!! But thanks to Rocco the Asst. Manager who will take care o you if you have a complaint !!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, if underwhelming, weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrbigjerk
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago does a lot of things very well...they just don't do anything exceptional. Check-In was quick and pleasant...the doormen, parking valets and desk clerks did their job in a professional manner. Luckily we booked a package with complimentary valet for only $20 over the discount room rate, so we got a break on the $50 dollar a day parking charge (wow!). The room itself was comfortable, but not remarkable. The beds were nice, the linens were nice quality, and the room featured a nice desk work area and a large Panasonic flat screen television. With that being said, the room could've used a little deep cleaning. The area behind the nightstand obviously hadn't been tended to in awhile, and on our final night we found a disgusting brownish substance on the wall behind a curtain. The bathroom was large and very clean...and was the best part of the room. The bathroom felt very modern, and the standard amenities were provided. Overall, the room was quiet with hallway noise barely discernable. We dined one night in Bistro 151. The food was good, if typically high priced. The service was well intended, but spotty. We frequently had to remind our server to bring requested condiments, utensils and drinks that were ordered. Sincere apologies followed, but at some point getting it right the first time would've been more appreciated. I love the location of the Hyatt....convenient to the Magnificent Mile, Theater District and Navy Pier. With that being said, there are several other "big hotels" located in the same vicinity, that offer essentially the same lodging experience and levels of service. My advice would be check the Hyatt, the Westins, Swissotel, Intercontinental, even the Hotel Sax and shop for the best deal. I've been fortunate enough to stay in all of them, and they all provide a nice stay with few surprises, good or bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for one night. Our room was in the West Tower on the 12th floor. The room had 2 queen beds. There was not a comforter on the bed rather it was double sheeted. I was glad that there was an extra blanket in the closet. It would have been nice to at least have a duvet. The toiletries were nothing special. I had to use a lot of shampoo to get a nice lather. The shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water which was a plus. I have nothing bad to say about the Hyatt but expected more than what I got. If you are looking for the "wow" factor then I think you will be disappointed at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if your not driving a car.”
Reviews.Author: ABQLyon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Two blocks to the "Loop" and "Mag. Mile" shopping, with views of the city/river or lake. Large complex, stretched over two blocks, into East and West towers. I stayed in west tower with city views on 23rd floor. Ample rooms with plenty of space. View rooms will require an additional $20/night upcharge. I found it to be worth the $. The major drawback here is the $50/ night valet or $30/night self park fees. Parking anywhere downtown is expensive , and the Hyatt falls right in line with outrageous parking fees charged across the board in the area. Aside from parking, I would definately recommend the Hyatt Regency Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention-type Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WVMountaineerinIL
Reviews.Content: Great location on Wacker. Clean. Staff efficient & helpful. We had a good breakfast at the Corner Bakery which is right across Michigan. Had dinner at Rosebud on Rush. One drawback - The West Tower entrance of the hotel is not always staffed. I noticed it in the evening. If I was traveling alone I would only use the East Tower entrance. Also, parking is a bit high - $50.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dancer9265
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Hyatt was good for New Years but I wouldn't pay more then $100 a night to stay there. It's not as glamorous as most Hyatt's but still very clean, rooms were nice, and great location! However, I didn't like the fact all the bars and pubs and steakhouse was closed down during the Holidays. They should have picked a better time to close them down and renovate. Also, parking was $50 a night at the hotels and only $25 right around the corner at Millennium Parking garages.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: kristopherowens
Reviews.Content: hyatt regency is located on wacker. if you're not familiar with chicago, it is really close (about a 3 minute walk) to michigan avenue and all the shopping. it is also equally close to the loop (central downtown chicago) and millenium and grant parks. the hotel was very clean, check-in was a breeze with self check-in kiosks, and the rooms were very modern and clean. we had a great view of the river and the wrigley building in the west tower. i had no complaints, and look forward to staying there again on a trip to chicago. only downsides, parking at the hotel was $50.00/night. but that's most hotels in the area. and wi-fi was $14.00 for 24 hours. a little silly if you ask me. besides, walk a block or so north, and there's a starbucks at the intercontinental hotel that has free wi-fi. as does the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gutes Hotel, gleich am Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: SWH2010
Reviews.Content: This large high-end hotel is located next to Chicago's big shopping street, the magnificent mile. The hotel has a great bar looking out over the skyscraper skyline of the city, a good way to start or end the evening! Cocktails are excellent. Rooms are spacious and the bed is divine to sleep in. King size beds are truly king size! The bathroom is neat and spacious as well. The hotel houses a separate Starbucks brewing coffee shop. Service is fine, staff are very kind and appreciative of your patronage. Very close to millennium park and Navy pier as well, so great for nice walks in the city. Top location hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made mistakes, but more than made up for it”
Reviews.Author: D3swooshG
Reviews.Content: The West Tower is entirely newly renovated and the entire East Tower, except the lobby (which has already been renovated), is currently undergoing renovations and is closed. What has already been renovated is beautiful, everything you'd expect from a 4-star hotel in a major city. Booked this hotel for 3 nights at $55/night + tax on Priceline. Check-in was fast and easy, and the room was a very good size and well-appointed. They even provide complimentary brand-name toothpaste in the room, which in my experience is rare. The initial problem was that they put us in a room with a connecting door to the adjacent room, which happened to host a screaming baby. I went down that evening to ask for a room change, but they were full that night and offered to move all our bags into a new room the next day while we were out as long as we had all our stuff packed. They also gave us $50 hotel credit on any food and beverages. The baby had stopped crying when we returned to the room to go to sleep, so no problem. In the morning we packed all our stuff and before leaving the hotel I went by the desk to double check that the move was in order. Yep, our new room would be set up with all our stuff after 3pm. We return at 6pm, and they haven't gotten us a new room or moved our stuff. I got quite angry as I had even double-checked the move. They were extremely apologetic, got a manager right on it, upgraded us to a deluxe room on the top floor, and gave us access to the Regency Club. They really bent backwards to make up for their mistake. To tell you the truth, it was really worth the 15 minutes it took at the desk and to move to the new room. So for $199 for 3 nights including taxes, we got great service (after the initial mistakes), a deluxe room, $50 hotel credit, and access to the Regency Club. It would be better if they didn't make the mistakes in the first place (or maybe in our case not....), but they really do try to make their guests' stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little concern about safety”
Reviews.Author: jgrandpa
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Chicago and stayed in a great hotel, Hyatt. Nice location and staff. The only complaint was that twice from 7am-11am, someone else had a key to our door because they opened it twice as I had to slam the door shut because I thought an intruder was coming in. I would recommend this hotel overall if you don't mind being scared to death at 7am from a nice sleep in room 2118/West Tower. Our stay was on 12-30-2010

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkiegirl
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was informed that they were out of non-smoking rooms that were clean. After about 10 minutes, I was informed I would be upgraded to a premium floor and room. I asked if I would have access to amenities included staying on one of the executive level and was told no, but when I asked if it was possible, I was told they could add access to the Regency Club complimentary. I got to my room which had a great view of the water but was unimpressed with the room itself. It was nice, but nothing really special. The Regency Club was good and I enjoyed breakfast and cocktail hour and it was a major plus to have the free wifi and business center within the club. I think for the price, there are better and more luxurious options in Downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Skister04
Reviews.Content: Incredible! My Fiance and I decided to have a night in the city for our anniversary. We stay at the Hyatt and It was fantastic! We were able to book the hotel on priceline for under $100!! We were able to check-in at a kiosk and choose the type of room, and floor that we wanted!! We had a beautiful view of Navy Pier, the Chicago river and the lake on the 21st floor. All in all It was an amazing time for a good price. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pingoMontreal
Reviews.Content: Just what you can expÃªct from Hyatt great service well located friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - nice location”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This is all you should expect from a Hyatt Regency: - Great location - Great discrete service - Nicely furnished room - Clean, fresh smell, comfy beds - Pricey add-ons (internet, breakfast, bar...)

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of an facelift”
Reviews.Author: brooksie22
Reviews.Content: The hotel boasts a great location, connection to the conference centre but the rooms are dreadful and need a major overhaul!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Experience at Mega-Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knoxmarlow
Reviews.Content: I'm a Chicagoland native and was returning home for a high school reunion. I lived in Chicago for years, but this was my first experience at a downtown hotel. We got a relatively good price during a busy week through a Priceline bid. The Hyatt Regency is gigantic and enormous = ginormous. However, the size did not diminish our experience. We navigated the hotel with no problem, and the overall experience was satisfactory (consistent with the "Hyatt Regency" brand). We stayed Wednesday through Friday nights leading into the Chicago marathon weekend. So it was particularly busy at the hotel. The location was great -- it was my fiance's first time in Chicago -- and the Hyatt Regency is centrally located for easy access to various "tourist" destinations. Highlights included a Bulls game and the Blue Man Group show. We'd stay at the Hyatt Regency again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for bargain price exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked here through priceline since we just needed a place to stay overnight following the Lifehouse concert. (Price was less than what I've paid in the past to stay at the O'Hare Radisson.) The only caveat I will mention is that parking was not included so we arranged our own rides to avoid paying the extra $50. Otherwise, experience here was an exclamation point to a perfect night. Check-in was a breeze. About 5 people ahead of me but went by pretty quick. Kind lady that checked me in was super friendly and accommodated all my requests: non-smoking, double bed in west towers. Even got a bonus -- room with a great view of the river n lake! She forewarned about the sensitive fridge so we made sure to stay away from that (based off of other reviews too). Even marked me down for late checkout since she knew we'd have a late night. Room was great: clean and modern. LCD tv and clock radio had an iPod dock. Breakfast at central lobby area was good (had specials to choose from that were decently priced for this kind of hotel). Then roamed around the floors with various shops. Self checkout was a breeze and we were outta there. Highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This Hyatt is not worth the cost!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lola44880
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a beautiful luxurious room with updated decor. The room had dust build-up along the edges of the carpet, mildew on the bathroom tiles, and an unknown substance stained the dreadful curtains. I would expect this at Motel 6, but $200.00 a night is a little pricey for dust, mildew, stains, and a 1980s time-warp. Parking was a mere $30.00 a night, however, I did get a discount since I was staying with a large group. Most of the staff was friendly, but again I could have been treated better, for cheaper rates, elsewhere. I would not recommend this Hyatt to anyone!!! It is way too much money for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Went to see a doctor, and this hotel was just what he ordered!”
Reviews.Author: spoiledbeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. It has all kinds of amenities, most of which I didn't even know how to use I'm so out of touch. I loved the free internet, which is a must when I book a hotel. There was a night club in the hotel, which I didn't use, but would be excellent for someone that was there for different reasons. There was also a wonderful pizza place in the hotel, and I would have to give it 5 stars if asked... it got me hooked on Chicago deep dish pizza! I only wish the fridges in the rooms had room for you to put food in, and not just the regular stocked mini-bar that comes standard... which you can NOT move things around to fit food in, because they have it set up with sensors and will charge you for the things you move, even if you don't really eat them. I did also notice there were quite a few conference rooms, so this would be a great place for large meetings and that sort of thing. I loved the fact that it was located in the middle of downtown, so I could walk to all kinds of shopping and tourist sites, and not have to pay out money for a cab or sit in traffic all day long just to get somewhere. I would definitely love to stay there over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: xyz1999
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago is a classical hotel of the Hyatt group. It is a very big complex located in the heart of downtown Chicago. Hence it is an optimal place to start trips to the city. The State Street is only 5 walking minutes away and the Magnificent Mile starts also only 5 minutes away from the hotel entrance. There are several bus lines and a train station close by the hotel entrance. The hotel itself is quite large, so at the very beginning it is a little bit difficult to get an overview. There is one Steak House, the Stetonâ€™s which can be recommended very strongly. There are also some other restaurants and shops as well. The rooms ore spacy and equipted in standard way for such a city hotel. However at some places one can realize that this hotel is several years old and it is not renovated always immediately. However this was never the case for important functions. The hotel can be recommended for city trips as well as for business trips but it also does not provide any advantages over the other business hotels surrounding the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location. High price.”
Reviews.Author: marciofleury
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and offers all the services necessary for business. It is well located and has a very pleasant environment. However, it services are quite expensive. The standard room is nice and comfortable, but doesn't have luxury. Pros: - Local: easy-to-go place. Near the main attractions and businesses areas of Chicago. - Facilities: many facilities are available in the hotel - food court, business centers, kiosks for flight check-in, shuttles, check-out express... Cons: - Internet: Internet should be free for guests. - Front-desk service: I tried to call five times the front desk and I was answered only once. - Everything is payed. For example, you can't use the fridge of the room to put anything, otherwise they will charge you $25.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star quality”
Reviews.Author: CoolMom1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average not 4-star. The bathroom sink had several large cracks that had obviously been repaired. Had to pay for internet and parking fees were outrageous. Location was good. Would not recommend because the price is way too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “You wont get any apologies from them!!”
Reviews.Author: Camacho87
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here and it was meant to be a nice romantic evening for us. A surprise had been pre-arranged for when we entered the room but there was nothng when we got there. When we called down to concierge we did not get an apology! Just an excuse as to why it hadnt been done! (Even though there was something preordered from room service and this was in the room when we arrived no problem) This was extremely frustrating and unacceptible from this kind of establishment. But we werent going to let it ruin the night and we enjoyed a nice dinner cruise around lake michigan watching the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Large COnvention Hotel, But Also is Great For General Use”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago is a multi-tower facility large enough to handle several conferences at once. Check-in and check-out were a breeze, the staff was wonderful. The location is good if you have business downtown, and it is well located for tourists seeking to explore Michigan Ave, Navy Peer, Water Tower Place, etc... My room was an executive floor upgrade, and was excellent. However, the associated lounge leaves a lot to be desired, in terms of ambiance, breakfast service, and size of the facility. Also, my room had internal doors for connecting to rooms on both sides, which meant that at 1 in the morning I could hear the "guests" next door loud and clear when they returned from their night on the town, and around 7 that morning I could hear the occupants on the other side loud and clear as they went through sneezing and coughing episodes. Such acoustics should be better handled in a quality hotel. The AAA rate for my room was terrific. Am likely to stay here again, but will first want to have a conversation with the good folks at Hyatt about acoustics.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: intheskies
Reviews.Content: I layover at this hotel as a crew member several times a month. The staff here are all very friendly and helpful, they are amazing! The beds are comfortable, the rooms spotlessly clean and the hotel itself recently underwent a compete room renovation in the West Wing. The few minuses are due to the air circulation system, there are gaps under the does so sound really does carry into the room from the hallways. If you are a light sleeper ear plugs are not a bad idea. Some beds have hard frames which can make for MAJOR bruises of you hit a corner . Pluses, many rooms have wonderful views of the lake and river. There are several restaurants and bars here for all price points, but even better is the basement level, which is shared with adjacent office buildings. You can hit a variety of delis/ coffee shops. restaurants without going outside which is important in winter in Chicago. Those same places are closed on the weekends though. The concierge desk is always helpful with spot on info. Hotel can get jammed with conventioneers and there is often a wait for elevators. Just add a few minutes to you comings and goings. You can walk to several train stops, and taxis are always outside. There is a grocery store Bockwinkels next to the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale big city downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: A very nice downtown business hotel: - Spacious rooms. - Surprisingly quick elevator rides. - Top-flight exercise room - Very comfortable bedding - Clean - Nice views from high floors - Lots of nearby dining options if you don't like overpriced hotel food On the downside: - No TV channel guide provided - Somewhat limited TV channel lineup; no Comedy Central (so I missed John Stewart) - Good location, but it's a bit of a walk from nearest CTA station

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Review_Fanatic
Reviews.Content: Travelled here for meetings in the hotels with colleagues from all over the country and stayed in a room overlooking the Chicago River and the bridge at Michigan Avenue. Loved loved loved the view, especially watching the boats passing by while I worked. Room service was courteous and prompt but food was only average. I fared much better grabbing food at the Starbucks/Einsteins kiosk in the lobby. Elevators were very slow when meetings let out and the wait was often unbearable. Cell phone service in the lower conference rooms was non-existent. Workout facility was serviceable: equipment was nice, room housing it left lots to be desired. All that said, the location and the view made this a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in the heart of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MsTinaF
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend stay with our family of four. Check-in was quick and easy. We were upgraded to a riverview room for free. The room was clean and comfortable with 2 queen beds and a small sitting area. The staff were friendly and efficient. The location was perfect for sightseeing with almost everything within easy walking distance or a $5 cab ride. Navy Pier fireworks are visible from the bridge right outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A truly AMAZING Hyatt!! A perfect location with stellar service!!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Chicago Date of Stay: Thursday, 11/4/10 - Sunday, 11/7/10 Total Nights: 3 In a nutshell, this is a truly amazing Hyatt -- it is in a perfect location with spectacular views and stellar service! This is a must-stay if you are in Chicago! Now, for my detailed review: My wife and I arrived extremely late on Thursday, having an 11pm arrival into Midway. I was worried that service might be lacking due to the late hour, but I was very happy to find that it was not. Check-in service was top-notch, with the Front Desk Agent repeatedly thanking me for my loyalty as a Hyatt Diamond Gold Passport Member. He quickly and efficiently checked us in, providing us with our Diamond Amenity Card and suggesting that we have our Diamond Amenity delivered just before dinner on Friday since it was so late. He also informed us that we had been Upgraded to a very nice "Junior Suite." Overall, it was an extremely pleasant check-in experience despite the late hour. Upon arrival at our room, I had no idea what to expect. Having used one of my Diamond Suite Upgrade Certificates to Confirm a Suite prior to arrival, I assumed that I would merely be given a standard, Connector Suite -- that assumption was completely incorrect! As soon as my wife and I stepped into the Suite, we were extremely surprised and happy ... the "Junior Suite" was anything but "Junior." We were given Room 3027, on the 30th Floor of the West Tower, right on the Riverwalk. We had a truly beautiful view of the River, as well as the City Skyline. We were looking directly at the beautiful architecture of the Tribune Building, as well as the Wrigley Building and Michigan Avenue. And, in the distance, Lake Michigan was visible. It was a truly amazing view -- one of the best City View Rooms that I have ever experienced. In addition to the View, all other aspects of the room were amazing as well. It was not merely a small parlor connected to a standard bedroom but was instead a truly large Suite. As you walk in, you have a small hallway leading to a dining table that could seat eight. In front of that dining table was a very nice large computer-style work desk and a very large floor-to-ceiling window with the excellent view I have mentioned above. To the left of the dining and work area of the room was a rather large sitting area, complete with a sectional couch and a large Murphy Bed, plus a very comfortable chair and ottoman. There was the usual large flat screen television, and a very nice bathroom with large glass shower, double sink/vanity, and all of the Deluxe VIP Portico Bath Products. To the right of the dining and work area of the room was the connecting bedroom -- Room 3026. This was a very nice, typical Hyatt bedroom, with one of the most comfortable Hyatt King Beds that I have ever had. This bedroom had all of the typical amenities, including a mini-bar, large flat screen television, and decent sized work desk and chair with the same amazing view and floor-to-ceiling windows as the Suite. As for the bathroom, it was a typical bathroom -- smaller than the Suite bathroom with just one sink/vanity, but it had an equally nice shower with the Deluxe VIP Portico Bath Products. A perfect place to sleep after a long day of shopping on Michigan Avenue! As for the dining and service, both were top-notch at this property, and we had a chance to experience many different venues. On Thursday night, after checking in, we had a drink at the "Big Bar" located near the Main Lobby Atrium. It was a very nice bar -- but it was just far too crowded on that Thursday night, as there was a large convention at the hotel. But, the drinks were well prepared and the service was decent considering the huge crowd. All-in-all, a very nice bar that I would definitely love to frequent on less crowded evenings. On Friday morning, we opted for Breakfast in the Regency Club. The Regency Club was a very well-appointed large area on the 35th Floor of the West Tower, complete with nice views of the City. Although we did not sample the evening fare, we did enjoy the continental style breakfast. My only complaint would be lack of a hot entree option, as I am not a huge fan of salmon with my bagels. But, definitely a very well appointed Regency Club -- had we had more time, I would have liked to try the evening fare and the "honor bar." Hopefully on another trip soon! Friday evening, we did not eat a full meal, as we were absolutely stuffed from our meal in the City -- off topic, but I highly recommend the Weber Grill Restaurant, located at the Hilton Garden Inn for an amazing lunch -- so instead, we snacked on our Diamond Amenity. I had chosen the Cabernet combined with the Fruit and Cheese Platter. It was a very unique assortment of cheeses and flat breads. Definitely a very tasty and filling Diamond Amenity, which put us in the perfect mood for our night at the Theater. As we left for the Theater on Friday night, we saw another example of exceptional Hyatt customer service -- the taxi line. Normally in a big city, one might have to wait for a cab. But, at the Hyatt Regency Chicago, the cab line was very well staffed, with a constant flow of cabs. The Bellman made every effort to get people out of the cold and into a cab as quickly and efficiently as possible. I also note that he screened the cabs, to make sure that cab drivers who the hotel has had issues with are not loaded -- we saw such stellar service first hand! We were next in the cab line and the next cab pulled forward -- but, the Bellman refused to load us into that cab, and instead ushered us into the next waiting cab, explaining to that original cab driver that he was not welcome at the Hyatt. Truly great customer service with the Bellman always looking out for his guests! On Saturday morning, we tried Room Service for Breakfast. We figured that we had such a beautiful view of the City, combined with such a nice dining table that a Room Service Breakfast would be perfect -- and it was! The food quality was superb, and arrived piping hot. Definitely very top-notch room service ... I would highly recommend it! Then, Saturday afternoon, we tried one of the other bars, "The Bar at 151" -- located on the lower level of the East Tower, just below the Main Lobby. The service there was also very good, and the drinks were quite a strong pour. This was definitely a very nice, relaxing bar atmosphere, compared to the packed "Big Bar" feel from earlier in the trip. Definitely a very nice bar that I would highly recommend. Finally, on Saturday evening, we had a truly AMAZING dinner at Stetson's Chop House. My wife has eaten there several times with her family, and I have been there once before with them. Saturday's service equaled if not excelled our prior experiences at Stetson's. This is probably the all-time best steakhouse that I have ever been to -- if you are in Chicago, you absolutely must try this amazing place! We had 5:30pm reservations, which is when it opened. As we arrived, we were offered a seat at the bar to wait for seating to begin. I'd never experienced the bar at Stetson's before, but the bar service was equally good. We all had a round of very nicely poured drinks, along with some cashews to snack on before being ushered to our table. Service was truly amazing, and the foods were to die for with extremely generous portion sizes. This is definitely one dinner not to miss while at the Hyatt Regency Chicago. All-in-all, it was a truly amazing long weekend at the Hyatt Regency Chicago for my wife and I. We will definitely be back soon, and we would highly recommend this property to anyone staying in Chicago on business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hyatt Regency Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mrfargo2
Reviews.Content: Was here just one night on a business trip. Perfect location downtown. Check-in was fast and efficient. Was even asked if I'd like a lemon-scented water while waiting a few minutes in queue. Scored a newly-remodeled room in the West Tower. At first, I found the bed in the middle of the room with desk behind the headboard to be a little odd. But quickly appreciated how it used the space quite nicely. Checkout was just as easy. I'd definitely recommend to anyone staying downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AlishasHubby
Reviews.Content: My wife had to come to Chicago on business, and I came along. First let me say Chicago is great! Loved the city. This hotel was good- not as good as some of the other Hyatt properties we have stayed in, but the location is great - near the Magnificent MIle and close to many restaurants. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. The room itself was a little small, but adequate. There are two towers, with an enclosed walkway connecting them.

Reviews.Title: “Remarcable !”
Reviews.Author: GaiaGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We (me & Isabel) have visited Chicago three times . And everytime we have choosed Hyatt for our stay . Rooms are simply very good , service is superb ans its location is simply superb for us . Quite near Michigan Avenue , it guarantees one's good walk either for shopping , or for the Museums and Art Galleries . As for restaurants , this hotel maybe considered well served , although me and my wife always choose to have our meals outside any hotel we're staying in . The lounge is magnificent and it connects by underground tunnel to several services and restaurant Houlian's . We are used , just for our nightouts at the music clubs Backroom or Kingston Mines , to catch a taxy . Anyother time we walk ...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: CandR_Travel
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice view, courteous check-in staff and conceirge. Cons: Pay to use internet, Very Noisy, Room was quite small Hotel just seems to be doing anything to nickel and dime you out of more money than you paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service!”
Reviews.Author: KKUHN
Reviews.Content: Pricelined a 4 star room in Chicago and got the Hyatt. My recent stay was just for one night but everyone from the valet guy to check in/out, concierge were over the top helpful. And when my hairdryer didn't work, they ran another one up promptly (twice) with a smile and an apology. Had a viewl of the River, Mich Ave and John Hancock Observatory. Wish I could have stayed longer!!!! Onsite parking is $50.00 (With I/O priveliges) but there is a parking garage 1/2 block away that will save you $20.00 (without I/O privelges).

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JakePilot
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel right in the middle of it all in Chicago...the Hyatt Regency @ Wacker and Michigan is the place for you! First, use Priceline and get your best deal. Second, get the "hop-on-hop-off" bus on a three day pass. Then let it take you all around the center of Chicago. After you have the lay-of-the-land...use the remaining passes to go to and see the sights...all three days for $35.00! The paces to eat and drink are everywhere. The hotel itself has a 4-star restaurant in the lower level...Stetson's!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying my stay except for the fact items in my room are missing... $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: mrwebb
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the hotel for my companies Annual Fall Confernce @ the hotel itself. I am enjoying the stay EXCEPT FOR THE FACT I left my room this morning @ approx. 6:30a to attend work. I then go back to my room for lunch around 11:45a to notice my room has been cleaned which is great but my PHONE CASE WHICH INCLUDED OVER $160.00 were missing. I'm totally disgusted by this, OUT OF CASH & wonders who in their right mind would take someone else's property from their room. I have contacted HYATT Mngt., they have taken an incident report, but I was advised more than likely there is nothing they can do for me. I am 10 hrs away froom home and staying here at the HYATT until Monday. I would recommend this hotel to the next guest, but unfortunately this incident prevents me from doing such. I will be contacting and sending a letter to HYATT REGENCY GENERAL Mngt. in ref. to this matter. This is def. not a good look for me or my company ASCD whom is hoting a major event here at this location. I am out of cash now and there is nothing anyone can do, except take a report. Very Unhappy Guest -Mr. Kiante' Webb-

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: esparker
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through priceline and did not get any attitude about that which was nice. The hotel has both rennovated and unrennovated rooms. We stayed in a rennovated one on the 15th floor. It was clean and nice. It had a nice view as well. There is an option to upgrade for $20 per night to stay in a room with a great view, but we chose not to. The regular room had a fine view of the river. The location is great, and everything is within walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and a good proximity to the happenings”
Reviews.Author: baconbrits
Reviews.Content: Snagged a room at a really good price. Didn't need a fancy room, as the intent of the stay was to be out and about in Chicago. Room was clean, modern, and had a nice bathroom. Loved the proximity to Millennium Park and the shopping on Michigan Avenue. Tons of food and nightlife options within walking distance. Every single staff member that I came into contact with was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor (no) sound insulation in rooms”
Reviews.Author: sgjsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Good location, near to the Mag. Mile. Very large hotel with typical service (both good and bad) that you would expect. Long wait for check-in - the three people on the desk kept disappearing for long periods behind a screen! Lady on the Concierge was not very friendly (as I see others have noted), and looked surprised that I wanted to know how to get to the Art Institute. Worst thing was the sound insulation in the rooms. I had two connecting doors, and could hear everything from next door -conversations, toilet, television - well, I mean everything! Had to sleep with ear plugs in! When will hotels learn that, if they have rooms with connecting doors, these should at least be insulated properly when not in use eg with padding or a sound-proof cover. I paid almost $300 per night, but it was like staying in a 1 star motel. No chance to move room as the hotel was completely full.
