Apart from that it was OK - but the maid did keep knocking on the door, despite the fact that I had a Do not Disturb card on the door! Also, the soap in the shower gave me a rash! I think there are better hotels in Chicago for these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that takes care of you”
Reviews.Author: s246002
Reviews.Content: Booked my hotel since we have a convention being held here. When I went to check in the guy at the front desk said he had a deal for me. So I listened. They were over booked and he was asking if I would be willing to move to a hotel down the street for the night, free of charge. So I moved to a different hotel for 1 night. The next day I came back to the hotel to check in, and my room wasn't ready. They held my baggage and I went to my convention. I figured they would compensate me some how. Nicer room maybe. When I checked into my room I would never imagined the room I received. I had a full kitchen, living room, seperate bedroom, 2 bathrooms. It was fantastic! The hotel was clean, the staff was nice. Although I was inconvenienced by switching hotels, they made it worth the switch. I did have a view of the river which was nice, but it also overlooked busy Wacker drive. The noise was pretty quiet for being in the heart of the city. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What did Ben Franklin do for me?”
Reviews.Author: JoeEagles
Reviews.Content: Actually it's what 4 Ben Franklins did for me through priceline.com. Stayed 4 nights here this past weekend. Came into Midway, took the Orange L to State & Lake then about a 10 minute walk to the Hyatt. Found out there are pedways everywhere that go to/from the Hyatt. Had a 4th floor room in the West Tower. Offered us a 1 bed suite with a rollaway with great view of the city for the same price but we opted for the 2 Queen room. Amazed at how quiet the room was. Beds were particularly comfy & whole family slept well. Everything was clean, bathroom was large, shower was super, maid service was prompt & we checked out in 2 minutes at 5:15AM at a kiosk with our credit card. Didn't take advantage of all the amenities in order to experience the downtown areas because the location is great to experience the Loop, Magnificent Mile & Riverwalk. Two cons - why must you be charged for room internet & to use the mini-fridge? C'mon Hyatt, roll that into the room prices. Even Motel 6 doesn't charge extra for that. Even so, I'd definitely stay there in the future & would recommend it to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Really 3.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: VacationDude
Reviews.Content: Typical Hyatt for a city. Lobby is pretty nice with the waterscape. This hotel is big, almost Vegas big, with many signs directing you where to go. The size didn't bother me in the least. Check-in was fast and they gave us our room, in the remodeled NW tower, well ahead of normal check-in time. We were even offered free late check-out. Our room was good, but nothing special. The minibar is as one would expect, overpriced. In fact, they don't even let you put medicine or leftover pizza in there without a surcharge. We always buy water outside of the hotel, and there are lots of stores right around to do so. At check-out we were billed for a minibar item we didn't take, but the desk quickly fixed the issue. The moral is, be sure to read your folio before leaving. As others stated, this hotel is very conveniently located. Easy 15 minute walk to/from "El" train. Take the blue line train from O'Hare for $4.50 round trip, and avoid traffic. We walked to most major tourist attractions including SkyDeck, John Hancock, Navy Pier, etc. If you walk 2 blocks down Wacker there is a place called Corner Bakery, if you just want coffee and a bagel, or a pastry. There are many nice restaurants in walking distance, as well, so we didn't eat at any of the hotel's dining venues. The BIG bar is pretty cool for drinks; bit of a scene at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, especially for the location”
Reviews.Author: checazzohaidetto
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really conveniently located in Chicago and is a 10 minute walk to many destinations, as well as very close to the L. Furthermore, I booked it through hotwire.com, and got a GREAT rate ($99 per night for 2 people w/ a king bed). It was clean, the room was really nice, and overall we had a lovely experience. Note, this hotel seemed more for a business crowd than for a romantic weekend getaway, but for what we paid and for our purpose (it wasn't a honeymoon, it was just a weekend trip), it was a great buy! Did I mention how clean it was? It was really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not My First Choice”
Reviews.Author: MCanter24
Reviews.Content: Pros: The price through Priceline was great. Location was perfect for our shopping trip. Counter staff, incoming valet staff, and baggage hold staff were quite friendly. Breakfast was very good. Cons: Though I called to confirm I would receive a room that would accommodate three people sleeping in separate beds, when I arrived the woman checking us in informed me that it would be against the Chicago Fire Code to place a cot in a room that had two other beds (I have never had this problem before...)When I asked if there was any chance for an upgrade because I had been misinformed, she said "yes" for another $100. As this was 9:30 at night, I wasn't going to argue when she gave us free breakfast (though how that addresses any sleeping situations, I'm not sure...). Upon checkout, the woman at the counter said my credit card would not go through. Panicked, I called my card company who said there was nothing wrong with the card and the charges had, in fact, gone through just fine. So, after not getting much sleep sharing a full sized bed with another person and having a mild heart attack when my primary credit card was "declined", we went to retrieve our car from the valet. The gentleman looked as us, standing at the valet stand, as if he had no idea why we were there. I told him we were there for the car, he glared at me and my ticket and asked if we were guests in the hotel. Before I could give him the room number he was already walking away from me and checking on his computer. He said nothing to us as he threw (I'm not exaggerating) my keys in the window for the valet to pick them up. 15 minutes later, my car shows up and they drive it out the exit... pulling around again to retrieve us (this gentleman was actually very kind). I have stayed at several 3 and 4 star hotels around the city and would definitely give this 3 stars and do my best to avoid staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “DownTown Chicago and thats the positive I can tell”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlovers
Reviews.Content: It is a big convention hotel and I am aware of some specialties of those. But frankly speaking I was expecting a bit more from this group. A very big turn off was the concierge service; her comment please speak I am a woman and I am able to do multitasking might be funny. But lady whats about the quality of the tasks you are doing? We booked the Hotel on www.hotwire.com where is has a 4 start rating which I think it doesnâ€™t deserve, not for a Hyatt Regency, I would give it more than a 3star. The whole thing is a bit rundown also the bathrooms where not so clean as I like it; especially anything beyond a towel turned out not cleaned. The 50$ parking areâ€¦ well there goes the saving and the 13.95 for internet was just rude. Next time I rather stay not such much in the center

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: manny721
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great location close to attractions and the magnificent mile. Very large and lobby is always bustling. Can be noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: AvaTennessee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference. It was nice and the staff was very nice. We ate at the Bistro Cafe and Daddyo's Irish Pub which are both located in the hotel. The food tasted fair, but was greatly overpriced. The conference was located in the hotel which made it very easy to get to the meetings.

Reviews.Title: “at full price, not impressive---but as a bargain---nice!”
Reviews.Author: kristilyn1
Reviews.Content: At an average of $200-$300 a night...this hotel is no deal. I would rate it more of a 3 star...not a thing wrong with the place, other than the rooms were fairly small and nothing spectacular. Since I paid $75 on priceline, I feel like I got my money's worth, but couldn't imagine being as satisfied if it was full price. Good location, and they never charged me for the valet parking...so that was a pleasant oversight....assuming other reviews were correct and they normally charge $50.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: guyinkc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for five nights during a work function. The hotel is just steps from Michigan Avenue and has easy access to transportion options to get around Chicago. I stayed in the newly-renovated West Tower. The rooms and bedding were very nice. Great views of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan from the northside rooms. The only downside to the rooms were that the walls seem thin, or poorly insulated. I had a "TV Sleeper" in the room next to me and could hear them nightly. Overall, the staff and service were exceptional. Good location. Good people. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ShelOt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple just got back from Chicago. This trip was an adult getaway to attend a couple of baseball games. The location of the hotel was amazing. It was right in the heart of the city within walking distance to just about everything we were looking to do, except for the baseball parks. The rooms were decent hotel rooms. I liked the floor to ceiling windows. All in all the rooms were nice and clean although nothing special. This is a large, busy convention hotel and there appeared to be a relatively big convention going on. A great feature of the hotel is that it is attached to the Chicago Pedway system (underground tunnels & walkways). We discovered this on our second day. It was great having a bunch of little eateries and shops attached to the hotel... not to mention DUNKIN DONUTS! I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone looking for a convenient location. Even though the hotel is large, I found all of the staff we encountered to be pleasant and eager to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: natsfan62
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is in a great location. Close to lots of attractions. Staff was friendly. But this hotel is in desperate need for an update compared to other Hyatts. The walls were paper thin and you could hear adjacent rooms. I had to wear ear plugs to sleep otherwise I would not get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago in style”
Reviews.Author: UncleMorty49026
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency overlooking the Chicago River is a very convenient location to discover the Chicago Loop. We took in the taping of NPR's "Wait, wait don't tell me" which was a riot. Too bad those folks get paid to have that much fun! Then on to "Billy Elliot the musical". The Hyatt is in the middle of it all. Great place to stay and Chicago is a fun city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImmeJor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after the Chicago Marathon. Great location, great service, great rooms and beds. Service was great ... I pre-registered early in the AM, and they called when they had a room ready (before check-in time). They made us something that wasnt on the room service menu ... very accommodating. Only thing that was a bit confusing was the layout ... I couldnt find the entrance at first! I think there were some renovations going on, and I was on the wrong side of the street. Great hotel, hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny42345
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency was a nice hotel in a great location. Itâ€™s right next to Millennium and Grant Park. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We traveled with our daughter and the hotel was very accommodating. They brought us a nice clean pack and play to use for our daughter. And, they were very accommodating to our request of having a mini fridge in our room for her milk. We enjoyed our visit to Chicago and would stay again at the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “We had an exceptional stay!”
Reviews.Author: RC43
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and clean, the staff was always friendly and courteous, we would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing. Dark unpleasant room. Hotel too large. Food poor”
Reviews.Author: J_B97
Reviews.Content: The rooms have small windows and are very dark. No sunshine. Had to wash my hair with my shaving foam as they do not restock the shampoo. The hotel is overlarge and you are always walking from one tower to the next. They give you a map! Each part of the hotel is fine, but as a whole it has no character and the has no ambiance. Internet should be incuded in the (high) price. The two breakfasts I had were cold and the coffee unpaletable. I would eat out and go the the good coffee shops nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful though (in the usual corporate way).

Reviews.Title: “Too Large, Too Noisy, Too Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: barndoors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. However, this does not make up for the impersonal desk staff, and concierge. Moreover, the hotel is SO large it has two towers and two sets of elevator banks. I stayed in the tower where there were no amenities. I stayed on the concierge floor-- needed room key to go up in the elevator. Despite the fact that I requested late check out, room key was deactivated. Had to ask the lovely cleaning lady to let me up in the elevator and into my room to retrieve my luggage. She was the best part of the hotel. Room located near elevator (shared wall with elevator bank) Noise kept me up all night..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accommodations, good priceline deal.”
Reviews.Author: Ryanwhob
Reviews.Content: Typical city hotel so you have to pay for Internet and breakfast, but we enjoyed our stay. Plenty of cafes nearby for reasonable breakfast food and free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: habsmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Hyatt Chicago. We enjoyed wonderful service at check in, the atrium restaurant, and the conceriege. Everyone was so helpful. Our room had a great view of Navy Pier for the fireworks so our young children were able to watch the fireworks inside with pajamas on while my husband and I relaxed watching tv. The location was great for catching the shuttle or just walking to Navy Pier or along the Chicago River. Thank you for a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “huge hotel, fantastic location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: attended a conference at the hotel and the facilities are impressive. the rooms are nice and spacious. when i checked in the room i got was dirty, the duty manager was up promptly and even though the hotel was packed moved us to a nice clean room. beds were very comfortable. the hotel is huge with over 2000 rooms, long walks to the various parts of the hotel!! overall a good spot in chicago as you step out cross the river and are in the thick of the action with shopping and restaurants all around

Reviews.Title: “it's okay, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pere-la
Reviews.Content: I paid about 250 dollars which was the conference rate. The front desk person tried to cheat me into paying for the internet while our conference actually had a contract with the hotel to offer free internet to us. I found this out later after talking to the organizers, and wanted my money back. Some other conference attendees didn't know this and actually were cheated into paying for the internet -- too bad. The room is clean, and nice convenient location. The room is not big, and there's noise from streets. No free breakfast. The toilet had some flushing problem and kept flushing for a long time. The faucet for taking shower seems very old and hard to use.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: We booked a travelzoo promotion, which saved us some money. We took the EL from midway and it was a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Wonderful location facing the river with easy access to the touristy parts of the city. We had a king in the renovated west tower. The room was average in size with an updated look. We were fortunate to have a room facing the river, it was a memorable view. The bed was comfortable and the washroom was a good size. The hotel was big but we did not spend much time here since there is so much to do. Staff were very friendly from the time we arrived until we left. We had arrived at 11 am and the room was waiting for us. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smooth stay”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location between the loop and North Michigan Ave areas of the city. This hotel is quite large but very accommodating. We were in the west tower which has a separate entrance/elevator system and was actually closer to Michigan Ave. The main art of the hotel is just a skywalk away. The check-in process was ridiculously easy with their computer kiosks and we had no delays with valet parking upon entering or exiting the hotel. Cabs were always plentiful and most things are within a nice walking distance if the weather is good. This is obviously a hotel that caters to large conferences so it certainly doesn't have the intimate feel of other 4 star properties in the city, but it is easily accessible. My wife and I chose to go for our morning run outside since the weather was cooperating so we did not visit the fitness center. The Lake Michigan fitness trail is however just a block away from the hotel. We opted to eat outside of the hotel so I can't comment on the hotel food, but if you're looking for a good "base" from which ti explore the city, you could do much worse!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Chicago! Excellent Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: skategeezer
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotwire and after reading reviews on this site and others, were a bit worried about the condition of the rooms. When I got to the hotel, I asked if we could stay in the West tower as the blogs said this was the newer part of the hotel. Unfortunately, there were no more rooms available there and we got a room in the East tower. Although the room was quite dated (furniture, wallpaper, bathroom, etc.)...it was very clean and quiet and had all the amenities. Staff was amazing everywhere...from the doormen to the front desk staff - to housekeeping. We always felt welcome there...something that made us feel good knowing we were just two of hundreds of tourists. Loved the presence of Starbucks coffee in-house. As we wanted to explore the city we dined outside of the hotel, and found the nearby Corner Bakery to be perfect for a patio breakfast by the river. The hotel is in an excellent location and we would highly recommend it to everyone. Looking forward to seeing the new rooms once they're renovated next year. Also liked the availability of the flight time monitor in the front lobby. There's no direct hotel based shuttle to the hotel from O'Hare, but the GOExpress shuttle took me straight from the airport to the hotel door for a nominal fee. During rush hour, it's probably the most economical way of getting downtown if you don't want to lug stuff on the Ltrain.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic hotel - look for best rate”
Reviews.Author: jerseyrocks
Reviews.Content: Close to the magnificent mile. Gigantic hotel where if you shop around, great rates are available - around $100 per night on weekends. Except for the rates place would have a lot of empty rooms. Rooms are somewhat modern and hotel is impressive, but eating or drinking at the hotel is not cheap. Use it as a place to set off from as it is ideally suited for that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, with expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: rrakoczy
Reviews.Content: This property was a great deal given the price I paid on Priceline. The room was comfortable, spacious and had a great view of the Chicago river from an upper floor. The staff was friendly, the location was perfect, and everything went smoothly. The only issue I have would be the same issue that affects almost every downtown hotel in a major city: expensive extras. $13 for the internet, $3 for an apple in the hotel store, and $50 for parking are pretty pricy but not unexpected. However, a short walk will get you cheaper parking, cheap apples and free Wi-Fi at a cafe. I just mention these items so no one is surprised when they book.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing for a premier hotel”
Reviews.Author: zdm1098
Reviews.Content: I checked in as a diamond member and had used one of my Suite upgrades for this hotel. The staff informed me that I was in the hometown for Hyatt at check in. A few observations about the checkin process 1) If you drive, expect a walk from the Garage. It's a large property. No one's fault, but be aware. 2) The lobby is impressive. The "Big" bar area is great and the overall feel is nice Now for the room. My suite was the poorest I've had with Hyatt. It clearly hadn't had more the a light remodel in the last 20 years. The bathroom was showing the wear and while there where modern things like a flat panel TV, the rest of the material finish was quite poor. In addition my room was across from the service elevator and ice machine. I was told at checkout this was a problem for that suite on any floor and to request a different one next time. The fitness center is well of the beaten path. I mean well off the beaten path. I had to travel down the tower I was in, across the lobby, down an escalator, and down a hall to get to it. It wasn't located in either of the two towers that the hotel rooms are in. I travel about 50% of my year and have experienced a lot of hotels, Hyatt has some great locations, but unfortunately this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping to guest: go away”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller123417
Reviews.Content: Staying here currently. Had aspired to sleep. The paper thin walls allow even the slightest peep from your neighbor to feel like you're right in bed with them. Couldn't sleep anyway because of the cheap, giant fluffy pillows. Called housekeeping, asked for any help...was simply and accomodatingly told, after my plea for help, could they, would they have any ability to supply me with a reasonable pillow? Complete answer before hanging up: "We do not." Hyatt, may your well executed service lead to your demise. Happy

Reviews.Title: “I had not been in this hotel in a few...”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: I had not been in this hotel in a few years and was disappointed to find that it really hasn't changed much, despite an update to the west tower rooms. My requests for a specific room type were not honored and met with indifference when trying to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Big Bar”
Reviews.Author: snowqueen3737
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the Regency, but we visited Big Bar for drinks and appetizers. They have a great selection of drinks and wines. We had the sliders as our appetizer and they exceeded my expectations! Big Bar is perfect for entertaining business clientel. And of course the view is amazing! The window overlooks some of the city and is lined with liquor bottles. It's a sight to see in itself. I've heard it gets pretty packed at night and will be back to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet sleep in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Lungfruit
Reviews.Content: Had a nice two night stay here recently while in town for a concert. I haven't stayed at this hotel about 5 years and it's even better than I remembered. It's a huge hotel and it seems like it's always bustling with activity due to the many conferences going on there. Front desk and concierge staff were always helpful and friendly. Everyone we encountered was always quick with a smile and a hello. We had a newly remodeled room in the West Tower and it was very nice. Slept well in the big comfortable bed. It was also very quiet. I thought the breakfast buffet at $22 a person was a bit steep. You can go right next door to Houlihan's and get the exact same breakfast (with omelet station) for $10! There is also a small grocery store (Bockwinkels) on Stetson, just behind the hotel where you can buy snacks, drinks, and other foodstuffs if needed. My one and only complaint about this hotel is that housekeeping did not vacuum well near the window and this too, wouldn't be that big a deal, except there were toenails (or fingernails or both) on the rug. Gross! And, to make matters worse, they remained there for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: soccermom51
Reviews.Content: Found a special that included valet parking (outrageously priced at $50). Had a renovated room that had a large flat screen TV. Location was perfect, in between North Michigan Ave. shops and Loop theater district, so we parked the car, and were permitted to leave it till 6:00 the next day. Staff was friendly and helpful. Admit that the review may have been different if we had to pay for the parking. No free wifi is a downer though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hyatt Regency - Chicago”
Reviews.Author: R0n_O
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation using Priceline name your price and save $60.00 off the Expedia rate. The hotel is very convenient to the attractions we wanted to see. It sits right on the Chicago river and if you get a room on the north end of the west tower you will have a great view of the Chicago river and Lake Michigan. Houllihan's restaurant is one block to the west and has a great breakfast bar that is considerably less than the hotel restaurant. The staff are friendly, the room was quiet, the bed was great and we slept well. Buy your own water from the 7-eleven store 4 blocks west. The bottled water in the room is very expensive. Don't open the refrigerator unless you want to be charged for using it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience for first trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lynne029
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is ok, very busy and noisy. Valet parking is the only choice you have and an additional $50 for every 24 hours. Valet parking stole our Ipod so they told us to fill out a claims report which we did and then we had to wait more than a week to call the claims department because the one and only person they have working claims was on vacation. Once I was able to talk to the claims department she was no help at all. She basically called me a liar and we will not be getting reimbursed for the loss of our IPod. I am furious that it cost me $50 per day extra and then we will have to pay another $250 + to replace our IPod.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest standards of cleanliness I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: katymo
Reviews.Content: I didn't have terribly high expectations, given that this is a very large convention hotel. But the front desk staff couldn't have been nicer; when I asked for a high floor I was given a lovely room on the top floor of the hotel. Too bad there was a large, half-eaten pretzel from the previous guest on the floor, along with other small bits of crumbs and miscellaneous lint, and dead flowers scattered all over the mini-bar. I requested that the room be re-cleaned several times. To make things worse, the hotel leaves a card on the nightstand that proclaims "we care" and encourages customers with any issues to call a special in-house customer relations number. I did so several times, left a number of messages - and yet, the pretzel remained, along with the dead flowers, day after day. I finally reached a manager who assured me the room would have a "deep cleaning" and offered me a $25 food credit on my bill to compensate. While I'd rather have a clean room, I appreciated the gesture - except they didn't actually give me the credit when I checked out. Honestly, I'd rather they flat out say "we don't care" than make all kinds of promises and then not honor them. I'll never stay in a Hyatt again. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: smiths0905
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend after finding a deal on Priceline.com. Great location - we were able to walk to so many places. If you don' t mind a mile or so walk in any direction you can get many places by foot. We had a view of the Chicago River from our room. Room was kind of small but clean and the view more than made up for it. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurants or go to the bars in the hotel but the lobby area was beautiful. One tip - they charge $50 per day for valet parking. If you ask they will tell you they don't have a self park option. However, you can self park your car at surrounding lots. We found one just a block away at 303 S. Wacker. it's a little tough to drive to because the entrance is on Lower Wacker but if you can get there it was $30 per day. Definitely saved us some money. Good option if you don't want to get your car out of the garage during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL WITH A BEST LOCATION TO LIVE”
Reviews.Author: najeebefs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with 250 participants from all over the world attending our annual worldwide conference. At the same time there were other big groups also staying in the same hotel. But never experienced any service failure from any corner. I had a throat infection and I requested the concierge to get some salt for gargling at 03:00 A.M. it was supplied within no time. Also lost the key for one of my baggage and their techician came upon my request immediately and opened the bag without destroying it's lock. The only problem I faced was poor mobile signal in their conference hall "Regency". Also the internet wifi connection prucahsed for 24 hours @ $ 14.00 has no much utility Because no signal available in the conference rooms. It was O.K. in the room only, but speed was not pretty good. Another experience we had, We 2 people gone to eat some Indian food in a taxi. The Indian origin driver took us to the Indian area were got Briyani for a cost of $ 10.00. But, upon & down taxi fare as paid US$.55.00...!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: TooCoolToBeMe
Reviews.Content: When we found a great deal via TravelZoo for Labor Day weekend, we pounced on 2 rooms for our family. Turns out it was not just a nice hotel but the staff was super friendly and the location was quite convenient to navy Pier, Millenium and Grant Parks, the Magnificent mile, and plenty of other sites that we walked to during our holiday stay. We had asked for rooms near each other on the same floor but ended up getting adjoining rooms so that was awesome. We ate in the main lobby restaurant a couple of times in the morning (for convenience more than anything else) and though it was just a bit pricey the food was terrific and the breakfast buffet plentiful and quite tasty. My only nit-pick is the $13/day for internet - c'mon folks, that's a bit absurd!! Thank goodness the parking was free as part of our booking. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jdo27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in Chicago for a week, both visiting for the first time. We got a great rate and were very impressed with the value. It was in an excellent location and the hotel room itself was very clean and modern. The thing that impressed me the most was the friendly staff who seemed very genuine and were always happy to answer our questions. The only thing that disappointed me was that they charged alot for internet. We were also warned that they charged if you put something in the fridge that was in the room. And the parking I believe is very expensive so we opted to fly there instead of driving. Other than that we were thrilled with our stay and would absolutely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: peterpanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Chicago over Labor Day weekend and stayed at the Hyatt. Traveling in our party was my husband, my 21 year old son, my married daughter and her husband, and myself. We got 2 hotel rooms on Priceline for a GREAT price but were still hoping to be upgraded to a nice room. The front desk is very friendly and willing to please. One room was upgraded to a state suite which allowed us more room for my husband, son and me. The room wasn't located in the West Tower, but I was afraid to ask for too much since we had been given the suite. Probably should have but we were pleased with the East Tower. The suite had a beautiful view of the river and Michigan Ave. My daughter and son in law were on a different floor but were pleased with their room as well-- view wasn't so great though. Heard about the wait on the elevators,but we only had difficulty in the mornings when everyone was heading out for the day. The hotel is about a 5 min. walk from the train. At first we were a little turned around when exiting the Orange Line from Midway. A very nice man directed us to the hotel -- I guess we looked a little lost standing on the street with our suitcases and confused looks on our face. : ) After getting our bearings, we found the hotel to be a great location. Very close to Michigan Ave. We used the trains and buses to get everywhere. We definitely got our money's worth from the 3 day CTA Vistor's pass we bought at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if staying in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jvande102
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in downtown Chicago, this is the place to stay. My stays here have primarily been focused around business, with exception of one stay. The hotel is very cool, modern, and always busy. For the most part, the staff is friendly and helpful, but can get a bit overwhelmed when they are extremely busy. The lobby has a couple of restaurants and a big bar named, The BIG Bar. The bar is cool and features two 100 inch TVâ€™s. The rooms have always been clean, comfortable, and very quiet! During my most recent stay, I stayed in one of their new PURE rooms/allergy free rooms. As and allergy sufferer, this is a great choice and is appreciated. The buildingâ€™s location is excellent. Itâ€™s very close to the lake, Navy Pier, shopping, and restaurants. Anything can be reached with a short cab ride. Last time I stayed there, they were filming Transformers 3 right across/down the street. That was pretty cool to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: Oooh-La
Reviews.Content: First visit to Chicago, got a GREAT rate on priceline by requesting 4 star in Loop area. Spent 3 days here with my wife as we explored Chicago. At check-in, requested a room in West Tower, as suggested by reviewers below.. thanks! Newly renovated and nice. Centrally located right on Wacker and Michigan... few minute walk to the Red Line to Wrigley, Blue line to O'Hare, Magnificent Mile, the Architectural Boat Tour (official one) is literally right outside the hotel. Staff was excellent in such a large hotel. Concierge helpful. Nice big bar on Blue level lobby. No issues whatsoever. This is primarily a business hotel, so keep that in mind. For breakfast, skip the hotel over priced option and walk dwon under neath through the Illinois Center... there is a Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, Potbelly, various bagel shops and delis all there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: ReeboKat
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate through Travelzoo which included the valet parking (which is normally $50/night) so we decided to try the Hyatt. We were more than satisfied. The location was awesome. Very close to the CAF Architectural River Tour and Navy Pier. We also saw the Blue Man Group which was only about 6 stops on the Red Line which we caught at Lake and State. Our favorite pizza place (Giordano's) was also only a block or so away. They had fireworks at the pier on Friday night because the Tall Ships were in and we were able to see them from our room (#824 - awesome view of the river and pier) and then we saw them down on the pier on Saturday night. All in all, we had a great stay. The only complaint we had with the room is that it seemed pretty dusty. You could see the dust floating around when the sun shined in. Also the bathroom vent was dusty too. But we stayed in the newly renovated West Tower and our room was really nice. Also when we went to leave, my boyfriend got directions from the concierge who sent us to South Lakeshore Drive which happened to be blocked, so we ended up going north and had to fight a lot of pier traffic to get back to where we started. Would highly recommend this hotel to our family and friends and it will definitely be one we consider on our future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good all around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie-Bean
Reviews.Content: I booked the room with Priceline so was not sure what to expect as the price paid was very reasonable. Myself, a friend and her teenage daughter stayed for 3 nights. The entrance was a tad difficult to find as there are two buildings. Check-in was straight forward and after reading previous reviews I requested a room in the newer West wing with a room away from the lift. The room was surprisingly spacious, modern and clean with two very comfortable double beds. The locations as suggested by other reviewers was very good. We were very please with our stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms in Central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KGCampbell
Reviews.Content: Steps from the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier and a slew of office buildings, the Hyatt Regency Chicago provides a number of amenities at a reasonable price point. Customer service at its best, "ask and you shall receive" quality of each employee, and being greeted by name throughout. The hotel hosts a number a major business conferences and conventions, so be prepared for the crowds, especially at the hotel's posh bar, "BIG". Tremendous food and four start service at the hotel's high-end restaurant, "Stetson's", with complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries and warmed washcloths. Enjoy the well-appointed rooms, with extremely comfortable beds and spacious accommodation for the business traveler (just be aware of the steep internet access rates). Overall, a pleasurable experience that I will seek again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kayoung1
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful for Michigan Avenue access & Navy Pier. Easily walkable from this location. Our room was in the East tower and had a great view of the River. Room was nice and clean. Service was exceptional as we were greeted immediately upon appearing near front desk. Parking is $50 a night - which is pricey- but you are in Chicago. Walls and doors are paper thin and you can hear any voice or toilet flush.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: utting
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in August for a quick weekend getaway. We booked our room direct through the hotel on a promotion. $159 with free parking. We arrived early (11:00 a.m.), but were promptly greeted at the registration desk, and he was able to secure a room for us. We requested the West Tower based on advice from others on Trip Advisor. We were given a room on the 20th of the West Tower with an amazing view of the river and skyline! LOVED IT! Rooms were clean and quiet. Bed was comfy. Fabulous stay! Couldn't have asked for anything more. Every employee we encountered was courteous, friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: concordia7
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in mid August. No issues at all. Stayed in older East tower, and had no issues with the room. Would have assumed this was the new tower by the look of my room, except for the fact that i knew the West tower was the one improved. Check in was easy online, got my key and room through the self serve terminal in 2 mins rather than waiting in the 6 person deep line. Was quick and easy. Staff offered to help me check out rather than use self check out, i was good with either. Pleasant staff. Lobby bar was very nice and relatively busy in a good way. Only issue I had was... they do not have pay phones !! Nor will they transfer you to an outside line by use of the hotel phones. You kidding me ? I needed to use the pay phone as I am traveling internationally, and my cell rates are ridiculous. Pay phone and 1-800 is free to call home. Hotel could not offer ANY alternatives. Had to run around the city block to find one. What's with that ?? Even 1 Pay phone would likely be a good idea. Dropped off and pick up car at Hertz on site. Worked out perfect. !! Nothing but good things to say about the Hyatt while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR TRIP HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: savvytrav123
Reviews.Content: Truly horrible experience. The lobby is impressive, location is good, and the first front desk attendant was great, however everything after this point was awful. Our room itself was missing electrical plate covers and had chipped floors and counters with goopy glue messes where they had tried to attach pieces, not to mention stains on the duvet and very minimal lighting (2 bedside ights and one corner lamp). Hotel bar was typically closed even though it was advertised as being open every afternoon and night. The only time we saw it open was on a Saturday night when it closed at 1am despite being packed. (bar time is 4) Perhaps the most aggrivating problem we experienced was when the hotel mistakenly locked us out of our room for "credit reasons". They initially made us new keys which did not work and then accused me of having an unauthorized credit card. They finally realized their mistake, but instead of being apologetic for their error they made us wait for a half an hour outside our room before someone showed up to reset the lock so we could get inside. After all of this I also had the cleaning ladies walk in on me in the shower. The worst hotel experience I've had. I would have preferred a budget motel off the interstate

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view and the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: lkreid
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, in large part due to the location. Amazing shopping was literally across the bridge, and just under the bridge is the Billy Goat Tavern (if you haven't heard of it, check the internet -- super casual but we loved it). The hotel also has a very nice bar, the rooms were nice, and we were given a high floor room with an amazing view of the river, just as we requested.

Reviews.Title: “great location - could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: juju030
Reviews.Content: great location In the middle of everything we go a west tower room which was well equiped and new not very clean. service is not great we were told we had to wait 20 minutes for a bell man... we carried the bags upstair ourselves... recommended if you can get a good price parking is 50$ a day!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: philia88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Hotwire, so we were a little nervous about what we would get. We did the express check-in at the kiosk and even though it said we had a non-smoking room, when we got to our room, it was obviously smoking. We went back down and spoke to an actual person this time and had zero problems changing our room to one of the newly renovated ones in the west tower. We had a gorgeous view of the river and Navy Pier and the room was a good size with a nice big tv, king size bed and a bath tub. We were a little disappointed that there was no pool but there were 2 nice bars and a nice open area restaurant that was surrounded by water. Parkingi was a little pricey at $50/night so we chose to park in a garage a couple of blocks away for $30. Wifi was also a charge, so we didn't use the internet. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel48990
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel geared toward the business traveler but quite accommodating to families! We had a great room and wonderful service. The room was in the west tower (requested thanks to suggestions of other reviewers) which has been renovated and is quite nice. The location of the hotel is fantastic! Our room overlooked Lake Michigan and was great! Due to the location of the other high rise buildings, we were disappointed that, despite our great view of Navy Pier, we were not able to see the fireworks from our room. Oh well:-) We had a great stay and will return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: usmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a large renovated room in the West Tower. I booked directly with Hyatt and the AAA rate came with a terrific buffet breakfast. Located near most sites this is an excellent value hotel and would stay there again. I recommend taking the water taxi just across the bridge. We eat a terrific lunch at xoco and shopped on N.Michigan Avenue. Great trip

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed by the service.”
Reviews.Author: RMOMD
Reviews.Content: Great location and conference hotel for recent stay. Very long lines at elevator and concierge. Multiple issues trying to coordinate dining events and transportation to and from the airport. A lot of back and forth with voice mails having to be left with customer service and either not having calls returned or poor follow through. Did not offer or uphold frequent traveler reward program upgrade or amenities when requested. Called my home after I checked out and worried my spouse about a missed airport transfer that was never confirmed. There are many other choices when you travel to or need to stay in the Loop area. Something has really gone wrong there since my last stay there?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gonefishing85
Reviews.Content: When in doubt, I usually pick a Hyatt to stay. They have a very good reputation and this hotel fits. It is a very nice hotel near O'Hare Airport. You can walk to the CTA - train station and take it to downtown. Quite convenient. Plan on 45 minutes to get downtown. I suggest you get the 3 day transit pass so you do not need to stand in line at every entry point. The public transit system is quite good and should be used versus driving. Parking rates downtown are about $50 plus per day. Do take the city bus tours. They do add so much more to the trip. The Weber Grill resturant at Grand street was terrific. Be aware there is a $22 parking charge at the Hyatt. Compared to downtown, the cost reduction versus convience was worth it. The hotel will be half what you pay downtown. You just need to take the train.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific ...but with a few cautions”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: What a gem - this place is very well managed The people who work here are truly some of the best I have ever encountered in my extensive yearly travels (currently Hilton: Diamond; Hyatt Platinum; SPG: Platinum). The service is unforced and extremely sincere. The location is just one of the best for a Summertime visit- close to Michigan avenue, next to the Chicago River; behind Millennium Park, $15 cab ride from Wrigley etc. The rooms in the West Tower have been recently remodeled. they look clean and fresh. They're very quiet too. The downsides? We booked two queens with a plan for my wife to share with my young daughter and my 13 year old son to have a roll-away. Discovered there are no roll-aways allowed in this type of room (despite calling central reservations to check in advance). Housekeeping sent up copious blankets (thank you!) to improvise a bed but it didn't really work out. Proved to be rough sleeps for the one time we were away as a family. Last caution relates to check-in/check-out. There was a big conference going on at either end of our stay. The lines in the east tower were insane (we're talking Disneyland). My advice is to check-in on line or (as we did) go across to the West tower and check in on level 1 - not a soul! Thank you Hyatt - you made this picky traveler happy (only 4*s though based on the sleeping arrangements)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ninapenina
Reviews.Content: I used priceline and wound up staying at the hyatt regency. I asked to stay in one of the renovated rooms, and it was very nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NovaCath
Reviews.Content: Went with spouse who was attending conference here. Good location and room was clean. check in was faster than we expected and check out was quick. Consigliere was helpful with tour reservations and directions. Internet modem was broken but tech came to replace it but took much longer then originally told. My only real issue was the cup at a time coffee maker and being left one regular coffee packet when two people are in the room. The prices at Js, the take out place in the lobby, were not too high and there are a number of restaurants nearby. Was several blocks from the CTA train stops but not too far. Within walking distance of theaters, Milenium Park and Art Institute. Boat tours from Michigan Avenue Bridge were about 2blocks away. The hotel is really large and there were some times when lobby is crowded and line got taxis is long but other times there was only a few people waiting for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CillaBang
Reviews.Content: Overall a great experience, booked a larger room and it was really great. Everything was clean and the servicing of the room was great. Staff had a great sense of humour and dealt with all our requests in a friendly and helpful manner. A good coffee bar downstairs, not too far from the Magnificent Mile and always cabs available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromMD41353
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Chicago was a perfect place for us to stay during our visit to Chicago. The check-in and check-out processes were efficient. The rooms were nice and clean and quiet. Great location! The only downside is if you want to use the internet, there is a charge for it and a big charge for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: SushiFoodie
Reviews.Content: This was a free night because of a terrible stay the last time we went to this hotel. They certainly made up for it. We were given a suite overlooking the river and city. The bed was extremely comfortable, and we had a quiet night's stay. The location is great, too. We will definitely be returning as a result of this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGals2133
Reviews.Content: First time to Chicago. I love New York and was always interested in Chiacgo. I wanted a more modern hotel with easy access to all the best spots. This htoel had that. Not sure if I would rate this a 4 star hotel? I would rate it about a 3 star. Our room was out dated and the maid service was poor. When cleaning our room they forgot to give us fresh towels,soap,dump trash,and a few other common things. These simple touches were expected from a 4 star hotel. We booked the room through Orbitz.. They probably save the older not as nice rooms for this purpose. Over all it was a good place to stay. Great steak house and nice bar. They let us have a later check out and free luggage storage.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable staff, thank you, thank you Vickie”
Reviews.Author: bettyIllinois
Reviews.Content: The hotel is getting a little dated. The Stetson restaurants still has great steaks and impressive service. My husband was on business and I tagged along. He left for a business trip early in the morning with all bags so I could go home on the train without luggage. Unfortunately he took ALL my clothes. He left early morning and I slept in and found out I only had a silk shell for clothing. Called the hotel shop and they only carry t shirts so I called the front desk. Vickie came to my rescue with an employee uniform so I could get to a store and purchase clothes. Even though I usually don't stay here I will definetly be staying here every time I am in Chicago. Vickie thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “business trip but would stay here for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: myjanda
Reviews.Content: I came with my husband for a conference for 4 days. Yes, it is busy and you are one of thousands staying here, but while on some trips that bothers us, we were in a large bustling city and this seemed on par. We arrived early and were given a small, dark, smoky room. We complained (more like asked for another room - it was also our anniversary) and were upgraded to a very large suite with a lovely view. Very impressive room! So right off the bat the hotel had something great going for it - don't settle for a crappy room because there are nice ones there, even if you don't luck out with a suite! Annoying to have paid for internet after paying so much for the room, but I don't know if that is different at other hotels. The location is fabulous and you can get everywhere quickly and conveniently, which is a big plus when you don't have much time in a city. We only ate at the little breakfast to-go place but it had a pretty decent selection of muffins and cereals as well as good starbucks lattes so I was happy. I met some people who ate at the steak house in the hotel and really enjoyed it but we didn't try it so can't comment first hand. The exercise room was far from our room and smallish but not too bad. All in all a pleasant hotel for a business trip and not terrible for a short pleasure trip to Chicago as well. Staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed for the money”
Reviews.Author: ajmayer
Reviews.Content: check in was crazy, when you first get there, there is a lot of confusion of what you are suppose to do, lines were not to bad when we arrived but were told that was unusual. we stayed in the west tower facing the river and the lake which was awesome, the small boys loved looking out the window at the water and all the lights at night. room was nice minus finding a dirty pair of underwear in the drawer, but the hotel did pay for our breakfast in exchange for that. downside of the hotel also was no pool. breakfast was wonderful, lots of selections and tasted great. check out was okay minus you dont get a reciept unless you go to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Busy”
Reviews.Author: HondaDoug
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with very nice rooms. Lobby is a mob scene at check in time. Very close to all the excitement of the miracle mile and within a long walk of the museum campus. Staff seems attentive and polite but no issues to test them with. Parking $52.00 which seems to be about the norm but I think helps make up for the lower priced room.

Reviews.Title: “Did they coin the term "to nickle & dime"?”
Reviews.Author: Robgetsaround
Reviews.Content: First the hotel claims to have gone "green" this is now the reason for all add-on rate adjustments and faults for instance: 1. Hotel did not flush properly. I called and they never even replied to call. I tried to flush down a scoop of ice cream and it would not go down after four flushes. Their excuse, " toliets are green to save water and don't flush as strong" 2. Big sign in the room bar/refridge "if put anything even medications in here, we will charge you $25.oo each time we see it. Of course you can order a refridg for $25 per day. 3. Want a newspaper at your door. Sorry, they are green...Take will be part of a deluxe package with the internet for $20-30 a day. 4. I got offered a nice view for guess what? $50.00 5. They did tell me I could get the newpaper deliverd on-line for free. All I had to do was pay $13.85 per day for the internet. Why because they are now "green" have to save that paper. However, the papers are in the lobby for free. In other words it is just done to day them from paying for service to your room! 6. Expecting a bill under your door for fast checkout? Not at this hotel! It's green! you have to go to the desk to get one. Once again just to save them the labor charge. 7. This was a tax forum conference with about 3000 people in attendance and the bathrooms in the conference area were ALWAYS filthy. Guess it was more "green" to let people throw the paper on the floor and leave filthy toilets then to hire help to clean them. 8. Need to use your cell phone or PDA while at a conference. NO way. Not here. No reception. Does not matter who your carrier is. But of course staying "green" there are terminals downstairs where you can pay $25.oo to connect to their computer that surprisingly gets service! I travel many weeks per year for business and travel at least twice overseas on vacation and BY FAR this is the worse hotel I have EVER stayed at. I get much better service, a cleaner place, more admenities at any Motel 6 or Holiday Inn. Don't waste your money at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunty79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt regency for 3 days during April, 2010. Right on the Chicago river and very close to Michigan avenue. Clean rooms, great bar/restaurant at the lobby level(hep and colorful actually). Couple of things to watch out for ... 1) A mini bar inside the room... if you open it they will charge you automatically. But of course they were kind enough to revert the charges once i told i didnt use the mini bar. So over all a very pleasant stay. 2) Valet parking is 50 bucks with in-out facilities. No self parking in the hotel. If you need self parking go to Millenium garage which is a couple of blocks away for 25 bucks. But there wont be in-out facilities though. But hey parking is a pain anywhere in the downtown. So i wont count it against the hotel here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jscott479
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the FCCLA National Leadership Convention in July, being the largest hotel in Chicago and a convention of 6,500 people, the place was booked out, which made the elevators have a terrible lag time. This wasn't a problem for any of us because we were with the convention, but if I was on vacation and staying here, it would've been dreadful. We were on some elevators for 15 minutes. The rooms were nice, clean and roomy. We had a great view of the river and the Aqua building. Anything in the hotel to eat or drink is expensive, so look outside of the hotel to dine. There's a Chipotle, McDonalds, Billy Goat Tavern and Houlihan's within a short short walking distance. We all packed quick breakfast snacks and some drinks. It's located a block or two from Michigan Ave, and right in the heart of everything from riverboat tours, double decker bus tours, shopping and great dining. Parking was also very expensive at $50 a day, next time, we'll fly and catch a shuttle to the hotel to avoid parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff, Overly Priced”
Reviews.Author: daisytoledo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location and the lobby, bar/lounge etc. is very nice. All of the staff I encountered are very friendly & helpful. Concierge desk is great! But the rooms are small & not of the qualify I've seen in many other hotels. Numerous breakfast room service trays were still sitting out in hallway at 5pm! Plus for the price we paid for our "convention rate" (just under $300 a night!) it was definitely overpriced for the quality. Plus it's $50 per day to park, and an extra $25 if you want a small fridge in your room. Also, you still have to pay an additional $15 per day if you want wifi access! For that price WiFi should be included as it is with many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good Property in the heart of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: 007CubsFan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times in the past 90 days and I have been thoroughly impressed with the property and staff. Everyone is friendly, professional, and helpful. Yes, things can and do wrong from time to time - it would be foolish to think otherwise. However, it is how the staff handle the situation or problem is what counts, and this staff always step up to the plate, apologize (even if it is not their fault) and immediately begin to resolve it. The hotel is in a GREAT location, about a block from Michigan Ave (major shopping) and very easy walks to subway/metro, as well as State Street, Rush St, and other sights. The rooms are immaculate, clean, and well maintained. I never had a problem at all in their area and have always been happy sleeping on these amazing beds! The WiFi is reasonably priced, but there are plenty of free hot spots within walking distance. I am a little sad that they do not have a pool - probably, my single downside with this Hyatt. Prices fluctuate a lot so check often. I have scored rooms between $149-$199. The area is safe, walkable, and family friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: twowisekids
Reviews.Content: Close to many restaurants and lots of shopping. We were only in Chicago for 2 nights, and were able to walk to everything. Navy Pier, Water Tower, Art Institute, all within walking distance. The West tower has recently been remodeled, and is very nice. Valet parking was quick and easy. Rooms are a bit small for a family of 4, but for the price we found on hotels.com, it was worth the tight quarters. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June. No complaints - it was a typical big-Hyatt experience with all the usual amenities (gym, business center, 24-hr room service, etc.) Room was a little worn, but comfortable and quite large. Good location close to Michigan Ave and plenty of popular/touristy sites nearby. The bar on the mezzanine level has a wall of windows facing across the river and was an excellent place to watch the lightning shows put on by the big storms in mid-June.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Libs1414
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this hotel. It is huge (over 2,000 rooms) and somewhat chaotic when you enter but a really fun place. Great bars right in the hotel! I have stayed here two times and I really enjoyed both trips. The location really could not get any better. The room was modern and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suizita
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for this place on priceline. The staff is very friendly and efficient. I was first given a standard room but it was very noisy on that entire floor because there were tons of partying college students. So I was upgraded to a junior suite on a higher floor with an amazing view over the city. The hotel is very conveniently located, has a great lobby and bars and the generous rooms are equipped with all the usual ammenities a 4 star hotel offers and there is even an ipod dock. The furniture seems to be rather old and outdated and some of the rooms have a funny (mildew) smell to them. Wireless costs 13 dollars per day which I think is way too expensive. All in all a great place to stay if you find a good offer.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but don't expect charm”
Reviews.Author: PlangalDC
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet, charming place, this isn't it. But, I found it to be just fine for our purposes. My mom and I just needed a place to sleep and relax after sightseeing and shopping. I stayed two nights, and got a great price through Priceline ($75 per night). Because I booked on Priceline, I didn't get to choose the hotel, but was pleased with this one. It's an easy walk from Michigan Avenue and many Chicago attractions, so the location can't be beat. The rooms were clean and fairly quiet, and I was actually quite impressed with the level of finishes. I think I was in a handicapped access room--the bathroom was HUGE. Nice toiletries and bed. The only negative was the level of chaos in the lobby--the hotel is a big, conference hotel and they have many events going on constantly, so at times it felt crazy. And, I think they had an elevator issue in the building I was in (there are multiple wings), because it took forever. But, all in all, these weren't a big detraction from an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - good rooms - good location”
Reviews.Author: Stone_xxx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a very good location - walking distance to all the important sights in Central Chicago. The Check-In was very efficient and very friendly! Room was big - very clean and hat a comfortable bed. Bath: good clean - the usual 4*-hotel things. Didn't try breakfast as there is a good breakfast shop just a corner away. Only negative: Internet is pretty expensive - I think hotels of that category should offer that for free

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JUXPrague
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights there. One of the best hotels I ever stayed in. Nice, spacious, clean rooms, seemed renovated. Very good location, on the edge of The Loop, very close to the Pier too. Was there shortly before Christmas and the atmosphere in the hotel was quite unique. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Hectic Hotel, Lovely Renovated Room”
Reviews.Author: nba1017
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a weekend with my girlfriend in Chicago at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker. The hotel is massive--comprised of two towers and totaling approximately 2,000 rooms. I found the lobby to be daunting and a mess of activity. We arrived the day of the Blackhawks victory parade, around 10am. I had requested early check-in and was promptly provided a room on the 14th floor of the main tower. I was unimpressed with this room--it was dark and the view was largely obstructed. I asked the desk if they could perhaps switch me to a renovated room in the West tower, and they were extremely accommodating in doing so. This was a very positive experience to me, as I know the variations large hotels have between rooms. Having stayed in the Trump, Ritz, 4 Seasons, and Park Hyatt in Chicago, I was delightfully surprised by the room. We had an 8th floor room with a prime view of the River and the Michigan Avenue bridge. The bed was luxurious, the desk area nicely appointed and well-laid out, and the window-side chair and ottoman comfortable. The large flat-screen TV was a nice touch. Overall, it was a large, modern hotel room with typical Hyatt Regency amenities and a view that hands-down beat anything I've had at the Park Hyatt, Four Seasons, or Ritz-Carlton. The bathroom was less than stellar, with an older shower-bath and poor water pressure. The sink was newly redesigned and was fine. Being in the West Tower, we never experienced the crowds that lingered in the lobby of the main building, and had a more intimate experience than I was expecting from such a large hotel. Overall, A nice surprise at a very competitive rate of $200 per night. Definitely recommended, especially the West Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TimBudi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on June 8 thru June 10, 2010. The front desk staff was very nice and put me in the main building in which I can see Chicago river and John Hancock tower from our room. Magnificent miles and Millenium park is just within walking distance. The room is a little bit old but they put nice and comfortable new beds. The minuses are I can hear the elevator going up an down since our room is only 3 doors away from the elevator. Also, I could hear when other guests flushing the toilet. The good thing is I am not a very sensitive person who need total quietness to fall asleep. Overall, I love this hotel and would stay again. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A Great value......”
Reviews.Author: wannago30
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in June for two nights on a long weekend. We received a great rate from priceline. I called the hotel in advance to request 2 double beds, which they took care of. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly staff, and that continued throughout our stay. We payed for an upgrade to 2 queen beds and a better view, completly worth it. The beds were very comfortable and we had a great view. We did have a problem with the air the first night. I called down to the desk and they sent someone up within 5 minutes. He replaced the filter and the air worked great from that point on. Parking is $50 a night, but I knew about this in advance. There are several public parking garages availble if you would like a cheaper rate. I perfer to cut a few corners elsewhere. Overall great stay......

Reviews.Title: “Nice + Convienent”
Reviews.Author: cohcoh95
Reviews.Content: We had stayed several nights there, in part for tourism and in part for a conference. The location was great: close to the Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, etc. The underground shops and restaurants accessible from the hotel made getting around the city easier on a rainy day, plus there is a Metra station down there for getting places further out. It was very close to the Chicago Loop and the Willis Tower. The only thing that could have made it better would have been a pool. Rooms were nice, too! Internet was super pricey ($29/hour at the Internet CafÃ©) but if you can survive without it, you will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: travelingjacki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after getting a great deal from Hotwire. To avoid having to pay the valet fees, we first checked our luggage at the hotel and then parked the car at O'Hare for $9/night and took the L back into the city. It took awhile, but the savings made it completely worth the time. As for the hotel, we loved it! I have kind of an elevator phobia, so at check-in I asked for a lower level room, and they had no problem accommodating me. The staff was all very friendly, and when we came back to our room on one 80 degree day to find that the air conditioner was broken, someone was sent up within 15 minutes. The room itself was somewhat small, but for two people there was plenty of space. We had a renovated room, with a queen-sized bed. We didn't have any problems with hearing another guest's TV, though we were in a corner room, which might've helped. My only complaint was the charge for WiFi. However, the Corner Bakery Cafe, which is just around the corner, provides free WiFi (and good food, to boot). The location was amazing, and I didn't miss having a car at all. Everything was either within walking distance or a short L ride away. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service - Good Rooms & Location”
Reviews.Author: NoidaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my wife as we were attending a conference in Chicago. The hotel offers highly impersonal service, I found the bell desk to be rude, Check-in a difficult process. Anytime you wish to reach an operator or front desk from your room, you are constantly navigating a computer menu (Press 1 for X 2 for Y) and when you do get the option to speak with a live agent, there is usually a wait of 10 to 15 minutes. This is the only hotel in the world I have seen doing so. We were expecting a package from Fedex, which was delivered to the hotel (letter size). The hotel charges $7 +tx in handling fee for receiving the package. This is not a typical 5 star service. That said, the rooms were clean. However the daily maid service from House Keeping was not very good. They would really only clean the bathroom. We have noticed that if we left the towels in the bedroom, they were still there when we came back in the evening. Location of the hotel is good, right next to the magnificent mile. The hotel was very expensive for such poor level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at HRC, and my first as a Gold Passport Diamond. I change my reservation to one that had the AAA and FREE VALET-probably the best deal i've seen here, and better than the AAA free breakfast if you have a car. Regency Club is average compared to others, an usually quite crowded. Room was good with a great view of Michigan Avenue on the 25th floor of the West tower. I must have had the same room as a previous poster, as I did not have a trash can in the room. I requested it 3x to no avail. I finally got one on my 4th request when a housekeeper came by thinking I had asked to clean my room. She brought me a trash can, albeit quite beat up, but it did the trick. I realize in a large hotel like HRC it's hard to be perfect. I'll be back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cherien
Reviews.Content: I had just returned from China and met my daughter to stay for a few days in Chicago. The room was wonderful, the view was great, but the staff was absolutely terrific! The concierge service helped us find and arrange sightseeing in an efficiently, economically, and enjoyably. The hotel is located within walking distance of most things we wanted to see and do with lake and river views. Food in the restaurant was delicious. This hotel has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good overall with just a few disappointments.”
Reviews.Author: tvlawyer
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and location with just a few criticisms. The hotelâ€™s location, near the corner of E. Wacker Drive and Michigan Avenue, couldnâ€™t be better. Itâ€™s a 10 minute walk from the State/Lake station on the orange line. A five-minute walk from the hotel youâ€™ll find the heart of the Michigan Avenue shopping district, the Tribune and Wrigley buildings, and the famous Chicago River boat tours. The hotel is 1980â€™s vintage design and dÃ©cor. Some of the common areas need renovation. The rooms are clean and comfortable (especially the bed!) and renovated with modern amenities such as granite counter tops and flat-screen televisions. The air conditioning system in my room was inadequate and left the room always feeling warm and stuffy. The hotel windows are bolted shut, so thereâ€™s no relief there. The showerhead and water temperature were hard to adjust. Unfortunately, the hotel was sold out and there was no other room available. Guys, take note! The hotelâ€™s bath products, â€œPortico White Gingerâ€�, are VERY flowery. For me it was an unpleasant fragrance that lingered on my skin into the late afternoon. Next time I stay at this hotel I will bring my own soap and shampoo. I got an AAA rate of $135.20/night including breakfast. Thatâ€™s a great deal considering the nice buffet breakfast costs $22.00. I paid for my room using several $100 Hyatt gift certificates sold at Costco for $80. Thus, my pre-tax cost per night was around $108. Valet parking is $53 per night. This hotelâ€™s on-site dining choices are very sparse. Stetsonâ€™s is a traditional Chicago steakhouse where a 12-ounce filet mignon will set you back $48 and all side items are charged a la carte. I did not try it because of mediocre on-line reviews. Bistro 151 is where youâ€™ll find the very decent breakfast buffet and lunch offerings. Oâ€™Daddyâ€™s is an Irish style pub where the beer offering outnumber the menu offerings by 10 to 1. The pub offers little more than one salad, one burger, a couple of sandwiches, and maybe a bowl of soup on the menu. â€œBig Barâ€� is an oh-so-trendy and flashy cocktail lounge with a few nouveau, Asian-fusion snack offerings. Every staff member I encountered, in every area of the hotel, was professional, courteous, and eager to please. There is no shortage of staff in this hotel! I would stay at this hotel again assuming I can get another bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: jramalho_ibmec
Reviews.Content: Excelente Weekend in Chicago from a room facing the Chicago river and just a few steps away from Michigan Ave. Not so pricy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a bit tired and could use a renovation, the Hyatt Regency is a decent place to stay. The staff are friendly and the rooms are spacious. The bathroom is definitely not 4 star, but itâ€™s clean. My husband liked the gym very much. The bar in the lobby gets very lively and serves good, albeit pricey wine. The location is fantastic. Right on the river just a few steps down from Michigan Avenue, itâ€™s just a five minute walk to Millennium Mile across the river, or the Loop. Booked through Hotwire we got a killer deal, and would stay here again if we got a good deal. I would not be willing to pay 4 star rates though, unless the rooms were refurbished and the bathroom completely renovated. That said, we enjoyed our stay in Chicago, and slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt yes, Regency - well, maybe....”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: You get pretty much what you expect from a Hyatt here. Pretty much a conference hotel - rooms are comfortable with great beds like you expect from Hyatt. Its the small details here that you would expect from a Hyatt Regency that I missed. No TV channel guide - so had to keep surfing to try and find channels. No room information of any kind other than room service menu. No waste basket in room, so had to use the one in the bathroom when working at the desk (or move it from the bathroom - only to be returned each day by the maid). Huge backlit mirror in the bathroom is very stylish, but very little shelf space for personal items - except a very narrow shelf above the toilet - so don't put anything that can 'fall in'. No bathmat on half the days. Work surface on desk area is again very stylish - but so smooth and reflective that you can't use an optical mouse. Few electric outlets - so you have to unplug something to use more than one or two plugs (most business travelers will need more than the one desktop outlet). Wifi overpriced like most business hotels - cheaper hotels all give this for free which is a pet peeve... at the rate I paid, you'd think they could through this into the rate. Bars/Restaurants nice, but overpriced enough to make you want to walk a block or two for a more reasonable meal or drink. Minibars are new 'if you even touch anything you bought it' - again overpriced and you can't move anything around to put your own water, etc. Minibar service person seemed to always interrupt at the most inopportune time even though she always said 'I know you didn't use anything' - so why does she have to check? Good things: Reading lights at bed, very nice. Great bed like all Hyatts. Nice views from most rooms. Overall, this hotel seems dedicated to business travelers who need to be here for a conference and where the company will pay for the high rates just to stay within the confines of the venue. For leisure travel - you might want to consider the added price of food/beverage/internet - parking fees very high, so check in advance if you're driving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but some services over priced”
Reviews.Author: Berghof
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property two nights and only have two complaints. More on that later.
