The hotel is perfectly situated on the Chicago River with great views of it and downtown if you are facing north. I stayed in the east tower which is nicely renovated. I am not sure if the west tower is being renovate or not. The room was well appointed and upscale. I payed $85.00 a night via priceline. Check in was fast and friendly. The place is huge and very easy to get turned around in. The two complaints are that like most large convention hotels, they charge for in room internet and sadly, they did not even provide free wi-fi in the lobby. I feel that is just a way to line their pockets especially when you can get it for free at any Motel 6 or the like. Many convention hotels at least give it to you for free in the lobby. My second complaint is the parking fees. They wanted $50.00 a day which is just crazy. No parking spot here or anywhere else is worth $50.00 a day. Again, this is just a way for the hotel to line their pockets. Their are two private parking garages within a few blocks that charge half that rate. Overall, though, the hotel is a nice one, especially with is location.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DeggaryP
Reviews.Content: Great location, great customer service, good rooms, great beds, good gym! I would like to spend less money, but hey, you get what you pay for. I have stayed here many times last year. If its good enough for the president of the United States (he has been staying here many times at the same time as myself) then its good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AkronTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Love this place. I even loved it more that we got it for half price on priceline. The location is excellent...in the middle of everything. Just south of of Chicago River and N. Michigan Avenue, West of Navy Pier, East of the L loop, and North of Millennium Park and such. Everything is within walking distance. Some reviews are complaining about the size of the hotel... I guess they are uninformed that this hotel is the largest hotel in the Chicago. That being sad, we were not treated like a number. Check in and check out were simple. The concierge is more than happy to help with your needs. The rooms are standard size and the beds comfy. Nothing was lacking. Someone noted that the refrigerator could not be used to store your food as there would be a fine as it was filled with stuff already. Folks, this is standard for a big city hotel. And if you need to refrig. something be creative. I took the ice bag, filled it with ice, and placed it on top of our pizza container. Then, the next day I put our drinks we purchased from the store in the ice bucket. No problem. Our room was very close to the elevator and It was somewhat of a distraction, but considering we paid half price via priceline I wasn't complaining. The room service is great, fast, yummy and friendly. We had appetizers and drinks at the "Big Bar" which we good and the service was good as well. Yes, the hotel is huge and there was a ton of conferences going on then, but we felt that met every need, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was upgraded to a suite and it was the...”
Reviews.Author: captshaw
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a suite and it was the best I've ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Treatment Despite Size”
Reviews.Author: bmfc1
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The tremendous size of the facility didn't stop the staff members from giving me special treatment. I was there for a conference and was impressed at how well the hotel managed to take care of the 700 people in my group. It's a beautiful hotel, situated right near Millennium Park and downtown. If you run, it's a block from the shore.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: mrsdebdav
Reviews.Content: I come to Chi a few times a year to visit my daughter. I thought I should try this hotel since it's a brand name. What a mistake. I hate this hotel. Location isn't great, rates aren't great, and I can't even get CBS channel 2 to come in without static. What century is this hotel in? The property is too big, too commercial, and charges for wifi. No upside to staying here. If you put your own food in their minibar, you get charged $25. Don't even know what floor the gym is on, and there's no info to tell me. This place is a factory. Go to a smaller hotel. I like Klimpton Monaco and regret I didn't rebook there. Won't make that mistake twice.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is a great city --- and this the Hyatt Regency is in a great location to see the city”
Reviews.Author: global_pov
Reviews.Content: Chicago is a GREAT city and the Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive is at a GREAT location to experience the city. One of the reasons that I stayed at this hotel was because I received a GREAT rate from Priceline.com for a stay on Magnificent Mile in Chicago. I had bid the rate and it was accepted by the Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive. And I am very happy with the result. Not only was the rate accepted by the Hyatt Regency great , but so was the experience of staying at the hotel. The check in service was quick and friendly, I was given clean and inviting room, the staff was friendly and attentive, and I enjoyed my 2 day weekend leisurely stay . The Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive is centrally located on Magnificent Mile and is within walking distance to many of Chicago's sight-seeing venues, including Millenium Park and the Chicago Art Institute. Shopping is also within walking distance of the hotel, right along N. Michigan (Magnificent Mile) or the Loop district of downtown Chicago, where Macy's Department Store is located. There are plenty of fantastic restaurants within walking distance including one that I would recommend called "Quartinos" (N.State/Ontario) (Italian - with thin crust pizza and gourmet toppings - gourmet pastas and other savory cuisine ) A gourmet topping thin crust pizza and a 1/4 bottle of merlot cost me $20 plus tip ... a reasonable price for a good meal and pleasant service. When I arrived at around 5:30 p.m. the restaurant was full, however the staff was quick to accommodate me with a table for one, which most restaurants don't normally do. So 'Quartino's' receives a a very strong approval rating from me on its food, service and menu pricing. In general the Hyatt Regency on Wacker Drive offered me great value for my dollar, notwithstanding that I didn't receive internet service .... but one doesn't need the internet when one comes to experience the sights, sounds, and flavors of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great.”
Reviews.Author: BlakeTyner
Reviews.Content: I am on a committee that had a meeting in one of the conference rooms at the Chicago Hyatt and had negotiated a group rate of $139/night. Since my wife was not terribly keen on the idea of taking a cab alone if she needed to go somewhere when I was in my meeting, we decided to go ahead and book at the Hyatt at that rate. Looking back, and knowing what people are bidding on these rooms, I would NOT pay $139 again. The hotel's location is decent; our room looked out over the river, and we were able to walk to all the places we wanted to go (except the Willis tower--that's a bit of a hike.) Cab from Union Station was roughly 6 bucks. We were greeted by a doorman who directed us to the 2nd floor of the East Tower for check in. He unloaded our luggage from the trunk of the taxi. In through the automatic revolving door, up the escalator, and to check-in. There was a bit of a line, but there were 6 or 7 people working the desk, and it took no longer than 5 minutes to get checked in. The lady made sure to let us know about needing our hotel key to operate the elevators at night, and that there were sensors in the snack/mini bar. If you pick something up from there, you are charged immediately. Our room was 2362, and I can echo the sentiment of a previous reviewer who had a xx62 room--you can hear the rumble of the elevators all the time, as you're the second door down from the bank of elevators. It sounds like a distant rumbling--exactly as described, like you're too close to the el. My wife and I are medium sleepers, and it did not keep us awake or anything; if you sleep light, get a room farther away. Our next door neighbor cranked up the radio when he/she took a shower one afternoon, and we could hear every word of the music, but once the shower was over, we could hear nothing else from any nearby rooms. One night a group of college students yelled down the hall outside, but that was a one-off. Otherwise, it was quiet. We had a king room, and it was fine. Maybe a little on the small side, but not too bad. The desk and office chair were helpful for typing on the laptop. One note--while there is WiFi at the hotel, and an ethernet cord in your room, the internet isn't free. We didn't need it, since we carry smartphones. The "J's Express" coffee/snack shop in the lobby offers good stuff at decent prices, and the baristas there serve very good Starbuck's products. The gift shop next door is a bit overpriced. I know cigarettes are expensive in Chicago, but they charge $10.98 per pack. If you're a smoker, you can probably get a better deal at a Walgreens within walking distance. Eating at the lobby coffee shop is too expensive. We paid $51 for a lunch of two sandwiches, two salads, and two teas. Walk to a nearby restaurant. Our food was decent, but bland and nothing to write home about. For much less, we ate a lot better at Pizano's Pizza. One note--this hotel will lock you out of your room if there is a problem with your credit card. For some reason, mine was rejected the first time they tried to run it (on check-out morning) and when I came back upstairs with coffee, my key no longer worked. The maid's master key didn't, either. We went to the front desk, where the clerk cheerfully fixed the problem and issued 2 new keys--she also checked us out at that time. However, when we got back up to the 23rd floor, the new keys didn't work. A call to the front desk resulted in my being transferred twice, with clerks saying that we were already checked out, before they sent a security lady to unlock our door. On the plus side, the security lady arrived within 5 minutes and was very sweet. For smokers: rather than going out the front door for a cigarette, there's a much better smokers nook on the side of the building; go to the 1st floor, and from the elevators take the first door to the left, just after Stetson's. Also, if you want an immediate cab, there's a taxi stand right outside that door. Nice place overall, but I agree with others that they try to nickle and dime you too much. That's probably okay if you're traveling on a company expense account, but for the casual traveler or vacation, hit one of the bidding websites, and do NOT plan on getting anything from inside the hotel. Better deals on everything are within a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... great location.... caution if you are a light sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: reynoldsgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt Regency for a weekend getaway using Hotwire. Particularly for what we paid, we would definitely return to this hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and did not treat us as second class citizens since we had paid such a reasonable amount. Our room had a wonderful view of the Chicago River and John Hancock building. The caution for light sleepers: the elevators make a quiet, light, constant rumble throughout the night. The first night we assumed an "L" train ran close to the hotel but finally realized that it was the elevators. We were in room xx62.... room xx60 is right next to the elevators. We had no problem sleeping through it but if you are a light sleeper you might be bothered by it. It is very convenient to Millennium Park. The closest "L" station is at State and Lake, which is a short walk. When ready to go to O'Hare, we paid the $5.00 fair for a taxi to the Clark/Lake station to avoid the transfer hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lizardMarquette_MI
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times, getting the rooms on weekends at a great rate. This hotel is a convention hotel, but it is a good location for Chicago -right on Wacker Drive, easy access for shopping and sightseeing. Prices at bar and restayrants are pricy, but you can avoid that. If you drive into the city and do not want to pay the $50 valet parking (it is convenient), there is a public gargae right on Wacker a half block from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: jaxxmack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located walking distance to Millenium Park and the Theatre District. There is also plenty of shopping and good restaurants all near by. The front desk and staff were very welcoming and helpful with any questions we had. Our room was located in the west tower (newly renovated). It was quiet and away from the elevators. Used hotwire to book the hotel and got a really good price. Parking is $50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago, Chicago....my kind of town!”
Reviews.Author: Southcoaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our overnight visit to Chicago! My family-which includes myself, husband and 14 year old son-chose this hotel because of its close proximity to attractions (walking distance to Michigan Avenue) and the AAA Breakfast Rate-$151.01 tax included) for a lake view room and full breakfast buffet for two- was unbeatable! The fact that my best friend gave us a $50 Hyatt gift card for Christmas certainly influenced our decision as well. When we checked in, we could not have asked for better service than what we received from Maria. She was friendly, helpful and answered all our questions concerning how to find particular restaurants and shops in Chicago. She also was kind enough to give us an extra breakfast voucher for our son, so we would not have to pay for his meal! What impressed me about the room was the size of the two double beds. Normally we get a king bed with a rollaway when we travel, but since we were staying one night only we agreed to make the best of it so we would not have to pay for a rollaway. We were pleasantly surprised to find they were queen sized beds, which were the most comfortable hotel beds we ever slept in! We were also upgraded at no charge to a renovated room in the West Tower, which was immaculate. As requested, our room overlooked the Chicago River, Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. The breakfast buffet was excellent (it costs $22 per person if you don't have a breakfast package) and included some of the best oven-roasted potatoes I have ever eaten. Other foods on the breakfast menu were bacon, scrambled eggs, sausage, omelets to order, Eggs Benedict, turkey ham, pancakes, bagels, cereals, muffins and fruit. Our servers, Punkaj and Alberto, were very accommodating and professional. I also like the fact that taxis are in front of the hotel constantly. That certainly came in handy when we decided to go to Navy Pier. You could walk to Navy Pier from the hotel but you have to cross a highway. Even the hotel recommends you take a taxi there, which ran us about $7.00 each way. The hotel definitely caters to a business clientele, as there are no pools or game rooms for kids. But we were so tired from sightseeing in Chicago all day that those amenities were irrelevant to us. To be perfectly honest, I have nothing negative to say about this place, and I am a very particular traveler, as anyone who has read my past reviews can attest to. My family agrees on two things-1. We want to return to Chicago to do the city more justice; and 2. When we do, we're staying at the Hyatt Regency Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nicely decorated room although on the small side!”
Reviews.Author: applestrudel
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this hotel. On check in the King room we booked was not available so we were offered either a Queen room or have to wait for an unset amount of time for a King room to become available, we opted to take the Queen room. I had requested a room in the West wing as I had previously read these had been recently updated. Room 1510 which we were allocated was tastefully decorated although rather on the small side. Everything was in full working condition and spotlessly clean, great view over the river and towards navy Pier. Now for the negatives, the air conditioning was incredibly noisy and I would hate to think that I needed to have this running all through the night. Bed's were very hard and not as comfortable as the hotel beds we usually sleep in. We checked out on Sunday at the west wing reception by Erin who was the most impolite and unhelpful member of staff I have ever dealt with in a Hotel. Never used the hotelâ€™s restaurantâ€™s, just used the Irish Bar which was nice but a small Baileyâ€™s cost just under $12. Donâ€™t pay the high price for breakfast, next door at Houlihanâ€™s Restaurant they offer a buffet breakfast everyday for $9.99 which was very good quality. For the right price I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room!!!”
Reviews.Author: coldfeet52
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Got a great deal through priceline.com. Wonderful breakfast buffet at Houlihan's next door.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Service for a 5 Star Price - LONG LINES & LONG WAITS Check In/Check Out - Valet”
Reviews.Author: MovieDoug
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Regency is basically a "factory" for pumping people in and then pumping them out. They have hundreds and hundreds of rooms and thousands of people staying there. And as such, you are treated like cattle here. Get in, get out, don't ask questions, and keep moving please. Upon entry, we were greeted by "Dan", a rude bell captain working the entrance driveway. He seemed annoyed that we were checking in and ordered us to park. He never said, Hello, Welcome, or Thank You. He also did not inform us that we needed to go to the second floor to check in. After wandering around the large entry way, we finally found check in. Trust me, its not easy to find. There were 40 people in line and only 2 people working the front desk. After 45 minutes, we were finally able to check in. The lady working the check-in was not completely fluent in English. It was obvious English was her second language. She was nice, but not the level of what should be expected for this establishment. Thankfully, We were given a nice room with a great view. The problem was, the walls at this hotel are paper thin, and you can hear everything in the rooms on both sides. We were shocked to hear tvs, conversations, music, and yes, even that. The conversations were not anything above a talking level, but yet could be easily heard next door, so be careful what you say or do here. Our final complaint was the valet service. Not only was it $50 a day, but it was a 40 minute wait to get our car. When we brought it to the desk managers attention, a goodlooking tall black gentleman, he stated that on Sunday they are very busy. He also did not apologize or offer any kind of compensation. I would like to say to him now, if you know that Sundays are busy, HIRE MORE PEOPLE !!! At $50 a day, there should be plenty of funds to do so. On the good side of things, the location is beautiful, unless you like the nightlife. This area is DEAD at nighttime. The BIG BAR was Excellent !! Great Drinks !! Great Food !!! and Great SERVICE !! The Bartenders were awesome. Super-friendly and attentive !! If only the Big Bar could take over the whole hotel !! In final, I would not recommend this hotel !! There are much nicer places for the same rate, such as Hotel 71, 2 blocks away, where you are treated with the star service you pay for. PS....The Internet is 13.99 a day, and they nickel and dime you for everything. Don't touch the stocked refrigerator with electric sensors or you will be charged. I am shocked that they don't charge for the Soap or Shampoo. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great lobby bar, $50/night to park...”
Reviews.Author: echolake
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice hotel. Lobby bar was very cool. Rooms are nice enough, a little tired, but still very nice and there is a pub too. I Pricelined this one - and it was a good deal. The only gotcha is parking - it's $50/night at the hotel. There are other options nearby for $30. If you need to stay in this part of Chicago you can;t go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: The best thing about they Hyatt is it's location--bang in the centre of downtown Chicago with Millenium Park and the Magic Mile shopping area just a short walk away. If you have a river facing room on a higher floor as I did, the view is pretty spectacular. The staff is friendly, helpful and well informed. The rooms are clean, well equipped and well maintained. My only grouse is that on both occassions that i gave clothes for laundry, they did not come back to me for two days, and then too, when I specifically asked housekeeping for them. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice renovations”
Reviews.Author: abst14
Reviews.Content: This large two tower hotel is located near the middle of Michigan Avenue. A block away is the best shopping in the world - either direction. The hotel is older and has an 80's look outside and in the lobby but the newly renovated rooms in the west tower are very attractive. very stylish, clean, fresh smelling, good size. The gym was not convenient. It seemed to be in the basement in a small store front. Disappointing better to walk instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Worked Great for Our Family”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3933
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for our family, including kids and grandkids. The staff at check-in treated us wonderfully, and despite our late arrival we were assigned 3 rooms near each other on the 24th floor of the East Wing. The rooms appeared to have been recently renovated and we were all very satisfied. Beds were extremely comfortable. We used room service a couple of times and although it was a bit pricey (what room service isn't?) the food was good and the service was prompt and courteous Despite our concerns about the large size and business orientation of this hotel, it worked out great for our family. We had a wonderful time at the Navy Pier, Shedd Aquarium, Millennium Park (just a couple of minutes walk), etc. It would have been nice to have a swimming pool, but there were plenty of other activities to keep us busy.

Reviews.Title: “I love Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingX
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hyatt Regency. I received a room on the 36th floor of the West Tower. It wasn't a great view but the room was fabulous! The service was wonderful too. There was no ice machine on my floor so the hotel staff would bring it to me. They have an outstanding staff and I appreciated all of the wonderful service I received. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Make No Changes!”
Reviews.Author: PittBusiTraveler
Reviews.Content: This chain requires prepayment and if there are any changes your initial payment is lost. I added a day to a 3-day prepaid reservation and ended up with a separate 4-day reservation. My Corp. Card was charged over $500.00 for the 3-day stay and then over $700.00 for the 4-day stay when I only wanted/needed one reservation. When I pointed out the issue, all I heard was "pre-paid, nonrefundable." If there's a chance the parameters of your business trip may be changed, stay away from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Big Place, Friendly Staff, Slow Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: SpartyIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: This is a huge facility. I stayed two nights in an East Tower room for a conference. All the staff from the valets, to check-in in, to check out, all were very helpful and friendly. As stated this place is huge and the staff were always around to direct you should you get disoriented. I did not utilize any of the on-site restaurants, but heard good reviews from fellow-attendees that did visit. Great location just off Michigan Ave and adjacent to the Riverwalk. Paid $158/night. Valet parking is $50/night, but conference had a 50% discount. There is a public garage very close, so I was told. Room was good-sized with a large flat screen. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom very good size. Stayed on the end of the 15th floor and it was very quiet, no noise from other rooms. Would definitely stay here again. Only problem was getting hot water in the morning. First morning it took around twenty minutes to get hot water. On the second morning I let the water run for twenty minutes prior to getting in the shower and all was well. Granted, that's not a good use of the resource, but it beats the heck out of a cold shower!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel- some of rooms are good, some are not”
Reviews.Author: CecibelB
Reviews.Content: The east wing of the hotel is great. The main hotel building is just average. However the location of the hotel is great. If you need a shower, clean sheets and centrally located, the this hotel is great. I wouldn't emphasize on the service. Some people get it right and some of them not.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Room”
Reviews.Author: crose75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights to partake in the Chicago St. Patricks festivities. Check in went super fast, and we were given a room the was so newly remodeled you could still catch a whiff of the fresh paint. It overlooked the river, which made for some great shots when they dyed it! Also, they allowed us a late check out of 2pm, at no charge, in order to not miss the parade. The beds were amazing, as was the bathroom. Plenty of space, with a very nice desk set up. And being one block from Michigan, and a 10 minute walk to Navy Pier, this is a great location. Couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the Trump to get the feel of what Hyatt use to be”
Reviews.Author: BEEKDEEK
Reviews.Content: Location is the key for this hotel. Room temp and noise from the A/C - Heat is very disturbing. They have put in a flat screen to keep up with the times but the same old bed.bath and tile is from 1984.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience - but remember this is a convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: Let's face it - this is a BIG Hyatt and its main purpose is to host BIG conventions - and it does. It is not able to provide personalized service nor is it going to be a comfortable experience. If you are not part of the convention, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: qa2152
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline for an overnight stay. Room was clean, staff at check in were pleasant. Not sure I'd stay there at their advertised rates though. Location is close to shopping and walking distance to Navy Pier. Not sure how full hotel was for our Saturday night stay but we had a room on the 22nd floor at the end of the hallway and didn't hear anyone else on the floor. Room was a slightly odd shape due to its location and I'm not sure I'd have liked that for a longer stay. Would stay there again for the price we paid (under $100) though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BmxFamily
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a conference of 4,000+ . The hotel did not seem overwhelmed with this number of people, and the conference facilities in the 3 "underground" levels of the West Tower were great. Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, and the Hancock Tower were all within walking distance and there were several boat & bus tours were available across the street. I had a room on the 31st floor of the West Tower and it was nicely appointed & cleaned daily by housekeeping. Other then the door across the hall, it was very quiet. The bathroom floor could have used mopping before my arrival but that is my only complaint there. The West Tower was easily accessible to the main East Tower, however there were no amenities such as food as in J's Express & there was no front desk personnel. J's Express was supposed to be 24 hours, but when I arrived at 5:45am for an early flight, there was no one there. The trip to the airport is 30 minutes and I was disappointed to not have any food. $13+ a day seemed a bit much for internet access (and it wasn't that accessible - I had to plug in), the elevators were incredibly slow & it didn't seem like they were all functioning. The only other disappointing piece was the food for room service. I ordered 2 dinners and they were both mediocre and a bit pricey for the quality. I did not try the restaurants on site. However, if you go to the bronze level of the West Tower and head straight through the doors it opens up into dozens of places to get food during the day as it is the hidden hub of the local business folks. I was thrilled to discover this gem. Upon check-in, I had had a particularly unpleasant travel to Chicago and was a bit annoyed when the check-in person told me to wait so she could check-in airline personnel. However, Rocco came along and was incredibly pleasant and was able to turn things around (thank you!!). It was a pleasant stay, and I would stay again. Great site for a conference, too.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Times at the Hyatt Chicago”
Reviews.Author: niagAdaoRehTnO
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and common spaces were wonderful. The newly remodeled room I had on the Concierge Level was the darkest and most poorly appointed I've ever stayed in. No drawers for clothing (I was there for a week-long conference and had to leave everything in my luggage), one non-functioning office chair at a desk that was very shabby (it must have been overlooked in the remodel, as it had battle scars that would do a Sherman Tank proud). The only other chair in the room was some silver, plastic, art deco thing that faced away from the TV. The lighting was so poor that I had to use one of the goose-neck reading lamps on the headboard of the bed to look into my luggage. The bed was really comfortable, though. If the conference comes to this hotel again, I'm staying home.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: RachelLP
Reviews.Content: Positives: Offers a Noon check out vs. most hotels in Chicago that offer 11AM, great location near the river, shopping, and good restaurant options. Negatives: Hotel has cookie cutter decorating, kind of noisy, commercial feeling bathrooms and no spa on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but walls are too thin!”
Reviews.Author: vanjovi1
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. But man, we could hear everything going on around us, including next door and especially in the hallways. For such a modern and nice hotel, I would have been happier if we could have had some peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lokeyh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in downtown and is near to Chicago river. It is very convenient place to stay. Michigan Avenue is just north of the hotel and Millennium Park is just south of it. The room is spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Seajax
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my colleagues. I took the "Go Airport Express" from O'Hare which cost me $50 for a roundtrip ticket and arrived in about 30 minutes to the hotel. There is a main reservation desk in the main lobby, but the van dropped me off at the West tower and I just checked in at the small desk there. The West tower is in the middle of being renovated, so there is construction going on if that is a concern before you stay here. When I saw my room, I couldn't have been more pleased. I had a great view of the river and it was just renovated so everything looked brand new. It is right near Michigan Avenue and awesome restaurants. I'm not sure why another reviewer said not to walk around the neighborhood at night. It seemed perfectly safe to me with lots of people walking around. Anyway, the bathroom was clean with a mirror which was backlit, so putting on my makeup was like being at the makeup counter at a department store. However, my pleasure soon turned to displeasure at about midnight when I was awoken by my neighbor's TV. My room had two adjoining doors to the neighboring rooms. By the way, why do hotels do this? Most people don't need to share rooms. Anyway, I could hear every word of his program he was watching. The TV wasn't loud, it was because of those adjoining doors which offer no soundproofing! This was proven again the next morning when I heard my other neighbor on the phone. I could hear every word she was saying, including her full phone number when she left someone a message! I asked the front desk to move me, but they didn't have any rooms available. So it continued for 3 days. I heard my neighbor's TV at night, blowing his nose, the other neighbor on her phone...it was a complete nightmare. This next example will show you how poor the soundproofing is: I was awoken at 5am by my phone vibrating on the nightstand (or so I thought was my phone). I went to go turn it off, and it wasn't my phone vibrating- it was my neighbor's!! Then I heard him walk to the bathroom...urinate...then let out a big fart. It sounded like he was in my bathroom, not in another room! Now.....If I can hear all this, it tells you how BAD the soundproofing is between the rooms. If other people who have stayed here have adjoining rooms like this and don't hear anything...its either because they had no neighbors, or they were very quiet. If you do choose to stay here, make sure to ask for a room without the connecting doors. I couldn't sleep well, because I was kept up late by one neighbor...then awoken early by another. Oh, and my sink started backing up also, but I asked them to come fix it after I checked out since I didn't want to deal with it. The whole experience was just terrible. Adding to the nightmare, the last morning I decided to splurge for room service for breakfast because I was in a rush. I ordered a bagel with smoked salmon and cream cheese. Imagine my surprise when my bagel turned out to be blueberry. Since when is a blueberry bagel eaten with smoked salmon?!? Glad that set me back $25. Although the room was clean and the hotel was in a convenient location, hearing every movement by my neighbors at all hours completely negates anything positve about this hotel. I asked my colleague how her stay was. Her shower knob broke off the first time she tried to use it, and she couldn't access her coffee maker because it was built into an alcove. The cord was too short so she couldn't pull it out of the alcove to open the top to put water in it. She also said she didn't even have any counter space in the bathroom to put her things. I showed her the pictures of my bathroom, and she said hers didn't look like that at all. She was in the West tower also. Parking here is about $53 a day, so if you have a rental car, just beware of that. The breakfast buffet was $22, so its not a cheap either. I was very disappointed in my stay, but again, if you do stay here, ask for a room that doesn't have adjoining doors, and maybe in the main tower you'll have better luck not the West tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttons78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while I was in Chicago to attend the 2010 Annual Symposium. I didn't book the conference package offered through my organization. I got a great rate online through Hotwire.com for $83 per night. The shuttle from O'Hare Airport cost $72 roundtrip for 2 people. This hotel has a great downtown location within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, and the Hancock building to name a few attractions. It is right across the street from the Chicago Riverwalk. I got there early and check-in was easy. The only problem is that I was given a room that was already occupied! I immediately went back downstairs to the lobby to request another room. I asked for a room with a view of the river but they were not able to accomodate me. The room was nice and offered a nice view of downtown. My only complaint is although the room was "non-smoking" I experienced the smell of cigarette smoke coming from the bathroom vent almost daily. I asked housekeeping to come spray the carpet with deodorizer but this didn't help. Keeping the bathroom door closed at all times was the only way to alleviate the smell. This hotel is huge and was full of conventioneers! The concierge was very knowledgeable about local restaurants and helpful in providing maps and directions. A few of the places I walked to more than once was Giordano's Pizza, Walgreens and Starbucks. I ordered room service one night and it was on point! The girl who took my order was very pleasant to speak with. The food arrived promptly and was more than enough for 2 people to share. I spent about $25 including tip on that meal. Internet service is not free. The Hyatt charges $13.63 per day for this service. Use of the business center will cost you as well as it is not operated by the Hyatt. Overall, I enjoyed my first trip to Chicago and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hyatt Regency agan!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARS819
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for just one night, and loved the hotel. It had an awesome water feature in the hotel, and great large bar. Like all Hyatts it had a very comfortable bed, lot's of pillows, and large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, Breathtaking Parking charges”
Reviews.Author: TheIsleman
Reviews.Content: Positive- decent location for someone who desires downtown chicago, though one must take great care not to walk around the neighborhood at night- cab is a must. Hyatt amenities are evident- friendly & efficient staff, organized, clean facility. Negatives- its like being in an airport- hundreds if not thousands of other guests that you must fight your way through to get checked in & out, or to go outside. Parking, whether or not a guest of the hotel, is now $50 + tax + tips ($5 expected both in & out). Room construction in progress!!!! Our room smelled like a paint store. Awful. Didn't have time to go through the hassle of going back down to the grand central station-like lobby to change rooms. Slept horribly from the toxic odors caused by a room & floor that had just been reopened after having been renovated. They're working on the floor just below- noise likely an issue during weekdays. Though I typically like Hyatts, I would not recommend staying at this hotel unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, comfortable and no surprises”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantLondoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt R when running the marathon in October 09. For this kind of stay - where the amenities are crucial - it was the perfect choice. - Very centrally located on Wacker drive - Very large hotel, with large number of amenities including plenty of eating options. - Staff were professional and courteous, service (e.g. room service) very quick. No small feat given the hotel was almost full. - Rooms are large, quiet, well equipped but functional. Decor is uninspiring and some areas are dated. - Hotel can seem extremely busy, which I liked but might trouble some. In summary, this is a very large, comfortable hotel that was perfect for a stay in which (as I was running a marathon) location, a comfortable room and predictable food options were very important. On this basis I have little complaint. However, if you are looking for something chic or a little more personal this is probably not the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: ski fanatic
Reviews.Content: I asked for a high floor away from the elevator and that is what I got. The room was pleasantly decorated, functional and very clean. I didnâ€™t need a whole lot of service but when I did they were pleasant and prompt. I used the fitness center which was well equipped and everything was in working order. It is in a great location at one end of the Michigan Avenue shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but very busy”
Reviews.Author: nytravelergirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really nice, great views, really huge. In the heart of Chicago, really pretty. Pictures of room online are pretty true to reality. Room was clean and updated with a lot of space. Lounge had great drinks and staff was very nice. I was in town for a conference for work so hotel was very crowded. The steakhouse was also very good. This was quite possibly the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. It was hard to not get woken up at night. The other coworkers I was travelling with agreed that it was very noisy - you could hear the elevators, people showering in the next room, and doors slamming and opening. I wanted to see if I could change rooms, but no availability. Not sure if it was just the room or floor I was on, or if it was just so busy.

Reviews.Title: “NLR Chicago Trip”
Reviews.Author: pamason
Reviews.Content: Work didn't work out, hotel was ok but pricey, people in Chicago are rude...luckily i'm a Cubs fan so i love Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with stay at Convention Sized Property”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the reviews and booking through Priceline at very LOW rate, I was not expecting to be impressed by this hotel (Especially because of it's size... Convention properties don't ever really impress.) When we arrived to check-in at around 7pm the line was very long on a Saturday evening so we decided to try the self check-in machines. This is the first time I have tried self check-in. The system did not allow me to choose a room with one king bed, so I had to go back in line to speak with a front desk agent. This defeats the purpose of self check-in and by that time I was a little annoyed. The front desk agent was very gracious and gave us a room on the 32nd floor with Concierge Lounge access and a SPECTACULAR view of the river. The room was also one of the roomiest standard hotel rooms I have ever been in. Very modern design... We only stayed one night so we did not get to experience much but I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Spica66
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed on Saturday night. Checked in at 3:00PM with no wait and went straight to a large, clean, well-appointed room on the 32nd floor. Well-stocked with supplies and a beautiful view of the river walk. Very quiet with excellent beds, pillows and bedding. Would recommend to anyone travelling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: danielswiss64
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and stayed here to just have a break downtown. I decided to have two hotel experiences. I had bookked TheWit for one night and then had Priceline surprise me for a second night in the city. I got a great rate, but at first was disappointed when placed into the Hyatt Regency because it is so large and never seemed a very nice hotel to me (compared to other 4 * hotels). I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. The check-in was extremely corteous and fast on a Friday night, early evening. Staff were very accomodating and helpful. I had hoped for a King-size room and was offered one when asked. I did not like my first room assignment on the 12th floor because it was close to the elevator and it seemed noisy. When I asked for another room, I was put on the 37th floor with a view of the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue. Beautiful room. Decor was very nice and the room was large and the bed very comfortable. Liked the feather/down pillows. Bathroom was very nice with bath/'shower combo. Some interesting touches like a good massage shower head. I loved the view. Large and nice TV. I must say the Hyatt exceeded my expectations. I think I wasa very lucky with the room, especially for the low price I had bid on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - But Huge Size Creates Complications”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: Got a fantastic deal on our stay here so want to honor that fact while pointing out some disappointments. Most noteworthy... SIZE - This place is a monster. We're smart people and had some problems navigating the hotel. For instance, getting to the health club is no small feat (and it's not well located). SERVICE - We didn't have the easiest stay imaginable. Arrived super late, had to change rooms mid-way though, etc. Through all of this, the service we received was quite good. At times, the lines at the front desk were brutal, but staff members seemed to stay very positive. ROOM - Well updated within the past few years, but the rooms feel a bit cramped and dark. Also, they felt a bit grimy. This is what happens when you update an old (but not old enough to be charming!) building - it never really feels polished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: abenefico
Reviews.Content: Booked through a hotel promotion, so got a rate of around $100 with taxes/etc included. My room was very modern, spacious, and extremely clean. I did not hear any noise from other rooms but this may have been b/c it was a slow night. The location is great - perfect because it is walking distance to the Mag Mile for shopping (going north) or Millenium Park (going south.) There are also several very convenient bus routes on Michigan that can take you up to Lincoln Park or to Union Station. The concierge was very friendly and extremely knowlegable. The best part about the visit was the extra service. I accidentally left my !wallet! at the coffee kiosk on the lower level. It took me about a half hour to realize this by which time I was about a mile away from the hotel. I called the hotel and explained the situation and it turned out that the staff had found my wallet and were keeping it in security for me to pick up. It was such a huge relief. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: RafaelM3
Reviews.Content: One of the highlights of the Hyatt Regency Chicago is the location itself. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, attractions, and EVERYTHING! Hotel service is great and the Convention Area is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Lauren137
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked into the hotel there was a massive convention going on, which caused the hotel to be dirty, chaotic, and understaffed. We were initially given the wrong room (which was later corrected), but had awful housekeeping (didn't even fold our towels and one day had rehung a dirty, stained towel), paper-thin walls, and inattentive staff. The club floor (which was just a room since it is undergoing renovations) was hardly cleaned and smelled awful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Besides the great location, this was truly the worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “wful hotel”
Reviews.Author: teklasa
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel downtown so that i could do my shopping near the Magnificent Mile and have some time to relax before the holiday rush. But OMG, i knew the minute i stepped into the hotel that it was not going to happen. Upon entering the lobby, there was chaos. There were so many people (about 100) loitering around with children playing and running around. Check-in took 25 minutes because there were only two front desk people to handle people checking in. There was a line to get into an elevator. It took me 15 minutes to get into one. The walls are paper thin, i can hear the people next door the entire time (talking and using the bathroom). The only saving grace was housekeeping. The lady was so nice and so quick. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: JamieC4
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, location, rooms, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; decent hotel if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: thatnyswagger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance or a very short cab ride from many downtown attractions and shopping areas, and at night it was pleasant to take a walk along the river. The rooms were up to par in terms of cleanliness and amenities, but service was inconsistent. One one hand, we met some nice people on staff who were super friendly and helpful, and a few who even gave suggestions on how to get around and where to go. On the other, we asked for laundry/dry cleaning service when we got there because we needed to have a suit ready for a wedding two days later. Despite multiple phone calls over two days to the front desk and housekeeping, and being told that all we had to do was leave the clothing and a form in a bag to be picked up in the morning, the suit was never picked up. Also, on one day during our stay, we were in our room when housekeeping came so we asked them to come back later, but they never returned to clean the room. Neither issue turned out to be catastrophic by any means, but I would have expected more from a Hyatt hotel at their published rates. I can't complain, however, because I booked the hotel through Priceline and was able to stay for $70 per night--a great value for the location, even if the service wasn't flawless. The important stuff (cleanliness of the bathroom and bedding, a comfortable bed) was provided, and room service was prompt and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very polite staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: AJulie
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at this hotel, and I wish I had stayed longer...the staff are courteous and read to help you in any information needed, the room was clean and comfortable, with a good view of the river. This establishment is located by the main streets and within walking distance of main stores, restaurants, and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: A friend once dubbed this place "Contemporary Disney" because of its sleek modern design. My bed was in the middle of the room and the desk was connected to it (see photo). It was very "modern," but made the room feel small. Also, there was a real lack of lighting in the room. The hotel was undergoing some renovation (particularly the blue East Tower), so I had some daytime construction noise, but it was quiet at night. Overall, a mediocre hotel - they really pack 'em through during conventions. It's not fancy, but staff is very professional.pretty good place to stay. More on my Chicago trip: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2009/12/work-in-chicago.html

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, expected more from a Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: cms1046
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the noisiest turbo-flushing toilets I've ever heard! I had no idea plumbing could be so loud! You can hear every annoying flush around you...and it'll wake you out of a deep sleep or really spoil a romantic mood! The room decor was beautiful, view was wonderful. Be careful though, whatever you use in the room, Housekeeping won't replace for the next morning. I made the in-room coffee provided...they cleaned the room but did not replace the coffee supplies for the next morning. I had to call and request it. 2 drinking glasses were provided. I used one the first morning....they didn't replace it when cleaning, so we had to share 1 drinking glass that evening. Sorry...I just expect more attention to detail at a Hyatt Regency. The concierge, restaurant, and check-in staff were absolutely perfect in their service. Breakfast buffet was wonderful. Although their location is great, I would not stay here again....I still have nightmares about the sound of their flushing turbo-toilets!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view... everything else disappointed”
Reviews.Author: killertofu
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt has an amazing unobstructed view over the river and it's beautiful at night. Its location is superb, situated two minutes from the start of the Magnificent Mile and all the shopping you can endure. However, that's pretty much where it ends for me. Rooms were average, poorly decorated, and not 4-star quality. The iPod functionality on my clock was broken, no pens were provided in-room, and colleagues who stayed on other floors constantly complained about noise and distractions that prevented them from getting a good night's rest. Sources of noise include: - Elevator doors opening/closing - Elevator gears - Street noise - Water running through the pipes Unfortunately, all the noises above were not momentary but persisted through the entire night due to the placement of their rooms and throughout the week we stayed at the Hyatt. It's almost like the building was designed with no consideration for sound-proofing! To also not have internet included at the price we paid was almost highway robbery... isn't it archaic to still charge for in-room internet nowadays? With that said, the hotel is still a decent stay. The service was acceptable and friendly. The location was convenient, and the view was amazing. I would still recommend this to a friend. If you can find a good deal on this place it's worth it; otherwise, I'd suggest looking at other hotels in the area around Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel, very well located.”
Reviews.Author: bsillon
Reviews.Content: This was a very good and positive surprise. This hotel has maybe only 2 drawbacks: 1-Bad isolation from the hall, like every other hotel in USA, 2-It might get crowded at conference time, because this baby is BIG... Otherwise the amenities are very good, with a nice gym and spa, shops in the basement and the staff is impeccable as usual at Hyatt. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I Expected MUCH More From A Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: SoFlo3
Reviews.Content: We got this room for a great rate, but we still expected a standard four-to-five star Hyatt experience. Yes, it enjoys a great location, but the facility has to be twenty-five years old, and while there have been some facelifts given, it's still pretty shabby. Here are the lowlights: Got to the room and noticed that there was some black stuff in the caulking around the tub. (See photos). I mentioned it to the front desk staffer, who apologized profusely. She said the housekeeping manager would get right on it while we were out at dinner. We got back from dinner and...still had the black stuff in the tub. So, the next morning, I brought it to the attention of the new front desk staffer on duty, and she, too, apologized profusely. (Using almost identical wording as the first woman. As if there were a script she was following...) We asked her to have the housekeeping team address it while we were out at breakfast, so that we could have a clean tub for the rest of our stay. Shockingly, there was no change in our tub after breakfast. Went back to the counter, spoke with the same staffer from earlier in the morning. She asked if we'd like to move to a new room, which, while inconvenient, sounded like a good idea. To her credit, she did offer to give us some sort of freebie for our trouble. But since I didn't need free internet or food vouchers, there was apparently nothing else she could offer me. I asked if they could comp my $48 parking bill (yes, that's a daily rate!) Sorry, no dice. So, we went to look at the new room. Unfortunately it had gunk in the tub too! (See photo.) What's This Foolishness? Making matters worse, when we returned from breakfast, we found that our sheets actually had multiple rips and tears in them! It was impossible to miss them, which tells me that the housekeeping staff either didn't care or wasn't given the guidance that, you know, ripped sheets don't really enhance the Hyatt brand. So, I pulled the ripped sheets off the bed and went back to the front desk. We told the desk agent we'd stay in our original room since the new one wasn't much better. (I think the sarcasm was lost on him.) Once again, profuse apologies, housekeeping manager will be calling you, putting our best people on it, yadda yadda. We have two more nights here. It will be interesting to see how this plays out....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt class”
Reviews.Author: ARiley1963
Reviews.Content: Staff and service were excellent from directions to room service. Ultra clean rooms, food was wonderful. Perfect walking distince to Mile shopping and most sights. Loved everything about this hotel. If you want class stay at the Hyatt Regency

Reviews.Title: “Great Updated Room with Great View”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: Check is was fast and professional. We were assigned a corner room with a great view of the river and some downtown landmarks. The room itself was spotless and totally updated although on the small side. The carpet was new, the bed was comfortable and the high definition flat screen was top notch as well. The marble shower and vanity were quite nice. The water pressure was very good and hot water plentiful. Considering the size of the room itself the bathroom was quite large. This Hyatt is a huge property that gets it right both with their rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cateyesinthemoon
Reviews.Content: They Hyatt Regency is a huge hotel - the layout is confusing at first as there are two towers and you have to go back and forth between. The location is excellent - just next to the Chicago River, very close to Lake Michigan and right off Michigan Avenue for shopping and dining. The staff at the hotel were uniformly polite, friendly and helpful. I had a very small room, though it overlooked the river so the view was great. The items that make me give this hotel a 4 rating instead of 5 are the following: relatively limited room service menu - with almost no vegetarian items; very poor lighting in the room (energy efficient fluorescent bulbs in 3 tiny lamps - so dark I could not see to open the combination luggage lock I have); pretty limited television channel lineup on the in-room tv. There is a nice little coffee and food stand downstairs in the atrium area that sells more than just pastry for breakfast (fruit, cereal, snacks, even ice cream) so it's easy to get some food while avoiding a restaurant. Overall this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Great Time”
Reviews.Author: bluesramsrock
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for $59 a night but would have found it a good value at twice that when location and amenities are considered. I have infrequently been given inferior room when booking with Priceline. (My price was about 1/3 the going Internet rate.) So when checking in I often state, I realize there is probably not much you can do because this is a Priceline room. The desk person's reply to that comment was "who says so?" She then gave us a nice room with a great view on the 31st floor looking out on the Chicago river and lake Michigan. I tipped her $10 and she was very appreciative as was I! I would absolutely stay here again but the $48 valet parking fee is not good and there are other parking options nearby that I would explore. (I was told that Hyatt has allocated money to this property for room renovations and that work is underway. While our room hadn't been newly remodeled it was certainly a very nice room with a large Plasma tv. )

Reviews.Title: “Hub of downtown with some down-sides”
Reviews.Author: with_every_breath
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at Hyatt Hotels usually. My husband had a conference here all week, so I was a solo tourist, diner, & guest for the most part. This Hyatt is very large, & the rooms are of typical Hyatt design/spaciousness. Not very much room to store clothing, though; only 4 clothes hangers in the closet - so bring your own. No counter space in bathrooms either. Our air unit was broken,so the temp was really hot upon arrival, but housekeeping was prompt to fix it. Our door keys were disengaged twice but also promptly fixed once we showed our I.D.s to guest services. For our troubles, they gave us a fruit bowl. The fitness center is small, but the equipment is new/clean. The spa staff were very pushy w/ services. All i wanted was a haircut, but the facial lady literally booked me for a facial w/o my request and insisted it would be the best facial ever. I ended up walking out. (She even followed me down the hall, still trying to make "the sell.") The food in the Bistro is not comparable with the price - dinner or breakfast. You'd do better finding someplace down the street. Every time I ate there, the waiter would bring the check to me immediately after taking my order, which I thought was rude. And they do take away your food before you're finished - a lot of language barriers with wait staff here. But the "Big Bar" is nice if you're into a happy hour scene. Good conference center for business too. I would say if you're here for a conference or enjoy being in the hub of downtown, this will work for you. $13/day for internet is surprising for a semi-luxury hotel, though. Even Motel 6 has free wi-fii!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler881
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation online and had gotten a pretty good deal, it was less than $100 per night, but if we had paid the original room fee it would've definitely been a HUGE disappointment. The location is amazing...it's right between the Sears Tower and State Street on Michigan Avenue. It's a nice hotel if you're not going to spend much time in the room, but if you are, then it's not the greatest. They have a weight system on the mini bar, if you move anything in the bar, you'll be charged for whatever it is that moved. If you BUMP into it and anything moves, you'll be charged for that!!! So if you're traveling with children, make sure they don't come near the mini bar!!! We didn't try the restaurants in the hotel, but be sure NEVER to try the restaurant next door to the Hyatt, Houlihan's...it's the worst! Overall it wasn't a bad stay but it wasn't what we expected from the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel, needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: WorldSeenItAll
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the hotel recently and stayed for 5 days. It's OK, showing a little wear. the concierge floor is nice and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: Call me crazy but I just love this hotel. I've been to Chicago at least twice a year for the last 10 or 12 years and this Hyatt just captures the big-city vibe in its own unique way. The lobby in the East tower is both warm and welcoming when you arrive back at the hotel yet you are engulfed by the sheer numbers of guests milling around, the facilities, the views... the rooms are always comfortable and I would agree with the reviewer who mentions putting a rolled tower under the door space to muffle any hallway noise. Staff is excellent, dining options are good, and the location is outstanding. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Well located but huge conference style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smillie1
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms and friendly service depsite being a monster of a hotel. Clean and functionable and in a good location

Reviews.Title: “LOUD”
Reviews.Author: Taurus8808
Reviews.Content: The restaraunts and the gym were very nice but the room was very loud, you could hear everything in the adjacent rooms and the housekeeping staff were extremely loud in the morning out in the hallways, also the bathroom was not very clean...the floor was sticky and the counter top was stained

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: polarbear123
Reviews.Content: We live in the burbs but wanted a nice getaway for the weekend as we had dinner and theater plans for the weekend. We ended up at the Hyatt Regency via Hotwire. We got a rate at about 50% off of the rack rate on the Hyatt website. After talking to people this seems to be a hotel that comes up on the discount hotel sites (hotwire, priceline) often as it is HUGE. We were happy we ended up here. It was convenient to everything. We parked at the Millenium Park garage for $24 for 24 hours. There weren't in and out privileges like the valet parking at the hotel which was about $50, but since everything was close that wasn't needed. We walked down Michigan Ave and considered going to Navy Pier but it was just too darn cold out. Our room was nice and the bed was great. We were at the end of a hallway in the West building so the noise factor was minimal. We had drinks at the Big Bar and DaddyO. Both were typical hotel bars, nice atmosphere but a bit pricey. The staff was friendly and attentive. While I don't think I'd pay the rack price for this hotel, I'd be willing to gamble on the discount sites to get something like this again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, huge, good for many occasions”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the Chicago Marathon. It was so busy that at first it felt like we arrived at an airport instead of a lobby. The hotel could use a major update to keep up with the newer, stylish hotels in the city. Our room (in the west tower) was spacious, comfortable, just a bit too dark. We did'nt experience any problems with noise from the hallway or other rooms. Location is great. Right in between the magnificent mile and milenium park.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, bloody expensive”
Reviews.Author: y850tdm1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a tradeshow. Hotel Lobby looks more like an airport or factory. I don't know if all the rooms were as terrible as in the East tower, but I asked 3 times for another room and 3 times I got the same poor quality: the rooms are very old (old carpet, yellow curtains, dirty windows) and the bathroom hasn't been upgraded since a long time. Although the view (on the lake) was great, the rest was just horrible: the doors have an opening of around 5 cm's between door and carpet (no need to say you have the impression to sleep in the corridor) and the old airco systems had to be turned down because of the noice. The breakfast room (hall) is not cozy, the bar is nice but expensive. I'll never go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: boomboomroom
Reviews.Content: Stayed both at this Hyatt Regency and the Hyatt Regency at McCormick Place last week on a business trip. My stay at this Hyatt was purchased on priceline for considerably less than the posted rate, and I have to say it was a fabulous deal. I have done the priceline thing for 4-star hotels many times in several cities, and this was probably the nicest hotel I have gotten out of priceline yet. The most important thing to me regarding hotels are clean and comfortable rooms, and good service, and it didn't disappoint on those marks. Our room was very clean (I meticulously check rooms as soon as I enter, and I was satisfied). The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly at check-in, check-out, and during our stay. We were able to check in at around 10 am on a Thursday despite one conference leaving Chicago and one coming in. The exterior of the hotel itself has no wow factor and is not particularly impressive, and the lobby is spacious but was probably last renovated in the mid-90s - meaning not modern, but still nice enough. The rooms themselves seem more modern, which is more important to me. Very comfortable beds. I got around by walking, taxi, and conference shuttle, and I found it convenient, but someone who wanted to drive might consider a different location. There is a grocery store nearby on Stetson Ave if you want to purchase snacks. I would happily stay here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: izzy37
Reviews.Content: stayed here for marathon weekend. The location was perfect; right between Michigan avenue and Millenium park. We had no issues with noise as other reviews have stated,. The room was a basic hotel room. The beds were comfortable. The only disadvantages were a fee for internet service and no refrigerator. Otherwise, it was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good if you get a room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: michael30309
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location. The exterior of the hotel is pretty dated and the lobby has an early 90's cheesy feel....but the hotel has pretty good service and, if you're lucky, a fantastic view. The office portion of my room (3365) overlooked millenium park. Unfortunately I didn't get much work done--absolutely beautiful view! The room itself was nice and rather modern, although looked a bit worn in. Not a bad size. What perplexed me was that there was a (dusty) mini bar/tv stand, yet the room had no dresser. I stayed for 4 days, it would have been nice to unpack! The gym was a decent size and had some great cardio with integrated tv's. nice touch. There are a lot of hotels in this part of town. This was a good place to stay, but this Hyatt Regency isn't as great as some others at which I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, very accommodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: Minturn1
Reviews.Content: Every part of this stay went smoothly. One of our party checked in early after I called to ask that she be able to check into a room under my name. When the rest of the party arrived, we were upgraded to a room with a wonderful view so that we could be close to the 1st room. This was a quick girls weekend. We spent a lot of time at the Big Bar, but missed the touted piano bar because of scheduling conflicts. The drinks were expensive, but location couldn't be beat. Location of the hotel was wonderful, easy walking distance to Navy Pier, the BillyGoat Tavern (the SNL Cheezborger-Cheezborger shrine), shopping and many other attractions. Every staff member we spoke to went out of their way to be accommodating. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice”
Reviews.Author: GailofIowa
Reviews.Content: Staff was very accommodating during our arrival. The room was spacious and modern with a large flat screen TV that swiveled. The bedding was of a nice quality and the bed was comfortable. I liked the decor, which was modern with touches of quality. The hotel is suitable for large conferences, so it takes some walking to find your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price, one block from Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: ajmackin
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered was very helpful. The room was clean and updated. The hotel couldn't have been in a better location. One block from the Magnificent Mile and about 2 blocks from Navy Pier. Perfect location to everything. The only thing that was confusing about the hotel was where to check in, there are east and west towers. A bit confusing but still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in food and bug in bed”
Reviews.Author: ElzadaPhotography
Reviews.Content: Poor experience for the expense. I attended a conference and my husband accompanied and stayed 4 nights. Room is regular nothing fancy hotel room. My husband found a bug in his salad at Bistro 51 in the hotel and then on last morning, found another bug in his bed. Lighting is poor. Bathroom is small. Sound travels. Location is good and when bottom floor entrance to other shops is open for lunch and breakfast, prevents going outside in bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, but there are better values”
Reviews.Author: greybelt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt for almost 30 years and have seen it through many renovations and changes. It's a good downtown hotel with convention and catering facilities, and a very busy lobby area where you can still find people when trade shows are in town. Paid internet. Convenient to Michigan Avenue; some nice views from higher floors. Can be expensive compared to the services provided. My most recent visit had to go to three rooms (first one had odor, second was occupied by someone else, and third finally was okay); had never had problems before. If you're in town for a meeting, this is a fine facility. If you're just staying in town, there may be better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Chicago Marathon weekend. The hotel itself is extremely huge and was very busy because of the Marathon. We booked on Priceline and got a phenomenal rate. Checking in at 7:00 on Friday was very busy and we had to wait in line around 15 minutes. Check in went very fast once we reached the counter, we asked for two rooms and we were granted them for no additional cost. We were on the 12th floor overlooking the River. The room itself was very clean, nice size and had all the amenities one would need when traveling. Comfortable beds, nice flat screen TV, data port, iron, blow dryer. The bathroom was fairly large and inviting. The shower head was pretty amazing, especially after a long race. All in all I like the hotel, staff, location and beds. Michigan Ave is hop, skip and jump away. There are a plethora of Starbucks, corner bakery and restaurants in the area. My only complaints were waiting 15 minutes for an elevator in the am, the $48 charge for parking and having to wait 20 minutes for valet to come and assist when parking our car. I would definitely stay here again and suck up the $48 parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lobby and good location, but rooms and service could be better”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference for two nights, and the location was great, but I think it's just too big a hotel to be really outstanding. First of all, the rooms need better lighting. Even with all of the lamps on (there's no overhead lighting) it felt really dark and drab. Also, my room was supposedly a non-smoking one, but it still smelled of smoke. The bathroom wasn't terrible, but the grouting between the tub tiles was kind of gross and needed to be cleaned or redone. It also irked me that you had to specifically notify them if you wanted fresh towels every day. I've stayed at places with a "towels on the floor will be replaced, towels hung up won't" set up, and that's fine, but to have to make a call was ridiculous. I had some clothes laundered and when they were returned to me they also left me another guest's shirt (which I took down to the front desk). My colleague and I had both unknowingly (we must have just clicked the first option presented when making the reservation) signed up for a "business plan" room reservation, which included breakfast, free wifi and some other things, but when she checked in they didn't tell her any of this or give her the vouchers for breakfast. If I hadn't told her she wouldn't have ever known (they did charge her for wifi but took it off of her bill when she mentioned it to them). So while it wasn't terrible, there are lots of better options, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: leenyburger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while traveling to Chicago for pleasure. The hotel is well located directly off of the Magnificent Mile. It is a bit of a walk from the blue line stop (if flying into O'Hare), but not too bad. The hotel was nice, and we were received excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BrenMN
Reviews.Content: This hotel very obviously caters to the business world, but there were plenty of couples and some families, too. Staff was courteous and prompt. My biggest complaint would be the $48/day fee to park!! Our room was clean & had a spectacular view out to the river and lake (our room was in the hotel's west tower, in the northeast corner, 6th floor). We got to take in the fireworks out on the lake from our room both Friday and Saturday nights. Great location for touring the city - Millenium Park is just a few blocks to the south, Navy Pier is a not far to the east, it's right on the river (there are restaurants tucked under the major bridges/roads, right along the river!), plus it's just off of Michigan Avenue's fabulous shopping & surrounding restaurants (there is soooooo much amazing food there!). The architectural river tour was wonderful - the river a great vantage point to take in the city's wealth of architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: CandisKay58
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The room was nice and clean. The hotel staff and hotel amenities were great. We got a great internet rate. The location is perfect - close to theaters and restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind hotels with 2000+ rooms, this one was a great buy...”
Reviews.Author: TexasEx78
Reviews.Content: I was on the fence about attending a four day conference in Chicago at the Palmer House because the conference rate there was $179 a night and I was on a limited budget. I decided to go but used Princeline's name-your-own-price option to find a 3* hotel and ended up at the Hyatt Regency on Wacker for $59 a night. To further cut costs, I decided to use not take a taxi from the airport and opted for the train which was very easy to use. It was a tight squeeze getting through a few of the turnstiles with my rolling bag and I had to walk a few blocks to the hotel from the closest station but the $5.00 round trip sure beat the cabfare. The hotel had a Realtors conference going on at the same time so the lobby and check in reminded me of the check-in at a Vegas hotel but it all ran smoothly and my room was nice. The hotel was close to everything I needed and I walked just about everywhere I was going including the conference I was attending at the Palmer House. It was also close to Millenium Park and since I arrived on a Sunday and had the day to myself, I took one of the Segway tours that left from a site a couple of blocks away and had a blast riding around the area seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KB22
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated in the center of the city, this hotel offered easy walking acces to Millenium Park, the Art Museum and great restaurants within the Loop. Rooms were spotless and beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: etoile1
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago October 2 through October 5 with my husband and 4 young children. The Hyatt is a very large hotel, so is a bit impersonal. I would have prefered to stay at a property with some history, but I had recieved this reservation through Priceline and got a great deal. For the price I paid, this hotel was just fine. The hotel is clean and well kept. The beds were nice with plenty of pillows. Our room was clean and updated. The bathroom was nice with a granite vanity and a spectacular view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. I would not consider this hotel luxurious, but was nice (just nothing spectacular). The location of the hotel is prime. It is a short walk to north Michigan Ave., the Loop, and the museums. I encountered one small problem when my housekeeper threw away a grocery bag of snacks. This matter was resolved quickly and courteously by the housekeeping manager. We were happy with the hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in heart of Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: Justmedjr
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, we had booked the room online with our flight, got a great rate for 4 days. Our room was nice, had a fridge with treats, which we used for our leftovers.
