One aside: If you wish to go to their main bar at night get there early because it draws a large crowd every night. Also, they connect to many other site via underground tunnels that come in handy when avoiding weather that is unpleasant. At the rate I got from my internet booking, I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler063
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We arrived at the hotel and were told we were the "guests of the day". They upgraded us to a suite, we got free parking, and 20% off the restaurant in the hotel. The rooms were very spacious, and the beds were SO comfortable. The staff was very helpful with directions in downtown, giving us maps and highlighting our stops. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from the blue line so getting downtown is easy. Even without the upgrades I would definately stay here again. Great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will return!”
Reviews.Author: JimJam_LippyCow
Reviews.Content: Wow - great size room; comfy bed; large flat screen tv; ok toiletries. This hotel is right across from the chicago river - a 2min walk and you're on magnificent mile; a few minutes in the other direction and you are at navy pier. Corner Bakery (a personal favourite) is just a block away (great cheap breakfast) and Houlihans is right next door (with tables on the sidewalk). The only complaint I have was that they do not supply enough inroom coffee supplies for the number of guests. we got 1xnormal; 1xdecaf; and 1xtea; with only 1x cream & sugar, for both of us! - what is with US hotels? Seems this is quite common here. Otherwise - a lovely stay for an excellent price (almost half on priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: nwbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a conference held there. Based on the reviews that I read on Tripadvisor, I was prepared for the worst. The hotel reminds me of hotels in Las Vegas - it is large, not intimate. But it wasn't too noisy and my room was updated and quiet. Room service was delivered as promised, and it was your average hotel food. We got recommendations for dinner on two nights from the concierge and both recommendations were excellent. So, if you have to stay here, it's fine, but it wouldn't be my first choice if I was choosing the hotel on my own. Unless you like large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Good & Bad of the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: DLAtrumpet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 9 nights during a conference on the Navy Pier. The location is very good with a short walk (2 blocks) to Michigan Avenue. You are right at the "Times Square" of Chicago with the river, Wrigley Building, and other architectural wonders at your fingertips. I would simply warn TA readers of two things. They dramatically overbooked on the night that we arrived. They quickly told us (and dozens of others) that all of the rooms were taken. Of course that's not true but they aren't going to give us the suites and other expensive accomodations at a corporate rate. We ended up staying in a "smoking room" which smelled very stale. The other negative that I'll mention was the extra charges that were originally on our bill at check-out. After questioning the front desk, $125.00 was removed from the bill. The property is huge and my gut feeling was that they are disorganized in terms of management. Our non-smoking room, which we moved to on day 2 of our stay was fine and we enjoyed the rest of our stay until check-out. BTW, Chicago is now my new favorite city!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of Tourist Chicago-Great location”
Reviews.Author: gadgetprincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one entire week for a conference at the end of July. (Room 1255). Overall: I would return if I got my same room. Even though I received a conference rate of $180 per night, there are additional charges for a refrigerator and internet that can raise the cost of your stay. Work-out facility was free. The Location is awesome with all the touristy things and cheap food/personal supplies close by. Check-in: Very impersonal. There are kiosks so you don't have to speak to anyone. I checked in at the assistant manager's desk. She didn't smile much and had this stressed business look on her face. When you get your room card, there is no opportunity for change as the hotel was booked. I called the day before and reviewed my request with them..quiet sleeping place. The person could not guarantee anything but just acknowledged my request were noted. I was in the Hotel Towers (Not the West Tower where the convention center is below). The 6 elevators were fast, only waited slightly longer than normal, once during the time people are checking out about 10AM. Room: Spacious, king size bed (comfortable, able to sleep well), Desk, Flat Screen TV (Movies $13+), Leather chair and two sitting chairs. Air conditioner, worked fine, sounded like a small fan that just became white noise when I slept. It didn't make loud noises when it came on or shut off. (newer). Bathroom, spacious with passive vent (quiet), toiletries by Portico (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion), shower cap. Noise: Yes, the walls are thin. The first night, heard children giggling but they quieted down by 10PM. I only heard people didn't hear bathroom noises. I could even hear the howl of the elevator go up on down. By 11PM to 6AM, all was quiet and I slept well. I have stayed in condos, just north of the Hyatt and I always heard sirens all night long. I think where the Hyatt is located there are not lots of people typically crossing in front of the Hyatt like the shopping district where there are people and cars everywhere. East Wacker is also a strange street which is raised above the other streets which makes going there difficult in a car. Internet is not free ~$13 per day. Refrigerator under TV (quiet) but it was filled with Hotel Snacks. A sign covered the door warning you if you stored any of your personal items, there will be a onetime $25 charge. If you would like your personal refrigerator for that fee, the hotel will bring one to your room. If you want to save money, I would bring a soft-sided cooler and fill it with ice. If you want your sheets cleaned you have to call to alert them to change them rather than leaving a card on the bed. Workout Facility: ~8 Treadmills, Elipticals, ~6 machines, free wts (lowest 8lbs, they need smaller wts for junior lifters). Does the job while traveling. Lobby: Calm during the day, noisy at night from the Bar. They allow smoking, so it spoils the lobby when just one person is smoking. There is a snack bar with espresso (automated machines with Starbucks Coffee, $2 for a banana). I would go through the tunnels (in the same shopping area of Houlahans), there is a deli with fresh fruit by the pound and cheaper food by far. (Cosi, McDonalds, Potbelly Sandwiches, Mexican, Japanese, Fresh Choice). If you're on a budget, go explore and don't just accept the hotel snack bar. Stenson's: Nice jazz singer, ate a Rib-eye (fair), but the sea bass was excellent. Parking: Outrageous! >$40 for over-night, day ~$16? reasonable to allow people to attend conventions at the Hotel. Convention Center: The conference rooms are freezing you will need a sweater even if it is hot outside. There is a FedEx Kinkos in the Houlahan shopping area if you need copies. There is a business center. Location of Hotel: After I walked the city for the week, I have found this to be the best location. 20 minutes south (Millennium Park), 40 min (Shed Aquarium, Planetarium), 40 min southwest (Union Train Station), 2 blocks (Boat Tour, Corner Bakery), 15 min Northwest-Michigan St Shopping. 20 Northeast (Navy Pier). Overall, I felt safe around the hotel and walking on Upper Wacker. My husband I drop off a rental on Lake St, southeast of the Hyatt and walked back at 12:30 AM. Lake ST was a little dark but once on Wacker we were fine. (runs along the river). Other restaurants: Houlahans for breakfast buffet $10 without the beverage (eggs, sausage, biscuits, hash, omelets, fruit etc). Italian Village: (50 min wait, they seem to let those who had tickets to plays/shows in faster) make a reservation. Food was amazing (veal with polenta and seafood ravioli). Deal: If you are an educator bring your ID. I work for the state preschool system and I got into the museums for free. (Shed/Planetarium). Others provide a significant discount. The walking times are based on temperatures of 85 degrees. When it got to 95 plus humidity, I barely could walk 3 blocks without jumping into a hotel to cool down to continue my trek. Bring a water bottle. Side note: People in Chicago smoke without concern. In Seattle, smoking is not allowed in public places and 25 ft from an entrance. So at restaurants with outdoor eating you might have someone smoking next to you which spoils the event. Just be prepared. The Free Trolley service runs along side the Hyatt. You might have to transfer to different lines to get to the museum area but it may help the weary traveler. There bellpersons are awesome as they are always trying to get you a cab. Shuttle from Airport: Continental Shuttle runs every half hour to Midway and O'Hare. For O'Hare, try to get on a shuttle 1/2 earlier than you would. There are always tons of people waiting for O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: JoeKH
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a very large property located on the Chicago River just south of the shopping district and close to Navy Pier and the Museum District - obviously a great central location. The rooms were roomy and well appointed. Business services are excellent. The only downside is the restaurants in the hotel, but it really doesn't matter, there are plenty of options within walking distance. Checking-in took more time then expected, but again, it is a large hotel and Sunday is the "big turn" of rooms. As a Passport member, I was upgraded to the Executive Floor - a pleasant surprise based on my rate. I did receive the rate (approx $175 for three nights) directly from the hotel. I have stayed at over 10 hotels in Chicago and rate this - value wise - in the top two or three.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: Had a great room in the west tower, enjoying a view of the lake, navy pier, and Chicago River. Room seemed to be recently remodeled. Nice linens, toiletries, bedding, etc. Clock radio w/ iPod docking station. One downside, the central A/C made a dripping noise. There must be some kind of condensate drain in/near our room. This is not a bad location for tourists. A short walk from Mag Mile and CTA red line (Lake Street), and right on top of the river docks (i.e. water taxi and CAF tours). Visitors should know that this is a BIG hotel. Getting on the scale of Vegas, and designed for conventioneers. From my experience, you get some benefits from this scale (i.e. prompt housekeeping requests, easy taxi's), but there are also downsides (i.e. impersonal feel). Come prepared for these tradeoffs and you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hyatt I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: They Chicago Hyatt is the worst Hyatt I've stayed at and I typically love Hyatt. I was there for a business conference in the hotel in July. The rooms have paper thin walls. You can hear people checking their voicemails, conversations, going to the bathroom, and even typing on the keyboard from your room. It's like staying in a youth hostel from a noise standpoint. The service at the hotel was atrocious. The Big Bar, which is the main bar in the hotel, basically had no wait staff if you sat at a table. Everyone was angry and harrassing the staff that was there. Eat in one of the resataurants and you practically have to scream to get a waiteperson over to your table to take your order. The place is a very poor value for the money. If you're going to Chicago, consider staying at the Westin on Michigan avenue. A much better location and a very fine property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Some issues, but still worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy510
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the hotel this past week and we thought the hotel was great. Great location - walking distance to everywhere, if you like walking. We would walk to the John Hancock, Navy Pier, Magnificant Mile, Millenieum Park, and the Art Institue - all the Chciago main attractions. We used their gym there and was big and roomy to get the job done. The only issues with the hotel was the impersonal check-in (we didn't have to talk to anyone to check-in as they had self-serve kiosks) and at certain times I can hear people walking upstairs and the water running and toilet flushing form one of our neighbors. Besides these two issues, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt to visit a friend at Northwestern Hosp. it was nice. The hotel room was ok we asked for a double double but they only had King bedded rooms. They were kind enough to provide a port a crib. The hotel does seem a bit dated and dark and getting around with a stroller is a challenge. I cannot imagine navigating this place with a wheelchair. The room was very nice.....spacious room floor to ceiling window but the view was of the office builings next door. We paid such a low rate I will not complain about our view and will hope that the business traveler paying a rack rate of $359 will see something other than concrete and dirt. The bed was so comfortable, soft and the sheets were nice. Bathroom ammenities were nice, very fragrant....I felt the need to take 2 showers in less that 24 hours since the stuff was so nice. Check in.....little tip check the line in the west tower first I learned that on here and it was quick to check in. Fridge.....mini bar is a joke and yes they will hit you if you remove their stuff and cool your own....and try to find anything but the mini bar at 4am in the hotel. One great thing about this hotel is the location for tourist things to do....you can walk to Millenium Park, walk to the boat rides, walk to Michican Avenue attractions and so many other things. Would we stay here again? If the rate were right. During tourist season or for a weekend no more that $150 per night. As for business travel to this hotel....Good if you need to be near loop and/or Michigan Avenue. If you are visting Illinois Center (not the government one the office building) it is great since it is attached.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Hyatt Regency???”
Reviews.Author: racerrandy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and first stay at a Hyatt Regency. Loved Chicago, but was very disappointed in the Hyatt. Was given a smoking room instead of a non-smoking one. They did try to make ammends about this, but after that it was all down hill. The best I can say about this hotel is that the location is perfect for travelers. Close to most everything. Once we got in our room, the window was open and the room safe did not work. We went out for a night on the town and came back to find that the room was stifling hot. By the next morning, the room was finally comfortable. Seems as if the ventilation system never did work properly. The third night brought terrible storms. The wind kept blowing open the window, we finally had to prop a chair against it to keep it closed during the night. As we checked out we were asked if everything was perfect. The problems were reported and they said they'd have someone look into it. Never even tried to make it right. Very let down by Hyatt Regency. Probably will not choose their chain ever again.

Reviews.Title: “As bad as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: cptjustice
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Hyatt was the captive hotel of a convention we attended in July. Other than the great location there was nothing even close to satisfactory about the hotel. The front desk was disorganized and discourteous. The hotel was totally unable to handle the numbers checking on the first days. The decor and furniture was tired. Elevators in both towers was completely inadequate. The fitness center is the worst I have ever seen at a major American hotel. Chicago is a great city but avoid this hotel like the palgue.

Reviews.Title: “A great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: hola123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for conference and was somewhat surprised at how nice it was. The staff was great, the train (the "L") was just a quick 5 minute walk away which led to a 45 minute ride to downtown. Food was great at the conference but not worth the price otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Bad back.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug218
Reviews.Content: The hotel was hard to find by car. Its centrally located and ez access to most things. The room was very clean and decorated nicely. The bed looked beautiful, looks can be deceiving! Woke up with backaches both nights we stayed here. Other than that.. Great room.

Reviews.Title: “Do You Hear What I Hear? You Must, Since You Are Making The Noise.”
Reviews.Author: sg4878
Reviews.Content: Let me start be saying this...the hotel was quite booked up when I stayed this past April and already a bit noisy. Was in town for work the weekend of Easter and was pleasantly surprised by the aethetics of the hotel and the front desk staff - both were great. I also loved my room...the decor, bathroom, bed, appointments, iPod-holding stereo ...it was all very nice. Sadly, I discovered that the walls in this hotel are paper thin. I could hear every single thing the people next to me were saying and doing. Luckily, it was a mother and her young adult son, so there wasn't anything too uncomfortable to be heard. However, I still heard everything. It got to the point that I called security after speaking with my neighbors several times, thinking perhaps they were just being pains and ignoring my pleas. However, whilst we were all chatting with the security guy, we simply realized that the walls were so thin that it was impossible for me NOT to hear through them, even if they spoke at a whisper. They, too, could hear my television, even though its volume was down to barely audible. I had a corner room, too! No one on the other side of me, and it still sounded like my neighbors were in my room. Management couldn't move me and I felt bad about the whole situation...I didn't want my neighbors to feel bad or be unable to speak to one another! Nevertheless, we had to deal with the situation, which meant buying earplugs. I've never encountered such thin walls! If you're a light sleeper, be forewarned!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wobblyboot
Reviews.Content: Managed to book a room on a discount deal for a family of four. The room was nice with comfortable beds and the location was near bus routes and easy walking distance to Magnificant Mile. A couple of resturants are available in the hotel but there are plenty resturant just a short walk from the hotel. If you have a car expect to pay high prices for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Triptaker365
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast, the room was perfect, and there were no problems. This is a standard big-city business hotel with every amenity imaginable. I got a very good deal for a one-night stay, but they made the money back from the exorbitant parking rate and the absurd access fee for wireless internet. If you are bored of the routine hotel fare, walk two blocks to Gourmet Pantry (155 N. Michigan) for a refreshing change.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: entrad
Reviews.Content: There were positives and negatives, but overall I would not likely return. Positives were: - my room was large, though others I saw were quite small. It appeared to have been recently renovated with a "designy" contemporary aesthetic. Best feature probably the 30 inch flat screen TV. Bed quite comfortable. Nice single cup coffee brewer. Bathroom clean and decently equipped. - well located near Miracle Mile, river, lake, etc. - bar is quite active until the wee hours. Negatives were: - incredibly thin walls, intolerable noise from neighboring rooms and hallways. - ridiculous charges for "refreshment center" - turns out if you put anything in the minibar (I bought some half-and-half for my coffee, as the powdered creamer they supplied was skimpy), they charge you a daily fee. Real nickel and dime stuff. - The ground floor lounges really pretty cheesy with dirty pool/fountains. Not the classiest scene. Chicago is a great city in the spring and summer. There are better places to stay than this.

Reviews.Title: “Too many negatives”
Reviews.Author: Scallywag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in May & chose it for it's great location plus we are Gold Passport members having stayed in Hyatts in Perth & Adelaide. We booked a Regency lake view room which was comfortable enough & had a great view. However, the heating system was something else. The instruction on the controls read to the effect "this heating sytem is silent & works on a radiant system, you will not hear a fan". Whoever wrote that was stone deaf. As soon as it was switched on the roar was like being in an aircraft. It would have been impossible to sleep with it on and apart from anything else it didn't work. Any schoolboy knows that hot air rises, so why would you put the heating system at ceiling level. No wonder it took 6 hours to go up a degree. The maintenance man sent to look at it agreed the whole system was a disaster. The touch sensitive mini-bar is technology a step too far & to charge $25 for a room fridge when you are paying $300-400 per night is outrageous. As my wife can only drink goats milk we needed a fridge but the charge was waived when I remonstrated with the desk. Nonetheless it still appeared on my bill & I had to remind them to remove it. However, the Hyatt's audacity doesn't end there, on the front of thecomments form in the room is a "place postage here" logo. So if you forget to hand it into the front desk they expect you to pay for the privilege of telling them about their poor service, but as they do not seem to follow up anyway it's a waste of time bothering. On one occassion housekeeping only left us one (cardboard) cup for the coffee maker. It took 3 calls to get a replacement & when we returned to our room they had sarcastically left about 10 together with a roll-away bed that we hadn't requested. I can't help thinking that the person who wanted the bed got our cup! The Regency Club in Adelaide was far more luxurious & not onl,y that, unlike Chicago the alcoholic drinks were free.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Laney02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a one-night business trip and I was quite happy. I arrived at noon and was able to check in, which was nice. My room was clean and nicely decorated, with a king bed and a small couch. The bathroom was clean and of a decent size, with a curved shower curtain rod and citrusy-lavender toiletries. (take note of the sign saying they'll only restock toiletries and towels on request). My room was fairly quiet, though as with most hotels, I heard some hallway noise. Room service was expensive ($12-$18 plus tip/delivery fee/tax for most breakfast entrees) -- to be expected for a big city hotel. Every hotel employee I encountered was very friendly, although the woman who checked me in was super fast, which some people might not like.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: UDSL05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for a two nights on a business trip. My room was oddly shaped to give a stunning view of the river and NBC Building. Both the room and the bathroom were spotless and the room had an air purifier which ran silently. The hotel was well staffed with individuals who were knowledgeable about both the hotel and the surrounding area. I would not hesitate to stay here again and plan to return with my wife for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money on this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe that anyone would give this hotel a good review. Hyatt should remove their name from this hotel because I will no longer stay in any Hyatt after this experience. When you walk into the hotel "lobby" you feel more like you are walking into an extremely busy shopping mall. People are packed in there like sardines. We got the impression that this was more of a hangout for locals rather than a hotel for guests only. The check-in desk is hard to find as it is no where near the hotel entry. Instead, it is located upstairs where even more people are hanging out. The check-in clerk was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we had trouble hearing her due to the noise of the crowd. Our room was borderline clean and the walls were paper thin. We could hear the conversations of the people in the room next door. We were given a room designed for the handicapped which would have been fine except for the fact that the door wouldn't shut when you went in and out. Instead, it stayed open for about 30 seconds and there was no way to force it shut. This was a big security concern for us since at one point we had someone pounding on our door and yelling "let me in". Of course we didn't open the door and the person finally realized they had the wrong floor but it did cause us to be very concerned for our safety. The fact that we couldn't shut the door if needed added to our concerns. I will say that I booked our room online but called to confirm and the person I spoke to was extremely helpful. Unfortunately, good customer service cannot overcome the magnitude of the other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: prairiemom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and loved it. Got it for $93 inc tax on Priceline, an incredible deal for this hotel. If I wasn't on priceline I would expect to pay $200 per night (maybe more) for this location/level of service. It's in the heart of downtown Chicago, walkable to many locations. The lobby is very impressive, the room was very nice. No complaints at all, from check-in to check-out. I was alone so didn't go to the bar but it looked like people were really enjoying themselves. It was full of people all the time. I want to stay here when I come back with my husband for a fun weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: BNT1120
Reviews.Content: just got back form a 2 night trip to Chicago, stayed at Hyatt Regency for 2 nights and it was great. Cab ride from Midway to Hyatt was only 23 dollars. Cab rides to local attractions, shedd aquarium ( and the whole museum campus), sears tower, john hancock, were all fairly priced ( under 10 ). Dining was also easy, breakfast we ate Houlihans(10 dollar brkfast buffet ! very good ! you can get there without exiting the hotel. Near by is also Giordano's ( very famous stuffed pizza in chicago area). Hyatt Room was pretty nice and the staff was very very nice. We had a free upgrade to deluxe on the 27th floor, and they gave us two free Breakfast buffet vouchers for 1 morning. Before this trip i was very skeptical because of peoples review on this forum, but non of them were true. The bathroom was all marble and clean, room service was good ( you have to call for your bed linens and towels changed because they "conserve the world". ) Overall it was very good and i would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a little rough!”
Reviews.Author: EkimPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is large are is primarily design for conventions. However the rooms are not much better than an old Holiday Inn. The linens were stained and wallpaper peeling everywhere. The beds were not very comfortable. The hotel looks to have been built back in the 70's. The convention facilities appear to have recently got attention but the rooms are in desparate need of help. Additionally, the rooms as part of the conference were priced at $240.00 a night and were definitely not worth it. The gift shop and restaurant prices were obscene!

Reviews.Title: “May 11-14-07”
Reviews.Author: beckyok
Reviews.Content: While we only paid $60 for our rooms through priceline we were treated extremely well. I asked for adjoining rooms with a view and got them on the 27th floor of the west tower. The view of the river, and lake beyond was fantastic. I never make housekeeping clean during my stay, I just went to the hall each morning and asked for coffee, shampoo etc. and explained that I didn't need service for my two rooms. She was more than thankful and very nice. This location is great and I hope to stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice -- recommended”
Reviews.Author: mrs_nuts
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency as a conference attendee. The hotel is very large, but I really enjoyed my stay. Check-in was smooth, no king beds were left, but since I was traveling alone I didn't mind two doubles. The room was clean and each room had an air purifier in it. All of the rooms are non-smoking, which works for me. Lots of restaurant choices on-site, and a lot of places to sit and relax. Location is great as well. Cost is up there...but comparable to everything else in Chicago. My big complaint (and I heard this from others) is massive problems with Internet connectivity. I never was able to connect, but others said I just didn't wait long enough (30 minutes) for the connection to take hold.

Reviews.Title: “Not good service”
Reviews.Author: andrewdd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business recently and it was a disaster. There was a problem with the booking of our room - two of my colleagues decided not to come on the trip and two different people came in their stead. Despite the fact that we had the credit card the room was booked on in hand, the hotel would not let us check into the room because the names of the guests who showed up did not match the names on the reservation (again, on the same credit card). We went through two levels of management, and the response was "Sorry, there is nothing we can do to help." Then, our office manager called from afar, was told the same thing about the rooms, and then put on a show by faking crying and making up a story that she would be fired if the situation was not rectified. Then, and only then, did management suprisingly decide to allow us to occupy the room. All of this wasted 2+ hours of time and caused great stress. I was simply shocked at how many times management said "There is nothing we can do" instead of trying to help us out. The other "great" thing was that they fully admitted we would be charged for the room because we had reserved it, but could not occupy it or cancel the reservation because the actual guests listed were not present.

Reviews.Title: “No great shakes”
Reviews.Author: Zin2
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for a conference and paid $239 for a nite through the conference organizers. The hotel only merits a lukewarm average from me. Like the other reviewers, I found the internet access charge to be exorbitant, especially since the access was cranky. Like someone said, nowadays, its the cheaper properties (like the Comfort Suites in Gurnee that I stayed in for one nite) that provide free internet access - ironic. That the minibar was on motion sensor was also quite ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: trainaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago back in Sept of â€™06. I was attending a conference there and I thought that hotel was very well accommodating to the massive amount of people. The rooms are typical Hyatt, clean and new, the bathroom was kinda of small, I have stayed at many lower end hotels that had bigger bathrooms, nevertheless, it was all marble and very clean. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Room Were Great!”
Reviews.Author: IndyDaytripper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many upscale hotels, but I have to say that I was completely impressed by the Hyatt Regency Chicago. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and they were more than pleasant, they were so friendly! The room was very comfortable and the massaging shower head was the icing on the cake. I had read a review that complained about the toiletries and towels not being changed daily, but maybe the writers of that did not see the sign in the bathroom that stated that in order to conserve, they will restock daily only if asked to. Our room had the best view of the river and looked straight at the John Hancock Center-Beautiful at night! Check in and check out were both a breeze and we had no problem with the valet service getting our car.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good with some service glitches”
Reviews.Author: LibrarianontheLoose
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt several times for conferences, and it's generally well run. Staff is very courteous and plentiful. The hotel offers a lot in terms of facilities for dining and lounging. The room was redecorated in a trendy color scheme sans bedspreads, and there was a nice leather chair in the room - much appreciated. Our view was great, looking out from the front of the building onto the Chicago skyline. Nights were beautiful. The location is great. I did find it off-putting to be greated at the front desk with a stern warning about the minibar. I was told it was motion sensitive and that I would be charged a $25 fine for putting my refreshments in there. I never go near minibars myself - way too pricey. The thought of setting off an alarm kept me well away. Staff routinely knocked on our door every day to inspect the minibar. Do these things make that much money that there needs to be this much fuss over them??? It just wasn't a warm and friendly welcome that one expects to get. It seems it's all about money, not about customer service. We asked for a non-smoking room, but there were aromatic signs that prior guests had definately been smoking. There's a $250 fine for that. The guests on one side of us started loud conversation at 4 am, in tones one might hear at a ballpark. Their son had an incredibly penetrating voice. The metal door connecting our two rooms was a great conductor of noise. I endured this, thinking they had to get up early to catch a plane, but after two hours, I figured they weren't going any where, not even to bed. I got up, stuck my head out to check the room number and called the Front Desk. About 25 minutes later Security knocked on their door. The noise was so loud, they couldn't even hear the man knocking. But we finally got that matter resolved. Lastly the hotel offers wireless Internet in the rooms for only $13.63 /day. (ouch) There is a tasteful embossed ivory card that says to look in the In-Room Directory for information about connecting. The In-Room Directory says instructions are on the desk. Ok, so after this verbal volleyball that goes nowhere, I just dove in, not knowing what the network was. My computer displayed about 5 wireless networks, and I quickly assumed GuestTek was what I needed. Unfortunately, I could not keep a connection. Despite the fact that there was no information on the little card or in the In-Room Directory, I had noted a phone number in the Terms of Agreement which I'm sure no one reads. I called the number and found it was no longer in use, but I was given the new number. Now how hard is it for GuestTek to change that number??? I finally did get through to a patient technician who decided he needed to reboot on his end. But the connection was problematic for two days. I had to drag my laptop down to the lobby to get my work done. And for this I'm paying $13.63/day!!! Why can I stay at a $79/night hotel and get free wireless that works great, while the Hyatt charges so much? Again, it's more about money than customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: wendy75
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline for $74 a night. Stayed 3 nights for a girls getaway. The location was perfect, within walking distance to pretty much everything but the museums and a short cab ride to train stations if you didn't feel like walking. The rooms were nice sized and our view was of the river and Navy Pier in the distance which was nice. No continental breakfast which was was a little of a disappointment. Also, we had to ask a few times for an extra ice bucket and more washcloths but they were eventually brought up to our room. As far as the noise from other guests, didn't run into any problems with it. We stayed in the west tower. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !! Great Price !!”
Reviews.Author: vinross
Reviews.Content: Named my price on priceline. $50.00 Bucks. Hotel room was great. Clean, Clean and new. Fresh crisp sheets, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, clean carpet, nice bath, etc. Short distance to food and sightseeing. I highly recommend this property. Be prepared to pay over $40.00 per night to park. Hey, Its a hyatt. They also charge $5.00 for a bottle of water that is normally a buck. For a total of $100.00 nightly stay in Chicago this place is it just don't drink the bottled water. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own...everything!”
Reviews.Author: Ithakan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency on East Wacker for five nights, from April 8 - April 13. All I can say is that the savvy traveler either books elsewhere, or she brings along everything that you'd expect an upscale hotel to offer. Despite the fact that a huge conference was underway, we had no problems with check-in, and although we'd booked through Hotwire, it appears our room was larger and better-designed than others described (or photographed) here. The overall cleanliness was also fine. That's the good part. Unfortunately, using the hotel's mini-hair dryer resulted in a blown breaker EVERY DAY. The dryers are attached to the wall, so you can't move to a different outlet, and we eventually requested that an electrician check the dryer. He said the problem is that the wiring in parts of the hotel is insufficient for the demand--and I was getting up before 7 a.m. daily. The hotel offers no robes, and they're remarkably tight-fisted with the toiletries--in five days, we got fresh soap, lotion, etc. only once. We also had to call for coffee two of the five days--and on days when housekeeping did refresh our coffee supply, they typically left ONE sugar/creamer packet. Given the poor fit of the door, our room was subject to both the light and noise from the hallway all night long. The worst problem, however, was the total lack of ventilation. There was no fan in the bath, and although it was possible to regulate our heat, the fan in the room was insufficient to ever clear out the humidity from showers so the room constantly felt damp. Our view was fine, but it was obscured by condensation on the inside of the window because of the humidity. This Hyatt offered a service called the "Exceptional Stay." Given the lack of attention to the details you'd expect from an upscale hotel, I think they have a way to go to move beyond the "Okay Stay" mark.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere If You Can”
Reviews.Author: MileHighMe
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the Embassy Suites, but my company made me stay here. They have decent toiletries and a decent bed, but so does the Holiday Inn Express... Some of the towels were like sandpaper. And the constant nickel-and-diming was ridiculous. No free wi-fi anywhere (it costs $13.63 a day and was very slow), threats that the minibar will charge you if you even look at it funny, a $3 "delivery charge" to leave papers at the front desk for another guest, a $7charge to bring a package to the room (no option to pick it up yourself). It makes them look sad and cheap. The only thing I can say is that some of the staff are accommodating--they brought me up a sewing kit when I had a problem with a seam, and the security team took care of some loud guests at 3 AM. The boarding pass kiosk is also a nice touch, but I was astonished that it was free because everything else has a charge. Also, the location is somewhat sterile and uninteresting, not a lot of street life nearby. I recently read in the paper that the Hyatt is one chain that doesn't designate anyone to read reviews on sites like this--believe me, it shows. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great view, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a little over a month agi while on a business trip. I read some of these negative reviews and I didn't have any of the problems they are reporting. It sounds like several of them got SUPER cheap rates or used some third party website to book them. That shouldn't make a difference but I'd venture to guess that it probably does make a difference to the hotels. I booked directly on the hotel's website and I also am a member of their frequent stay program which may or may not have made a difference. I stayed 3 nights and my rate was about u$s 200 per night but I had a King room on a higher floor. My room was very spacious and it had a very comfortable bed, a work desk and a spacious bathroom. It also had a great view of the Canal. The hotel does stay very crowded and there were always tons of people in the lobby. The location is such that you need a taxi for many locations. The nice thing is they have plenty of employees working in the front to flag down taxis. I never waited more than 5 minutes for a taxi. The internet was u$s 10 per day and worked very well and was glitch free. The refrigerator was fully stocked. I did find it funny that they had a sticker on the refrigerator warning if you took anything out and put in your own drinks they would charge you for it. That's the first time I've seen a sticker like that and I've stayed in a LOT of hotels. I ordered room service a few times and it was always fast and the food was pretty good for hotel food. The check-out was fast and easy as they had self check-out so I checked ou within 5 minutes even though there was a long-line at the front desk. They had at least 5 of these check out terminals. All in all a good trip. Definitely if you can snag these cheapo rates whtat some of these people are talking about do it. I'm not sure what kind of room they were getting but mine was very spacious and very comfortable with no noise.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!”
Reviews.Author: LjCo
Reviews.Content: I dont know who to blame for this experience, so lets start with Expedia. These reservations were confirmed and paid for through Expedia days before my arrival. I arrived in Chicago, Illinois on 03/31/07 for a cheerleading competition my daughter was participating in. I dropped her off about 11:40 am and preceded to check into my hotel (Hyatt Regency Chicago on E. Wacker) they had 1 CSR available handling check-ins, it was taking an extreme amt. of time and with a cab waiting I decided to check my bags and get to the competetion thinking I would check in later that evening. When my daughter and I arrived back at the hotel after a very long day at 9pm we were told to our disbelief they had given away our room after 5 pm and on top of that had no more rooms left they would gladly put us on a twin bed in a parlor room. This was unacceptable. Their staff left us on our own to find other accommodations. I fought with this hotel and Expedia for 3 days to get my money refunded because they had already charged me for a service (room) I never received. If I were you I would be very careful booking through Expedia or using the Hyatt Regency Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt Regency...”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledTraveler
Reviews.Content: Are they sure they are part of the other Hyatt Regency Hotels?? My husband and I stayed from a Monday to a Friday, April 2007. The renovated room was poorly decorated and dark. The rest of the hotel seems dated and needs updating too. Housekeeping did not change our sheets until 4 days later, even though we requested that our linens be changed daily. Housekeeping was also cheap with replenishing our toiletries daily. Does housekeeping have to pay for the soaps? I thought that was already charged to our room. They even left us a half empty bottle of shampoo when I went back to the room one day. Housekeeping must need to be retrained on what they need to do. The weather was sketchy, so I went to get a "courtesy" umbrella. The bellhop station had the umbrellas, but I had to sign my room to the umbrella I got. I needed to return the umbrella, or get charged a $25 fee to my room. Is this a Hyatt Regency?? No hotel of this range would charge for an umbrella. Other hotels would give the umbrellas out.....with their compliments. There was also a charge for using the internet. I guess with such cheap rates, the hotel tries to make money off of every little thing. No, we did not get our room off of a discount website. Some of the "satisfied" customer reviews previous to mine are from customers who got lower rates, many $65 and under. (If I paid that little, then it would have been worth it. That's the standards this hotel offers.) This was part of a business trip, so our travel agent booked the room for us at $119 per night. Clearly, we paid all that for the view of our room, which was the only thing good about our room, (that is why I gave them a rating of "okay" rather than "terrible"). We had a room with a view of the lake and the river. Our room was also weirdly designed. We had our king bed in the middle of the room with a long desk behind the bed. Rather than redesigning the room with more space, they tried to form a desk area behind the bed. We will never stay at this hotel again. There are much better hotels nearby that charge less, and we would have paid more for better services.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Time At The Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: mymr2us
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend getaway with the "fellas". The Hyatt is a beautiful looking hotel from the inside. Very modern with a very nice fitness center. I did not see a pool, but swimming was the last thing on my mind. We arrived at the hotel and had NO problems checking in. The location is okay, but it seems like you need a cab to go just about everywhere. Chicago is a very expensive city, just like the rest of the big cities out there. So be prepared to spend a good amount of money on food and drinks. The Hyatt has a few nice choices to eat in, from high to low end. It also has one of the biggest bars that I have seen in a long time. They HAD a night club right in the center of the hotel, but it's now closed due to noise issues. I was told by the bar mgr St. Patricks day weekend was completely out of control. There is also a nice gift & coffee shop located inside. If your someone who likes a very quiet place, then this is NOT for you. This Hyatt holds a large amount of conferences and was jam packed all day Saturday. The bar was full all night long. You kinda get the feeling of a party hotel with class when you walk around. Everyone seems to be having a good time. All in all the Hyatt was a good hotel. Location was fine, food was good and the beds were GREAT! You will not be dissappointed at this hotel, unless you want total silence........

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hyatt I've Ever Been To”
Reviews.Author: bruceleedc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. The weekend we went, every negative review on Tripadvisor turned out to be perfectly accurate. As other reviewers had experienced, I too was informed that no rooms were available when I checked in upon arrival. This was despite the fact that I had called earlier to confirm my reservation. Because no rooms were available, I was offered a "parlor room," which was described as a "standard room with no bed." Because the parlor room had no bed, a rollaway bed would be provided instead. Furthermore, because this parlor room option was being offered, Hyatt claimed not to be obligated to offer alternate accomodations at a different hotel. I am fairly certain this is a scam Hyatt has planned in advance. Hyatt very likely overbooks their hotel whenever possible while keeping one or two of these parlor rooms on hand. When customers arrive and no rooms are available, they offer a parlor room. Predictably, very few customers are willing to accept this arrangement. Thus, the parlor rooms remain available for any customers that arrive even later, and Hyatt is never obligated to offer alternate accomodations. On top of this, the hotel was ridiculously loud and crowded. The ground floor of the hotel is essentially a nightclub, complete with the thundering bass and shady clientele. This could possibly be the worst hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Twiga2
Reviews.Content: $65 on priceline, nice room with stylish decor, great location, steps away from mag. mile/shopping, millenium park, giordano's pizza just around the corner. Also, reasonably priced grocery store next door. Downside - no pool, and $ internet, request room away from the elevator - very loud, low price = low end bedding. Would stay again but not for more than $100/nt for standard room, or pay $$ for upgrade, nicer view/bedding/ect....

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment Abounds”
Reviews.Author: Mstrong
Reviews.Content: This was the 7th hotel I've stayed at in the River/Magnificent Mile area. However it was the first negative experience I've had as well. I took previous advice to sign up for the gold passport program. This got me a late checkout and nothing else. Everything comes with a separate charge here including the business center ($7/hr) yikes. Yes, the bar does have normal sized drinks, however they are about double the price of anywhere else I've bought drinks in the city. There were two positives staying here and they were proximity and bed. I can find these two things at hotels within a few blocks that have much better service though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Huck33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for our anniversary. We booked it online and got an awesome rate. Overall, the service and overall atmosphere was excellent. My only 'complaint' was that one morning the housekeepers were talking SO loudly in the hallway it woke me up. I felt they could've been a little more considerate. Maybe the walls are just a little thin............................

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OHgram
Reviews.Content: We stayed here like another poster, because there was free shuttle service to McCormick place. The room was fine although the bathroom does not have much counter space for toiletries for two people. The beds were comfortable and a nice view of the city from our room. However, the bar scene is something else. We could never get into one on the second level as it was jammed every night. So we went to the lobby level one....don't. We came back after a play on a Friday night and stopped there to get a drink and appetizers. The martini's came without olives and in chipped rim glasses which we sent back. Then we were told not only were they out of olives, but totally out of food at 11:00PM on a Friday night!!! We could not believe it in a hotel this size. The service is snail paced too and near rude. And to add to this, our martini's were $14.00 each! Never had such an expensive drink without even one olive! Don't eat or use the bars in this hotel. Walk somewhere else. I wrote the General Manager a letter after this stay and never got a response. That's just bad business. We won't stay here again regardless of the transportation.

Reviews.Title: “decent, but not four star!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgee_P
Reviews.Content: I lived in chicago for about 10 years & now live in the burbs. We went for an overnight outing downtown to celebrate my husbands birthday. Booked our room through hotwire for about $80. A decent hotel for this price, but if you are paying full price the $200 would be better spent somewhere else. Pros: Good location, updated room decor, decent size room, bed VERY comfy, Big window & great view (our room faced the river with the hancock building in the center of our view-wonderful.) I did the phone check in (800 #) the morning of our arrival & that person was very helpful, arranged a room with a view & had a crib waiting in the room when we got there. Cons: Lobby/service/amenitys/over all vibe, on par with a 2-3 star hotel (very average) When my husband called the hotel directly a few days ahead to confirm the reservation, the person he spoke to was VERY rude & when he requested a king, she pointed out that he made the reservation through hotwire and that he should be happy to get what ever they give him. The crib they had for us was a pack & play & was FILTHY/stained, so we wound up having our 2 year old sleep with us. The "coffee pot" makes just one cup & we were only given enough coffee for that 1 cup, no cream/sugar. (when I called the front desk for some, they did bring it) Overall: Good location, room had a modern style, Good views, average amenities. Worth the discounted rate, But if you are looking for something "grand" save your extra four star bucks for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clvier1
Reviews.Content: This is the archetypal huge convention hotel, w/2 towers. I stayed in Room 2730, in the West Tower. It was a corner room and a "deluxe" room, as well. Great view of the city, framed by Trib Tower and Wrigley Bldg. It was basically fine, though I was less than impressed with all the clutter of other peoples' room service junk right in front of my door. There is a room ionizer, and the ambient ventilation system was a little weird, there is a thermostat but as near as I can tell no actual cycling. Hotel in a good location for Mag Mile stuff. Park in the Millenium/Grant Park Garage, $18-23/24 hours, hotel rates are outrageous. And, for what it's worth the Houlihan's breakfast buffet next door was very forgettable...there was NO one there save one person at 8 am, and when I tasted it I found out why. There is a Corner Bakery across MI Ave in the London Guaranty Bldg., and a McDonald's near the Wrigley Bld., to name a few choices. Chicago, however, is a gem, one of the greatest cities!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel - Weird Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MIRay
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a conference. The hotel is very conveniently located to shopping, the pier, and the park. It is a very large hotel with a pretty lobby area. If you find yourself staying in the west tower, expect to cross the street via the street or overhead walkway to get to your room. If you are able to get this hotel for some of the very cheap prices I have seen talked about in other reviews, then you may like the place. My company paid about $170 per night for me to stay here (since my conference took place right in the hotel) and at that price I would have to try elsewhere. The rooms are quite weird. The bathroom has no vanity top â€“ just a very small shelf that was not large enough to hold any toiletries - I had to keep mine on top of the TV cabinet. There was only one small drawer for clothes â€“donâ€™t plan to unpack your suitcase. Itâ€™s also pretty hard to hang up your clothes in the closet. It is very narrow and so shallow that the ends of the hangers extent out of the closet. The door is bi-fold into the closet so once you put clothes in the closet, you canâ€™t close the door and the door itself uses half of the already really small closet. Not sure who designed the rooms but they sure didnâ€™t have practicality in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Big and busy, but good”
Reviews.Author: TravelFairyQueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge. For as big as it is it runs like clock work and every employee we dealt with was extremely professional and gracious. This was my second stay in the last six months. Both times my room was in the West tower. Both times purchased on Priceline. Each time I checked in, there was no mention of Priceline and I was treated well. Each time I was asked if I wanted to upgrade for a slight fee. Each time I said yes. A deluxe room was $30.00 more a night. I really can't tell you the difference between a standard room and a deluxe room. Both times I stayed there I stayed in a deluxe room. The amenities in the deluxe room include a bathrobe, air purifier, ipod alarm clock, hairdryer, Lighted make-up mirror, down blanket, nice sheets and linens. The coffee maker with 'to go' cups is a nice touch. The room I stayed in 3024 was weird because in this room they 'floated' the bed-meaning the bed was in the middle of the room with the desk behind it. I really didn't like the design and felt it was a waste of space. It made me uncomfortable. Also the rooms are a dark earth tone. Almost too dark to the point of the room seems dirty even though it's not. I felt like I was in a cave. Because this hotel is so huge, the rooms are starting to show wear. However, it's still a great value for the money. I would recommend it. Within walking distance to North Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier too.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: jent103
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a double room with a friend last weekend (March 1-4). We didn't use many of the amenities (gym, restaurant, concierge), so I can't comment on those. Our room was a bit bigger than a typical Holiday Inn-type room and definitely better decorated. There were some paint issues in the bathroom, probably due to there being no fan, but since we booked the room on Hotwire for $69/night I won't complain much about that! My only true complaint was that the walls are very thin, at least where we stayed (7th floor of west tower). I could hear the people next door talking very well, and it didn't sound as though their voices were raised at all. Otherwise, the room was just fine and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcguinpd
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hyatt Regency for $50/night on Priceline! My girlfriend and I stayed from 2/28/07-3/04/07. THE PROS: From the start, everything went well. I heeded the advice of other posters, and joined Hyatt's Gold Passport program. I was able to call and check in over the phone at 11:30 the day of arrival. I was specifically looking for a room with a view of the Magnificent mile fireworks on Saturday night. The woman I talked to knew excatly which rooms would be great for that, but none were available yet. She took my cell phone number and called me back about a half hour later when one of those rooms became available. Talk about excellent service! Additionally, when I called, I asked if breakfast was included. The woman told me that it normally is not, but that she would include vouchers for 2 at the breakfast buffet for each morning. That was a $22/person value! The buffet was excellent. There was cereal, dried and fresh fruit, muffins, pastries, hash, sausage, bacon, eggs, potatoes, and made to order omelots. We arrived about 8:40 at night and check in went smoothly. Our room was on the 20th floor of the East Tower. We had a King room with a great view of the river and the Wrigley building. It was clean and average in size. The floor to ceiling windows were great for watching the fireworks. Toiletries were nice and replenished/replaced every day. Cleaning was also thorough. My girlfriend forgot her toothbrush, and the front desk was happy to provide one for her. There was a digital thermostat on the wall which was fairly quick to react to changes. The location was excellent. 3 blocks to the El, walking distance to museums, Navy Pier and the Magnificent mile. Millenium park is a 2 block walk as well. There is a small grocery store on Stetson St. less than a block away which sells wine, and other necessary items. THE CONS: Parking is expensive at $41/day, so we parked in the millenium park garage for $18/day, which is only 2 blocks away. There is little to no drawer space for clothing if you are the type to transfer your clothes from your suitcase to the dresser. There is no fan in the bathroom, so it fogs up easily. The lighting in the bathroom is also kind of dim. The doors are thin and hallway noise was easily heard. I do not know if the walls were equally thin, because we did not hear anyone through them. Sunday morning the hotel was very busy (as is expected), so elevators took quite a while and were sometimes full when they arrived. OVERALL: For the price, it was an excellent deal, and a great place to stay. We would definately stay here again. The service was excellent and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiniCoopGuy
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we usually LOVE Hyatt properties. However, this hotel is a nightmare. We've stayed here twice, and hoped our first bad experience was only a fluke. The staff and managers were pleasant when we voiced our issues, but we will never stay here again. We travel to Chicago at least 8+ times/year for pleasure, so we've stayed almost everywhere downtown. If you are traveling to Chicago it is a known fact you will pay A LOT to park your car (owned or rented). The valet parking at the Hyatt was an absolute NIGHTMARE when we checked out after a three day stay. We called down for our car and was told we had to go to the garage to pick up our car. When I went into the garage there must have been 200+ people either in line, or sitting on the floor of the reception area wondering if or when they would ever see their vehicle. Some people told me they'd been there an hour waiting for their car. Picture an airport that has canceled all of their flights, and that is what this lobby looked like. The hotel told us that they were just busy and everyone was checking out at once. I was also told this is a regular situation. My advice to the hotel is that you need MORE STAFF if you are making people wait an hour to get their car. If you know Sundays are your busiest day, HIRE MORE PEOPLE! There were other issues with our room, but I would end up writing a small essay listing those things. On a positive note the hotel is in a great location, but there are other hotels we've stayed at in Chicago for the same price and offering a much better experience. Be smart and check out various hotel websites before booking your stay in Chicago and you will be surprised at what cool places you can find. We loved our experiences both the Hard Rock and House of Blues Hotels. Based on two stays at this Hyatt we won't be returning for a third.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel; Staff was friendly and rooms were very clean”
Reviews.Author: ANDYH428
Reviews.Content: I got a Sunday night stay for only $50 off of Priceline.com, so it would be hard to complain...but this was truly a great hotel, even if I paid double. The first impression you get when you walk through the sliding doors of the Hyatt Regency Chicago is WOW. The lobby is beautiful with a upscale mall type of look to it with an open area that has a restaurant, plenty of couches,seats etc to people watch and a lake with water fountains. You take the escalator to the concierge/directory/check in area. The hotel let me check in at 12pm (I had a 3pm check in time). I suggest you call ahead like I did so they know you are coming early.The women at the desk was friendly and when I requested a higher level floor she was more than happy to look it up and even told me "I have a room on the 18th floor with a veiw of the river or you can go higher with no view". I thought it was pretty nice to give me that information so that I wouldnt get stuck with a room with a view of a wall. The rooms are big (I had a doubles room) The beds were beautiful with great pillows,blankets,headboards etc. An Ipod alarm clock was a nice 21st century touch to the room. Great to plug in your ipod, listen to some music and get ready for a night out or when relaxing after a long day of touring Chicago. The view was very nice and the bathroom was spotless and had great toiletries. Another great feature is the concierge area's computers that gives you access to printing your boarding pass before you get to the airport. You simply look at the screen, click on your airline icon and following the instructions. I had my boarding passes in about a minute. Came in handy when I got to OHare and was able to skip a long line of frustrated passengers. I was only in the hotel for 1 day, but it was by far one of the better hotel experiences I have had and I travel alot. It is a business hotel, but definitely a great choice for families and couples. Definitely would stay here again when Im passing through Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “2 Visits in 2 week period”
Reviews.Author: Exhaling
Reviews.Content: I booked this property due to the 99 dollar and 79 dollar specials on travelzoo. Let me first say, the property is huge and beautiful. I was told by an employee that it is the largest hotel in Chicago. My bags were taken by valet right away. Easy check in-either at desk or kiosk (there is also a person to help at the kiosk). NOTE: They charge two days hotel day if you stay one night. I was unpleasantly surprised after using a debit card. Took 3-4 days for release. Pros: Room has air cleaning Oreck system. A stereo that one can attach a MP3 or IPOD to, and the most comfortabe bed. There was also a mini bar. I had a great view in the West Tower of the Fireworks. Cons: There was strawberries on the carpet from the last people staying there. I complained to the manager and they offered me another room (smoking or a king bed only due to the hotel being booked and my non-smoking double was not available). A housekeeper came to clean the spot but could not get the stain up......I was a little heated but the firework view calmed me down. Location: 1 block off Michigan Ave. Not far from Funky Buddha Loungue-very fun place. Houlihans connected-BEST 10 DOLLAR BUFFET for Breakfast. So why the 4 stars? Next visit was perfect. I loved the personal atttention. Valet parking was 41 dollars, but worth it when we were in -15 degree weather. I applaud those doormen. There were cheaper options close by but it was too cold. Very friendly and helpful staff. At check out, we were able to keep our bags there and do some shopping. Also, for 89 dollars I have stayed at budget motels in a far less exciting city. The property is grand. When they do it bad, it stands out, so I will forgive their flaws. The hotel should let people know that it is a two day charge.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the price- great location”
Reviews.Author: janestclaire95
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and nice. The hotel has a great location on the Chicago river, and situated nicely between the millenium/Grant Park area and the north side of the river, making it easy walking distance to many sites, including the art institute, magnificent mile shopping and restaurants, and navy pier. The room was comfortable, although there were some scuff marks on walls and the sheets were a little scratchy. But overall, a nice stay in a nice hotel with a great location. I got this hotel on priceline for 2/26/07 and it was quite inexpensive ($60 for hotel- total including tax was $76).

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel: Lobby Buzzing with Activity, Near Michigan Ave Activity”
Reviews.Author: UniversityLad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a snowy weekend in Chicago for a convention. . I booked the Hyatt Regency downtown through Hotwire for 85 dollars a night; given the amenities listed, I was pretty sure I'd end up there. There are a few reasons I like staying in this neighborhood that also includes the Swissotel and Fairmont: cheap parking is nearby, it's central, and the Lakeshore Athletic Club nearby is a great workout facility with lap pool. Hotel parking can be expensive in downtown Chicago, but the city owned parking lot under Millenium park is just a few short blocks south. Valet Parking for the Hyatt is currently 41 dollars *per night*, but I parked in the city lot from Friday afternoon to Sunday morning for 32 dollars *total*--a savings of fifty dollars. The location is centrally located near Millenium Park and a short walk from the Art Institite and Michigan Avenue shopping. The streets immediately surrounding the hotel are quiet though. The Lakeshore Athletic Club next door is one of the nicest and largest workout facilities I've been to. The hotel itselt is a large convention hotel and lobby is busy and buzzing with lots of people and activity. Both towers are shaped like the letter H, and the hallways are well light. Late at night, there security was checking for keys before entering the elevator banks and a key was needed to call elevator. There is a medium sized workout room with a large variety of weights and machines, but no locker facilities, showers, or pool. The rooms are well furnished with comfortable mattresses with thick mattress pads and white duvet covers and comforters rather than bedspreads. I had two double beds in my room and there were four great quality pillows per bed! How great! Night stand had a clock radio to wich you could attach your ipod or ipod shuffle to listen to your music. I also had a nice lounge chair and comfortable rolling desk chair. The closet contained a safe and ironing board with iron. The bathroom toiletries are nice with great quality herbal shampoo, conditioner, soaps, and shower cap. Towels are fluffy. As noted in another review, the toilet looked a little instiutional, but I found it comforting to know it would flush powerfully for both me and the room's previous occupant. My brother had corner room which was a little bit smaller and oddly angled, but he had a great view of the Wrigley building from his bed. Wireless internet worked well for 13 dollars and change for 24 hours. I was pleased with my experience and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: cch1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times as it is frequently available through Priceline and nice deals for stays here can be acquired there. The facility/upkeep is always good. It is about 2 blocks East of Michigan Ave. leading up "the Magnificent Mile" to the North. It is a bit of a substantial walk from the hotel to the clubs of Clark St., etc. My wife and I generally go about on foot, but be prepared to do some walking if you want to skip the taxis, buses, etc. I generally get rooms with a king bed and have had no complaints about the comfort or condition of the bed. Bathroom/shower facilites are more than adequate and you are supplied with fairly good quality shampoo, soap and lotion. I've never had a complaint about the towels. My only complaint about this hotel is that the walls are really transparent in regard to sound. My last stay was the second time that we could hear "adult activity" loud and clear in the room next door to the point that it was impossible to sleep through. That can get a bit old, but I suppose that's always a risk of congregate living! Parking was $41/night as of mid Feb., 2007. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel, esp. if it can be gotten for a bargain on Priceline. The location is quite good and you aren't far from the attractions of downtown and Navy Pier. Just try to be sure you aren't rooming next to newlyweds or newly coupled!

Reviews.Title: “Large clean room for $89/night”
Reviews.Author: bruceInDC
Reviews.Content: Booked a $89 rate I saw on Travelzoo. The Room (2518) was large and clean, comfortable bed, and beautiful view of the river. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to either the CTA (train) or shopping on Michigan Ave. There is a Houlihan's connected to the building that has a great $10 breakfast buffet and reasonable drink prices at night. The hotel bar was overpriced and understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: IndianaNiki
Reviews.Content: We were in room 2410 on the 24th floor in the west tower. Overall, we really loved the hotel. We paid $77.50/night including taxes thanks to Priceline. We were going to arrive late Friday night, so we used their 800 number to check in at 7:00 in the morning. I would HIGHLY recommend doing this if you are worried about them overbooking the hotel. The phone number is on their website. When we called, we requested a queen or king size bed and a room with a view, and they delivered. We had a beautiful view of the river and Navy Pier (and Lake Michigan of course). The parking was $41/ 24 hours, but we were only charged $41 total for some reason (and we were there from Friday-Sunday). That was a definite plus. Internet was $13.63/24 hours which we felt was somewhat reasonable. The hotel room was very nice and very clean. There was a large work desk and an additional table with four chairs, as well as a sofa bed, an alarm clock which also serves as an iPod dock and an Oreck XL air purifier. There were extra towels, toilet paper, a blanket, and pillows in our closet. We were very impressed with the hotel for what we paid. There were only a few very minor things that bothered us, but they were resolved quickly. On our second night, our "neighbors" had very loud music and we could hear them talking (still) at about midnight. We called the front desk and were then transferred to security. About ten minutes later, I heard a knock on their door and the music was turned down. The walls seemed to be paper thin, but it was ok since we ultimately slept very well in the comfortable bed. Also, because we didn't have our room number when we first arrived to check in, the valet just took our name and said they would bill the parking to our room. This was fine untiil we went to retrieve our car the next day and we were told we had to come pay for parking in the parking garage. Instead, we just went to the front desk and asked that they charge the parking to our room. It was taken care of, and we called the valet and our car arrived shortly thereafter. Overall I think the hotel was GREAT and very accommodating. I wish I would have known a little more about the location before I booked it (it's South of the river), since there are not a lot of restaurants within walking distance, but we would stay there again if we got the same great rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Zgibson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency during the week, Tuesday - Friday, after getting the room for $69/night on Hotwire. I was a little worried about our stay after reading the reviews online but we were very pleasantly surprised. The location is great, right off of Michigan Ave and within walking distance of theatres, shopping, and restaurants. We were on the 25th floor and had a fabulous view. The staff was helpful and courteous. The front desk checked us right in, there was no wait in line. The concierges were polite and quick to give us answers to all of our questions. We'd called ahead and requested a room with a king size bed and that's what we got. It was clean, modern, and spacious; the bed and pillows were heavenly; and the bathroom was very nice and roomy. My only wish was for more drawer space for our clothing and more hangers in the closet. The mini-bar is weight sensitive, if you remove anything the scale senses it and the item is charged to your room, so we never touched the bar. There is a grocery store literally a minute walk away, so we got snacks and such there. The room was right off of the elevators, and we were not disturbed by noise. Likewise, we never encountered a problem with bar or band noise or crowds as we came and left the hotel. When we checked out, we called ahead for valet to bring the car. They said it'd be a 15-20 minute wait but the car was there in 10 minutes. I'll admit that parking is pricey at $41 a night, and there are several ramps nearby that are much cheaper, but we chose to splurge on the valet parking. I would not hesitate at all about staying here again. We had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok for $50/night on priceline”
Reviews.Content: It was ok. They let me check in early which was very nice and I should have requested to stay in the West Tower. The main tower is very loud on the weekend and there is a loud night club in the main lobby. The walls are also very thin and I overheard my neighbors at 1 in the morning. (not cool) But, as I said, for $50 (that included taxes) it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I was skeptical. Just completed a two night stay and was very pleased. Took the blue line directly from the airport to the State and Lake stop and paid 5 dollars plus tip to get to the hotel. Normally the cab fare is 40-45 so we were happy to save. I purchased a 2 day pass from the CTA on their website for 9 dollars. Pass arrived within a few days of purchase and makes using the subways and buses easy. Front desk staff was quick to check us in and gave us exactly the room that we requested. We were able to check in very early and were treated very professionally by Megan at the desk. Room was on a higher floor corner facing the Chicago Tribune. Room was extremely clean and I didn't see any food trays etc. as noted on other reviews. Room appeared updated with an extremely clean bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable with lots of pillows and extra towels and blanket in closet. Not a great deal of drawer space. Didn't wait more than a few minutes for the concierge which were extremely helpful. The location is okay, steps from Michigan Avenue right near transportation. We walked the 10-15 minute walk to the Chicago Art Museum which is free until Feb. 21. The hotel is huge with two towers and holds more than 1800 rooms. It has a convention type setting but we knew this and for what we paid were extremely happy. We took the Gray Line tour which picked us up on time right in front of the hotel. Didn't eat the food but lines in the morning appeared long. There is a Houlihans right next door. Had drinks at the Martini bar and loved the setting. If I was planning a family trip with kids in tow I might look for another hotel considering that there is no pool. Dined at Maggiano's for great Italian family style food with huge portions at inexpensive prices, had a huge portion of meatballs and rigatoni for 11.95. Went to the Chicago Chop House and had a great steak for a fair price. Both places need a reservation and I would make them online on their websites. I would go back in a heart beat for the right price. Bell staff and everyone else truly demonstrated the Hyatt attitude and willingness to do whatever it takes to please the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Valet”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is, well, it's the Hyatt ... and everything you associate with the name. The hotel itself was quite nice, the amenities as you would expect and the size grandeur. I was pleasantly surprised to book the stay through Hotwire at a very, very fair rate (just $85 / night) but I should have known it was too good to be true. When I arrived at the hotel, I learned it would cost an additional $41 per day to park my car with the valet. While there were other options, none were nearly as convenient and reliable, so I agreed to spending nearly half as much money as I did on the room per night. While this frustrated me, it probably wouldn't have been as bad if the valet service wasn't as poorly run as it is.
