There is a bottle neck of cars in front of the hotel, unorganized and rude valet staff and a considerable amount of wait time for the car retrieval (my wait time ranged from 15-30 mins each time easily). It was faster and easier to call for my car to be brought up front, but I was not informed of this service until the final time I retrieved my car. Sigh. One last word to the wise, should you forget any toiletries or run out during your stay, I advise you to suck it up and find a drug store nearby. I was in a pinch and needed something quickly, but I paid dearly for purchasing them at the gift store (a small premium is expected, but nothing like what I had to shell out).

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated.”
Reviews.Author: pslee
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is very clean, staff very friendly and is conveniently located, I didn't find it to be worth the $$$. Our double Queen room beds were most definitely NOT queen size beds and they were extremely uncomfortable. Even my children woke up stiff. Some things you should know before-hand. Parking costs 41.00. There are no snack machines on the premises. However your room is stocked with refreshments that are outrageously over-priced. If you stay here be prepared to spend some cash or better yet...bring a cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Almost always a good call”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago on at least five occasions over the last three years (all through PL) and have largely enjoyed our stays each time. You cannot beat the location both at the north end of the central business district south of the river (plus art institute, State Street, and Grant and Millenium parks) and NMA just across to the north of the hotel. The city is really at your doorstep here, with about a five minute walk to Lake and Wabash street L stops! The general quality of the experience has been good each stay. Some rooms have been better than others in regards to location in the complex or decor, but we have found the rooms to be well stocked and clean each time. The staff is largely very helpful. The bell service is always very accommodating and willing to hold your bags after checkout while you spend one last day in the city. My wife and I joke that we really ought to stay somewhere else whenever we go down to the city for a getaway but always find ourselves happy coming back to the Hyatt Regency Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: glory4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night getaway from this Hyatt. Overall, this hotel was great. We had a huge executive suite with breakfast included. Breakfast was wonderful and service was quick and courteous. The room was nicely updated with modern touches. The hotel is in a prime location, just a block off Michigan avenue. When we arrived at 9 am they told us that our rooom was clean but when we checked the room out it had not been serviced. We went back down and kindly let the front desk know. They were VERY apologetic and gave us a free day of breakfast and sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The front desk manager even walked us to our room after we had breakfast to ensure that the room had been serviced. I would expect this from a Four Seasons or even a Park Hyatt, but this was above and beyond. All our requests were met quickly and politely. We would most definately return to this Hyatt. The only issue with this hotel is the fact that there is a night club that is in the lobby. We could not hear the noise from the club but people returning from it at 1,2 and 3 am. They were very loud and drunk and we did have to call security one night because a group of men were shouting at each other in the hall. I imagine that this would not be a problem during the week and only on the weekends. This hotel is attached to all kinds of stores, via an underground walkway. There is an attached CVS, Starbucks, Hallmark, spa and dozens of others.

Reviews.Title: “Forewarned is forearmed”
Reviews.Author: Fortunateson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an embarassment to the Regency name. Spent 3 days here 11/10 - 11/12/06. I've stayed at several Regency properties around the world and felt they offered quality service and accomodations. This hotel greeted me with the stench of the cesspool-like lobby fountain. This offensive odor persisted throughout my stay. The staff were superficial and indifferent (though there was no problem with extending a hand for tips). The accomodations were more fitting for a Super 8 (apologies to all the industrious Super 8 staff out there). The path to my room was littered with room service trays with discarded food which remained uncollected into the following day. The hall carpets displayed numerous stains of undetermined origin. It is also "Convention Central", totally lacking in charm or personal interest. Never at a "superior" hotel have I experienced such indifference towards the guest's comfort and overall experience. The 4 star rating is about 3 stars too generous. STAY AWAY !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chicag0bears
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hyatt through Priceline and was able to get a rate of $45/night! Can't go wrong with that! The rooms are nice, spacious, clean and contain all the amenties a traveler would need. I have to say that I have fallen in love with the Hyatt chain due to their customer service. I have stayed at a few of their hotels in different cities and the staff has always been extremely friendly, which you don't often see at other hotels. I used the self-check in machine, and the customer service person checked in on me to make sure everything was going smoothly. Then, when she saw that my room was not on a high level, she offered to have it changed for me so that I could have a better view. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice easy stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hyatt for one night. We paid $79 though Hotwire. I arrived at around noon. Check-in was a breeze and my room was ready. The king size bed was very comfortable. Nice linens in the bathroom. We checked out early the following morning. No problems. Overall, a nice shot stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: branshaw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from stayin at this hotel for 3 nights and I have nothing but good things to say about it. For $99 a night it was a steal. Great location on the river within walking distance from just about anything! Magnificent mile is just a 3 minute walk away, and the CTA is about a 5 minute walk. When you get there get a 2,3,or 7 day guest pass for the CTA this is a discounted ticket that give you full access to all trains, red line, and buses. Much cheaper than taxi!! The service at this hotel was great, we were visiting Chicago on our 3 yr anniversary. When we mentioned this the front desk upgraded us to a junior suite, which was very nice and spacious. Thanks to everyone for a great stay. Also, if you are ok with spending some dough, there is a great steakhouse located in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: cathyfromillinois
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get this for $56 a night through Priceline. We requested to be in the quieter West tower. City and lake view. Our room was spacious and clean. Very comfortable bed. Staff was friendly and informative. Parked a few blocks away at the Randoph street garage for $16/night. Can't beat the central location. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “will return if price stays right”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjohn
Reviews.Content: i suppose if i was paying a lot more than the $75/nite we paid i wouldn't be as pleased as we were. my 2nd time at this hyatt and it was good both times. at $41/nite valet parking is expensive, but since we walk or take public transportation or taxis we parked at the monroe/millenium garage 4 blocks south for $16/nite. $20 for the pool/whirlpool at the lakeshore athletic club 1 block away was something we passed on. however the exercise room on the lowest level was roomy and well equipped. the concirge service was friendly, eager and moderately well informed, definitely useful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Texas-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December during the Midwest Band Conference. Overall the stay was ok, not spectacular and certainly not what I would have expected from a Hyatt. Our party had two adults and two kids. We upgraded our room to one with a city view and into the regency level. The regency level gave us access to the club where breakfast (continental) was served with an evening reception (cash bar). If I had to do it over, I would have passed on the upgrade. Then again, if I had to do it over I would choose another hotel. The positives: (1) Location - the hotel has great walking access to shopping, restaurants and the waterfront. (2) free fitness center (3) the doormen were responsive and extrememly polite The negatives: (1) Value - the rooms were small and expensive for the price, our "view" was not worth the extra $$. (2) Limited breakfast choices (the buffet is $22 per person). (3) No pool (4) the hotel lobby alway seemed smoke filled. (4) Parking - like all downtown hotels, expect to pay $35-40 per night The concerge service was hit or miss, with some staff going out of their way to help and others not interested. When checking in the hotel gave us a room with one king even though we reserved one with two doubles. Fortunately, they were quick to fix the problem, but only after we carried our luggage up. This is probably a great conference hotel, but I would not recommend it for family stays. You can do a lot better in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not a great value”
Reviews.Author: harless01
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel due to a conference. The hotel is nice, what you would expect from a Hyatt but I was expecting something that would dazzle me. This hotel does not dazzle. It is an upscale hotel that is very expensive. The shop in the hotel is extremely high, soft drinks are $2.29 each. We walked around the corner at a Walgreens and got the same soft drinks for a dollar cheaper. Next time at the conference we will probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: TDog47
Reviews.Content: I felt like I had gotten a great deal for this hotel when I got it for $111 with taxes through Priceline. After checking the hotel's website and seeing that their rate was $198 plus tax, I was pretty happy. When I got to the hotel and my room, my attitude changed and I felt like even I overpaid. The hotel is huge first of all. There is a lot going on at the hotel all the time, which is nice if you like that kind of stuff. Check in was super easy with an automated check in machine like at the airport. I was very impressed. It even gave me options for my room. After finding a place to park our car(the hotel charges $41 a nite), we went to our room. I recommend parking your car just down from the hotel. You can save $10 a day in parking. The room was tiny. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and this was small for what I'm used to. And that includes Paris, London, and Berlin hotels. The room obviously hadn't been updated in quite a while and the air conditioning never cooled the room down. Overall I think the next time I'm in Chicago I'll stay somewhere else. Never pay full price for this hotel, it is way overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with size”
Reviews.Author: lpbear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six days to attend a conference.Check-in was fast .I became a gold card member after reading these reviews.Requested a room with a view which i got .Rooms were not fancy but comfortable.Went to the big drink bar each night.Aiways packed but service was reasonable.Went to the disco one night but it was very crowded.Ate in the the chophouse-food was excellent but a bit pricey.Used the conceige to book tickets to the sears tower and dinner on the Abby- they were very friendly.This hotel has the capacity to handle serveral conferences and a large number of people at one time.I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Al M
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation through Travel Zoo for $119.00 per night and arrived at 10:30 am. The reception personnel were polite and we were able to occupy our room right away and well before the posted check in time. The room was large and the king sized bed was comfortable. The bathroom was average and not impressive. Maid service was exceptional. This is a lagre hotel and we were awakened at about 2:30 am by inebriated people talking loudly in the hall. We called security and they sent someone up right away and they quited down. The other three nights were quiet. The hotel is convenient to downtown and the only downside to the location is that you have to run a gauntlet of panhandlers along the sidewalk from Michigan Ave. to the hotel. All in all, considering the discounted rate, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless stay, though this hotel isn't for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Ascenseur
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal for $119/night at this hotel and decided to try it out. Overall I was very pleased. The staff was kind and accommodating, the room was very clean and spacious, the fixtures were modern and the bed was decent. The assistant checking me in asked if I'd mind a room near the elevators. I said no, and sure enough the room was very quiet all night despite being next to the elevators. I also appreciated being given the chance to choose another room. Despite my very positive experience during my single-night stay, I will concede that this hotel isn't for everyone. It's an absolutely enormous convention hotel, so you won't find the personal level of service of a boutique hotel. The lobby is gigantic and always crowded, though it's quite fun at night since the lounges and dance club are integrated right into the lobby. For the price I paid, I thought this hotel was well worth it. And by the way, that deal is still available from travelzoo.com...

Reviews.Title: “Felt rooms are too old”
Reviews.Author: echotrain
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in the Hyatt Regency Chicago off Wacker Drive. The hotel is just too big. I felt that the rooms looked old and the furniture used. There was a musty smell in my room. The check-in for both towers is on the second floor of the east tower, which I find weird. The service staff also appeared too busy. Perhaps it was due to the large number of guests in the hotel. Popped down to the concierge a few times to find no one there, but subsequently was able to get some help. Convenient but I will probably stay in some hotel north of the river the next time I visit. Those will be nearer to the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Susan66
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago recently attending a convention and was allocated a room in this hotel. The hotel's location is great, right in downtown Chicago and a ten minute cab ride away from the McCormick Convention Center. This is a really large hotel, which doesn't seem to have any pretentions regarding atmosphere or style. Room was adequate with nice bed but decor was a bit drab and could do with a make-over. Breakfast was good quality but prepare yourself for a long queue. Feels like a hotel factory. Not for people who crave individual attention and service.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Room”
Reviews.Author: chiasere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago this summer, and have to say it was quite memorable. Not because of the teeny tiny room, and not because if you compare it to other "4 star" hotels in Chicago, it doesn't stand up, but because of the accident that occured while i was there and their lack of concern because of it. While bathing in their "1 star" bathtub/shower, I realized that someone had pulled off the appliques on the floor of the tub that keep you from slipping. While stepping out, I used caution because of this, but because it was not a flat surface, and quite wet and slick, I fell anyway. I ended up twisting my ankle. I later called down to a manager to explain the situation, she never apologized, but sent up a security guard to take a report. She couldn't be bothered with speaking to me in person. I ended up missing 2 days work because of the accident, as I do not have a sit down job. I wrote a letter to the Hyatt corporate office a few days later and never heard back from them. They made it obvious to me that they don't care about their guests. I will never stay at a Hyatt again and reccomend the same to everyone- there are enough customer service oriented hotels out there where you should never have to give your money to a chain like Hyatt who apparanty doesn't want to be bothered by their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: kimke
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Chicago last week and the Hyatt was one of the conference hotels. Because of the Hyatt name, there was no decision to make; of course, I would stay at the Hyatt. When we arrived, check in was easy and the staff offered us the opportunity to upgrade our room to a Deluxe room. At only $15.00 more night, I thought the amenities definitely sounded worth it. When I initially entered my room, I was impressed by the design and concept. It had an Oriental feel to it and reminded me of some of the boutique type hotels I have stayed in the past. I noticed on the surface that the room was rather dirty. When I sat down at the desk, the leather placemat was very sticky. On the bathroom vanity, there were numerous soap type stains. I was able to easy rub them off with a damp washcloth. The walls were dirty, both in the bathroom and bedroom. Both the carpet and the bedspread on my bed had cigarette burns on them. This was rather surprising since I was in a non-smoking room. The carpet was more understandable, but I was surprised that a bedspread with two burns on it would be used. I also noticed that the â€œplush bathrobesâ€� promised by the check-in staff was not in the room. I called to have a robe delivered and when I put it on the next morning, it had a big rip in the front of it. I had dinner out, came back to the room and put on my pajamas. I was a bit disappointed that we did not get the â€œturn down serviceâ€� we were promised. It something I enjoy while traveling and makes me feel a bit pampered. I pulled back the bedspread and noticed much debris on the sheet. Initially, I tried to brush the sheet off, but on further inspection, I noticed there were at least five hairs on the sheets. It was really disgusting. I did contact housekeeping and the sheets were changed by a very nice woman named Sarah. She did have much difficulty finding sheets that were not torn. After 20 minutes, I told her I didnâ€™t care if they were torn; I just wanted them to be clean. She did replace the burnt bedspread and apologized that it was used. I also did not receive the daily newspaper. I did call and re-request the turndown service the next night; I received it on night #2, but not #3. I suppose overall I was very disappointed by the room that I received. I did call to complain several times (robe, turn down service, dirty sheets) but no one seemed too concerned about me. I donâ€™t know if I should have pursued it more while I was there, I felt like I was being too picky, but when I got home, my husband thought the room sounded terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location”
Reviews.Author: thirdromechild
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price (got it off hotwire for 90 bucks a night). The halls decor was a bit dated and worn. But the room was good and the view was really nice (the river). The staff was wonderful. Really overpriced bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samjkh
Reviews.Content: I just returned from The Hyatt on E Wacker in Downtown Chicago and found it very good.The location is excellent just a few steps from the Magnificent Mile and right on the river.The hotel itself is very large and busy with people coming and going constantly.We had a great room in the west tower overlooking the river and water tower which was beautiful to look out on anytime of day.The rooms are spacious and pleasant and we used the wireless internet connection which cost approx $11 for a 24 hour period.There are numerous eating places in the hotel from pubs to a very trendy bar (apparently the longest free standing bar in America).We did eat the buffet breakfast which was awesome and worth the $22.If you are looking for something cheaper Houllihans at the side of the hotel does a buffet breakfast for $10.This hotel is just around the corner from the famous Billy Goat's Tavern (Saturday Night Live) well worth a visit and their cheeseborgers are just a few dollars! There is also a Walgreens very close for all those supplies that you might have forgotten to bring.I would recommend joining The Hyatts Gold Passport Club its free and much faster with virtually no wait on check in.Overall I would definitely return to The Hyatt on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Just So-So”
Reviews.Author: Jcooper707
Reviews.Content: I stayed here (hesitantly) for my annual trip to chicago. I normally stay at a four star in the North River area, however I didnt pick the hotel this time. The hotel is made up of two seperate towers connected by a glass skywalk. The west tower is, where the front desk, restaurants, bar, and nightclub are. The two story atrium seemed failry busy and crowded, with people going in every direction. The second story of the all glass atrium is where the front desk and the Big Bar are located. Im not sure how to describe the lobby---other than I would've exepcted a nicer lobby for a hyatt hotel. We arrived prior to checkout and were told we'd have to wait till just after 3pm for a room. We ate lunch at Connies, a family style pizzeria, to kill some time; the food was good. We got our room at three and were not all that impressed with it. The view was wonderful. We had a clear view of the river, marina and lake from the 31st floor of the east tower. The room itself left A LOT lot to be desired. The carpet was stained and the furniture seemed out of place and uncomfortable. The bed was rock hard and the bathroom was old and begging to be remodeled. The staff were friendly for the most part, however we didnt really feel the love when we went to seek out the concierge for assistance. The other thing I should mention is that the hotel, in my opinion, isnt really a great place for families. In the west tower there is a nightclub called Hard Drive in the middle of the lobby on friday and saturday nights. It is smack dab in the middle of the lobby and blasts throbbing music with flashing strobe lights. I dont mind nightclubs, but I didnt really appreciate watching drunk people bumping and grinding on each other when I was trying to quietly unwind with a drink after a long day. I guess I perfer my hotel to be a bit more mello and classy. We ordered room service in the morning, but theres no where to really eat in the room aside from the bed or desk. I tried to get a coffee from the coffee shop in the west tower, but the line was literally out the door. All in all I wasnt that impressed. I wouldnt waste the money to stay there again, and I wouldnt reccomend it to families or older crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt good location & value”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBC
Reviews.Content: My Finance & I visited Chicago over Labor Day Weekend & stayed at the Hyatt Regency. I have stayed there before & it's a very trendy hotel. The location is great (even though it's on the South Side of the River), with the ability to walk to Grant Park, Down Michigan Avenue, and to Navy Pier. Positives: Location, price (if booked on-line in advance), rooms are updated & have a mini frig w/a fully stocked bar, an air purifier, comfortable beds, and the restuarants/bars w/in the hotel. The Big Bar is great for Happy Hour, however, very, very, trendy after 8:00PM. There's a convenience store next to the hotel and during the winter when it's cold, snowy, etc. (the underground walkways are very convenient to get around in a several block area). Improvement: NO POOL OR SPA. You have to walk to the GYM & Pay $25 a day to use it. The Hip-Hop Bar on the Weekends in the Lobby with a long line & mostly mid-20 year olds, makes the hotel lobby extremely LOUD (I feel sorry for the Front Desk Staff). I recommend it to business travelers & weekend get aways. Not good for Kids.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: skyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting a bit rundown, but the location is outstanding and the staff is excellent. If you're looking for a hotel in downtown Chicago, this should be a definite option. On the River, near the Lake, walking distance to shopping and restaurants galore. The decor is nice, and the rooms are clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cdnmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency over the Canadian TG w/e(Oct 6-9/06)We stayed here because at the last minute we got a price of 229USD per night over 289USD per night at the Hilton Garden Inn on Grand. I checked the reviews quickly on TA and thought for the amount of time we were planning to be in the room, it was worth the 60USD a night. Location seemed ok. When we arrived we had no trouble with the type of room requested and had checked in earlier on their 1-800 #. Got a king room, no smoking, on 20th floor. Yes, we looked into an office building(west tower) but it was the weekend, so no worries of peeping Toms. We could see Soldier Field from our room which my husband liked. The room was exactly like the pics on the Hyatt website. As described by other travellers, the lighting was not great, and the room was worn, but in good shape. Everything was clean, but could use some sprucing up. Bed was no problem. DONT use the room fridge to store YOUR drinks, as the hotel will charge you by weight (what is up with that?) and if you even take a drink or item from the fridge to look at consider it sold as again, it will recognize the diff weight. This sounded crazy to me but then again, I wasn;t going to pay 8usd for a bottle of water. This could be a problem with young kids who like to look in the fridge or if you would like to keep stuff in your room. Location was great, 2 min walk to MM, 10-15 walk or quick free shuttle to Navy Pier. 1 min walk to Millenium Park etc. The lobby bar (Hardrive) can get pretty loud at night, but the BIG lounge is a good place to stop at the end of a busy day. Overall, no complaints, just suggestions. Don't assume that the fancy name Hyatt Regency means it will be top notch. If I had my children with me, I probably would not have stayed here. If you are looking for a good hotel to stop by and shower, sleep etc. this hotel will be fine. If we were going to be in our room a little more I probably would have stuck with the other hotel. Chicago is a beautiful city. Go if you get the chance. Thanks to all on TA for their suggestions. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience By All”
Reviews.Author: kitten450
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel nearly 2 months in advance of a conference being held there and confirmed my reservations with a credit card...I called prior to arrival as well. Upon arrival. After driving 9 hrs with my husband, and 7yr old I was informed that they did not have a room for us. We were put in a conference type of room on 3 rollaway beds. (my husband is 6'5 with a neck injury )Although we check in at 11pm we didnt receive our rollaway beds until making various phone calls and they FINALLY arrived at 1:45 am. We were not the only ones without rooms.Many people before us and after us were advised they had NO rooms. They to had made confirmed reservations. Some were sent miles away and others put on rollaway beds. According to a bellman it is common practice to overbook the hotel by 15%... Hey the Hyatt is not inconvenienced just their guests...apparently they dont care about them. At check in their were only 2 people at the front desk. No apologies and the only compensation for our inconvenience was we received 1/2 price on our first nights stay...big deal....we didnt even get a bed til the following day. ..WE STILL PAID OVER 100.00 TO SLEEP ON ROLLAWAYS and another 41.00 to park our car at the hotel....This is just NUTS.....Ive stayed at many nice, friendly, and customer oriented hotels....THIS was not one of them.....I spend my lunch trying to get us moved into a new room. Fianlly, at the end of my lunch I was told that we had a new room but that we needed to be moved before 5pm or our room would be given away. Given that my conference was not over until 5:30 pm I had to leave the conference (my reason for being at this hotel) 1.5hrs early. The parkig garage well that was a story in itself. When we finally found out the rate of 41 per day...we called about moving our vehicle down the block where we would only have to pay 16 per day....a far cry from what they were charging their own guests.... Although we were told that if we moved prior to midnight we would get another charge....we did...they even added an extra 41.00.....they all played the unless you know who you spoke with it will be 41. I even spoke with the manager....I told him waht time of day we called and gave him a description of the females voice...he still played DUMB....and didnt remove the charge.....They have no pool, hot tub, the exercise room for this size of a hotel is a JOKE....Nothing for kids at this hotel...you are paying 200. + per night for beds...well that is if your lucky and they havent given them away....I stayed at one of the nicest hotels in Las Vegas....and well....no comparison.....This place is a HORRIBLE place to stay with a family. No one really cares if you enjoy your stay....I will NEVER stay at a in a HYATT AGAIN.....it was a joke. On the way home we stayed at Lees Inn and Suites...never had been there...we had no reservations walked into a room as nice as that at the Hyatt, with a frig, microwave...which we didnt have at the Hyatt (At the Hyatt getting ice on your floor and forget a pop without going to the gift store a pop and candy bar are nearly 4.00). ....LEES INN had a nice pool and hot tub....we even were given a full free breakfast for all of us....PRICE 87.00....THE HYATT needs to learn about CUSTOMER STATISFACTION, THAT CONFIRMATION #'S should ensure that you have a room, and that they give your room away they should be kissing y our butt during your stay.....NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!MANAGEMENT should be reading the comments about their hotel and improving the stays of their guests.....they are showing a "we dont care attitude" by allowing this to continue......

Reviews.Title: “Gross & Nasty”
Reviews.Author: bluepaco
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline and pretty much knew I was going to get this hotel based on tips via betterbidding.com however I was fine with the assignment based on my last stay 4 years past in the East Tower (King corner room) which was pretty satisfying. This time I was placed in the West Tower, double double non-smoking room on the 20th floor and it was pure shame. The room had a musty odor throughout. The faucet the bathroom fell apart and the wallpaper was peeling down everywhere. The shower and tub combination was permanently stained yellow and black mildew/mold was throughout the grout. Carpet was stained, aritificial lighting is the worst ever and the narrow tiny window looks directly into another building. Should you stay here, do NOT stay in the West Tower. This is also not a hotel for the quiet guest - always a conference being held and the elevators are constantly stopping on every-other floor.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Bland”
Reviews.Author: PeteSimon
Reviews.Content: This Hotel suffers from some of the most poorly designed supposedly "deluxe' rooms I've ever stayed at. The bedside lights (with bright fluorescent lamps) either shine in your eyes or else have to be angled to hit against the walls, making reading in bed an excercise of frustration. In fact the entire hotel has a slightly worn and sad feel -= an impression that is no doubt a result of the combination of age, cheap furnishings, and the preponderance of flurosecent lighting throughout. The bathrooms are mediocre and again worn, with tubs too shallow and stained to be inviting for baths, and the shower pressure pretty unimpressive. The sheer size of the hotel, replete with a pounding disco on the ground floor (in an open plan lobby) means there is almost no getting around the flashing lights and driving music at any time from around 9 pm until 4 am when returning or leaving the hotel. While the rooms themselves were quiet, overall the poor design, the dated furniture and fixtures, and the depressing flueorescent vibe is inescapable... And, finally and perhaps most strangely in this day and age, the TV in the rooms had such a small selection of channels (no doubt to push you to rent a movie) it just added to the sense of corporate cutting of corners in this Hyatt experience. Definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed & Pleased with our stay at The Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MrsTexas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 night stay at the Hyatt on Wacker, and was quite impressed! I was with a large group for a convention and we had a blast. The hotel was packed as there were other conventions there as well. Actually ours was at McCormick Place and I was so glad The Hyatt McCormick Place was sold out and we had to stay here. The Big Bar upstairs was rocking and where evreyone hung out. I called twice before my arrival making *sure* I could get a smoking room, because Hyatt is famous for having only a handful of smoking rooms. They assured me I had one reserved. I checked in through the Gold Passport line and it was quick, The other line was very long! I went up to my room and WOW!! It was huge! Somehow I got an upgraded suite, with an L shaped couch, wetbar and frig in addition to the mini-bar. The bathroom was huge, but it did not have a tub. I had plenty of room to stretch out. I did visit a couple of my friends rooms and they were very tiny, so I am not sure how I lucked out, but I was happy I did. All of the rooms I saw had beautiful views. I had room service for breakfast and it was excellent, although pricey. Maid service was a little so-so, they left hunks of hair on the bathroom floor, but other than that it was ok. Up until this stay I had avoided Hyatt having had the trouble of being told there were no "Smoking Rooms" available not once, but 3 times in Denver, San Antonio & Austin. I would definately stay here again. Great location in Chicago. Loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToohothereinTexas
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago and was there for a meeting that was going on at the hotel. The hotel is large but it was very easy to get around. I arrived in the mid-afternoon and the check in process went very smoothly. The agent who checked me in was efficient but not particularly friendly. My room was comfortable and set up well but the furnishings were a bit run down even though everything was clean. The wireless internet was a little slow but the ethernet connection was quite fast. The meeting halls were excellent and the staff was very efficient. I ended up skipping a dinner meeting and had room service instead which was quite good and the room service staff were outstanding. The airconditioning unit was a bit annoying since there was a drip pan that ran the length of the room on the ceiling under the condenser and I could hear it dripping when the airconditioning was on. The problem was easily solved by putting a towel in the drip pan. The noise from the hallway was also a bit annoying but the decorative pillow that was on the king sized bed fit perfectly along the length of the room door and reduced the noise substantially. I had meetings the next day that went till about 1:30 PM but the staff was very accomodating when I asked for a late check out. The bell staff saw me coming from the front desk and had a cab waiting for me to take me to the airport. Overall I enjoyed my brief stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago and would certainly stay there again alhough I would advise the hotel to update their airconditioning and better sound proof the room doors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: homerbucket
Reviews.Content: Three couples stayed at this hotel Labor Day weekend and was very pleased with it. Although there was a large convention at this hotel we are Gold Hyatt members and did not have to wait very long to checkin (you can sign up online for free). The rooms were ready at 11:30am and were adjacent on the 8th floor. They were very roomy and the beds comfortable. We had read about the minibar sensor and did not attempt to remove anything. The coffee maker was a one cup unit with a pre-packaged filter and was good. It would have been nice to have a frig in the room for our leftover pizza. Our AAA rate included breakfast and it was very good. There was an omelet and waffle station, plenty of fruit, and on Sunday free samples of smooties. The room, food, and staff could not have been more friendly. As for the location it was great! Easy walking to Michigan Ave, Millenium Park, even Sears Tower if you, like me, enjoy walking. And for the best pizza go to Giodano's (several locations). WOW! All of us had the best time in Chicago but it was way too short a stay. No complaints about the hotel at all. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Hyatt Regency Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ljmattox
Reviews.Content: We just finished a great weekend (Fri-Monday) at the Hyatt Regency Chicago, and enjoyed our time there. The location (on Wacker Drive, at Michagan Ave.) was perfect for us, as we split our time with visits to Navy Pier (and from there, to catch the water taxi to the Museum Campus) and up the Magnificent Mile to shop and stroll. Make no mistake, this is a *huge* hotel, and definitely designed for business travelers and conventions. It is very nice still, and decorated in a dark wood sort of "80's Moderne" style that's a little out of phase with the lighter pastels everyone uses now. Most male business travelers wouldn't notice a thing, other than they wished their office/den at home looked this good. The hotel lobby does hustle/bustle for sure, the hotel was hosting a convention on our weekend but seemed to handle all the traffic very well. Check-in at 10:15 pm on a Friday night was prompt, no issues with getting into our room, nice-sized with a comfortable California king bed, desk, leather(like?) chair / ottoman, and a adequate but nice bathroom. We ate pizza at Connie's in-house twice...once late on Friday night, and again on Sunday night when we tried to dine at Gino's East, Pizza Due, or Pizza Uno at 7pm...block-long lines! Connie's Chicago-style (deep dish) pizza was great anyhow, and they have a great selection of beer as well. We enjoyed ourselves, and the meal. I'd booked this room very early in 2006, and got a great rate as it turned out. I had chosen the hotel based primarily on this rate and the location, only later reading some of the reviews here on TripAdvisor. We had no trouble getting into / out of the hotel when we used our car; valet parking *is* expensive, but it's expensive to park cars in major cities, no surprise there. No issues with the whole "upper / lower " Wacker Drive thing either. Wouldn't have any concerns with using this hotel again, but we'll likely try another one just for the experience...there are so many good ones in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a dump compared to the Holiday Inn City Center”
Reviews.Author: kurtech
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and all I can say is it was a tremendous disappointment. Although the location is excellent (right on the river), the hotel is really showing its age and the rooms are VERY small. When we made our reservation, we knew that check-in was at 3:00 but we requested early check-in for Noon. We arrived at 2:30 and were told that our requested King-sized room was not available but that they would upgrade us to a Queen with a view for free of charge....the room was very small first of all but as soon as we put our bags down we heard water dripping. It was dripping from the airconditioning drip tray, right on to the electrical outlets. So we called the front desk and were moved to another room, just as small with the same water issue, only that once wasn't as bad. We called the front desk and at that point asked if a King Size room was available. They put us on the 34 floor which is on a Regency level. The room was ok, but not nearly as nice as the one I stayed in at the Holiday Inn City Center. The bed was very comfortable, but we were awoken at 6:00 AM by housekeeping slamming doors in the hall. Housekeeping came to clean our room on check-out day at 10:00 when checkout wasn't until Noon and we had not checked out yet. Our rate was $149 per night, but with valet parking at $41 per day and room tax it was more like $220ish. The same rate was available at the Holiday Inn and I wish we would have stayed there. I think it is a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go only for convention - not luxury”
Reviews.Author: raznboyz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago on business for my husband. I read the reviews prior to going and was on the look-out to see if the reviews were slanted. Upon arriving, I thought that with a "river view" and it being a Hyatt, it would have been more "up to date" than it was. The overall look was dated and could have been any lower class hotel. We were booked on the 34th floor - Suites. If our suite was as small and boring as it was, what must a regular room be like?!! The layout was "different" with the bed facing the entrance not the window. There was little room to put a suitcase for unpacking that you were constantly walking into. The bathroom had very little counter space and didn't appear to be cleaned very well each day. Water spots remained on the floor from day to day. The shower was okay with the extended shower curtain I had read about in a review. Only redeeming thing about the bathroom with the "industrial" toilet. Our view was of an appartment building and the street below. Nothing special - like I said - not my idea of a suite. The colors in the room were not my favorite either. However, when we turned off the lights and were in bed, the bed was by far one of the most comfortable I have had. Six generous pillows across the back was great too. If that was all you were going for, then you wouldn't mind any of the other negative things about this supposed four star hotel. How did it get that rating?? The breakfast buffet was less than fair. I left most of the food and pushed away from the table cutting my losses. The bill for that experience was $19 plus tax and tip. Staff overall was friendly. No problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Most Miserable”
Reviews.Author: Guestw/standards
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were compelled to stay here for a convention. This hotel is always full and enormously profitable consequently the management is, at best, indifferent to complaints. Where does one begin? To start with the individuals behind the front desk are always new and inexperienced. It takes them an inordinately long time to check you in, and it will take at least 30 min for your luggage to be delivered to your room from their luggage staging area. I knew their attitude to guest services (and guests in general) was a problem when I first called about our luggage (after waiting 30 min and when reached a live body ---- which took considerable effort and another 5 min) instead of apologizing the individual rudely indicated â€“prior to hanging up -- that it had only been 20 min since the luggage reached the staging area from the front desk. Since we were staying for a convention and needed a hospitality suite we had a bedroom with an adjacent suite living room â€“meeting room. This was the shabbiest suite Iâ€™ve even had the misfortune of having to use. The couch was missing two back pillows. It lacked an adequate sink and fortunately I rented a SUV because I had to go to Costco and buy a small standard bar refrigerator ($150.00) for the only fridge is the hospitality suite was a most inadequate mini-bar model. When I inquired of management they offered to â€œRentâ€� at a charge of $30.00 a day additional min-bar units. The A/C is fundamentally defective in design. In our bedroom there is no circulating air. The a/c is provided (I use that word most liberally since there is none) via chilled water circulating through a pipe located close to the ceiling behind the cove lightning and near the window. After numerous complaints when the head engineer and her assistant visited they advised me to buy fans and strategically place them so that they force air across the pipe. UNBELEIVABLE! Relative to hot water for showers (and all other guest services) this hotelâ€™s motto seems to be spare no effort to lower our operating cost and increase profits: comfort of guests be dammed! No matter when you want a shower you will have to wait for hot water. They have evidentially calculated the projected demand at all hours and make sure to never produce any more than the minimum they can get away with. During our stay I showered at 5:00AM, 6:00AM, 7:15AM, 8:00AM and 9:00AM as well as evenings before bed. ON ALL OCCASIONS I HAD TO WAIT FOR HOT WATER OR â€œENJOYâ€� A LUKE WARM OR COOLER SHOWER! Needless to say room service was always a 40 min or longer wait. But then again the eggs were not edible so why bother. If you want clean linen you need to actually call housekeeping and demand it. Finally you can forget about complaining to a live body the phone system seems to connect only with individuals â€œvoice mailâ€�. In short NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and close to it all!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a big conference July 6-9th. Check-in lady was very nice. We had booked 2 rooms and she insisted we get the rooms with the best view available. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which is open late. We had booked rooms on the Regency Club level. Rooms were decorated in modern design. Regency Club had a very good breakfast even on the weekend comprising of fruit, pastries, cereals, bagels yogurts, juices and coffee/tea. The fruits were constantly being refilled. The staff was very nice, always offering to take away our dirty dishes. One thing to note - there is a dance club in the lobby which is open for viewing to everyone. On Saturday night, 4 girls dressed in lingerie, referrred to as the "Go-Go Girls" came down and danced to the music, basically putting on a public show for everyone. Not very family-oriented at all and very loud. Housekeeping did a good job. One thing lacking in the rooms is drawer space!

Reviews.Title: “Fool Me Once”
Reviews.Author: k1787
Reviews.Content: Great location, huge hotel, paid rack rate. Parking over priced, restaurants overpriced, service was good. Our regency club room was clean, a little noisey from other guests, great vew, great king bed. You will wait for elevators and then expect to stop at every other floor. The regency club room was a bit of a joke. There were no beverages available [ non chargeable kind ], no concierge most of the time. The evening dessert trays were actually one with 4 squares remaining when I arrived, that was 1 hour before the stated closing time. We had the appetizers one evening, didn't waste our time competing for breakfast, evening dessert you already know about.This was our 1st trip to Chicago, beautful weather for the 3 days we stayed at the Hyatt. If you would like to feel good checking into a Hotel, have the clerk hand you somebody elses check-in info. Their rate was $140.00 for the same room I paid $ 260.00 for, shame on me. Will stay again, will park next door, and will be the patron paying $140.00 nightly or less. Before you buy the City Pass for $50.00, be sure you know in many cases it provides entrance and 1 of maybe 5 exhibits, you have to pay extra for the main events. Finally, Having to pay for internet at any hotel has to be something beyond a joke. The rate for daily internet is no joke. Sure wish the other August 2006 review had been available to read before our trip, talks about where to park, rates, and where to eat. Take the free Trolley to Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Kimbmd
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in 4 years I have stayed at this hotel. While it is a beautiful hotel it is nothing special. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is very nice and helpful. Overall, though nothing out of the ordinary. The fitness facility is very nice, probably the highlight of the hotel from my perspective. There were plenty of towels, headphones for use with the Lifefitness machines which all have little TV's. The machines and free weights were good as well. This is much improved (new location) over the prior fitness room here which was small and very sparse. The regular restaurant is not open for dinner (closes at 3pm) which leaves a steak house and a pizza place or room service as your choices if you don't want to venture from the hotel. As is usual for hotels the restaurant is overpriced. Breakfast service was slow on both days we were there. The breakfast buffett was $19 for everything or $14 for the continental breakfast. Off the menu, a basic breakfast of two eggs, meat, potatoes and toast was $14 with an additional $3 for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not kind to the Hyatt name”
Reviews.Author: mythrenegade
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference. I arrived early in Chicago because I had other things to do, but made a special trip into the city to check into the Hyatt. I was assigned a room, they took my credit card, they got me all setup but couldn't give me the keys because the room wasn't cleaned yet. Fine, I'll come back later. I arrive later that night to find out they gave my room away! Apparently checking in is of no actual value unless they give you the keys. Something that could have been brought to my attention WHEN I CHECKED IN! I got the distinct impression that because I was on a conference rate they weren't willing to give me a nicer room, so they stuck me in a rancid smoking room. After a night smelling nicotine and tobacco I insisted they give me a new room the next day (something they had promised) which they did. Props to them for keeping their word, this time. The rooms are nice, no question there. But nickeled and dimed to death isn't the half of it. They offer "deluxe" rooms for an extra $15 per night, and those have things that a Hyatt hotel should have as part of every room. As for my room, the fridge threatens me with a $25 fine if I put something in it. Nice. Paying $10 per night for internet seems absurd at this price point as well. At least with the Westin if you belong to their frequent traveller program it is free... but not here. I went to the "Big Bar" something they are very proud of. The service was glacially slow. I asked about premium liqours and the waitress said they had everything. I named a few bourbons that I would like, and they didn't have them. So I settled for a glass of Maker's Mark and some wings. When my bill finally came I paid over $30 for a single glass of bourbon and some chicken wings! Needless to say I was not even remotely impressed. This hotel has a nice plant, but it seems to have an identity crisis. When I stay at a cheap hotel/motel I expect them to charge me for small things. When I stay at a hotel in this price range, I don't expect to be threatened with a $25 fine for using the fridge in my room. I would not stay here again unless I attended another conference that was physically in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and rooms Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: loghomes
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the front desk staff told us we did not have a reservation. We told them we had reserved and our credit card had been charged thru hotels.com. They were unable to find a reservation and were very rude. We went to the business center to print a copy of our confirmation and were charged seven dollars to use the computer for 2 minutes. We returned to the desk and were reluctantly given our keys. The rooms were very nice with excellent views from the 24th floor. A coke from the mini bar cost $5 for a 12 oz can - ridiculous..... Internet access was $12 and parking was $36 per day. The rooms cost over $300 per night. I would not stay here and pay these prices again but for one night in the city it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ARIMASG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights in early July...Because I am a gold passport member, I was able to go to that line and check in right away...The staff at the Hyatt was verrrrry helpful...I did pay with my debit card and did not have any charges added unlike a previous posting mentioned. They warned me about the sensored mini bar right away and gave me the same rate to extend my stay another night even though the rates increased. The location is perfect...right smack in between millenium park and magnificent mile...I also like the fact that there were restaurants inside the hotel...True that it is a busy hotel, but you can't beat the price...I stayed at the Hard Rock last time I was in Chicago and I enjoyed it, but my stay at the Hyatt was even better...I know I'll be booking at the Hyatt each time I come back to Chicago...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tanteb
Reviews.Content: I generally like Hyatt hotels a lot, and there is a lot to like about this one. We had a great room, recently redone and with a comfy bed. It has all the amenities you could expect for a city hotel. My only problem was with the noise level. True to many prior complaints on this board, I can vouch for the fact that you can hear every single thing that goes on outisde your door and in the rooms next door. I am not a sensitive traveler but the noise level was incredible. Basically, I got no sleep for the 3 nights I was at this hotel. People rolled in at all hours of the night and we could hear the tv turned on next door, not to mention the ice machine which sounded like a jet engine for a good portion of the day. If you are in Chicago to party and sleep is not an issue, by all means you can't do much better for price, comfort and style at such a good location. But if you are on business or like to retire early, this is the WRONG hotel. The only other negative is that you need a cab to go practically anywhere in the city you really want to be, so that expense can add up.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved over previous visits”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Hyatt this month was a great improvement over previous visits. We found check in and service to have had the most improvement. I have visited the Hyatt for conferences in the past and always had problems with both check in/check out and service. This visit the staff was so much more knowlegable and service was friendly and efficient. This was my first positive experience with the Hyatt! The location of this hotel cannot be beat for visiting the sights of Chicago. Fantastic restaurants are well within walking distance, so there is no need to eat meals at the high priced Hyatt restaurants unless your company is footing the bill. This hotel, because it is huge, is also featured often on Priceline and Hotwire. Get a good rate through one of these outlets and you will not be dissapoined. The rooms are on the small side but they are clean and have been remodeled within the last few years. With such a great location I would not suggest spending much time in the room anyway. If you are looking for a Chicago hotel with a fantastic location and get a good rate, this hotel will fill all of your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Mid_West_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel but only paid $79.00 via Priceline. TIP: You may want to check in in the West Tower - - not at the main entrance. I did this and was very glad. I was checked in immediately and was given a room in the East tower. When I passed through the lobby in the East Tower, it was jammed. I received a nice room on the 24th floor with a great view of the river and the Hancock Tower. Contemporary decor with a color palate that seems to pay homage to Frank Lloyd Wright - - olive green, golds, earthtone reds, tan, - - prarie style colors. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was easy to hear noise in the next room and in the hall. The bathroom was very clean but showed a little wear and some rust on the light fixture over the vanity. The A/C was ok on a mild day but the fan hardly blows so I would warn that if it's hot outside, it might be unacceptable. This hotel is very big and very busy but I had no problems with service. Great location. I would not pay rack rate for this hotel and in fact, I would not choose this hotel. For a very cheap priceline rate, it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled, Dimed, and Quartered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I travel for a conference, I usually stay at the conference hotel, which in this case was the Hyatt Regency in Chicago. This was probably my worst hotel experience in my 20 years (and approximately 100 hotels) of attending conferences. Why do hotels insist on providing rock-hard matresses? I wish the Hyatt (and others) would learn that people want a comfortable bed - the Hyatt provided a slab of concrete! While the room was nicely cleaned by housekeeping, I was always being shorted on toiletries: one day no soap, the next day no shampoo, the next no shower cap, and so on. The food at their restaurants was overpriced, even by Chicago standards, and was not of good quality. Internet access was $11.34 per 24-hour period, which is just ridiculous given that hotels that charge $60-$80 per night (e.g. Drury Inn, Holiday Inn Express) have no problems providing free Internet access. The biggest annoyance was encountered at 4 am on Wednesday, when I was awakened by the telephone ringing. It stopped ringing just as I collected my wits and picked up the receiver. I laid back down in bed, and two minutes later it rang again: when answered, the hotel employee on the other end cheerfully told me that this was my wake up call. I told him that I had not requested a wake up call. He very casually said "sorry sir" and hung up. How can something as simple as a wake up call be so screwed up? It's definitely not a place that I would want to stay at again the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the bellhop service”
Reviews.Author: Mike_N_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the hotel is big, and staff is definitely overwhelmed. First, the rooms are decently appointed, comfortable and spacious enough, although serverely lacking in storage space for clothes, and we don't even travel with much. At 11pm on a Friday evening we gave our two bags to the bellhop right out of the car, checked in and went up to the room. At 12am we called the front desk to check on our bags, and were told they were on the bellhop's cart somewhere in the hotel and should be at our room within 20 minutes. We called again at 1am, and were told there is only one bellhop delivering bags so he is very busy but he is on the way. We called again at 2am, same story. We went down to the lobby to talk to the front desk at 2:30am, same story, "go to your room and wait". At 3:30am we started to worry our bags had been stolen, so we called and were told the manager would look into it. We called again at 4:30am, same story. We went back down to the lobby at 5:00am, ready to file a police report. The bags were finally delivered to the room at 5:30am, with no apology from the bellhop, the front desk or the manager. We didn't dare ask anything of "the staff" after that. The rest of the stay was fine save for a constant flow of noisy partiers. The Hyatt is best used for people in town for a party in one of their two dozen banquet rooms, but not great for families or business travelers seeking some peace and quiet and a helpful staff. The hotel is just too big and understaffed. They definitely didn't seem to care if there's a problem with an individual guest, as they seem fully occupied in dealing with the problems and demands of large groups renting the banquet rooms. We would stay here again if we could get a deal on Priceline or Hotwire for $100 a night or less, but anything more than that is not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got this room using Priceline ($70 bid) and it was a great find. Staff was very nice, had a great view of the river and up Michigan Ave. Room was nice, king bed and clean. Didn't eat at any of the hotel bars/resturants becuase everything downtown is within walking distance. Hotel was easy to find, it's the one on Wacker with the big "Hyatt" sign out front...so no problems there. There was a wedding both days I stayed but never had any problems with noise, etc. Great stay for 70 bucks! One other thing, EVERY hotel charges an estimated amount to your debit card if you use it for room charges and incidentals, not just the Hyatt. They actually warn you about this when you sign your card at check-in, so it shouldn't be a huge shock or anything. Even with credit cards they still pre-authorize a set amount, they just hold off running it until the charges are complete. So don't use a card tied directly to your checking account if the fees are only estimated.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding the building. The staff was courteous and helpful at check in. Our room nicely decorated but not clean. Previous guest contact lens on bathroom floor. New and used toothpicks on carpet and a dropped pill from previous guest found on carpet. Crusty residue on decorative roll pillow on the bed....for the price NOT clean. Great location but don't know if I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 undecided (Do Not Use A Debit Card!!)”
Reviews.Author: VivaVegas
Reviews.Content: I took my Mom for her 50th birthday to the city for three days/two nights and thought the Hyatt would be perfect. Check in was a breeze, our room was beautiful and the elevators were keeping up with the 100's of people there. Staff was helpful in the beganing. But after the first 24hrs it all fell apart...the bed sheets had a damp feel to them (like when we go camping), there was a "party" in the hall and I did not fall asleep until around 2am. I woke up tired and very mad...I called the front desk and complained about the noise and she snapped at me and wanted to know why I did not call security?! Now to me security would be for something very serious like an attempt to break in to the room or a fight. So I called the customer comment line and I think I got the same gal and the same crap from her again...she added "Well what do you want us to do since it was last night?" A very long story short...they knock off $50 for our stay. I check out and they asked if I would like to use the debit card on file? I told them yes, due to I put most of my spending cash in my debit account. Well the day after I got home my debit account had been charged $459!!! My check out bill was $235. I spent the whole morning on the phone with my bank and the Hyatt's accounting dept, customer service dept, and manager. When you use a debit card they charge you the estimated amount for the nights you stay and they a % more added to that for room service, damage, etc. But!!! This is a holding amount that their bank issues out to your bank and then when it clears they drop it off and charge you the correct amount!! What a mess...do not use a debit to pay for a hotel!! They are making this up by giving me a free night and a discounted night for this weekend...my husband and sons are going to the city for our family trip. I am hoping this is a much better stay. Positive thinking will help. I will review again when our trip is over...stay tuned. One more thing, Networks and Stetson's Chop House are top notch!!

Reviews.Title: “High on the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Hyatt with my husband, our son and my in-laws. Our rooms were ready on time and exactly as requested - one room with two doubles adjoining another room with a king. The rooms were spacious and quiet - they looked exactly like the photos on their website. The bathroom was nice and the toiletries were great. I was initially concerned about the size of the hotel, but we never had much of a wait for service (check-in, check-out, taxi, etc.) We odered room service once and the food arrived within 15 minutes! We did not eat at the restaurants, but we did grab a quick breakfast at the kiosk downstairs and had snacks one afternoon in the bar area. Food prices are a little on the high side, but comparable to other hotels. Location is great - one night we we walked over to the Wrigley Building and caught a boat tour of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. We also enjoyed shopping and restaurants that were within walking distance. We look forward to staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Rico3201
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here (checked in June 23.) I am here for a business convention. I have read recent reviews online at thie site and was prepared for some negatives. This hotel is huge, as described. I think two different conventions may be going on at the same time. There have been "events" in the first floor meeting areas each night so far. That said, it's not impossible to find your way around and you just need to plan the time to get there. There are helpful LCD screens that describe meeting events and where they are located, including arrows for which way to turn. My room is fantastic. I am a Hyatt Gold Passport club member (which took nothing to sign up for) and they offered a room upgrade at checkin. I am on a "Regency Club Floor" (the top 3 floors) and the rooms have been recently renovated. Innovative king sized bed located in the middle of the room (facing the TV.) The back of the headboard is a spacious desk for working. Right behind the desk is the window where I have a nice view of the river and the Wrigley Building. The room is usually a $50 upgrade but it was offered at $15. I wonder if that is because they are so booked up. One other thing that has impressed me is that every employee... EVERY employee... has spoken to me as I come into contact with them. Naturally the desk employees, but also the maid service, maintenence men, etc. as I pass them in the halls or ride the elevator. It must be company policy but I really like it. It comes across as very sincere and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A priceline deal”
Reviews.Author: Sun_Goddess003
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the day before we left. We came to Chicago on June 15, 2006 to see the Madonna concert at the United Center (it was AWESOME, she really does put on a great show). The hotel was not hard to find, however I would reccomend that if you are headed to chicago you want to arrive in the middle of the day. We arrived at 4 pm and sat for 3 hours on the Dan Ryan. It was very annoying. But it all worked out in the end. Upon arrival to the hotel they did not have a room for us because they were overbooked. They gave us a "busniess room" with a hard couch and a rollaway bed (there was two of us, so someone had to sleep on the couch). They gave us a $50.00 voucher for room service as a compensation, which was nice, but still a little annoying. The view was awesome (room 1976). The hotel just seemed a little worn down and old, it could use an update, but the service was OUTSTANDING. Everyone was very nice and went out of thier way to make sure we were taken care of. Maybe the other rooms were nice, but I never saw them so I can not comment on them. At check out they have electronic machines (think the self check in at the airport). Because we had the room service voucher we needed to check out with a human. This was handled smoothly and well taken care of. The room service was fabulous!!!! We ordered pizzas after the concert from room service. They were very good. We went out on the town and we to a bar called Cans and Four. Good times if you can get to them. We got home about 6 am, and ordered breakfast from room service. I ordered the Belgain Waffle.... AWESOME!!!!! So that is a good thing. We stayed in room 1976, there are some pics from the window of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MerritMalloy
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and this hotel ranks very low on my list. The room had such a strong odor of smoke, it gave me a headache (and I used to be a smoker)! The room service was mediocre and extremely expensive. The hotel is disturbingly huge. Very difficult to navigate your way around it. I waited on hold for twenty minutes to ask a concierge where a pharmacy was located. She curtly gave me cross-street names and hung up. Uhhhhh, how do I know which direction to go in??? Stains on the carpet in the room. A big gauge in the wall, where maybe a thermostat once was??? The shower is decent. All in all, for the price they charge, NO THANKS!!! I'm just glad my company is footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but ok service; bad food”
Reviews.Author: travels_well
Reviews.Content: I just completed a two night weekend stay at the Hyatt. Location is awesome. I was in what appears to be a newly remodelled King room in the East tower. The bed was very comfortable. No robes in the room, but called down for some. The toilet was leaking a little. I called guest services and was told someone came, but the problem was not fixed. WE had really noisy neighbors that woke us up three times, but the manager gave us a late checkout and was very apologetic. We ate at Connie's--so overrated. Their pizza is ok (but at $23 for a 14" one topping, I expected much better; Gino's East is a much better option). Also, the $13 sandwiches were comparable to Friday's or Chili's quality. Despite being empty, the service was aweful--slow, had to constantly ask for drink refills, and they mixed up our orders. I would not eat at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Would only consider staying if you get a great rate”
Reviews.Author: sauceontheside
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Hotwire the morning of our arrival for 107. It was not there the night before so they must do it last minute. We also paid the 15 extra for a view, but it was of the Chicago River and not the lake. We also chose to stay in the West Tower because we wanted a quiet room. Problem is, it's so far from the other amenities in the other tower. The bell guy never said thank you for the 6 dollar tip, which made me mad. Also, if you're driving, get directions right to the parking garage because you'll be stuck in a cluster at the other tower with taxis. Pull right into the garage, which is in the West Tower, and they will call you a bellman from there, if you need one. Parking was 39 per day, but cheaper parking two blocks down on Stetson, we were told, but decided to secure our car there since we were moving cross country and had lots of important stuff in there. The room was adequate. The bathroom was old fashioned and the tub drained slowly. The temperature in the room was uncomfortable as it was sooo moist in there, like, old heating and air conditioning system. I hand washed a pair of undies and they stayed wet for two entire days. I also thought the location was just okay. If we ever go back, we will use our military rate of 149 given at numerous hotels and pay the extra and stay where we want next time. I would not stay at the Hyatt again. I wanted to use the Internet and it was 7 bucks for 15 minutes. We actually like Marriott courtyards and Hilton Garden Inns better. Who cares if a hotel has a bar and a full service restaurant -- we don't! Go eat pizza at Giordanos closeby. It was really good. City is great and I would go visit the city again. Great military discounts everywhere, just ask. We got in the Sears Tower for free and an architectural tour for free on Shoreline. I didn't, but my hubby did, active duty. Big savings for two things! We only did those two things that cost money, but I'm sure there's more. We were very impressed by the fact that they have appreciation for the military. Thanks, Chicago! You're a great city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stevendale
Reviews.Content: Nice self contained hotel, convenient walking to everything in Chicago. If you don't have much luggage you can take the train from the airports and walk a few blocks. Hotel has underground access to several other neighboring buildings and stores and restaurants. Ate at all three hotel restaurants, all very good, but exspensive. Stayed two different nights in the same week. Rooms are small but are tastefully decorated in the latest Hyatt simple modern decoration. Rooms were inconsistent, one had a bathrobe but no comfy leather chair, the other had comfy chair but no bathrobe. Avoid the snack fridge unless you are starving. If you move an item in the fridge it automatically gets charged to your account and is hard to clear up at front desk. I was impressed with the ability to print boarding passes for free at the Consierge desk. Lobby was extremely smoky at nights. Even though the building is showing it's age it is kept up very well and has everything you need, at a price though.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly but great for couples.”
Reviews.Author: speechie604
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Thursday-Sunday with my husband and two boys ages 12 & 13. We got a Priceline rate of about $100 but decided to spend a little extra to get a better view. For $15.00 more per day we were give a room on the 33rd floor facing out to the lake. What a beautiful view of the city! The room was small but adequate since we were gone all day long and were only in the room to sleep. Decor was nice but not fantastic. Prices for items in the minibar were excessive as were the prices at an in-house restaurant, Connie's. Two burgers and two beers was over $40.00. There was what looked like a high-school prom going on Friday night in addition to the lobby club, so drunken folks using lots of profanity and sexual references everywhere. The boys were cussed at by a couple who wanted to use their seats to make out, and we rode the elevators with several people who couldn't stay on their feet. We didn't have much contact with staff as we left the hotel by 8:00am and didn't get back until 9:00pm or later, but those we did encounter were very pleasant and helpful. I was especially impressed by the housekeeping staff who loaded us up with extra everything when I left a note (and tip) for some extra towels and coffee. I would recommend this hotel to individuals or couples but would look for another place if I were to take the boys back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but extra cost and cost”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before so I knew what to expect. Good rooms that are very comfortable and greatly appreciate the desk setup. Each room also has a Oreck air cleaner which I have never seen in any hotel I have stayed at. This night I stayed one night 05/23/06 for a rate of $169.00. I commented upon checkin that last time I stayed at the hotel I was given a roll away bed in a room that I think is designed for parties, etc. So she gave me a very nice corner room #1585. Here is the downside - its expensive: Valet parking $39.00 / day! Wow. Internet $11.34/day Good hotel in an excellent location but beware of the extra costs that can easily add up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: As a hotel, it's very nice, with very nice amenitiies, but it's also expensive. Canned soft drink in the mini-bar cost $4.25, and Internet use in the business center was something like $10 for 7 minutes (or was that $7 for 10 minutes?). Location is good. If price is no object, it's a good choice, but there are better bargains in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but only at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I normally donâ€™t seek out large hotels, like the Hyatt Regency Chicago, that are frequented by conventions and other large groups. However, the deal I got on this hotel for three nights in May, using an Entertainment Card, was approximately $80 to $100 cheaper than if I had stayed at a comparable hotel. So, if I had been paying full price, I probably would have gone to a smaller place, but at the price I paid I was perfectly happy at the Hyatt and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is large, but not anywhere near as large as the hotels in Vegas, where it can take 15 minutes to get from your room to the main entrance. Rooms are very modern and comfortable; service is adequate. I didnâ€™t eat at the hotel, so I donâ€™t know what the restaurants are like. The fitness center is quite large and is better than most places I have stayed. Best of all, is the location â€“ just a block from North Michigan Avenue with easy access to the Loop, Millenium Park and the Art Institute and the great shopping and restaurants of the Magnificent Mile and surrounding areas. So, again, if you are paying full price, you probably could do better, but if you get a deal via Entertainment Card, AAA rates, Hotwire or Priceline, this is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but not for light sleepers....”
Reviews.Author: aliasrlm
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this site before my stay at the Hyatt this past weekend - and I wished I would've given more heed to some of the negative ones. First things first - our room (booked on Hotwire for $85/night) was clean, roomy, comfortable and nicely decorated. I loved how the Hyatt manages to make a normal-sized shower seem so much larger by just having an arched shower curtain rod. The effect (my arms NOT brushing against a shower curtain while washing) was definitely appreciated. The location, as others have mentioned, is great - right off Wacker and near Michigan. It's a central location...close to Loop area attractions as well as shopping on Magnificent Mile. I have to say this, though. This hotel is HUGE. If you don't like riding in a packed elevator or feeling like you're staying in a city within a city, this place is not for you. Tons of people everywhere. Lots of groups - we were unlucky enough to stay in the room next to a large group of young men who were very, very loud. And I'm in my 20s; not a finicky old woman. We had a hard time sleeping our first night because of all the commotion these guys caused - at 3:30 am, nonetheless. Someone else on our floor must've called security, because a hotel employee thankfully paid a visit to our obnoxious neighbors.
