The following night, they were quiet and we were able to sleep peacefully. Luckily, we didn't spend any time in any of the hotel's common areas or restaurants, as Chicago itself offers so many better options. Keep in mind that this is one of the biggest hotels in the city - it is NOT a boutique hotel with extremely personal service. We waited about 30 minutes for the valet to bring our car around - but then again, it was Mother's Day and the hotel was packed with brunch attendees. The valet mentioned that the hotel had 3,000 cars they were trying to manage, so that might give you an idea of the scale of this place. The hotel staff were very pleasant and efficient, which was also nice. The valets were also energetic and full of smiles. So I would recommend this hotel if you can get a room on the cheap, meaning less than $90/night for a weekend night in the city. I would've felt a little cheated if I had paid more than $90/night, honestly, and I've traveled around the world (staying at some very nice and not-so-nice hotels). I prefer smaller hotels, personally, but the price was right. If you end up staying here...make sure to ask for a room away from the elevator bank - you can hear a LOT of noise in these rooms. Every time a toilet flushed upstairs, we heard it, so I imagine you'd definitely hear those six (or eight - I can't remember) elevators shuttling about all night. All in all, not the best place I've stayed in Chicago, but it was a good deal for the price. Again, the room was very nice and comfortable - I had no problem with the room itself, just the amount of noise we heard at night. I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveling_esquire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a night at the Hyatt Regency Chicago. This Hyatt is right on the Chicago River on Wacker Drive. The room was nicely decorated and very clean; the virtual tour on the hotel's website is an accurate depiction of the room. The bed was comfortable; not too hard, not too soft. Good feather pillows. Bathroom was a little sparse but nicely decorated just like the room and comfortably sized. Tub/shower combo with bowed out curtain rod, single sink. An upgrade to a "deluxe room" was available for an additional cost, the description of which included a larger bathroom, bathrobes and other amenities, but since we were only in town for a single evening, we decided not to do it. I was comforted to see that after 2:00pm the elevators that access the rooms were only accessible with a room key. The fitness center of the hotel was very good; room-key access only, Lifecycle equipment, plasma screen TVs on the wall and headphones that connected to the individual machines so you could hear the TV. Free weighs and nautilus weight circuit was also available. Networks restaurant was average in quality and what I have come to expect for hotel restaurant prices (e.g., $10.00 for a hamburger at lunch). Big, a bar in the hotel, was good. Service at Big was friendly and fast. Service at Networks was unobtrusive and served its purpose. The location of this hotel is great for shopping on the Magnificent Mile (a mere two blocks from the hotel's front door), visiting Navy Pier and the museums. I would certainly return to this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a great location for sight seeing and shopping. The hotel room was nice and clean, with lots of room. The best bed I have ever slept on. It had a tempur-pedic mattress. The bathroom was very nice and big. The only negative thing I could think of was the inadequate drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “For the price -- we loved it”
Reviews.Author: djckmc66
Reviews.Content: I got this room on Hotwire for $59 per night. We arrived on March 16 and departed March 19, 2006. To be honest - the first room we had - sucked - however i was told it would be "smaller" - smaller was an understatement. They changed our room the next day- they were almost annoying -- calling to check out status. That was appreciated - even if we got 'terbed. We have stayed at this hotel before -- we did not drink in the hotel, eat in the hotel -- this trip we bought the "visitor's pass" and ran the streets. Best trip and most fun we've had! Can't beat it!! Get the pass. if you ever have a Q email djckmc66_91@insughtbb.com Enjoy have fun and get the visitors pass; an amazing discovery.

Reviews.Title: “Functional business hotel”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a week as part of a conference that occurred in mid-March 2006. I had no problems with it except that I agree with the earlier review that there was inadequate drawer space. The only drawers in my large room were in the desk--it was kind of strange. You need your room key to access the elevators after 10pm so don't forget it if you're arriving to the hotel late at night!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely average, but Priceline saves the day”
Reviews.Author: glazen
Reviews.Content: This is your perfectly normal business-person's convention hotel with absolutely nothing beyond average going on. The rooms are exactly what you'd expect in any Hilton, Sheraton or other Hyatt. If this was a $79/night place in Rochester, it would feel like a fair but not exceptional value. HOWEVER---there is one outstanding reason to choose this hotel! If you need to be in that area of Chicago, you can get their rooms for $50/night on Priceline. I'm not kidding, it works every single time for me. Just select the highest number of stars, Millineum Park, $50, and you will almost always get it. That tip aside, the hotel offers a busy bar, busy reception area, terrible restaurants, a perfunctory fake-Starbucks coffee shop and not much more. Definitely not a place to stay if you expect anything beyond average.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. A few blocks away from the Magnificent Mile/Michigan Avenue. Lobby: Too dark, even in the middle of the day. You need to take the escalator to get to the registration desk. Room: I think it's a mixed blessing that the first thing I noticed was an air purification unit. I don't smoke, so I noticed the smoke odor in my "non-smoking" room immediately. Maybe smokers, former smokers, and people who live or work with smokers won't smell it, but it was very noticeable. It definitely smelled like a place that recently disallowed smoking. For my nose, the air purification unit wasn't working hard enough. Otherwise, the room was about average for a Hyatt. There were not enough drawers in my room to put my clothes away. The television unit that usually doubles as one only had about 3 drawers -- big enough for a yellow pages book. Bathroom was clean. Housekeeping was very good at refilling the little soaps (but I also tip them, so that may have been a factor at getting twice as much as I normally get...). Shower gets cooler during the peak time usage between 6:30am to 8:00am. Walls: Not paper thin. I think I heard someone yell next door, but it was muffled. I slept well. TV: I forget this is a sports-oriented city. I think there were more 24-hour sports channels than there were 24-hour news channels. No premium channels (that I can recall). Gym: Very nice, with new equipment. Gets very hot and stuffy. I didn't get much air during the morning, so I had to curtail the use of the treadmill. Nightclub: I agree with another reviewer: What was up with that?!? I had heard from other conference attendees that they heard the pounding of the music all through the night. I was on the 17th floor, so I can only pity anyone who was down near the floor. If you stay in this hotel, request a high floor if you need to sleep. Room service: Very prompt. I always order room service when I travel for business. I even ordered at the usual dinner time, and I got served within their 30-35 minute time frame. Elevators: I don't know if it's because the conference wasn't that big, but the elevators were prompt and they were never too full during the busy times when I needed to use them. Stamps: Not something I usually review, but I needed to mail a postcard. The cashier kept telling me to use the stamp machine that was in the building, but the stamp machine only had bulk stamps available.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience especially for couples”
Reviews.Author: Dudeks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt last weekend and had a good experience especially for the price. We've stayed their before via Priceline, as with this trip, and it was a good way to stay at a nice hotel at a great price. Last time the lobby was under construction, which made the experience less enjoyable, but now that it's finished, it was really nice. The rooms look to be recently renovated and had great pillows and plenty of them. If your traveling with a family, we have 2 small children, the hotel does not have a pool and the hotel caters more to business tracelers and couples. There is good nightlife at the big bar and dance club on site. I'd skip the breakfast there, since it's pricey. I recommend West Egg Cafe, for a great experience on Columbus and Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: lakecity211
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. Some of the other reviews I have read are ignorant. The lobby is too large to smell of anything so I donâ€™t know where people are getting that from except maybe they didnâ€™t have a good time in Chicago and are blaming the hotel. Many reviewers fault the hotel because they hold conventions. I donâ€™t see why that matters because the hotel goes above and beyond to give excellent service. You donâ€™t expect to stay at a hotel and be the only guest they have. Every time I called from my room for something they answered the phone by greeting me by my name. The staff seemed to genuinely care about assisting guests. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and more then willing to assist. The only reason I would not rate this stay as an excellent 5 is because I am very particular about where I stay and there were just a few very small details that prevents me from saying this stay was a perfect 5 visit. We got a room with two double beds. The beds were very comfortable with high-end sheets, pillows, and comforters. In addition, the sheets were very clean with absolutely no hairs on it (which I do pay very close attention to.) However, they were a little bit small for two average size people. If two people are going to share a bed I would recommend getting a room with a king size bed. It was about 40 degrees outside during our stay. Although the temperature inside the room was very comfortable it was a little too warm to sleep in the beds because there was no air circulating even though we adjusted the thermostat. In addition, the room was slightly dusty. (It had about a few days worth of dust accumulated on the furniture.) Also, the base of the toilet around the floor was also slightly dusty and I found a bottle cap on the floor between the bed and the desk. I am extremely picky and I notice things like that. However, the room was very nicely decorated in contemporary design and big enough to store our stuff and move around. The bathroom was beautiful with granite looking counter tops and floors. The shower/bathroom was spacious enough where you wonâ€™t feel boxed in when bathing. The shower had different speeds with excellent pressure. In addition, the hotel provided high-end toiletries, towels and a bathrobe. The room also was very quiet making it very relaxing. I would definitely stay here a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: Frankie28
Reviews.Content: As a person who has stayed in many other Hyatt hotels, I was not at all impressed by this Hyatt. We booked on Hotwire at a rate of $75 per night. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a horrible smell in the reception area (which could also use an updating). Check-in was smooth, and we chose to upgrade to a deluxe room for an extra $15 (mainly for the pillow-top mattress). The room was small, with a tiny bathroom with absolutely NO counter space. Although the room looked like it may have been updated sometime in the past 5 years, I was not impressed with the dark, dreary decorating. The hotel's fitness center was pretty impressive--all newer equipment, with 8 treadmills, 5 ellipticals, free weights, and standing weight machines. I would rate this hotel a 3 star versus the 4 star rating Hotwire gave it. Not horrible, but definitely not luxury by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallets and hold your nose!”
Reviews.Author: ksummerlee
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and stayed here with some girlfriends for a bachelorette weekend. Got an incredibly cheap rate on hotwire but it ended up costing me a lot more in money, time and hassle. We encountered many issues through the 48 hours we were there. The most major issue was that I was pick-pocketed while sitting in one of the restaurants enjoying drinks with my friends. These people were obviously professional theives at work so hang on to your belongings at all time. Jeff from hotel security was very helpful, and management did comp one of our rooms for both nights plus our valet parking. Obviously this isn't the fault of the hotel. But, just be forewarned that because this is such a huge convention hotel, it's a target for those looking for an easy take. Our room was nice and we were happy with it until cigarette smoke started rolling in through our vents. Since we were on a non-smoking floor, it was pretty irritating. When we called to inquire about where the smoke could be coming from, the woman suggested that it was coming from outside and offered to "spray" our room. We were 14 floors up and it was obvious that it was coming from one of the other rooms on our floor. But that wasn't the worst of the smells. Because the lobby does indeed become some kind of nightclub in the evenings on the weekends, which might be one of the strangest things I've ever seen, it REEKS like stale beer and cigarettes. I don't even know how people could eat, the stench is so bad. The front desk acted like it was a single incident, but it smelled like that the entire time we were there so I'm pretty sure it's not an isolated thing. Therefore, next time I get a hotel room in Chicago for any visiting friends and family, it won't be here even if the price is only $61 a night. It will be worth the extra $50-$60 to keep my belongings safe and smelling good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Firm Bed”
Reviews.Author: Commish123
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt us one block off off the Michigan Ave. Easy walking to shopping. Very nice decoration, good staff that was very helpful to get Bulls tickets and Wicked Tickets. These guys no how to make the most of your stay... Don't Forget the Billy Goat Tavern on Lower Wacker. Cheeseboorger, cheeseboorger Chip No Pepsi just Coke...just accross the river accross the street and below....

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Hyatt Regency for three nights. I had booked my stay on Hotwire, and was able to book at $48.00 per night. The hotel is large, and is connected to a shopping mall. The hotel is located in an excellent spot for sightseeing and shopping. At check-in the staff could not have been nicer, even though I am sure they were aware that I had booked on Hotwire. The female receptionist was pleasant and most informative as to what the hotel had to offer, and gave me a warm welcome. The room was clean and nicely appointed. The only part of the room that seemed a bit cheap was the lounge chair, it looked like it had been purchased at a flea market or a second hand store.I am sure the Hyatt could do better. The bed was fanctastic. The bath room was immaculant and had all the amenities that one would need. I did not eat at the Hyatt, as I found the prices too high for my budget. I had asked for a late check-out, they were accomodating for an extra hour at no charge but then the price jumped, too expensive for a few extra hours. The hotel is excellently maintained. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Plata
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel!!! Best hotel in Chicago! Great location, the room is very clean and the service is wonderful! Eeling at the front desk is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Christmas night in this hotel with my brother in law and his wife. After making plans to have a nice room with the view of the city, we found the view nice. However, after checking in and paying extra for a deluxe room, we got into our rooms and found that it was far from a deluxe room. We were told our beds were pillow tops and robes in each room (this we didnt' necessarily care). After contacting the staff, we were promised to have our extra cost deducted at checkout! Our beds were far from pillow top! It was a matteress that forms your body, so when you roll at night, you were rolling uphill out of the hole that your body formed. Then after a horrible nights sleep, we found the maid service knocking on our door asking when we were leaving. This was at 8:30am! We thought check out was 11am! Not once did this person knock, but three times afterwards! They did this to our family that was staying as well! So to say the least, the only nice thing about the hotel, was the view of the city! We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during busy MLK weekend-- got an incredible deal (about 50% off advance purchase rate) on hotwire that ended up being about $60 with tax per night for 3 nights. Lobby is overcrowded and gives wrong first impression but this is a super large conference style hotel. Rooms are rather small but nicely equipped. May be a stretch at 4 stars but 3.5 stars is very appropriate. Fitness room is great, room service prompt, elevators frequent even with a huge convention, and checkout a breeze. Reccomend a room in the west tower as it can be quieter and they have their own check in desk you can use for a speedy checkout. Accessible via the T line at the Lake/Clarke stations (blue line for O'Hare, Orange for Midway) about a 5-7 block walk or a few dollars cab ride. All in all, great trip and positive expereince at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hyatt. We had a wonderful view of Chicago from the Hotel. We were staying in the East Block which in my mind is far handier than the West. As with all hotels, beware of eating around the hotel. It can be really expensive. I had a hotdog, two glasses of wine my fiance had a coke. We got a bill for over $50. I thought the service was impeccable. Very friendly and courteous staff throughout. I also enjoyed the Big Bar and Harddrive. This hotel is more suited to a younger generation in my opinion. The hotel lobby turns into a night club in the evening with a very nice bar upstairs overlooking the dance area. The music is techno so and there are plenty of neon lights and strobes more. While in the room, I heard nothing. It was peaceful bliss. We got a queen bed which was very comfortable. I thought the whole place was very tastefully decorated. I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “more than happy stay at the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: ReginaFillangie
Reviews.Content: 2 nights/3 days spent in Chicago on business, staying at the Hyatt Regency. The service throughout my stay was impeccable. The check in desk was very busy when we arrived (the hotel does seem to cater to large conferences) so the conceirge desk checked us in. The rooms are spacious, climate controlled, comfortable, and VERY quiet when you consider how busy the hotel was. I didn't dine in the hotel apart from breakfast (average) but both bars on the 1st and 2nd levels were fine - the Big Bar in particular was very busy/buzzy with spectacular views and a great atmosphere. I don't think this is a quiet-getaway kind of place but then why would you be going to a busy City if that's what you wanted. Also, the location is fabulous, steps from the Magnificent Mile. Thank you Hyatt Regency for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not have high expectations for the Hyatt since I had read mixed reviews... However, I was disappointed. The room was small, but I did not consider it cramped. The room was clean and the service was friendly. However, the people who worked at the hotel, while nice and willing to help, were not knowledgable. For example, I asked about the fireworks on Saturday night and requested a room with a view of the show. I paid extra for a room with a city view and the room did have a great view. The first person I spoke with did not guarantee that I would be able to see the show. The second person I spoke with assured me that I would not be able to see the show. At 6:30 pm, I heard the fireworks and decided to look out the window on the off-chance that I would be able to see something. It turned out that the fireworks were directly below my window. I had a terrific view. However, the staff had no idea. More importantly, the guests across the hall spent most of the night yelling and swearing and being generally obnoxious. I called the concierge at 1:00 am to report the noise and I was assured that someone would come up to deal with the problem. I watched to see if anyone came for half an hour (the noise continued), but no one showed up. The noise continued through the night. The people next door left around 6:30 am and although they were not the least bit noisy, their departure woke me up yet again since the walls are so thin. While the service was passable, the overall experience was unpleasant and I will never stay at the Hyatt Regency Chicago again. More importantly, if you do stay at the Hyatt, I recommend you use Priceline or the equivalent. I would have been even more upset if I had paid full price for what is not a four star hotel, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: michalmm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay MLK weekend. The hotel was sold out, but we booked in November on hotwire. Paid $55 a night, and was offered the $15 a nigh upgrade (which on seeing what it included on this site we should have taken!) The staff was also very helpful in checking us in for plane reservations. The hotel was about 4 blocks away from two T-stops, and was really convienent for all of the shopping that we did. The hotel was packed with conventions, but the staff was very sueful when they assisted in loading the evelators (before that it was a maddning free for all). The hot water took awhile coming on, and the pressure wasn't that great. The Big Bar is fantastic. The drinks were big, and so was the pricetag. But I don't think it was outrageously priced for a hotel and was probably in line with upper end bars even here in Buffalo, NY. They had the football games on a couple of big screens too which was nice. Overall, I would definitly stay here again. Especially since the indoor smoking restrictions went into place MOnday January 16th.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: txlandsource
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Chicago for a weekend away and we stayed at the Hyatt Chicago on the Riverwalk. We got a great deal on Hotwire. I was alittle wary on the reviews I had read, but didn't want to pass on the price. Here are my specifics: Location: Downtown on the Chicago River, one block from Michigan Ave. We walked to all our sights and shopping. Couldn't have asked for a better location. Great views from the upper floors. Hotel: The hotel is very spread out, there are two towers. Very busy with conventions and lots of visitors. The atrium was loud but very nice. There were lots of things to do in the hotel, many top-rated restaurants, and you must go to the BIG bar. The drinks are pricey but you'll see why they call it the BIG bar. We had one margarita, expect to pay $20 for house and even more for top-shelf. It was fun though and we got to watch the playoffs on their big screen. Rooms: I was very disappointed in this category. The room itself was very nicely appointed, but one of the smallest rooms I've every stayed in. We had a queen room on the 14th floor. Nice view, but cramped. Luckily we didn't stay much in the room. When you can see the bed from the bathroom, that's small. There was also no hot water pressure and water seemed to be brown. But after I ran it awhile it cleared up. Other: We didn't eat at the hotel, but there were many restarants to choose from. I would recommend Houlihan's down the street for breakfast, $9.99 buffet. We also ate at Pizzerio Uno on Wabash, arrive early or call ahead, the wait on the weekends can be long. Worth the wait though, the pizza was awesome. Checkout the Sears Tower Skydeck for a unforgettable view of Chicago skyline and nearby states. Again, can be a long wait on the weekends, we waited about an hour. Hope to return to Chicago soon, but I would probably not stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Love hyatt”
Reviews.Author: chinawut
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hyatt Regency Chicago for 2 days during the new year break. I got the deal from Priceline which is very cheap! Everything in Hyatt Chicago is great. It's located in downtown area with everything accessible. The room is large and clean. I love to stay at Hyatt Chicago again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency was great! The Big Bar in the lobby is great! Houlihans breakfast next door is awesome! It's a great place to stay for St Patrick's day. It is right by the river at the location that they dye it green! It is great! The rooms are very modern. Our experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected with a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights towards the end of November and had booked a room on their Club Floor because of the great rate I received and for all the extra's you receive. I had read many reviews and was a little hesistant but thought I would give it a try. The location is great, but it def. is a convention hotel. Nothing really impressed me with the upgraded room that you are supposed to have for staying on the Club Floor. The bathrooms need updating, the towels were worse than one's I've had at the Best Western! I've stayed at other hotels in Chicago (the Fairmont and the Hilton) and would not likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency from Dec 20-24. We had a very good priceline-deal and when asking for a room with a city view, they offered a upgrade for $15 to a large king room with a wonderful view. The room was in the west tower on 21st floor right at the end of the hallway - it was absolutely quiet. No problems with hot water or the towels - the bathroom was large and modern. This hotel is all about location - Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, The Loop and millenium parc - everything is in short walking distance. If you don't want to spend too much money on your breakfast go to Houlihan's next door, they have a breakfast buffet every day for $10 aye or go to the Corner Bakery-turn left on Wacker Dr. cross Mich. Ave and it is right there on the corner. When we checked out the lobby was packed with people - a large convention started that day, but they got more staff at the front desk and so everything went smoothly. The night before we left, our smoke detector started to beep every 5 min at 4 am, we called the front desk and 5 min later a friendly service man came and simply took it off the wall and promised to repair it later that day, which he did.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Momi812
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hyatt regency for just one night of dec 10th, couldn't stand it any longer. I booked a king room with a crib and got a two double bed room instead. The bathroom sink had a big crack in it and and the shower had a slope towards the bathroom floor so after shower the whole bathroom was like a wading pool. Had to put towels on the floor to make my way out. Would never stay there again, if i have other options

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for $99 & under”
Reviews.Author: disneyaholic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12/8 - 12/12. All in all it was a nice stay...paid $92 off hotwire. We checked in at noon and received all requests asked for (high floor, king bed, non smoking with a river view). Great assistance with luggage. Room was very clean...you could tell the comforter & shower curtain were new due to the creases in them. Great location.... Con - the lighting is poor. I would definitely stay there again but, not for $199.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overpriced and the customer service was horrible. The parking alone was $39 per night for hotel guests. To send a fax was $5 for 1 page. A can of pepsi cost 4.36. The room itself was a little small, and the bathroom looked like a cheap remodel. No one offered to help us with our bags when we arrived. The hotel did not fulfill my request for extra towels. Also, when I called the front desk for extra shampoo, the person who answered the phone spoke to me as if she was doing me a favor just to answer the phone. After about 2.5 hours, I finally got my shampoo. I expected more from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room we booked wasn't available...Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyB122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this so called 4 star Hotel more like 1 star. First the room we booked was not available made us upgrade $15 to get the Room we Booked. How Funny. Heat was Terrible in the Room made lots of noise. The Tub wouldn't drain out very fast. Stained Carpets in our non smoking room that smelled like smoke. Even had ash trays in the NO Smoking room. Would not stay here again ever. Was close to shopping and attractions. Buyer Beware booking this Room.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again for sure......”
Reviews.Author: Greeneyez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for my 30th birthday on October 28, 2005. We were very skeptical about it because of some of the reviews I seen on here, but figured we would give it a try. We just happened to be in town for the BIG White Sox parade and hoopla. Check in was kind of busy, but we expected it. They upgraded our room for us at check in for only $10 extra. Our room was very nice (deluxe room- 2 double beds). The shower was amazing...probably the nicest shower I have ever had! We are pretty low maintenance and don't require much service, so we didn't experience any one waiting on us. The hotel inside is gorgeous and clean. Very modern looking. Excellent location and SO close to everything. I would stay here again for sure. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay. But bring your own toilet paper!”
Reviews.Author: jkjohnson1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights Nov. 4th-7th. I was apprehensive about staying at this place after reading some of the reviews. Got a rate of $99 a night through Travelzoo. Paid $15 extra per night for a deluxe room. I was not exactly blown away, but I was not disappointed either. The Lobby: Turns into a very loud and busy nightclub at night. The bar one floor up was not much better. This was really not a problem because we were up there for a girls weekend. The bar was way too crowded for my taste. We went to another club. If travelling with a family, or a couple wanting to get away, I would recommend staying in the West Tower. You can enter through the unimpressive lobby there and avoid the whole club scene. Another reviewer referred to the West Tower as shabby etc. The rooms are identical to the ones in the east tower. I think the West Tower is actually much quieter. The front desk workers were very professional and personnable. We arrived at 11 am and had no problem checking in. Our rooms were ready. The concierge was very helpful and gave some great tips. The front desk printed up our boarding passes the night before we departed. I found the staff to be far more helpful and friendly than I encountered at Le Meridian. Check out was done over the phone and I picked up my receipt via video machine in the lobby. Took less than one minute. The Room: Deluxe room had rather odd layout. Bed was smack in the middle of the room. Attached the the back of the headboard was the desk area. So when at your desk your back is toward the window and you look into the back of the headboard. Roomy desk area. The view was excellent. The reading lights were attached to both sides of the king bed. The look was meant to be sleek and modern, I found them to be a nuissance. I was always worring about smacking my head into them when sitting up. The room was decent sized. I think it would have appeared larger and more functional if it had a different layout. The bed was new and very comfortable. I like the idea of duvet covers. I did not hear any noise from neighboring rooms and street noise was minimal, but the noise from the hallway could be annoying. The doors are extremely thin and there were large gaps at the bottom and one of the sides. Rolling up towels and placing them at the bottom of the door helped buffer out some of the noise. The bathroom: Average. Not much counter space. Okay shower pressure. Never had a problem with getting hot water. The towels were paper thin and scratchy and the toilet paper was atrocious. Remember the TP when you were in elementary school? This was worse than those jagged little squares. Dermabrasion where and when I did not want it. Overall, this hotel was better than I expected. I found the staff to be very well trained and professional. They did not blink or roll their eyes at my requests i.e. non smoking, king bed, away from elevator and high up with a view. The location is wonderful and most rooms seem to offer great views. I would stay here again. I am giving this place four stars because of the excellent rate I paid and the great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-day convention held at this hotel. A coworker and I shared a room with double beds on the 10th floor of the East tower. The room itself was comfortable, with adequate space for the both of us. It came equipped with all of the standard amenities I'm used to: minibar, safe, hairdryer, cosmetic mirror, bath products, etc. Sheets were a little scratchy and the beds not quite as comfortable as I'm used to at other comparable hotels (but not bad). I had some trouble initially connecting to the Internet, but finally got it to work after calling the help desk. There were also not enough hangers. Housekeeping was sometimes a little tardy; I had to call one day when they hadn't cleaned by 1 pm (not a major issue, except I had several coworkers joining me in the room for a client conference call and the room was still not tidied). Noise level was good; we could hear a few sounds, but it was generally quiet because we were the last room at the end of the hallway (although one of our empty neighbor rooms had an alarm set for 7:30 am that went off every morning). We called for laundry to pick up a bag of shirts to be cleaned and pressed and left everything in a bag by the door. A couple hours later, we received a voicemail that said they tried to pick up but the laundry wasn't ready. Finally we realized they had gone to the wrong room (they mentioned the room they checked had been cleaned, but ours wasn't). I found it ironic that they have eco-friendly notices, but the hot water problem (mentioned in other reviews) requires you to run the water for several minutes in both the shower and sink to get the right temp. Water pressure was poor. Service was generally good at the front desk, bell desk, restaurant staff, and doormen. One of the doormen arranged for a limo to drive us to evening destinations over several days. The concierge was fairly successful in getting us dinner reservations (we tried Keefers on their recommendation, but changed our minds on the second night's reservation at some French restaurant). We ate the first night at Stetsons, which was quite good but very expensive. Without alcohol, dinner for two came to $150 including tip. We also tried the breakfast at Networks in the main lobby area, which wasn't bad. Food served at the conference was standard hotel fare, nothing special. The hotel is very spread out. I'm glad we were staying in the East tower; the one time I ventured into the West tower, I got lost and was unimpressed with the shabbier decor and elevators. Public restrooms were sometimes hard to find. All in all, it was a decent hotel for the conference. I doubt I'd stay there for pleasure though; it seemed really busy with numerous events and other activities, so I wouldn't want to mix with the crowds if I were on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelColumbus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt recently and had a great experience. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were updated, roomy, and very clean. The location downtown to resturants, shopping and attractions was great. To address some of the cons listed by other reviews..the hotel is large and, as would be expected, the lobby is full of activity, including the great lobby bar that looks out over the city. Yes, there is a disco/club atmosphere at night but if you looked at the hotel's website before you booked you know exactly what you are getting. The dance club didn't get started until later evening when kids shouldn't be out anyway. We were informed in advance that if you enter the minibar a sensor is set off so there would be a charge. The parking at $39 a day is very average as anyone who stays in a big city would know and it was quite easy for us to get our car when we needed it without any long waits. There were also complaints listed about the hot water and towels--the water was always hot even when showering during the busy morning hours and the towels were more than adequate. We have traveled all over the world and this Hyatt is a great choice for fun weekend in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Avolid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlyfirstclass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for the weekend as a gateway to South Bend Indiana for the USC-Notre Dame football game. We were given a group rate of $179 for the room. We arrived at the hotel on Thursday evening and we had booked a non-smoking king size bed and were told that all that was left were two doubles, this is the largest hotel in Chicago with over 2,000 rooms. I have a very hard time believing that our room request wasn't available given that we arrived on a Thursday night. We asked about an upgrade and were told about the concierge level floor that had just been updated, our room wouldn't be on the concierge floor, but it would cost $50, a cost that seemed very reasonable, until we saw this terrible excuse of a concierge lounge that was supposed to have soft drinks, none were cold, just sitting in a bowl with no ice, snacks, of which there were none. We went for the continental breakfast the next morning, there was no cereal, bagels, fruit, etc., just granola bars. I called the front desk and told them that we didn't want it anymore, they didn't ask why. Calling the front desk, bellman, room service, all calls attempted resulted in very long hold times. The room had four light fixtures over the bed that were long metal over the beds and were so ugly and offered no light. They seem like a safety hazzards. The sheets and towels are abnormally scratchy.Upon reading a sign in the room from management regarding the hotels sheet changing and towel replenishment service. I'm very eco friendly but this policy is a joke. It states that sheets and towels will only be changed every 3 days, unless you call housekeeping directly to request daily changing. Every 3 days is just laziness on the Hyatt's part. Every other day or every two is reasonable. If the hotel is indeed eco friendly, then why aren't there recyling bins in guest rooms or in other prominent areas. One of the biggest eye soars and security breaches can be seen when crossing the indoor bridge to the West Tower is luggage storage in plain sight spanning the length of the bridge. There was only one person working there and it would have been very easy to simply walk away with someone elses bag. This hotel bills itself as the destination spot for business professionals and conventions. Believe me when I say there is nothing professional about this joke of a hotel.You would be better off with the homeless along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: windycityfoodie
Reviews.Content: I spent one Saturday evening at the Hyatt with my fiance for a night downtown. Check in was very busy, we felt like we were in Las Vegas, but the woman who helped us was friendly and efficient. We had room 1572 a city view king non-smoking and we were very impressed with it. It had a little bit of fun with color and was definitely roomy enough. The bed was very comfortable and the view was fantastic. We woke up to a view of the river, John Hancock building, the Tribune building, and the rest of beautiful Chicago. One problem was that the shower literally needed to run for 15 minutes before it warmed up. We called the front desk after 5 minutes and they said to just continue to let it run and call back in a few minutes and if it still isn't working they will send someone up. It did eventually get hot, but it threw us off by 15 minutes. Big Bar in the hotel was a really fun place. You can't beat the view and the 48oz. martinis, margaritas, beers, and drinks are very fun. They are pretty reasonable at under 20 for all of the Big drinks. Most of the clientele looked like they were guests of the hotel stopping in to get a drink before dinner or clubs. It would be a great place to go for the start of bachelorette party or girls night out with the big fun drinks and Big appetizers. There were a lot of groups like that there. The location is fantastic, the valet is expensive but very courteous and quick with your car, and the 16.95 breakfast buffet was above average. The service in the hotel was good but not fantastic. All of the waiters, bellhops, and front desk people just were a little off in service. It seems as if the Hyatt is trying to improve this because with literally every time you interact with an employee you get handed a survey. I booked my room with Hotwire and got a great deal, I think this hotel is worth every penny. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: flymunkay
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a convention and because I travel for a living ( Flight Attendant) I do know great from so-so Hotels. The staff was very nice and efficient but the room was tiny and furnishings were quite worn. The bed cover was torn and piling and the carpet stained. The lobby was very gross with cigarette smoke at all times-YUK- I would not reccomend this unless you are in a pinch. For the same price my friend stayed at the Palmer House and had a beautiful room-

Reviews.Title: “Our stay could not be faulted.”
Reviews.Author: MARTIN R
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get mixed reviews,but our experience was great. This is a very large property,but the location is excellent,convenient to much that Chicago has to offer. Check-in was quick,but do yourself a favour and join their Gold Passport club [free ],which has a dedicated check in line,and which will enable you to be upgraded if they can;which is what we were lucky enough to experience. The upgraded room was on one of the Regency floors,which apart from being the better rooms also entitles you to continental breakfast buffet...a great deal for Chicago at the rate we paid of $89-00. Room was recently renovated and was in top condition due to this. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: MSW2
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that this hotel is really not worth the price. We did in fact have a regency room in the hotel. We spent our first two nights being kept up by a noisey air condition unit that would bang every hour, after two nights we had tgo move rooms, which was really an inconvinence to the four of us. The regency club is also not great, breakfeast ends at 9:30, yes this is ok for the business traveller, but there were a lot of tourist also using the hotel, who along with us were dissapointed by the service that would actually come to an end 10 minuties before it should have. It is a shame as the hotel rooms, and the hotels location (so close to Michigan ave.) were really great. It is a shame that the hotel staff had to let it down so much. We did also realise just as we left the hotel that we had had one of our cell phones stolen form a handbag, and all the hotel have offered us is, to look into it! We stay in many Hyatts but this was definitely not been of the same class as the others, a let down!

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a weekend in December through Hotwire and paid around $100 a night for it and still was disappointed. I am originally from Chicago and for shopping, this location is not as convenient as gold coast hotels or even loop hotels it's not close to any major shopping area or museums. Location may be ok for warmer months when walking awhile is more tolerable. Rooms are cheaply redone and stuffy. I was even moved to "exec. floor" and still stuffy and awkward. This place is a monster, none of the restaurants in the hotel are worth the cost when there are so many better alternatives outside of the hotel. Starbucks isn't even a real Starbucks in this hotel. NOT a four star hotel. Stay somewhere with less stars and a more central location for the same price and you will have a better visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with everything at your fingertips. Grocery store that sell wine, spa, Coffee stand with Star Bucks coffee and a business center which came in handy. The room was clean, staff friendly and the location very convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: themacs40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night but we got to experience the entire place. Before we arrived we were stuck on lower Wacker and lower everything else, not a great place to get lost. We checked in, everything went smooth. We got in our room and the mini fridge did not have a plastic tie on it like our adjoining room did. We didn't want to get charged for anything so we called and told them the problem, they had someone there within 5 minutes to inventory it. Pretty fast!!!! We had a cocktail in Connie's before we went to the Big Bar and had margaritas and then on to shrimp cocktail in HUGE martini glasses. After we got back from being out late, we went back to Connies and had a GREAT pizza, just the thing we needed.... The next morning we had breakfast downstairs at the buffet. Everything was fine, fresh fruit, smoothies, french toast, eggs, etc. We have no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: RDS3918
Reviews.Content: I stay here once every 2 months on business but have stayed in almost every hotel in the Loop and Miracle Mile. Positives: The rooms are nice and big and have mostly been renovated recently. I always get placed in a high floor so street noise is never a problem. There are no trains directly outside to wake me like at Palmer House or Rennaisance. Staff is always curteous and helpful. Connnie's pizza is a great place for takeout or reasonably priced food, salads are great. Negatives: They stopped free WiFi about a year ago. It's on the edge of the Loop and Miracle mile. Although everything is walkable, you just have to walk further. Which can be a bear in bad weather, which is almost always. They put in an obnoxious disco right in the main atrium/lobby which it appears that no-one ever uses. This " disco" doubles as the breakfast and lunch restaurant. When checking in you feel like your in Las Vegas, so noisy and busy because of the Long Bar upstairs by the registration desk. All in all it's an OK place to stay for business travelers, I'm just wedded to Hyatt for the points. If you're a tourist there are nicer places to stay that are more central.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: atltripper
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Chicago, where we spent the weekend at the Hyatt on E. Wacker Street. Despite the hotel being crowded with hundreds of lawyers there for the annual ABA convention, service was great, everything was clean and always spic-and-span. The hotel was very convenient to the art museum, the aquarium and planetarium, and shopping on the 'Magnificent Mile'. The bed in the room was unusually comfortable, with a very nice down-filled comforter, covered by a duvet, on the bed. The pillows were also down-filled and very comfortable. On the whole, the decor was a step above the usual chain-hotel surroundings. Our only complaint? There wasn't enough storage space in the dresser in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: soxgirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location.Excellent service and large renovated soundproof room.Great price on Hotwire.I read some bad reviews on this hotel and was sceptical but after spending 4 nights there,I have no idea what some people complain about.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rawdogg
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the hotel was very nice. The price of parking was $ 39.00 a night 2 much 4 me. We parked at the Millenium Parking garage which was down the street. It was $ 25.00 a night. We did not move the car. We did alot of walking but that was great. I got a great price on this room from Priceline $ 82.00 a night. Great for a Hotel in downtown Chicago. The hotel was clean. The bathroom could have used a little more lighting but it was clean. I was worried after reading several reviews. I do not understand what some people are looking 4 in a hotel. We did not spend much time in the room. After all it is CHICAGO but all was well with the rooms. No pool (If u have kids this could be bad), No workout place but again it is CHICAGO. (So what miss a few days eat well and have fun u are on vacation).

Reviews.Title: “Super first time at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Kevil_KY
Reviews.Content: This was the first time to visit Chicago. We knew the price of hotels were high and decided to try Priceline. We won Hyatt for $85. We were a little nervous about staying here after all the bad reviews. We arrived by train, found a taxi and arrived at the Hyatt around 10:00 pm. It was busy but did not have to wait very long. We were offered upgrades and took an upgrade so we could have access to the business center and food on the 36th floor. Our room was on the 35th floor. We did not have a good view but it didn't bother us because we were busy touring. We did not hear any noise, the room was clean and big enough for two adults and one child. We asked for directions and restuarant suggestions from the front desk. They were very nice and helpful. The location of this hotel is great. You are close to Navy Pier, parks, Art Museum, Michigan Ave., bus stops and the taxis are waiting for you. We had to check out before our train departure. The bell hops kindly held our luggage till we were ready to leave. All in all this hotel was a great place for us to stay. Everyone was kind, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: So_Haven
Reviews.Content: We had planned a week-long vacation in Chicago around the 4th of July in order to go to the Taste of Chicago as well as have our kids see fireworks on the 4th over the Lake. Booked this hotel 45 days in advance through Expedia. Even confimed booking with the hotel 24 hours before. We showed up late on the evening of our stay due to our late flight in to O'Hare (thus the reason we confirmed). The first thing I encounter when walking into the hotel was some disco with music so loud I had to put my fingers in my ears. It looked like they were throwing some sort of dance party in open area lounge at the main entrance. When I got to the front desk, the woman's face turned white when I told her I was checking in. She took my license and went in the back room (to speak to a manager I presume). She returned 5 minutes later to tell me they GAVE OUR ROOM AWAY! She offered me a voucher for another hotel 5 miles away for that night and then told me we would have to come back the next day to the Hyatt to get a room! We chose that hotel because of its proximity to Grant Park, Navy Pier and all the other attractions in the area. Since we already paid (in full) through Expedia, she was binding me to stay in their hotel even though they did not hold a confirmed reservation. I explained (Yelling over the music) that I had 15 bags, a wife and two sleeping toddlers in the car (it was 11:45pm by then) and I was not about to tote them from hotel to hotel just to satisfy Hyatt. She offered no explanation, no alternatives and no apologies. As I was leaving, another couple that had just driven 17 hours tried to check in and were left roomless as well! We were left with no choice but to leave. We drove by their Voucher hotel - it was a zero-star roach motel unfit for anyone. Certainly not the 4-star hotel I already paid for. We were unable to find another room in Chicago and had to drive around for two more hours just to find a room. We finally found a room 45 miles away at 2:30am. Since we were so far away from Chicago, we missed all of our vacation plans and the vacation was ruined. After contacting Hyatt with this mess, they offered no remuneration and little in the way of an apology. I will NEVER stay in another Hyatt after this HUGE disappointment. Be Warned! This hotel's overbooking policy is a farce. They will give away your room. They do not feel any obligation to the customer. Find a more reputable chain if you want to have an enjoyable vacation in Chicago, especially around holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, if you use Hyatt Points”
Reviews.Author: mjb172
Reviews.Content: My and the wife decided to use my Hyatt points in Chicago and go see a White Sox game. The Park Hyatt had no room available for point users, so I had to stay at the Regency. Chicago has some pretty expensive hotels, so I figured it's a good place to use points. Here's the good and bad of the place: Good: -Location -Nice room and bathroom (the room was club level) Bad: -We weren't told about the complimentary breakfast for club level guests -The Card key didn't work for the club level room. Others were having the same problem. Had to walk the 1/2 mile to the front desk to get this fixed. -This hotel is big and busy. If you stay on a lower floor, many elevators on their way down will be full. -They have sensors in the minibar, so you'll get charged even if you just move something. That's just plain wrong. -Our in-room coffee maker only had decaff (don't know if that was an oversight or intentional) -One day, we left for an early start then came back and rested in the room for a few hours around lunch time. The room wasn't made up in the morning and still wasn't when we came back in the late afternoon. We evenutally had to call to get the room made-up. All in all, it wasn't awful, but on my own dime, I wouldn't stay there again. On a side note, we're trying to see every baseball park in the country and U.S. Cellular field is at the bottom of the list for the eight we've been to so far. Next time in Chicago, stay at a different hotel and go to Wrigley Field.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: granolagirll
Reviews.Content: The first thing that greets you when you walk into this hotel is the overwhelming smell of smoke. The "remodeled" rooms didn't appear to be remodled--the bathroom seemed old and the room was not worth the cost. It was extremely loud and overall a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute change to this hotel due to a great deal I found on-line. We had a little trouble getting the price I found on-line but they did accommodate us since it was in print. We checked in later that day. Asked for a room with a view and we got it. We could see Navy Pier from our room. Nice clean room. Easy access to many things in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great last minute deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: alibee1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern rooms--a view provided based on request at check-in. Fantastic concierge service--these people really love & know the city--recommended things with knowlege and zeal plus there are 2-3 available at a time. No pool but rumor has it, you can swim somewhere nearby. Gracious and accomodating staff, perfect location--be forewarned (and the woman checking us in did tell us) that their mini-bar is on a sensor system and if you move anything--you will be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago over the July 4th holiday weekend and enjoyed our time. For the most part, the hotel was well maintained and serviced. The real turnoff was the first room that we were issued... there were at least two cigarette burns and one unidentifiable stain on the bed sheet (at a Hyatt??). We returned to the front desk and were promptly given a new room on a higher floor with a beautiful view of the lake. It is a very busy place with many visitors, and the hotel walls aren't exactly soundproof. But a restful stay was had, nonetheless. All in all, not bad. The hotel's location is PERFECT and for $97 / night (Hotwire) on a holiday, how can you go wrong? I would stay again for the right price, and recommend it to others. 3.5 stars out of 5 in my book. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JeepGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in walking distance to Michigan Ave., tons of shopping and restaurants. Location is prime! The room itself was lovely. I stayed in the West Tower and had a great view of the River, Michigan Ave./Wrigley Building and a partial lake view. It is a very busy "big city" hotel. If you don't like busy, then I would suggest a Hampton Inn or equivelant. They are professional and very accomodating to say the least. I have stayed here many times and you cannot beat the price if you shop around. The lobby is very beautiful and great for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: KennyfanFairfaxVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in early June. My room was nice and I did have a good view but there are rooms with office building views. The bed was kind of uncomfortable (large enough but too firm) but that can go to personal preferences. It is definitely a large - meeting oriented hotel. Two towers (with good signage, I had no trouble finding meeting rooms in both of them). But it's clean, safe, comfortable and in a great location near Michigan Ave. I liked its modern style.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibentmywookie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chicago for a weekend at the beginning of June 2005, and our experience was pretty much what most of the reviews had prepared us for -- very average. Don't get me wrong -- it's not a *bad* hotel, it's just not a fantastic one. I definitely wouldn't qualify it as 4-stars -- 3 seems fair to me. Our room was in the West Tower, with a fantastic view... of the office building across the street. Not the hotel's fault but if you want a room with a view, make sure you ask for one. The walls weren't as paper-thin as other hotels I've been to, but in the mornings we couldn't tell if housekeeping was knocking on our door or on the doors of other rooms on the hall -- sound definitely travels well down the hallway. Our room was *dark*, too -- especially in the bathroom, which had only one dim light for the whole room. Speaking of the bathroom, the water pressure seemed low. Not low enough to complain about, but low enough for us to miss our showers at home... Other things to note -- as has been mentioned before, you can't store food in your fridge -- they'll nail you with a $25 charge if you try. You can request another food fridge if you're taking home leftovers from restaurants, but that will cost you $25. (Not sure if that is a flat fee or per night... we didn't bother trying.) Additionally, housekeeping came very early in the morning -- before 9AM every day we were there. If you're there for a conference, it probably doesn't matter to you, but if you're vacationing and would like some extra rest, make sure to put the "do not disturb" sign out the night before. On the postive side, the hotel was very clean, the staff was extremely helpful -- especially the concierge, the location is fantastic, and the Big Bar has a great view and some great drinks, even if they are a bit on the pricey side. We'd definitely stay there again if we got a great price, but otherwise it seems like Chicago has better places to offer for the prices that Hyatt charges. I wouldn't try to talk someone out of staying there, but I also wouldn't recommend it unless the price were low.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Deal, Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edith_C
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for the re-dedication of the U-505 exhibit. Our whole family stayed at the Hyatt Regency. We got a great deal by using AAA. The hotel is in a GREAT location for restaurants, theatres, etc. We walked to eat and to the theatre to see WICKED (which you shouldn't miss if you can get tickets). The hotel had some good views of the lake and the canal. But our room faced an office building. We also had a chuckle watching a kid in a nearby condo building do an "American Idol" routine thinking no one was watching! Parking is expensive, $39 a night, so taxis would have worked out cheaper for us than renting a car etc. Staff is great and helpful. Restaurants are wonderful and have resonable prices. You have to get BIG drink at the Big Bar. It cost about $20, but it's the size of 3 regular drinks! Breakfast Buffet was nice also, on weekends they had and custom omelet and waffle bar. Make sure to sign up for Hyatt's Gold club so you don't have to wait in line at check out, plus you get points for your stay. Wwe got enough for a weekend in another Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not so great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saphireinto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a conference in early May '05, and found that it was exactly that ... a conference hotel, huge, very basic rooms, ok service, but good location. The hotel strongly reminded me of an airport, expecially the massive lobby and constant flow of traffic. If you can get a great deal ... it's worth the $, but if you are paying >$100 ... Chicago has soooo many other places to choose from. I would also avoid the Pizza restaurant inside the hotel. If you want Chicago Pizza head to Rush St. I loved the city, but not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend for a Girlfriend's Weekend. I have stayed in Hyatts before, and as always, the service was great. Rooms were very quiet, decorated very nice, and beds comfortable. Centrally located between shopping, museums and theatre. It's a large hotel, and was packed with conventioneers, but that wasn't a problem - the hotel is obviously used to large crowds. We had breakfast one day in the restaurant, and while very expensive, it was also delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: emily174
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I was a little worried about staying in this hotel after booking through Priceline, but ended up having a great experience. The staff was friendly and accommodating, check in was very quick and the concierge desk was very helpful, providing maps and reccomendations of activities. We had a standard room which had a great view and was very quiet considering that we were just around the corner from the elevator. We also had pizza from Connie's in the hotel, and appreciated that we could order pizza until midnight. Overall for the price this was a very nice hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great city great location”
Reviews.Author: lufiboo2000
Reviews.Content: Well we just came home from a "girls" weekend. We had a great time in Chicago. First let me say I also booked the hotel on priceline, but, I paid $77 plus tax. After reading some of the other prices paid I feel I should have gotten a lower price through priceline (I started my bid quite lower, but, I guess that is a priceline issue not a hotel issue.) Now, back to the hotel. This was also my first trip to Chicago so I was a little ify when I was told to take the train at night, turn out though it was quite a nice ride. For anyone else reading this review you take the blue line to the Clark/Lake stop (about 40 minute ride fare is $1.75) and than a taxi to the hotel about another 5 minutes. Ok, so when we arrived at the hotel it was big as all the reviews said, but, we did not encounter any lines at the check in stand. The ladies that checked us in were very pleasant. After reading reviews on this site I requested a Delux room in the west tower. At first they said this is an additional $15 per night charge, but we asked if there was anything they could do to wave the fee the lady was more than accomadating. So, kudo's to them (I am sorry I cant remember her name). As many of the other reviews have said, the lobby can be a noisy place with the Big Bar and the dance floor (I think it is called Harddrive or something along those line) but, from our room on the 25th floor you would have never known those places existed. Our room was quite nice, this was also a consern of mine after reading some of the reviews. The room temperature was very comfortable, if for some reason we needed to change the temp there was a thermostat on the wall. The beds were great not your typical hard hotel bed, my friend even said she wasnt used to such a soft bed. Each bed had 4 pillows, a down comforter, and a light blanket if we opted for that. Another review said it was hard to watch TV from their bed, I am not sure if that person knew it or not or if this is specific to the deluxe rooms, but, the stand the tv is on swivles to face either bed or the chair in the room, so neither of us had any issue with the boob tube. The delux room also had plenty of towles and a bathrobe in the bathroom. This hotel has a very central location, most of the local attractions are within a mile of the hotel, but, wear comfortable shoes because you will do alot of walking. As for the food, we had a hot soup and dessert in the steak house down stairs. The soup was ok but the cheescake was amazing. Also, the wine guy really knows his stuff. We had one drink in the big bar because it was there, nothing amazing and I had ordered on of the special drinks (Big Blue). After going out to dinner in Chicago, the prices for drinks there were just about average, but, we got the normal size drinks. Yes, I must say this hotel is geared more to a business travler, the morning we left I wanted to print out my boarding pass before going to the airport, just to find out there is a $7 fee for using the computer in the business office and $1 per page charge for a print out (I took a pass). Also, If you rent a car, you dont need one, there is a steap parking charge, but, there are garages around the corner you can use for 1/2 the price. All in all I enjoyed this hotel. If any one from Hyatt reads this review please put real creamer in the rooms instead of the powder stuff (I had to borrow some from the local 7-11)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant after reading some of the trip advisor reviews, but it was too late to change because I had booked thru Priceline for $75.00 per night. My 10 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt from April 1-3. It was a most enjoyable experience, we caught the Airport Express shuttle from O'Hare, $60 round trip. The hotel was centrally located, the weather was beautiful, we visited our main destination (American Girl Place), Children's museum, Michigan Avenue shopping, Garrett's popcorn. etc. The room was clean and showcased a beautiful view of the Navy Pier. We ate at Houlihan's one night, which is accessible within the same building, we received a 10% coupon to return for the breakfast buffet on any morning, which was wonderful. I highly recommend staying at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but I've paid the same for better”
Reviews.Author: sunnyd_0807
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt over Easter weekend. We flew into O'Hare, and took the El train into the city. This was my first trip to Chicago, and if I had known more about the layout of the city, I would have chosen a hotel closer to one of the El train stations (we found the bus schedule to be unpredictable and erratic, so we just walked to the nearest train station, almost a half mile away, everytime we wanted to go somewhere). It was snowing and quite cold for most of the time, which made the walk unpleasant. The Hyatt itself was fairly decent, and right away we noticed no problems with the elevator waits as other guests have mentioned. We went to the BIG bar one night, and service was quite slow (this may just have been because it was Elite Eight weekend of March Madness, and there were a lot of people around). One bad thing was that even though it was very cold outside, it was extremely hot in the room, and the heat wouldn't go off, no matter what temperature was on the thermostat. The windows were bolted shut, too, so opening them was not an option. I called downstairs, and after about a forty minute wait, someone showed up, and took the vent cover off and reached into the wall to do something to make the unit stop spewing out heat, but it never really did cool down during the night. The decor was fairly nice, but the room was sort of small, and the TV was at an odd angle to the bed. If you get a really good rate, stay here, but if you don't (and especially if you want to be close to the train), go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: constructiontiger
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a long Spring Break week-end at the Hyatt. I booked the room via Priceline and got a pretty good rate. After reading some of the reviews on here, I was a little worried that we would dissapointed. However, we were not. The room was nice, clean and had a great view of the river and the Navy Pier. We stayed on the 8th floor of the west tower. The location great for catching the bus to get around, and you can walk to the shops on Mich. Ave. The staff was friendly. Only complaint - no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: undecidedguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hyatt from 3/31 to 4/3. Staff was great. The previous post said that they had to pay for the gym use. Don't understand that because my husband and I used the gym a few times and never had to pay. We entered the gym with our hotel key. Big bar is great. Overpriced but it's typical of a hotel in a big city. Parking is expensive ($38-40 per night), but again, it's typical of a big hotel in big city. Hotel rooms were clean. There is a little market by the gym where you can pick up some drinks, wine, beer, snacks, etc. Great for those looking to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our 4 children to Chicago for spring break. I was a little worried after reading some reviews of the Hyatt. Boy were we suprised!!! The rooms were beautiful with a wonderful view of the city. The staff was helpful, friendly, and overall delightful. The rooms were beautiful, clean, and quiet. Our trip could not have been better. The hotel was in the perfect location and when we needed our car, our wait was only 10 or 15 min.. The city and the hotel were wonderful and we will go back to both!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: elizabethvo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and from the beginning I had trouble. The heating system was "just changed" is what was told by the staff, and the heat would not go off. The room was 80 and over. There solution was to OPEN THE WINDOWS. I have a young daughter and she became very ill after this stay. The ultimate insult was upon checking out I spoke with another man who had the same problem and was transferred to the other tower, where there was NO heating problems. I was not given this option and not told that the other tower was available and not an oven. Don't bother staying here. Go through HOTWIRE or TRAVELZOO and find another hotel that cares. I was offered another night upon my complaint. WHO WANTS IT. And only offered the free night upon calling and finding out if they have any rooms available; this is not the way to treat customers. Elizabeth Vo Highland, IN

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!!! No redeeming features and I am in a deluxe room!”
Reviews.Author: watchful1
Reviews.Content: I could not sleep more than a half hour at this hotel because of the noisy heating system and constant water flushing sounds. About every half hour the heat would come on with a loud popping noise, then it would sizzle like an old radiator before quieting down. It's hard to believe that people would be flushing toilets at all hours of the night, so I have to believe that there was something else making this other noise. The room provided no methods for drowning out the sounds, like a fan motor in either the heating system or the bathroom so there is no way to create "white noise". The rooms are small and grey -- very harsh in lighting and they have those annoying refrigerators that automatically charge you if you touch anything in them. Someone had left a wine glass balanced in mine, so I was afraid of touching anything and there is a notice on the door that you would be charged $25 for putting anything in this refrigerator -- very unfriendly place! I am on the 33rd floor and have "club privileges" although the club is too crowded to truly enjoy in the morning. I can't wait to check out!! Horrible, horrible place! I cancelled the reservation I have there for next week....I will be taking sleeping pills tonight in the hope that this will keep me from constantly waking up. A pillow over the head helps somewhat too. Yikes!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Hyatt for a conference this past week. The hotel is easy to find, for Chicago, from the Interstate and is centrally located in the city. The Hyatt is a very large hotel with many floors. My room was on the 20th floor with a beautiful view of the river (nicely green for St. Paty's day) and the lake. My room was clean and modern. Everyone was very helpful and polite. I dropped my bag and jacket with the Bell staff without any problems. The only thing to avoid is the breakfast buffet in the Networks restaurant in the hotel. The breakfast Looks good but is really bad and not at all worth the $15.00+ charged. McDonald's in the building connected was a much better buy for breakfast. Also, don't be shocked when you pick up your car at $39.00 a night. Overall a very nice hotel with a helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The first room I was given smelled so stronlgy of some kind of cleaning solution that I asked for another room. It, too, had a odor but not as strong. (I later found the problem in an "Ionizer" machine - some kind of solid room deodorizer that smelled like something from the restroom in a convenience store - after I flushed that it was much better). When I asked for a different room, I was told I would have to come back downstairs for a key. Since there appeared to be no bellman I had to haul all my luggage back down and wait in line for a key to another room. Rooms very dark - especially in bathroom - so putting on make-up was an experience. Carpet stained. There are much nicer hotels in the same price range in Chicago with a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “LOST/STOLE My Bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on this hotel through priceline and thought, how bad could it be for a 4 star hotel, I mean it is a HYATT. Well everything was ok until I checked out and left my bag with the bell staff so I could enjoy the city for the day. The bellman gave me an attitude because I didn't tip him for storing my bag two feet behind him in the luggage storage room. When I got back to the hotel that afternoon they had lost my bag. It is two months after the fact and I am still working with their insurance company. Needless to say this is a huge hassel and would have gladly paid more to stay somewhere else and still have all of my belongings. Ok hotel but BEWARE of the bell staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Never been scared in a hotel before”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a girlfiend Valentine's weekend for one night. Paid $82 inc taxes on Hotwire which I thought was a deal.....but. As soon as we entered the hotel (West Tower) after dinner we saw lots of teenagers with beer in hand and I thought 'Oh no'. The noise in our hallway was unbelievable so I stepped out to ask the kids to keep it down but was called a ----- by a girl who was clearly the worse for wear - this was at 8:30 pm. The noise continued and we called security twice to deal with it (not willing to take more insults)...and it finally went quiet at 1am. Neither of us was tall enough to reach the spyhole in the room door and we didn't know what on earth was going on - kids banging on door, shouting etc. Staff seemed unconcerned. It was truly a scary experience and not what one would expect form a 4 star hotel. Next time I would pay more and ensure my personal safety.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency is fine don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt last Saturday night and I had a room on the 29th floor. The room was very clean and looks like it had been recently remodeled. It has a great location on the Chicago River. It is a large hotel, but there are many elevators to move the crowds quickly. I got a great deal on the hotel for just $60.00/night.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Lights, Big City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
