Reviews.Content: Our family's top choice for accommodations in DT Chicago. Maybe it's because when we are visiting a big city we like experiencing that big city feeling. We also like the versatility of having so many establishments under one roof - if the weather is nice, we are located close to everything we like to do in Chicago, and we don't return "home" to the Hyatt until late at night. But if the weather is inclement, as it was on our recent visit, we did not go any farther from the hotel than the Art Institute for the afternoon (a very short cab ride) and spent most of the day exploring the underground city, which the kids thought was a real hoot. Lots of places to eat so we didn't have to go back outside. The Seasons Cafe in the lobby was great for dinner. We have also tried the pizza place, which is mediocre, especially in a city where you can get the real thing everywhere. Another note , to save on breakfast, there is a McDonald's in the underground level. For the best rates, go to the hotel website. We use our AAA discount which is usually available.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Regency: American Splendor at it's best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excessive, massive, gargantuan cocktails and people decorate the lobby of this structure. Big I tell you, big and well, just ---- big... It's simply frightening to see 4 grown-ups sitting on couches too small for them, sipping from long straws that look like drainage pipes as they slurp slurp slurp yellow liquid out of one large Margarita glass... this is only the one of the few sites you see while at check-in for an hour while you're in line. Yes the check-in lines can be that long. I stayed at this hotel this President's day weekend, first time in Chicago, and I have to say the only way I tolerated the chaos there was because of the good deal I got on Travelocity. It's a huge hotel, the most visible feature is their bar called 'BIG' which serves 20 oz. martinis to middle-aged conventioneers and 19 year olds for $20 to $30 bucks. It's a cool place if you're traveling alone, it's amusing and disturbing in a Super-sized American kind of way...feels like Disneyland inside, way too much going on, fat people with fanny packs left and right, drunk soccer moms and their bored children, overly-made up teenagers in tafetta and cheap polyester roaming about the ballrooms with Coronas in their hands, and IT nerds convening in the lobby with their laptops... it's a freakin' madhouse... I was there for three nights. The air conditioning is currently not working at the hotel, the hallway heat is at full blast because the air in the rooms isn't on so you roast first then you simmer...the fan inside the room recirculates the stale air (the bathroom is without ventilation either). We had a handy-boy come in at 2:30am to open the window and let a bit of the blizzard inside. That chilly breeze was better then marinating in our human funk. There's free breakfast for Fri-Sunday check-ins, (if you pay for breakfast 2 eggs and bacon will cost you 10 bucks and the buffet is 16 bucks, not cheap) the free breakfast is great if you can blow 3 hours waiting in the long lines on weekends, that's no joke, the waiters are nice but take forever to serve you. You have to be patient with this hotel. It's huge, it's in a good area, near the loop/theater district and off Michigan, but kind of ridiculous if you pay market rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: AMNA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past weekend. Place is very nice - location and rooms are great. It is, however, a mega hotel - so expect tons of people all over the place. I would say that given the location, paying $150 or less is more than fair, over that could make you feel like you could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “A Faded Lady”
Reviews.Author: whostl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Feb 2005. A former jewel that has fallen into disrepair. The hotel is dark, and shabby. Even the newer wing is not up to par. If you stay in the Loop area, try the Burham instead.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Price-Line Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: I got this room through Priceline, bidding on a 4-star hotel. For the price, it was a good deal and the location is first rate. After I learned that I bought this room, I read the reviews at this site. I will attempt to tailor this review to address the concerns that have been raised in prior reviews. It is indeed a cavernous, impersonal convention hotel and a step below other Hyatt hotels. On a star rating, I give it 3.5, not 4. There did not seem to be any major convention business going on when I arrived and check-in was friendly and quick. The room was compact, but not cramped, and clean. The bed was firm and the bathroom amenities were average. Internet was $9.95 and pretty slow at that. No wireless. Being at a convention hotel is like being at an airport or a ski resort. They've got you and will charge you accordingly. I dined in the fancy steak restaurant and had a drink at their enormous bar. In both situations, the service was professional, but not exactly impressive. The food and libations were fine, but not worth the price. There is far better to be had for a 10-15 minute walk or a quick cab ride (there is a cab stand to the left of the main doorway upon exiting). I checked out the next morning by video and they had the hard-copy receipt waiting for me downstairs 5 minutes later. There is a first rate exercise room with lots of cardio and weight equipment and a nice selection of dumbells. If I were paying published prices, I would go elsewhere, but for the price I paid (well under $100), this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel @ a great pice on Priceline. The hotel exceeded our standards for the rate. True, there is no free internet acess and no pool but it was awesome. The staff was very helpful. They allowed us to check in @ 10:30 am in the morning!! THe location was excellent for closeness to the "EL" and the loop and Mag. mile. We had a great time. The rooms are appportioned very nicely. We didn't drive so the parking problem was not a problem however, it seemed that you had to pay to park just about anywhere in Chicago and rightfully so with a great public transportation system. Overall we were extremely satisfied with our stay and would go back anytime. Faults: Pool would have been nice and lack free internet (but most hotels you have to pay for this now so no big deal). Would recommend to anybody. We were a little apprehensive with some of the reviews but I believe if you were there in the summer or during convention season it may be a different story with the amount of guests. One not there were a couple of conventions but we didn't experience any problems with service.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you get it with discounted price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay over night in Chicago with my girl friend for a weekend trip(Early January, non-holiday). Since I saw a 4-star Hotel available in the Hotwire for $53 (total $70 including service charge), I thought it was pretty good deal. Therefore, I paid for it and I got this hotel. So far, these are the negative experience I seldomly have had in a 4-star hotel: - The lobby likes a central terminal It seemed that there was a conference meeting during the period I stayed in this hotel. A lot of people stayed in the lobby. They spoke very loud and noisy. More than 30 people smoked in the lobby, surprisingly, nobody stopped them. (Usually, smoking is not allowed in the indoor in USA.) I can't believe that it happened in a 4-star hotel. - The wall is too thin I can hear the conversation from the people in the next door completely and clearly. Also, if someone knock the next door, I can hear it too. The wall is just too thin that can't block any sound at all. - TV is in a wrong position The TV is on the right side of the bed. It is hard to watch the TV on the bed. - Running water in the bathroom After flushing the toilet, the water will keep throwing. This sound is so annoyed and I have to close the door before going to sleep. - Fair River View When I checked in, I was told that my room came with a full city and river view. However, half of the river view is blocked by the other buildings. If you are a photographer and you need a good river view, I suggest you go to Hotel 71. It is few blocks away from Hyatt and it is on the same street. Their view is excellent. - The comforter is not comfortable The comforter was not clean and it made my body itchy. Well, there are serveral advantages: - Excellent Bell service. Since the check out time is 12pm and I have to leave Chicago at 6pm, it is not convenient to carry my luggage around. Therefore, I stored my luggages through their Bell service. They handled my luggage carefully. Their service is excellent and helpful. - Excellent Check-in and Check-out service. The service is fast and the persons are very friendly and helpful. - Excellent room service Last time when I stayed in Hotel 71, the room service was at 9am while I was sleeping. This time, no body disturb me. It's good. - Excellent Location It is just 5 minutes walk to the River Bridge on the Michigan Ave. It is about 10 minutes walk to the Grand and Lake Subway stations. The location is very convenient. Overall, I think it is a good deal if you pay for a discounted price. I think it does not worth if I need to pay the regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Phenomenal Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having won the Hyatt Regency for less than $60/night, I was ecstatic. The hotel is very large and I was quite impressed with the hotel's "Big Bar" which provided great live entertainment and huge drinks. Our 30th floor room was impressive as well. The air-ionizer added a unique touch and the king-size bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept on in my life. I couldn't pull myself out of it! The location is great - you'll be close to drug stores, shopping, several restaurants and more. The only negative - we heard a loud banging noise in the room a few times throughout our stay...perhaps it was the heating unit or the pipes. Overall we were thrilled with the hotel and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lowlights: * Concierge told us to travel west from O'Hare to reach the hotel * Breakfast coupons were never given to us upon check-in even though we pre-paid * Toilet was overflowing with waste upon room entry If this is a the flagship hotel - Hyatt is in tough shape. Will stay at the Sheraton or Intercontinental on next trip

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Is More Expensive than Rates Imply ($39/night for parking)”
Reviews.Author: pdx_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: The best description that I can think of for this hotel is that it is driven by up-sells, which you will encounter from the minute you enter the driveway, but the standard room is decent and clean. There was a chair with ottoman in the room, which was nice. By far the worst thing about the stay was it cost $39 a night to park. (I've paid less for hotel rooms.) My advice on parking: leave your car at the Millennium Park Garage for between $12 and $15.75 a day. Millennium is the massive city owned lot designed for downtown events and offers clean, well-marked, underground parking. Thanks to the hotel's central location, it is just 2 blocks away. The garage is accessible from Columbus Drive between Randolph and Monroe streets. In addition to the actual price of parking, the Hyatt systematically over bills as well: first, charging for multiple days, even if you check your car out after the first, and second assessing for 48 hours of parking even if you use 30 hours or less, so watch out. Hyatt knows the practice is wrong, but has chosen not to change it. They will however adjust incorrect charges at your request, but it's a hassle, especially when you are checking out. The room upgrades offered totaled $30. Hyatt said they would provide a slightly upgraded room for this with a somewhat better view out of the window. We declined, and our standard room turned out just fine. The hotel also has lots of bellhops. My daughter got a kick out of their presence. The downside, of course, is that they can drive the cost of your stay up. That said, they are a lot cheaper than the parking, and fun for the kids. By the way, I stayed here about 10 years ago in my only other visit to this hotel. Back then the cabbies became upset enough that they were getting hit up for kickbacks for higher end (O'Hare) fares that they drove around the hotel all night with their horns blaring trying to wake up the guests. Seems as if this hotel never changes.

Reviews.Title: “Packed”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a hotel so overrun with warm bodies. It was like walking through Disney. Crowded. Expensive. The room was nice. But not for the $200 I paid. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “love the hyatt”
Reviews.Author: march-16
Reviews.Content: second time we have stayed here this year =got both on priceline=this time at $53 on a fri.=great upgraded room-wonderful check=in and staff was wonderful=bar very crowded and noisey but it is the biggest and best bar in chicaago -what do you expect..a fun happening, noisy palace to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Down and Dirty for $100 a Night...the Reviews were Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews of the Hyatt Regency were right.....this is a monstruous hotel that has $39.00 a night for parking. The rooms have loud unknown noises from steam or something. Our room, like many other reviewers, was D-I-R-T-Y....the toilet seat had not been cleaned, mirror had toothpaste spray on it, other mirror had huge thumbprints, bedspread and throw pillows on bed had unidentifiable white matter on them, and the pillows were stinky. Like many others, I used Priceline paid $70 and with all other charges from Priceline paid $100 total. When I got my priceline choice and went on Expedia to see how I did, the hotel was at $113.00. The comments about modern decor are true....the decor is fine. The people were very nice and if you called down for your car, you did not have to wait long. Chicago is a very expensive city and I usually spend at least $200 a night or more. It was nice to save money........but having to clean the bathroom and wonder what was on the bed...made one thing for sure: I will never book at the Hyatt Regency again. And because it was so cheap--if you do Priceline, grin and bear it. 2 weeks ago I snagged the Sheraton across the street for $75.00 and my friend said it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TripadvisorUser
Reviews.Content: I bid $69 for this hotel on priceline - the total price was $86. Stayed the day after Thanksgiving - the place was CROWDED. Our biggest complaint is that we waited twenty minutes for an elevator at checkout, and we were only able to get a down elevator because we hopped on the up elevator (the down elevators were all completely packed). A couple we stood with while waiting for the elevator said they had no hot water (we didn't have any problems). Good location, facility is apparently remodeled, but the rooms were not very clean. All in all, would pay more to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The pros and cons of booking here with Priceline”
Reviews.Author: melkmail
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Free high speed internet *Clean, large rooms *Friendly staff *Great location Cons: *Busy and loud, especially in the lobby at night (The "Big Bar" is a major nuisance, unless you enjoy bad Frank Sinatra impersonators and other cheesy entertainment and the loudest drunks in Chicago) *A bedspread that could double as tissue paper--upgrade or bring your own--even with the additional blanket in midsummer I was cold *The room service reads like a menu at Denny's--and this is upscale??? *Windows that do not open at all, even a tiny crack for ventilation *The fitness center is not worth the fee *Trying to find the fitness center, dry cleaners, salon and spa, or any other services that would be easily accessible in smaller hotels requires navigating an endless labyrinth of hallways and tunnels The Bottom Line: If you enjoy noise and crowds and think that greasy chicken quesadillas and nachos are the stuff room service dreams are made of, the Hyatt Chicago is the place for you. If, however, for the price you expect something quiet, elegant, and upscale, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent place! I loved the large room space and bathroom. Large work space area with high speed internet access. Very Quiet. Great view of the Lake and the River. Service was very helpful and accommodating. They greeted me several times when I was leaving or returning. It is just a few blocks from some of my favorite eating spots. I picked up from Pizza Uno and brought it back to the room do some work. Nice Italian restaurant on the hotel property. I would stay here on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the Labor Day weekend and there were a few large conventions going on but I still had no problem with getting an elevator or checking in or out. This hotel is in a great location and its near everything. The 4 Seasons Cafe located in the hotel lobby is overpriced and the service is not that great, so avoid it. There is a salon in the lower level of the hotel where I had the best pedicure of my life. Ask for Alma if you want a pedicure, she is wonderful. My room was large enough and the bathroom was clean. Overall I enjoyed my stay there and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pay more than $65 for this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oni242
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline and got the room for $65 a night. I guess the hotel is ok for business people or families on vacation but i can't imagine paying full price for a place like this. The hotel is so large and busy with convention-goers that the service suffers. it gets pretty loud as a result of hallway noise and you can hear the pipes going everytime someone flushed their toliet. rather disgusting. i think i had cleaner rooms and better service from motels. DO NOT PAY MORE THAN $65 FOR THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok place, but there are much, much better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during a huge conference and found it frustrating to be in such a huge place - impersonal, small rooms, just-ok service. i would find someplace with a higher rating close to wherever you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Getaway for New Family”
Reviews.Author: seekingsun4
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service that we received while staying at the Hyatt Regency Chicago. The hotel is in "ok" shape and generally clean for the shape that it is in. The hotel location is awesome! It is close to everything! We didn't experience any delays with checking in and the front desk staff was very helpful. We purchased our room off of Priceline for $75 and we inquired about an upgrade to a suite when we checked in. The upgrade would have been an additional $150 so we opted not to do the upgrade. We had requested a refrigerator for our room and they waived the $25 fee for that since we had an infant with us. The room that we got had an awesome view of Navy Pier and we enjoyed the fireworks from our window on Wednesday night. The bed was VERY comfortable. The only downfall was the paper-thin walls and the connecting doors between the rooms. On the first night, I could hear the guy next to us snoring throughout the night. Needless to say, our infant heard him too so mom and baby didn't sleep good the first night. Thank goodness he checked out and we had a better night's sleep the next night. After we checked out, we came back to the hotel to pick up our luggage (after shopping all day) and Angie at the Assistant Manager's desk was VERY helpful with giving us a temporary suite to use so that I could privately breastfeed our infant. The service at this hotel was top notch! As a family, we probably won't stay here again only because of the noise issue. Other than that, it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth Every Penny.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was *very* impressed during our recent stay at this hotel. The rooms are modern, clean and recently renovated. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean. Also, the size of the room was very ample with a sitting area and a desk. The location was really standout -- right near the Wrigley Building and the Herald Building (oh, and the new Milleniium Park, which is great!). You can get to anywhere in the City quite easily from this hotel. Plus, there is a free shuttle to Navy Pier. Also, the great Chicago archictectural tourboat leaves from right across the street. The concierge desk was generally very helpful. The only drawbacks are thin doors (if you're a light sleeper, bring earplugs) and the parking situation. Its $36 a day which is apparently standard but the service is not very good. Front desk service could be smoother too. We got a rate of $99 off of Travelocity for the last weekend in July. It was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely exceptional experience a this hotel. As a guest in the Monarch Suite, I received friendly, courteous and prompt service. It's been three months since my stay and I still remember "Pierre" who handled the reception and other food/bar service in the suite. I hosted two events and entertained many guests -- the staff was wonderful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The attention to detail from making sure that beds were perfectly made to making sure my guests were properly served was first class. Even a mistake at checkout was promptly and courteously handled by the manager on duty. If you want to impress business associates (or anyone else) -- try the Monarch suite. The Hyatt Regency is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, glad I am going back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for Valentine's Day weekend. Like many others on here, I was fortunate enough to get my room through priceline for around $50. My husband and I enjoy going on small weekend trips, so I have frequented many of the Chicago hotels. Needless to say, I was impressed. The room was very well decorated, very modern, whoever said it was retro, I think you were in the wrong hotel. As for parking, $35 for the city is normal. This is Chicago, and it is much safer than half of the other garages in the city, that can charge up to $50. Plus you get in and out privlages, which if you were just to park in the city somewhere, you would not have! As for the service, it was all very helpful. Our shower broke, so when I talked to the manager, I got two free breakfast buffets, they moved us to another room for showering in the morning, and they gave us a free night. The location is ideal, and there are plenty of awesome restaraunts and attractions nearby. Lastly, there is always free entertainment on the weekends, and Connies Pizza just rules!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a relaxing environment...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good: Location is convenient (but this is true of most hotels in downtown Chicago). Rooms have been recently renovated, and although not particualrly large, are comfortable and attractive. Some rooms have very nice views (mine did). Free high speed internet access, reasonably priced room service. Safe in room (but not large enough for a laptop). The Bad: The elevator situation is horrendous--expect to wait and then be packed in like sardines--to make matters worse, maids, maintenance, and room service use the guest elevators too. Expect to hear your neighbors a little, and hallway noise as well. Verdict: Although not an unpleasant experience overall, not recommended unless you enjoy a lot of hustle and bustle in your hotel. If it's an oasis of serenity you crave, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel, okay overall”
Reviews.Author: 1Methos
Reviews.Content: My husband, father and I spent the 4th of July weekend at the Hyatt Regency. After reading other reviews, we were a little concerned, but kept the reservation because of the good rates. We are Gold Passport members and had no trouble or wait checking in, but we were not offered an upgrade. We had standard rooms on the 21st floor. We did not encounter any problems with noise, but the rooms did have limited drawer space and counter space in the bathroom. My father's room was clean, but our bedspread had an unidentifiable stain on it and one of the pillowcases had black marks. We switched the pillow with a spare in the closet (clean) and my husband called the front desk to request a clean spread. We then went down to have dinner in the hotel restaurant and the bedspread was replaced when we returned. We also received a follow up call to make sure the clean bedspread had been sent up. Our biggest complaint with the hotel was the elevators. We stayed in the west tower, and waited, at times, up to 20 minutes to get from our floor to the lobby. When the hotel is at high capacity, the best thing to do is get on any elevator that has room, even if it is going up and you want to go down. We heard many other people complaining about this as well. We only ate at the All Seasons Cafe which I highly recommend. The food is very good, especially breakfast, and the prices were reasonable. This hotel has a great location and proximity to riverwalk, the lake, Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile. Overall, I recommend staying here if you can get a good rate and a room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “I've been in worse hotels......”
Reviews.Author: kimkru
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a 2 night stay at the Hyatt Regency and I'm glad to be home. I have stayed in worse hotels then this place, but I've also stayed in much, much better, for less money. If you are going to Chicago, try to find another place, but if you have to stay here, make the best of it! The Stetson's Chophouse has good steaks, but I've been to better(Old Homestead, Morton's) but the piano player and accompaning singer was a nice touch. The bartenders are nice and quick. The front desk clerk was a little confused (first day, maybe?) and the maid service was adequate but nothing special. This place was probably really great 20 years ago, now it's just old and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency a great location”
Reviews.Author: tea50
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hyatt June 5 and 6th, having gotten a room on Hotwire. The location is wonderful - a short walk to the Magnificent Mile and Rush Street, and not a much longer walk down to the Art Institute and Grant Park. We were able to check in well before the posted check in time and our room was comfortable and nicely decorated. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Hyatt last night and were very impressed! The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were great and the location was perfect. We highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “WAY too big but good job overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The HR Chicago is huge! 2000+ rooms! Luckily, it's divided into two towers so it's not as massive as, say, a large Vegas hotel. Staff is nice and friendly but sometimes gets overwhelmed by the sheer numbers of guests. The renovated rooms are beautiful, however, and are definitely worth the $140 corporate rate. If you can get it on Priceline, even better!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt doesn't stand for much any more”
Reviews.Author: aglazen
Reviews.Content: In the last month I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency downtown and the Hyatt by Ohara. Both places make it clear that the name Hyatt doesn't mean much any more. In both hotels, the rooms were as ordinary and unadorned as the most average Sheraton. Maybe worse---in both rooms at both hotels, the bed sheets were thread bare, even torn in some places. And imagine this---you open the refridgerater and you want to put a bottle of soda in it...and there is plenty or room, but there's a very bold sign that says IF YOU PUT ANYTHING IN THIS, YOU WILL AUTOMATICALLY BE CHARGED $25 EACH TIME. This is the theme of the Hyatt. If you have to stay there because you are with a convention, you put up with it. But I can't imagine voluntarilly choosing either of these properties. The one by the airport is by far the worse because you are in the middle of nowhere and they own you---and take full advantage of it. The Hyatt Regency is huge, the rooms are utterly ordinary. If for some reason you insist on staying here, do it through Priceline. I got it for $67, and honestly, I don't consider it a bargain. Best wishes to you.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Chicago
HotelInfo.Address: 151 East Wacker Drive, Chicago, IL 60601
